Reviews.Title: “Such a shame”
Reviews.Author: Decspur1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a group of friends over St Patricks weekend. The hotel itself was very clean and tiny in a great location, as said before the staff were very friendly and nothing is too much for them. Then we discovered the dreaded Irish bar, first impressions were great. The service was good with a smile and no wonder with the free tips the bar tender was helping himself to. When this was noticed and duly reported we got see the ugly side of the Irish bar with refusal to serve as well as other unsavoury tactics. By all means stay at the Lenox but avoid the Irish bar at all costs, there are plenty of other bars across the road which actually do resemble an actual Irish bar in character and scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Left refreshed and rewarded!”
Reviews.Author: cdenihan
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is located just one block from Newbury street, close to the train station and right off coply plaza- for those who don't know Boston its doesn't get much better than this. The team there is amazing. The girls at the front desk are always smiling, concierge happy to help with anything and the bell staff friendly and nice. It's clear this place has top management as its run really well. The best part is you get stash hotel rewards to stay a similar hotels around the USA. I look forward to returning and recommend travelers to stay at the Lenox for exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but the hotel bars are awful”
Reviews.Author: tom w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Hotel in boston over st patricks night. The hotel was very clean and the girls on the front desk were very nice and helpful. We were however very disspointed on how we were treated by the staff in the hotel irish bar which seem to be run by children pretending to be adults, it reminded me a bit of bugsy malone. We complained that one of the bar tenders was stealing money from us by short changing us which was pointed out by another hotel guest. He then insinuated that we were drunk and to cover up what he had done, which was not the case as at least two of the party did not drink. Because the barman had been rumbled, the bar would let us in then say we were drunk after being in there a matter of minutes and we would be asked to leave regardless of what time of day or night it was, once even allowing us to order a meal in there and then when the food was bought out asking us to leave. The bar staff seemed to be very young. I liked the hotel and would have stayed again but they seem to victimise us after the bar episode so on this basis I would not stay there again and would not recommend it. Don't go near the irish bar though, its terrible.....grim, grim, grim!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay at The Lenox. We have stayed at other hotels in Boston before and decided to try something new this time. There were four of us including one very tall teenager so the size of the room is very important. We had a very large room with two queen beds and a couch that fit my youngest child perfectly. We didn't incur the extra cost of a cot that we usually have to do. it was beautifully appointed and the hotel itself is lovely. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The location is perfect for Copley and Newbury street shopping and dining, access to local colleges and universities and an easy walk to the Common or the Charles.

Reviews.Title: “an amazingly positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Gaillen_12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay at the Lenox Hotel in Boston. The staff is exceptional & the facilities are excellent. We were in Boston for medical reasons & the staff went out of their way to do everything they could to accommodate our every need. We have traveled the world & never have stayed at a hotel where everyone went out of their way to go overboard & to have such lovely facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in Boston to choose- don't even bother researching other hotels!”
Reviews.Author: HKtravel_12
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by every facet of my stay at The Lenox. The room was large, which was a surprise being an older building in the heart of a major city. I had a walk-in closet, an ample bathroom, two double beds with a desk and loveseat, all with plenty of space in between. The linens, toiletries, and furnishings were first-rate. The staff was always friendly and accomodating, making me feel very welcome and taken care of. The location was fantastic and within easy walking distance of a Trader Joe's, a Walgreens, public transportation, and many restaurants and historic sites. All of this positive experience was even before seeing the hotel staff spring into action to take care of guests during the Back Bay blackout on March 13th. When this occurred I spent the majority of the evening in the lobby with many of the other guests. The Lenox staff handed out cold bottled water and snacks as some of us had not eaten dinner at that point and it was about a mile walk to find a restaurant that was not affected. The staff kept us updated as they received information. The Lenox restored power via generators before many of the other hotels in the area. They offered a fantastic complementary breakfast the following morning to ensure the guests' comfort. As many of the guests' cell phones and other electronics had "died" overnight, The Lenox supplied power strips in the lobby to enable everyone to charge their equipment. I will definitely stay at The Lenox when I am back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for three nights and was very pleased with the service and room. The location provides great access to the "T" (Copley Station) and there are many restaurants very close. All this is fairly routine though with a hotel of this level. Where they really showed what they were made of is the day of the blackout. There was a fire in the BackBay which caused the power grid to fail for a large radius around the Prudential Center. The staff at the Lenox quickly sprang into action. They ensured that all the guests needs were taken care of and made sure that everyone had water and snacks. The rooms were without power, but it was night time and I got a good nights rest. The next morning the staff made sure I had breakfast to go on my way out, awesome! I mentioned the fire that caused the outage...well I was at a local tavern when they evacuated and I left my jacket behind. This was the first gift my wife gave me after we were married and was very special. I mentioned this to the staff at the Lenox and after I left town they sent a runner to retrieve my jacket allowing a friend of mine to pick it up a day later. I will make the Lenox a regular place to stay when business or pleasure brings me to Boston. I know that no matter what happens the staff will ensure that I have a great experience. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: delphi11
Reviews.Content: Chose to spend 4 nights of a family vacation at the Lenox, based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor. Never have we been treated so well in any hotel. As another reviewer posted, everyone, from front desk, to concierge, to housekeeping, was extremely friendly and welcoming. What made this even more evident was that we were in the hotel during the recent power outage, and the way that the staff dealt with this difficult situation highlighted their professionalism and determination to make sure that our stay remained as positive as possible, under the circumstances. They secured a generator ASAP, offered all guests a complimentary breakfast on the morning after the power went out, and ensured that we got reservations and transportation to a great restaurant to replace the ones that had to be cancelled. We cannot say enough about this hotel and its staff - we were treated like royalty. Kudos to both staff and management, and we would not recommend any other "home base" while staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Mojito82
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Boston with my wife and teenage son. The location next to the Prudential Centre, Newbury Street and Copley Place shopping is excellent. The room (714) was a spacious room with a decorative fireplace, all the normal amenities and very comfortable in every respect. However, the reason to stay here is a staff that has embraced service to a level that I had associated only with the very finest hotels and at a much higher price point. In fact, their version of service may be better because it was delivered in a very friendly and casual New England way. I would be reluctant to single any individual out because the fact is that from the valet parking, the front desk, the concierge, the bellman and the housekeeping staff there was a consistent message that they were anxious to make our stay as pleasant as possible and to be helpful. I can't think of any request for assistance or special consideration which wasn't handled beyond my reasonable expectation. Whatever management is doing here, they are doing it right. This is truly a team effort. We are frequent vistors to this area and chose the Lenox on a whim and the good reports from others. We will not stay anywhere else from now on. It was that good!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mattandmel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the jr suite and they were perfect. The staff was amazing and took care of our every need. The location was ideal for walking around and shopping. Also we ate at Sonsies on Newbury Street and the food was amazing. Will stay here on all my trips to Boston and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels”
Reviews.Author: ahva63
Reviews.Content: Everything is excellent at this hotel: the location, room, service, etc. just name it

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous second chance. great job wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: lisaprn1
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review in which my reservation was totally messed up and I ended up staying at a different hotel when the Lenox Hotel gave away my room. I was compensated for the mistake and rebook a weekend for Nov 12,2011. I want to say that the Hotel Lenox did everything in their power to make sure we had not only an excellent time, but to make up for past mistakes. They surpassed their own efforts. They gave us a room that was more than we expected and a welcome basket to say they were sorry. Nothing extremely fancy, but chocolate works!!!. The staff was sincere and helpful, the hotel is warm and cozy and the room was exceptional. Stay here and you will not be disappointed. close to everything and easy access to the T. surrounding neighborhood is the best. Again, I want to thank the Lenox for a wonderufl stay and all is forgiven. It actually was forgiven with the personal attention from management and a " I'm sorry for the mix up" again from management. that was important. So please stay here and enjoy Boston while staying at a great hotel. I have travelled the world and have stayed at the worst- mongolia( actually the tent was better than the hotel) to the best, Paris. Stay here and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable, good service”
Reviews.Author: PeterDS
Reviews.Content: Friendly and efficient service from start to finish. Comfortable, good sized room. Dining acceptable. Very well located for Back Bay, museums and concert hall. Moderate walk to historic centre- no strain as Boston is such a lovely city to walk around in. It is still a town of stone and brick rather than steel and glass, and it has a sense of history that most US cities lack (dare I say that it is a more 'European' city than most in North America).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Dermot B
Reviews.Content: Just back from a five night stay in Boston.We booked the Lenox through their own website and got a really good deal.On the second night there we were upgraded to a junior suite with some really spectacular views of the Boston skyline.The staff in this hotel are second to none,they are pleasant,courteous and very helpful.In particular Kelly on reception was a credit not just to the hotel but to the city of Boston itself.In summary if you like to stay in a clean professionally run establishment then the Lenox is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great people !”
Reviews.Author: Kortenbergtraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife found some good deal on flight tickets to Boston, so we needed a hotel ... well, nothing to add to what is already said on tripadvisor : it is a great fantastic historic hotel, with excellent staff, in an excellent spot. One thing to add : the owners and staff are such honest people : I booked directly on the website of the hotel, and then 1 day later BA sends me an offer, which came to usd 40 less a night plus upgrade to junior suite .... I informed the hotel by email, and within 24 hours I got a reply from the Lenox adapting their price as well ! So honest of them. Also to mention for the kids is the hot chocolate drink they serve in the afternoon in the lobby. Very classy place, will certainly return sooner or later.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox Hotel Is Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: mrs-marthasvineyard
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful and relaxing weekend at the Lenox Hotel with the husband. From the moment we arrived in front of the hotel at valet, we were greeted with amazing service and smiles all around. The central location in Boston is out of this world and you can walk to all the fun shopping, cafes and restaurants. Front desk staff was fabulous! They offered to send a complimentary drink up to our room upon arrival, which was delightful and a wonderful welcome after our drive to Boston. We're not high maintenance and didn't need much, but I know if we did, they'd go above and beyond to accommodate us. Although it may be considered "fancy" it is not stiff or stuffy, everyone is made to feel welcome and comfortable without any kind of snootiness. Neither of us cared for the food at City Table, the restaurant inside the hotel, they need a new chef, new vision or something.....but that should not be a reflection on the hotel itself. The drinks and martinis were pretty great though, and we snacked on the house made chips and dip along with them and we enjoyed those a lot. There are also plenty of places to eat nearby. I'm already planning our next trip to the city and we will be staying here once again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Horn R
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Lenox! The staff were superb, very helpful and friendly. Location was perfect for us, we walked all over Boston but also used the buses and subways. We did not eat breakfast nor at the restaurant but we ordered room service one night and it was great. It was an overall fantastic experience for us and we would absolutely recommend to anyone travelling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: k2ands
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in February. This is an extraordinary hotel and we had a great visit. The location is the best - near everything in a wonderful Back Bay neighborhood. The subway is a block away and the Prudential Center shopping is also nearby. It is located convenient to excellent restaurants. We enjoyed Atlantic Fish for dinner and the Met for breakfast. Newbury Street is a block away. The concierge service is exceptional. Keith and Justin really took care of us! Every one of their recommendations for restaurants and sightseeing was wonderful. The service was among the best we've seen anywhere - chocolates each night, coffee/tea/newspaper in morning. Hotel is spotless and classy. Our corner room was spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: elj123
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a standard king room. Rooms are small, but nicely decorated, updated baths and very clean and comfortable. Not sure I would want to stay here with children, however. The most enjoyable part of our stay was the hotel staff. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk staff made it a point to make sure we were happy and accommodated our every request, even delivering a Sunday newspaper to our room at 9pm free of charge. The morning coffee in the lobby was a nice perk as well. The location was perfectly within walking distance of restaurants, shopping, and the Freedom Trail. Room rates are very reasonable but beware of the excessive parking fee of $44 per night if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, but not my style.”
Reviews.Author: motogrrl2003
Reviews.Content: While it's a very nice hotel, the old style is just not my thing. The rooms were small, but clean. It's conveniently located and very nice. If you don't mind high quality, antiquey places, you'll probably love it.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: cokeo
Reviews.Content: We spent two night's at the Lenox. It is an incredibly welcoming environment with the entire staff, front desk, doormen, maids, etc. highly motivated in creating a warm and relaxing ambiance.We stayed in a junior suite,which is a single corner room with two queen beds overlooking downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway evening”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogetaway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for a quick overnight getaway. I booked a fireplace suite, a large corner room on the 5th floor with a nice view of the city. The room itself was nicely decorated, but not particularly cozy or romantic. It seemed a bit cold and staid. (All those florescent lights don't help!) Anyways, after enjoying dinner at City Table, we wanted to take advantage of the fireplace, so called the "fire man" to come up and light a genuine wood fire. I don't know what those logs are made of, but he was able to light a blazing fire with only a couple of pieces of newspaper. It was very nice. We were told to keep the glass doors closed for 15 minutes, but then we opened them. (There were still screen doors closed in front of the fire.) All was well. But WHOA! At a very inopportune time, a flaming log came tumbling out of the fireplace onto the carpet! (The hearth is very small.) Hubby had to jump up and grab it on the sides with bare hands and throw it back into the fire. That was a close one! We closed the glass doors again, but the room had quite a bit of smoke in it. Good thing the windows to the outside open! I love the idea of the wood burning fireplace, but they really need to leave people with a log gripper in order to rearrange the logs when needed or catch one that has fallen out. We had no tools at all. I had to carefully shift the logs with my hands at one point to keep them going. (No, I was NOT going to call the fire man up to do it.) Once I did that, the fire continued to blaze until midnight. The other issue we had with the room was that there was a ventilation fan that hummed away loudly 24/7. It was in the ceiling, and there was no way to shut it off. It sounded a little like someone running a shower in the next room all night. So that interfered with a perfect night's sleep. I would definitely ask about it. Overall, it was an adventure, and I did enjoy the hotel. If you get a fireplace room, just pack your fireplace tools!

Reviews.Title: “Across the board wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Therese K
Reviews.Content: We spent two night's at the Lenox. It is an incredibly welcoming environment with the entire staff, front desk, doormen, maids, etc. highly motivated in creating a warm and relaxing ambiance.We stayed in a junior suite,which is a single corner room with two queen beds overlooking downtown Boston. In this case "suite" means single corner room with more square footage that a single room, but not huge. The beds are very, very comfortable, the linen luxurious, the decor is refined but not stuffy. There is a small refrigerator but no coffee maker due to fire codes for historic old buidlings. Peets coffee served complimentary in the lobby each morning. Free paper available upon request. Extremely quiet. I would jump at the opportunity to stay here again. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely example of a beautiful traditional style hotel in an incomparable Boston location. Located adjacent to Prudential Center shopping and a short waly to Newberry St., it is ideal for shopping, restaurants, and the center of the city. Accommodations were first class, as was service. We had a large party with multiple rooms and everyone was very pleased. I shall return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Dani C
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin...I love the location, so this property is perfect, as it is close to everything. From the moment you arrive, the wonderful service begins; they treat you as family. The classic property is amazing, but the five-star customer service, is truly unexpected, and what every other hotel should strive for. The sales team, is absolutely wonderful to work with, knowledgeable, accommodating in every way and treat you as if you are their only client. TOP RATE across the board. Looking forward to future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTT17
Reviews.Content: First off I've never actually written a review, so here goes. The Lenox was outstanding! We weren't exactly sure what to anticipate of such a highly regarded hotel, but after having read the reviews had very high expectations. The classic room was a little smaller than we anticipated (though we should have known better as they do fall into the category of boutique hotel), and seeing as that was one of our first impressions we were left a little underwhelmed. No need to worry. The staff was AMAZING, we had a hard time understanding how service could account for such high ratings until we experienced it. We were ultimately sad to leave and genuinely felt as though every staff member we encountered had befriended us and had our best interests at heart. To make a long story short, they'll get you pretty much whatever you need (if they can get it), they'll do whatever they can do for you (if they're able to), and help in any way they can (if you need it and a lot of times even if you don't). Helpful hints, 1) Use the concierges they're great, 2) let them make reservations for you (you'll get treated outstandingly where ever you go as a Lenox guest), 3) Ask if the courtesy car is available to take you out on the town, it's beautiful and the staff drivers are amazing! Hope this helps you all, and ENJOY the trip!

Reviews.Title: “unable to find fault with hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: dandoo62
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here twice now and both times we were given a corner room. these seem to us to be the best as they seem a little bit larger than the norm. the staff there are excellent and customer service is first class. if you have children, don't forget to ask about getting a lenox lion for them. we got pne for pur niece and she loves it to bits, and also a nice keepsake. idellay suited in back bay area, but close to all amenities. hotle is really very, very nice. unable to fault it. se were made to feel very very special at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: FrogCatchers
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel has spectacular service and REALLY knows how to make guests feel special. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the staff gracious and accommodating and the amenities are first class. You can't beat the location for exploring and enjoying all Boston has to offer. This is THE place to stay in Boston. Thank you Lenox for another fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: ProvidenceTravelerdc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel in great location to points of interest, restaurants and shops. Attentive and professional staff-including valet, front desk, concierge. Rooms were quiet and comfortable. Nice bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: MollyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to the Lenox. The staff can't be more accommodating, making the atmosphere very welcoming, and they pay attention to details. I needed a quick zipper repair to my jacket, and upon asking the concierge where I could find a tailor, he went out of his way to phone one, and to point out the tailor's building which was across the street. The room was spacious (Sup. King), and still includes extras like bathrobes, a "good" hairdryer, magnifying glass on the wall in the bathroom. The bathroom was average size, with Aveda products and plenty of towels. The location is very central, and also around the block from access to the Mass. Pike. We will continue to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Found my new favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: profpop
Reviews.Content: Have been to Boston many times always staying someplace other than the Lenox - this shall not happen again! The Lenox is, by far, my best Boston hotel experience and I shall return here on my next visit. The entire hotel staff was exceptional! Great location too, but would stay here the location notwithstanding. Thank you Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be back home!”
Reviews.Author: mcbc79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Saturday night at the Lenox, just for a little get away to Boston. We have been there twice before, each time a year previous. We were greeted like royalty and welcomed return guests. We asked for a "pet free" room and they put us on the eleventh (top floor) which was the allergy free floor. We had a "Pure" filter going in our room which was quiet and efficient. We had a beer and a snack in our favorite Irish pub, "Solas" and had a late dinner at "City Table"...both incorporated in the hotel. We were recognized and welcomed back by the Concierge. We enjoyed a great night's sleep...(snore free by my husband)...and had breakfast at City Table the next morning. All meals there were excellent. When we left, we felt like we were leaving family and will look forward to our next mini-vacation at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Joanmayo
Reviews.Content: I really want to thank front desk assistant Ashley, for solving a simple but urgent problem. She offered to print a revised QR CODE sent by my printing company to fix a pop up banner required for a Company event. She got The marketing team at the Lenox involved and got the colour changed and printed on sticky paper to fix the pop up with minutes to spare before the event. Her reply when thanked was "sure - no problem!" Most hotels would send you to staples! Really appreciate the Lenox team going the extra mile, especially Ashley, thanks again Also, my 12 year old son in now on first name terms with thewhole lobby team! Overall a great hotel for business stays and family trips too. Top marks to all at the Lenox Hotel, Boston

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Good Price Good Service”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerzzzz
Reviews.Content: What more can I say. You can't ask for more. Well you CAN ask for more and sometimes you get it. Like the woman in the next room who kept asking for more ALL NIGHT. And, from the sound of it, she got it. The walls are thick but she was loud. Can't wait to return to the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “May, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Traya
Reviews.Content: Most helpful and professional staff, all staff. Great location. Irish rest./bar @ 1st floor, u can watch soccer games ( real football) and ur team will win :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LML31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last night for a Valentine's Day getaway, and we could not have been more pleased. We booked the King Junior Suite and it was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was smaller than expected, but the room as a whole was beautiful. Firm but comfortable beds, complimentary bottles of water and free WiFi were nice touches. Since we only stayed one night, we didn't use any of the amenities, but check in was easy and the staff very friendly. The lobby was very welcoming with a fire going in the fireplace. Here's a tip for parking: If you don't want to pay the steep $42 per night to park at the hotel, you can get coupons to local garages at http://boston.centralparking.com. Just click on "neighborhoods" then select Back Bay and a selection of garages will come up where you can get coupons for discounted prices. We parked at the Prudential Center garage which is literally right next door for $27 overnight (without the coupon, it's $39). All in all, I would highly recommend the Lenox Hotel for a great stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCharm09
Reviews.Content: We found The Lenox hotel on tripadvisor for a 2 night trip to Boston. We had to take our 17 month old daughter to the Children's Hospital Boston and wanted to stay somewhere nice. This hotel exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a King Junior Suite on the 11th floor and it was an allergy friendly room (which was a really nice surprise). We had a corner room with fantastic views of the Back Bay area, and the room was very elegant and cozy. We were never disturbed by anyone and never heard noises from the hall or elevators as I've seen some other people post. It was quiet and relaxing! When we checked in, they brought our daughter a stuffed animal and brought us up some milk for her. You don't find people who will do that kind of stuff for you at just any other hotel. Everyone was just over the top nice 24/7 and there were friendly faces all over there place. We had one small issue with the mini fridge in our room, but it was our fault for not calling down to let them know it needed to be fixed. The little door to the freezer part wouldn't close, so everything in the fridge was either frozen solid or in the form of a slushy. But, like I said....after running all over Boston and chasing after a 17 month old, we were too busy to stop and remember to call down. Overall, this hotel was fantastic and we'd love to stay there again. We will be making 2 more trips to Boston over the next couple of months and as long as the rates are decent, we'd love to stay there at least 1 more time!

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox was special for us”
Reviews.Author: charlieaust
Reviews.Content: We found the Lenox in Trip Advisor but of course there are always some unhappy comments so you never know for sure until you get there. We stayed there with our 9 yo grand daughter in November and could not have been happier. It's an old but charming in every way from the lay out to the staffing. We had a very large corner room--no noise! It's hard to describe "charm" but we will never forget the Xmas decorations going up around the hotel and on the street. The lighted "Lindt" chocolate shop on the corner with the Lenox behind it. The staff were wonderful from the doormen to the front desk to the house maids who treated our grand daughter like a princess. We love old hotels with atmosphere and this one was a keeper. We would not stay anywhere else in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: Stuart K
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lenox for a vacation weekend in Boston and could not have been happier. Excellent, friendly service from the moment we stepped through the door, a fantastic location in the Back Bay, a very spacious and well-appointed room (the suites and junior suites have working fireplaces - its worth the charges to upgrade) and an extroadinary list of available amenities for free or at a small charge. I'm a longtime busines traveler and typically prefer the well-known premium brands such as Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton. The Lenox is all that those hotels aspire to be, and then some. We will definetly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShwrRoses
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in a prime location in Boston with outstanding customer service! Have stayed in other Boston hotels and this is tops on our list. Terrific restaurants if you wish not to venture out during your stay. Tastefully decorated and most comfortable rooms. Inviting lobby with fireplace and seasonal beverages and cookies. Aveda bath products and Lindt Truffles with night-time turn-down, and free bottle water are welcome treats. And even a terrific little workout room. Highly, highly recommend staying here as you will be treated like a king / queen. Skip the chains and stay in a unique, quaint hotel in a great location with superior customer care!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with a wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: owl0108
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding reception at the Lenox Hotel four years ago and recenlty returned for a weekend visit. We can not say enough wonderful things about the Lenox family and staff. From the momemt we arrived to the moment we left, the staff was incrediably warm, friendly, skilled and on their "A+" game. They have redone the lobby ladies room, beautiful marble counters, the hotel is dog friendly, so friends visited us with their dog for morning coffee in the lobby, and our baby received a stuffed animal upon our arrival and when we left everyone was saying bye to our baby. Truly a wondeful, fantastic hotel. An absolute must! And, the location is perfect! Right in the center of it all in the Back Bay, and if the weather is poor, you can easily get into the malls at Copley & the Pru. A big thank you to the Lenox for again exceeding our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “A Wedding Weekend to Remember”
Reviews.Author: CAMManlius
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked rooms at the Lenox for her out of town wedding guests. The hotel was great at letting us add on more rooms as needed at the wedding rate. Very helpful. They were even able to find a room for the bride's Grandmother at the last minute at the wedding rate even though the date to book was well past. We had a Sunday brunch following the wedding at the Lenox and the room was beautiful, food was excellent and service was great. All in all the Lenox helped to make a wonderful wedding weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: SwindonLester1
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK from a 5 night stay at The Lenox staying in a Junior Suite. The hotel, the room, the staff, the location, the food, the bar (an Irish Pub) were all Superb! The staff throughout the hotel were all very helpful, polite and courteous and they all understood my english accent (Most Bostonians struggled to understand me even though I come from Wiltshire and really haven't got a strong accent. One or two people remarked that I spoke very old fashioned english!) Our arrival and booking into the hotel from the moment we stepped out of the cab was swift and very professsional. The valets moved with almost military prescison. The reception staff and concierge were perhaps the best I ever encountered. The room and the beds were perfect and the maids kept the room very clean and tidy. Cab fares to from Logan are very reasonable and perhaps present the most stress free option even though the price arriving at the Lenox was more expensive that the departure. $28 arriving and $19 departing. Both journeys free of traffic. The hotel is centrally located and in easy reach of excellent restaurants and shops. The Prudential shopping Mall and Newbury Street (more shops!) are minutes away. Copley square and the "T" rail transport link are also minutes away. I loved the hotel and location. I recomend the Union Oyster bar. The lady that served us was a little gem of a person and certainly an ambassador for the city. Fenway Park isn't that far way and is definately worth a visit. The people that run the stadium tours were very friendly and helpful. Salme isn't that away and is also worth a visit. We frequently have short stays in the States. Visiting as many cities and States as we can. We love the US and the people. Boston itself is a great city though I did originally think that perhaps New Yorkers were the least friendliest but I now think in general Bostionians win hands down. I lost count the amount times I was reminded how little England was how the Colonists booted us oppressors out. Obviously the Mel Gibson's film Partiot is taken as gospel here. I love history and Boston has it by the ton. The only thing is its presented very, very inacurately. Overall the hotel and staff were brilliant and I fully recommend it. Boston's architure, shops, restaurants and culture is wonderful. Just be prepared, if you're English, to hear the same old tired comments and jibes that wears a bit thin after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Experience”
Reviews.Author: TheDeacon87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of hotels in Boston and the Lenox is at the top of my list right now. The staff is exceptional and will go out of their way to help. Though small, the hotel is in an exceptional location with lots of shoppring and sites nearby. There is a great bar, a fun restaurant and an Irish pub all on premises. The fireplace in the lobby was blazing and the hotel was just a very inviging place to hang out. This is a top choice is you are looking for an exceptional boutique experience with the best staff out there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband in January on a short trip to Boston. We booked a Classic room so weren't expecting anything fancy but it was smaller than we expected. The bed was really comfy and the linens were of the high quality you'd expect in such a hotel. Reception staff were friendly and the porters were very accommodating, explaining features of the room when delivering our bags. Good restaurants on site and lots of options in the surrounding neighbourhood as well as the usual room service options. The building itself is beautiful and feels very welcoming with an open fire roaring downstairs for you to sit by and warm up after a wander in the Boston weather. The real benefit of this hotel is the location - perfect for wandering this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: suiteleaf
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Lenox and we had a wonderful visit. We stayed here in December for business, but enjoyed Christmas shopping and dining on nearby Newbury Street. Location is excellent, staff and concierge were great, very helpful. Took advantage of a Cyber Monday deal to get a discount on the lovely room. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone heading to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Longshot78
Reviews.Content: Every staff member we came into contact with at this hotel was inhumanly friendly. We took a red eye from Los Angeles and arrived into Boston at 7am. We called the night before to inquire about early check in, and they said they could probably help us out. I was still surprised when they allowed us to check into our room immediately upon our arrival to the hotel. That doesn't work out very often from my experience! It allowed us to take a nap before heading out and sightseeing for the day. Made a huge difference in our trip. They have a nice restaurant, club and bar in the hotel for those cold winter days/nights when you don't feel like venturing out too far. A great hotel in a great city. Would absolutely stay again if I returned to Boston, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in the Lenox for 4 nights. Staff were so helpful. Location is just fantastic. I had previously stayed in the Marriott but will definitely be returning to The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: extremecommuter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lenox half a dozen times in the past several months and have always had a wonderful experience. The rooms are cozy, free wifi, Aveda bath products, and the lobby and restaurant are great to just hang out at! I like the quiet in the rooms--you can't hear doors slamming or people in the hallway. And, you can't beat the location! Great restaurants, shopping, and a Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: rzoe
Reviews.Content: My 2 older children and I had a reunion at the Lenox Hotel and stayed there for 4 nights. The staff was amazing - there is no other word for their consideration, manners, accommodation and helpful attitude. This applied to everyone from the managers, to the front desk, to the chamber maids. The first night we were there, we were interested in finding some live music and the Concierge did research for us and brought it up to the room. Another night, she brought up a bag of home baked cookies from the kitchen because my son had said he was in the mood for chocolate chip cookies. When I first got there, the room they gave me was not what I expected so they upgraded me to a Jr. suite at no extra charge. The room was extremely comfortable, clean and beautiful. The Lenox is centrally located near the Boston Public Library, Copley Square, an easy walk from the Boston Gardens, the Back Bay, not far from Symphony Hall and the Museum of Fine Arts. It is close to the Copley MTA station and there is a taxi stand on the Boylston St. side of the hotel (it's on the corner of Exeter and Boylston). There are many good restaurants in the area as well as shops and art galleries. If you're interested in a longer walk, it's not that far to walk across the Longfellow Bridge to MIT. Another plus is that the Lenox has made the attempt to be completely sustainable and have a neutral carbon foot print. Most of their energy comes from wind power and they recycle everything.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Joann3699
Reviews.Content: Was in town for business, but had friends come with. The junior suite room was perfect. When we first arrived, we didn't like the view, they promptly moved us to a higher floor. The food at the hotel was good. And as business traveler, the self-serve coffee bar area was a must and nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time, once again”
Reviews.Author: LaHormiguitaViajera0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to Boston after 14 years, this time with our kids, aged 15 & 13. We had previously stayed at The Lenox and loved it. So, we didn't doubt about it when looking for accommodations in this lovely city. We stayed 2 nights in early-December 2011 in two superior rooms, as standard rooms don't have double beds (I needed them for my children), which weren't connected but next to each other. Rooms were very clean and with a luxurious touch in the decor. Comfortable bed and bathroom. Aveda ammenities, which I really don't like. Location: more than perfect, easy access to shops and restaurants. Walking distance to Freedom Trail and to the T (subway). Valet-parking only- call well ahead to ask for your car, it usually takes quite some time. If you request a late check-out, please be sure your keys work after regular checkout time. We had to go to the front desk 3 times to make it to our rooms... Overall, our stay was very good - we'll return to The Lenox if in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mainegirl1047
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Boston several times a year and like to try out different hotels. Although I do like other places, The Lenox has got to be my favorite. The Hotel itself is lovely and it has very nice amenities, but I think the thing that really sets it apart is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The man who parks the car, the desk clerks, the maids who take care of the room, even the staff in the restaurant - all are lovely. If I can, I would always choose The Lenox

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: snailme
Reviews.Content: Lovely little Hotel with fantastic location in Boston. We felt that anywhere we wanted to be/do/see was at a walkable distance ( except for the Aquarium to which we took a taxi) We chose to not eat breakfast at the hotel and instead popped over to Starbucks for a nice latte each morning, which saved us some Dollars. Very nearby the hotel there are some nice little shops down on Newbury street, which we found very pleasant. One thing I found confusing- Am I really supposed to tip the doorman ( who doesnâ€™t actually hold any door for you, but only touches his hat) everytime when you enter the hotel? I donâ€™t like these surplus staff hanging about for that very reason. We went for a Junior Suite. Beds were lovely, we were right in a corner with great views over Boylston street and it was less noisy than I thought it would be. Overall a great experience, friendly staff- but do make sure you have 5 Dollars on you each time you leave your room- there will always be someone ready help you with something you didnâ€™t realize you needed help with.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox Hotel - My new favorite in Boston”
Reviews.Author: L1
Reviews.Content: I only booked The Lenox Hotel for Friday night since Saturday night I was staying with friends. I would have loved another night. The location of this hotel canâ€™t be beat. 1 block from Copley â€œTâ€� Station and in the midst of shopping, (Newbury Street is 2 blocks away), sightseeing and many wonderful places to eat. I arrived a bit early and my room was not quite ready. So I dashed out to see the sights, and they phoned me as soon as my room was ready. They upgraded my room and put me on the top floor. I was surprised to see a air cleaner in my room but I was given one of the PURE rooms as they call them. They also had the foam pillows that I had requested already in my room. The room was very big for being in the city. It has a walk-in closet, which shocked me when I opened it. The furnishings were very nice, traditional as to be expected as the hotel is a historical landmark. The bathroom was a bit tight but fine for 1 person. Loved the Aveda toiletries and endless supplies of bottles of water which I needed as the room was dry from the cold weather. They turned down my bed and left Lindt Truffles. (The Lindt store is right next to the hotel!) I stayed in December, so the hotel was festively decorated for the holidays. It really made me feel like I fell into an Old English Christmas book. I sat down in the lobby area by the roaring fireplace and read as it was so relaxing and beautiful. All in all, a fabulous and memorable stay. It started my weekend and holiday season out perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Berkshire Concepts-Thank you”
Reviews.Author: natasha327
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and had a great expiriece. Location is perfect to enjoy yourself in the great city of Boston. Berkshire Concepts made it affordable for me, I got a room for 150$ per night. Thank you Berkshire Concepts!

Reviews.Title: “Five stars is not enough for this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Racandtac
Reviews.Content: From our arrival to the departure seven days later there was not one thing that was not of a five star standard or beyond. The door staff, reception staff, especially Ashley and Meghan were outstanding! They could not have been more helpful or friendlier. The location in relation to Newbury Street, the Metro, sites and shopping is extremely convenient. The Prudential Centre, Lord and Taylor, Saxs on 5th are all within a very short walk. Our room was whisper quiet, large and comfortable. It was spotlessly clean and well equipped and refreshed each day. Bottled water was provided daily and there are fountains on each floor to minimise the plastic bottle use. Evening turndown provides Lindt chocolates as well. There are bananas and tea and coffee in the foyer by the open fire each morning, hot chocolate and cookies each afternoon. The business centre and gym are excellent guest facilities as well. We ate in both restaurants, the chowder in the bar was delicious, the more formal dining food was very good too, as was the service. The cocktails are delicious! We were so sad to leave this hotel. They certainly have the needs of the guest at the forefront. There is not one thing they could improve. Continue to maintain your standards Lenox staff, other hotels should visit and learn from you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JackBauer1955
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Lenox! One thing to note is that there is Valet parking which is very expensive because there are very few options for parking nearby. This hotel has a great location close to shopping and many great restaurants are close by. The room was almost palatial, very clean, and had wonderful views. This hotel is quite expensive for my tastes but you really do get every penny's worth for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Lenox in Boston travelling with my partner & sister. Our first impression of the hotel was great. It was so welcoming and the service was fantastic. Our room was lovely - lots of character and very comfortable. It is not comparable to the other modern style of hotels we usually stay in because it is so different. We ate dinner in the main restaurant downstairs before heading over to the Irish Pub to watch #6 game in the Stanley Cup. The atmosphere was electric and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The location of the hotel is great - right in Back Bay with an easy walk to restaurants and shopping. I certainly wish we spent more than just 2 nights in Boston and I look forward to going back again. I will definitely be staying at the Lenox when we return to Boston. We also caught the train up to Harvard which was very easy and a lot of fun. Also caught the subway around to Fenway Park. I was very pleased at how easy it was to get around Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aimhigh2
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels that I have ever stayed . Very good service, location anad rooms . THe restaurants have good food and teh price was very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury in Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: cody008
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to the Lenox. We stayed there several years ago and were impressed. When we had the opportunity to return over this past Holiday, we were delighted with our experience. This hotel is a five-star gem. Not only did they meet us at the curbside and bring our bags to our room, our wait staff went above and beyond, offering advice on local eateries, directions, and even travel weather. The rooms were plush without being overdone, and the Lobby was beautifully decorated in the New England Holiday spirit. If you're tired of the "big chain" hotels and looking for great value in the heart of Boston, the Lenox Hotel can't be beat. Superb location, wonderful staff, good in-hotel dining, and exceptional service!

Reviews.Title: “Should be number 1 - really really really good!”
Reviews.Author: Mickeyd76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a good rate. Complimentary upgrade to suite. Great room, great service, great amenities and great location. Stay here. Just take my word for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly courteous service.”
Reviews.Author: Hector18
Reviews.Content: All as we would have expected based on good recommendations on this site. We booked Exec King with fireplace -- these rooms are large corner rooms, ours was on 11th floor. Bathroom a little tired but ok.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I want to stay when I'm in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dancepig
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Boston. I've stayed in many of them, Sheraton, Marriott, Weston, Copley, but this is the best. The best customer service you will ever find, the most fantastic bar and lounge, and the location cannot be better. One block from the Copley T stop. One block from Newbury Street. One block from the Prudential Building and one block from Copley Center. The customer service will do their utmost best to provide you with what you need. If you're needing directions, a toothbrush or a banana, it's there for you. The hotel is an historic hotel, so be prepared for the carpets to be showing some wear and tear, but the fireplace in the room (if you're in a room with a fireplace) more than makes up for this. If you don't have a fireplace in your room, and you want to be near a fireplace, just go down to the lobby, there's one roaring away for you (in the winter). If you want a mid-day snack or cocktail, try the Irish pub located adjacent to the Hotel. If you stay at the Lenox, be prepared for the best stay in Boston you've had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sarra A
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Lenox for 3 nights right after christmas, after much research on Boston's best hotels. In the end, we were very pleased with our decision to stay here. The room was nice, we had booked a queen bed and were upgraded to king upon arrival. We also arrived very early, around 10:30am and our room was waiting for us! I had read that the bathrooms were small, which is accurate, but not so small that it was any sort of hassle for us. What made this hotel such a great experience for us was the staff-- it's as if at the beginning of their workdays, they are each told to treat every guest they encounter like kings! Even to the point that when we called near midnight one night with the farfetched question of if they had any candy on hand, a staff member was at our door not 5min later carrying a gift box of lindt chocolates, free of charge! What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonaldsmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Lenox for 4 nights at the end of Nov 2011. We had a great time and the staff were brilliant at the hotel. The bed was hugh and very comfortable. We had a big tv which was great when we were awake at 4am in the morning. The supermarket was just a round the corner for bits and pieces and the mall just up the road which was great. The decorations were up for xmas and the lobby looked great and very festive. We would return to the Lenox without hesitation and hope to do so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed messages”
Reviews.Author: JandJMSP
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Lenox. The first stay was delightful which brought us back when we had a family event in October. I reserved a single for my mother in law and a small suite for my wife daughter and my self. I believe that if I am going to pay a premium for a room I should receive a higher level of service along with the room being above average. Service for us was spotty, a delay in having a room ready allowed the front desk to shine by buying us lunch. A further delay though understandable was not communicated us us and that off set the good feeling from the front desk experience. We finally asked for alternate rooms and after some conversation they were provided. It may have been the change of rooms because although we received the same room it had a number of flaws which for a premium property should be unacceptable. The smoke detector was missing, I called and I told the bellman. It was never taken care of during the four days we were guests. Holes in the wall where something had been removed - not for what bills it self as a boutique hotel. Having to repeatedly call for our bags - I was comfortable with them not arriving shortly after we moved into our room even though we were told they were on the way up. I was comfortable calling and asking when they might arrive. I was told the bellman was on the way up. I was aggravated when the bags still had not arrived and I started to get questioned by my wife and daughter. I was expecting and hoping for a premium experience and that was not the case. I called about what I thought was a noisy ventilation system - I don't believe anyone ever looked at it. We loved the location, restaurant service was very uneven, the doorman was great - the hotel just disappointed. To add insult to injury I receive an automatic e-mail from the general manager thanking me for my stay and asking me to rate the hotel. I was honest with my responses and even handed just as I believe I am here. I thought a quality hotel like this would at least respond to a critical response from a guest. It didn't happen. I like the hotel, I believe it could fix the issues so I called and asked to speak to the GM. There was no response so I followed up - at this point you have a right to say I'm the moron here. the GM's assistant finally called, set up a time for me to talk with the GM which I scheduled and then he never called. Several days later I had a voice asking to me to set up a new time. Enough said - I was terribly disappointed on a number of levels. It did not ruin the trip - it was one of those things where because I walked in with premium expectation and on a number of levels they were not met. I hope this helps guide your decision making.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandRita
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel in August 2011 on a family trip to Boston and loved it. The room was very spacious with two double beds (which were very comfortable), a sofa, fireplace, flat screen TV and bathrobes. The staff were very friendly and helpful giving us plenty of ideas on where to sight-see. We took the metro from the airport and could not believe how close it was to the Hotel which made travelling around very easy. It is also within walking distance of lots of nice shops and restaurants. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy with our room on arrival. We had breakfast in the restaurant and late evening snacks in the Solas bar and the food was very good. I would stay in this Hotel again if I ever go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and personal service”
Reviews.Author: RdSxfn
Reviews.Content: We live locally so don't often stay in Boston hotels but had a birthday to celebrate and had a good offer to stay at this hotel. We booked two rooms, one for us, one for the kids, and had a really nice stay. There are glitzier hotels in Boston, for sure, but the Lenox is in a very convenient location on Boylston Street (in Back Bay - excellent for Newbury Street, Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Center, Fenway Park, most of the local colleges - not on the waterfront or in the financial district) . The rooms were nice, comfortable, and we had a great stay. It's a smaller, more compact hotel - you won't feel like you're crossing a huge lobby or fighting the crowds. The room size is decent though, I've seem much smaller ones in far more expensive Boston hotels. What made it special was how nice all the staff were, even sending a cake up for my son's birthday and really making him feel important. I have definitely recommended this to friends and would return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGibbons
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in December. Could not fault the hotel. Lovely warm welcome with home made cookies at the reception desk.Enjoyed complimentary hot chocolate a few mornings before setting off for the day. Girls were most helpful with any queries we had. The room was spacious and very comfortable with a large tv, fridge and aveda wash products. Great location. Right beside Prudential Centre and around the corner from train station. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: GramercyNYC
Reviews.Content: Booked a King Junior Suite for 2 nights on December 26 & 27th (Monday-Wednesday) I called to confirm a few days in advance I asked if there was any possibility to be upgraded (based on other reviews) and the woman from the front desk said they were very quiet so it was a good possibility. When we arrived we were greeted by Peter, who was extemely friendly and helpful providing restaurant suggestions, directions, etc. My boyfriend told the front desk that it was our anniversary and asked if there was any way we could be upgraded and was told that they would 'take care' of us. Oddly, when we returned from lunch we found that they had changed our room to the top floor but we were not actually upgraded. The bellman also informed us that the hotel was very quiet so I'm not sure why the upgrade wasn't given. In addition, we found out that the ice maker on the 11th floor was broken and it took longer for the elevator to arrive. Regardless, the hotel was very nice, clean, and located in walking distance to most attractions. I'm rating the hotel 4 stars because I think we got exactly what we paid for but I was not blown away like the other reviewers. Maybe the staff was a little different because it was right after the holidays? I think next time we will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: NONE1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days over the New Year, based on other TA recommendations and were not disapointed. The service is absolutely top notch, and you are made to feel so welcome, from the reception staff, to the concierge, the staff in the 2 bars and the chambermaids. The lobby is lovely and homely, especially on a cold winters morning, with an open fire and coffee/tea facilities.( Would have liked these in the room) We had a room on the 11th floor, so good views. The bed was really comfortable with great pillows. The room could have been a bit bigger, but hey how much time do you spend in your room.My only grip was the bathroom, it was quite small and could do with upgrading, hence the 4 rating. I also could not find a guide in the room about the facilities in the Hotel, which was quite unusual for a hotel of this calibre. The location is fantastic, close to great shopping, restaurants and the T. Atlantic Fish Company, across the road is amazing, also a good steak house in Abe & Louie's. All in all, very pleased with this hotel, and if we do ever return to Boston, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel/Experience”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here after New Year's and everything about it was top-notch--location, staff, room and so on. Highly recommend it. Just be prepared for a hefty valet parking bill--$43. Still it's a lot less than parking in midtown Manhattan! Any way, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: coluforever
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the Lenox from start to finish. Relaxed surroundings, helpful and friendly staff, comfortable and clean room, plus a great location for tourist sights, shopping and the 'T' - this hotel had it all. Not forgetting free WiFi and complimentary bananas in the lobby each morning! We stayed for 5 nights post-Xmas and would thoroughly recommend this hotel when staying in Boston. The perfect base for exploring the city. The sign of a great hotel is feeling a bit sad when the time comes to leave. That's how we felt checking out of the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox boston”
Reviews.Author: neilmcCornwall
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel from start to finish. We stayed for our wedding anniversary over new year, and had the most amazing stay. Room 1004 was fantastic, the maid cleaned and tidied the room every day, the front desk staff and door staff were perfect, and the the snacks and service in Solas were excelkent. I write this sat in the city bar, and the lady (alanna) serving us was simply wonderful. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We will be back again asap.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 20aloha08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in mid November 2011. The location of the hotel is excellent - a short subway ride from Logan Airport to Copley Station (1 transfer) and the hotel is a minutes walk from the station exit. The hotel backs onto Newbury Street which is full of dining options as well as fantastic shopping. The Prudential centre shopping mall is a few blocks down from the hotel and a great place to explore for a few hours. The atmosphere in the hotel is fantastic and from the moment we were greeted by the doormen on arrival to the moment we checked out we felt at home. During check-in, the concierge noted that we were in Boston for a birthday trip and brought up a birthday card and chocolate cake on our first night to allow us to celebrate. It was an unexpected but lovely surprise! We were also given an upgrade and were in a beautiful superior room on the 9th floor which provided lovely views across the back-bay area. The rooms were large and clean with a 32" television and 2 double beds. The room also had a fridge which was free to use for guests and each morning they fill it with complimentary bottles of water. The bathroom was luxuriously kitted out and included aveda bath products. We understand some reviews have noted the decor is old-fashioned and in need of an upgrade, however, we felt this added to the charm of staying in a period hotel. The turndown service each night was a lovely touch and we looked forward to our chocolate truffle each night! The hotel has 2 bars/restaurants inside it and also had a reasonably-priced room service menu. Each morning the lobby provides complimentary coffee for guests, and in the evening they provide a complimentary "seasonal treat" (apple cider and cookies whilst we were there). Overall, we would certainly recommend this hotel for anybody looking for a base to explore the wonderful city of Boston. We would, hower advise to look for deals was we got our room for a fantastic price by booking through our airline - deals are out there so check before you book.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL FOR BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: Jahoovdmeer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for 6 days in December. The hotel is perfectly located in downtown Boston. The hotel is close to the subway station. The front desk could see at check inn that we had stayed before. So we had a warm welcome. We got a room on the top floor. The bed was excellent. Free internet. Also a perfect concierge service which can arrange almost everything for you. The staff is utmost friendly. The have also a nice cocktail bar. It feel really like you are staying in a high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: livezwinky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was quite expensive but well worth it. Found the twin room very spacious and full of frills! There was certainly no expense spared when this hotel was renovated. Found the staff very friendly and helpful. I thought that the coffee in the morning a great touch. Also the turn down service with Lindt sweets was great. The location of the hotel was great. A lovely area in the heart of the city! Very very central. This hotel really exceeded my expectations and the staff really went that extra mile for the customer. Will most certainly stay here again. A model hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Dad-O-Rama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox in August with my wife and 2 children. We booked 2 ajoining rooms. We arrived at reception quite late (at 11:30pm) but reception was well staffed, friendly and the bellman showed us to our room quickly. The location is brilliant. The hotel itself is a great throwback to the hotels of old. The rooms were spacious and well furnished. The decor is good though not necessarily as upscale as some 5 star luxury hotels. What you do get is a friendly, spacious home away from home. We were extemely pleased with the hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Jimtr
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Location was easy walk to everything and T was close if you wanted. Service was exceptional. Only problem we had was AC was a little noisy and temperature inconsistent. Front desk comp'd us breakfast one day due to problems with AC.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with confortable roooms”
Reviews.Author: tracey h
Reviews.Content: We had a great stop over with a super room is a great location, excellent friendly staff. Would stay again, reasonable value too

Reviews.Title: “Living in luxury at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: rgrippo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while I attended an environmental toxicology (SETAC) conference and my wife did an NSF workshop that both happened to be in Boston at the same time. Our stay was wonderful. Check-in was quick and easy (and they accomodated us two hours early). The room was fabulous with nice appointments, a great bathroom and a very luxurious bed. Our only negative was the view from our room, not bad but mostly of a roof top. Location was good with a fair amount of expensive and inexpensive dining within walking distance. Also had a Trader Joe's supermarket just 1.5 blocks away. I love to walk and Boston is definitely a walking town, with the start of the Freedom trail only about 6 blocks away, which I spent a day doing on foot. Overall, a wonderful experience I would love to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellieander
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox last weekend after his company holiday party. The Lenox has many of the personal touches you'd expect from a boutique hotel: complementary cookies and hot chocolate at check-in, chocolate truffles on our pillows, and Aveda products in the bathroom. The staff were all friendly and helpful at check-in, and there was an older gentleman greeting people in the lobby who was so sweet I wanted to put him in my pocket and take him home. We booked a double room with a hefty discount on hotels.com. The room was on the small side, but had lots of period charm. The bathroom was beautiful and remodeled; we especially appreciated the soft towels and bathrobes. The Lenox has a superb location in Back Bay and is in walking distance to lots of shopping, restaurants, and the T. You get excellent service for a price much lower than comparable hotels in the area. We parked in the Prudential garage (~$25 for overnight parking) and walked over so we didn't pay for the Lenox's parking. I definitely recommend the Lenox for business travelers and couples. As I said, our room was small so I don't think it's ideal for those traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrav99
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Lovely large room, feather pillows, robes, Aveda products in the bath, free coffee in the morning and cookies and cocoa in the afternoon. The room had an excellent view of the Hancock Tower and Boylston St. Good location in the Back Bay, just one block from the T station. The staff was really friendly and helpful, can't fault anything at all about this hotel. We'd most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight getaway”
Reviews.Author: bscotchnh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live about one hour's drive from Boston, and wanted to grab a couple of days in Back Bay during the holiday season. I agree with other reviewers that the location is supurb for experiencing the best shopping that Boston has to offer, and as long as the winter weather is cooperative, puts you within walking distance of many charming and interesting attractions. Indeed, in warm weather, I've even walked to Fenway Park from this location. With a AAA room rate and mid-December hotel slump, the price was right. Extremely accomodating staff and classic (meaning not modern) decor, was just right for us. The attached City Table Restaurant is a plus, particularly on a cold and blustery evening. The noise level is a bit high, but the food is of excellent quality and the prices put it into the $$$ range. The upscale Copley Place Mall is just a few blocks away, and the shops, galleries and restaurants of Newbury Street are one block north. If you like to browse libraries, as I sometimes do, cross Exeter Street to the Boston Public Library. Just one night and two days like this can really do wonders for one's spirits. There was mention on another review of the $43.00 valet parking fee. That can be avoided by clicking onto www.boston.centralparking.com and printing out a certificate for the Prudential parking garage, which is just a bit further down Exeter Street from The Lenox. The discounted fee for 24 hours is $25.00, and there is no one to tip.

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: ammaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel. .Although we did not use the gym or eat in the restaurant, in every other way the Lenox Hotel was more than satisfactory. We would reccomend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Magic at The Lenox”
Reviews.Author: steve w w
Reviews.Content: Words can not express how much we enjoyed our stay at The Lenox. We spent the first two nights of our honeymoon U.S road trip at The Lenox in September this year (2011). On check in we were congratualed on our marraige by the receptionist and made to feel very welcome. She then advised that we had been upgraded to a King Superior corner suite. A wonderful suprise!. On arrival in our room we were greeted with flowers, a teddy and a card from the staff congratulating us on our marraige. Within 10 minutes of settling down in our room champagne was bought to us. We couldn't beleive our luck, this was customer service on a level neither of us had ever received. The room was stunning, extremely clean and the decor was fantastic. The bed was huge and all of the facitlies you'd expect were available. On unpacking I'd discovered that I failed to pack my cufflinks. On the off chance that the hotel may have some I contacted reception and within 10 minutes a pair of cufflinks were delivered straight to my door. The hotel itself is amazing, classic decor and beautifully maintained. Both nights of our stay, before leaving for our evening meal we headed straight for the bar within the hotel, which is a more of a modern style compared to the rest of the hotel but very cosy and the service was great. We didn't eat at the hotel itself so can't really comment on that. Overall we had a fantastic stay at The Lenox, the staff were amazing and the hotel absolutely wonderful. Boston is a great city and we definately want to go back for a longer stay. After our experience at The Lenox I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else. It's probably the best hotel either of us have ever stayed at. Thank you so much for helping to make the first nights of married life so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Astridur
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with great staff, the location is the best and it doesnt matter which hotel room you stay in they are all good. The only thing I missed this time was the coffee maker in the room, but instead they have coffee in the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Top Banana !!!”
Reviews.Author: pekaclarke
Reviews.Content: Cant fault this hotel , from the moment we arrived on a cold thursday afternoon we were met by such lwe were on the 6th floor overlooking Exeter street . The irish bar is well worth a visit !! The guiness isnt to bad , had worse in Ireland , the food is cheap and very nice too . The only little mistake they have made is not providing tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms but there is free hot drinks in lobby every morning . The room service IS very expensive , $60 for 3 turkey club sandwiches , 2 cokes and a bottle of bud , works out to about Â£38 . But there is a Dunkin Doughnuts straight over the road which we went to every morning afterwards . All in All a very nice hotel and would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in an awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0999Boston
Reviews.Content: How awesome to arrive on a cold Friday afternoon and be greeted by mint choc chip cookies at check in! The comp hot chocolate in the sitting area was also good! Very old fashioned Boston, impeccable service! Our room was even much bigger than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Baseballzill1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 days at the beginning of July. This is a hotel where the staff are so helpful its almost too much. The decor is grandiose but then it is a boutique hotel. We never got round to eating in the hotel but the on-site pub is really good. Some fabulous touches from the receptionists, so if you want plenty of attentive service, the Lenox is for you. Try and meet Johnny, the world war 2 veteran octagenarian still working in the hotel. Boston is a fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Its difficult to imagine a better hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Birdiestir
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Lenox just after Thanksgiving. From the warm welcome, to the upgrade and the amazing friendliness of the staff, we could wish for a better hotel experience. All the things that you normally look for in a hotel were there from cleanliness, quality amenities, and caring service. The lenox also seems to be leading the way environmentally with in room separation of recyclables, choices regarding linen changes and even wooden room cards (not plastic). Staff went out of their way to help us and in one case where my wife had lost her eyeglasses, one of the desk staff went to a distant department store to see if she could locate them. We have travelled widely and stayed at many hotels and we could not help buy notice the genuine attitude of the staff. Location in Back Bay is ideal. A couple of the tour buses run right past, and most things are a reasonably easy walk. Newbury street is one block away the trains about one block. Lots of good restaurants abound. Check out the Pour House for drinks and good meals about 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff to Match”
Reviews.Author: JVPG
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of hotels around the world, the Lenox is hard to beat for its standard of service, friendliness, and value for money. We had a superior room (515), which was both spacious and extremely comfortable. Nice little touches, like complementary coffee served in the lounge each morning, hot chocolate in the evening. The hotel is located in the heart of Boston, close to all amenities and transport links. We stayed for 5 nights and the standard of service never dipped once. We intend returning and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: candi28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Lenox at end of September 2011. It was my birthday and they arranged a bottle of wine and balloons to be waiting for us. A lovely welcome. The position is excellent and we walked everywhere or used the T. We had breakfast there which was good and the recommendations for meals etc were excellent. We had a lovely room on the Pure Floor which was a treat we didn't expect. The bed was sooo comfy! It was our first time in Boston and we hope to return and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: Tomsawyer71
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay there. The location is perfect ( 20 min from the airport by Taxi, T line one block away and next to Newbury street). The staff was very professional and friendly. The amenities are very good ( free WiFi through out the hotel, restaurant, bar, gym). I was on the 11th floor. the room was nice and spacious.
