The only negative point is that it starts to look slightly tired and a slight refurbishment with more trendy colors would make it look even better. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and definitely recommend the Lenox Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in an unbelievable location!”
Reviews.Author: LaryS6143
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and the old world feel of the lobby and the rooms, very ornate! I was here on a business trip in the dead of winter and was happy to find that I could hop on a train a block away and skip out on long walks in the cold, there are a ton of great restaurants nearby (atlantic fish- nearly across the street) I could stay close to the hotel if need be and the pub in the hotel offers a decent dinner menu (standard pub fare) if you want to skip braving the outdoors altogether or if you just want to grab some wine and hang out in your room there is a grocery right down the street with a pretty notable selection. The customer service here is outstanding, constantly greeted with a smile no matter if you are rolling in from a late night or getting a 5AM head start into work, turndown service with an extra cookie if it was clear you had a rough day, and Escalade service should you need to call on it to get to the airport or to a meeting across town! The rooms are a bit on the small side, and it is a bit spendy if you are staying a few days...but it is absolutely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TrueSingaporean
Reviews.Content: The location of this quality hotel is very central to main points of interest, shopping, subways and eateries. The environment is very conducive and safe, within 3 mins walk to the Prudential center which house several shops and the famous Boston Legal Seafoods and Cheesecake factory. Our family with teens got a good price with advance booking and we stayed in the corner suite for about a week. It was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The lobby serves complementary and good coffee/tea in the mornings and juice in the evenings. We saw other neighborhoods but nothing beats Lenox with its great price, quality stay and great locale. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The most lovely and relaxing mini-honeymoon weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Since we are saving up for a larger vacation later next year, my wife and I spent our honeymoon weekend at the Lenox, and it was one of the most pleasant, welcoming places we have ever stayed. We chose an Executive Fireplace Guest Room since we both love the warmth and ambience of a real wood-burning fireplace. The room wasn't too extravagant, but we only spent the nights in, spending the days shopping and eating in some of the finest stores and restaurants in Boston, all along the Back Bay. The only thing I would caution about - and I think it's only because I am a bit hyper-sensitive to sound - is that the HVAC made a constant low whirr. This may not be an issue on other floors; We were on the 5th. Regardless, it is a minor issue but one worth mentioning. Also, while they inexplicably do not provide a water boiler or coffee maker for tea/coffee in the rooms, they are happy to deliver tea, coffee, or boiling water to your room at any time of day or night! Solas, the Irish pub on the ground floor of the Lenox was cozy, but not particularly impressive as far as Irish-style pubs go - if you want real Irish ambience in Boston, I heartily suggest getting on the subway to Haymarket and make the walk through Quincy Market to The Black Rose. City Table on the other hand had absolutely delicious food and very nice lighting and atmosphere. But the thing that really, truly shines about The Lenox is its staff. Every single person we encountered greeted us with a friendly smile with no sign of pretense. We felt truly welcome at every moment. The front desk was incredibly helpful, and we were also impressed at the range of complimentary amenities available - I fully expected our bill to be at least another $100 from the services we ordered - snacks, firewood (repeatedly), water and milk - and all there was 50 cents for some Tylenol (they likely have to charge for any medicine by law). Overall, I would definitely, enthusiastically, recommend The Lenox to anybody looking for a comfortable, romantic evening or two in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with all good service, central location for shopping (ladies, take notice!)”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: very central, very close to central shopping street (Newbury st) and malls AMBIENCE: itâ€™s a mid-size boutique hotel, with medium-size charming lobby and a medium-size reception. I liked that they had coffee and tea in the lobby (gratis) for everyone. It seemed it was just part of their good service. ROOM: large, comfortable, luxurious room with all top-notch amenities. Great bathroom. RECEPTION: quite helpful and friendly. Knowledgeable about Boston. BAR: quite a cozy bar on ground floor, which during the cold weather was inviting to sit and relax there. VALUE: reasonable well-priced ($280 incl all taxes) for such location/service/room.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Gerard46209
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for the first time during the first week in December intending to stay only one night but was so pleased with the hotel and my room that I stayed a second night. The front desk staff were very helpful and cheery. Jessie is a real credit to the hotel. The hotel seems to have been recently renovated from what must be a 1900 building. The wonderful character remains while nicely updated. There is free WIFI in the rooms. There's a small fridge with complimentary water. There is early morning coffee in the lobby and if you ask ahead they provide your choice of newspapers to your door. The Lenox is located a block from Copley place and across from the Boston public library. Great location with restaurants and night life a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in boston”
Reviews.Author: Docdic18
Reviews.Content: Lenox hotel was a great place to stay. We enjoyed our room, but would've liked a bigger tub. Great location in trendy back bay, with easy access to the T at Copley station. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love The lenox”
Reviews.Author: Pickersgills
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at The Lenox, the rest of my family their first, and most definitely not the last. I booked 3 rooms for my family and stayed 3 nights, we all wished it had been for longer. The bedrooms were clean, it was good to have a couple of bottles of water each day put in the fridge without having to pay for. Of an evening the beds were turned down and a couple of Lindt chocolates left on the pillows, just adds that finishing touch to the day. What can I say about the staff, so friendly and helpful. You walk into reception and straight away the staff talk and smile at you, nothing is too much bother for them. Jimmy and Sid, the bellmen were superb and kept us entertained at all times. Even when we were leaving for the airport the doorman didn't give up looking for a taxi for 5 of us, not always that easy to do, but he found one. The Lenox is perfectly located for tourists. Not far from Copley, the Prudential Centre on the doorstep for shopping, Boston Common, the T and loads more. Also some great restaurants around. We went to The Atlantic Fish a couple of times and Stephanies on Newbury, all within 5 minutes of walking distance. We always had breakfast in the hotel, not a bad price. Coffee and bananas were available from the lobby in the morning and late afternoon juice and doughnuts, yet again making the finishing touches to a great hotel. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of professionalism and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: dendc
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is always my first choice when in Boston. Excellent staff and unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Mags H
Reviews.Content: Three friends celebrating a big birthday - 3 days stay - loved the welcome, the staff could not have been more helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Food and drink great, bedrooms clean and well maintained but this hotels greatest asset was its staff. From front of house to restaurant and bar all we got were smiling faces and friendly banter. Shopping within walking distance - would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our quick Boston trip!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie382
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Lenox Hotel for a quick trip to the city. Our stay could not have been better. The location of this beautiful historic hotel is perfect-- within walking distance of many shops, restaurants, pubs, attractions, and fine dining (even in heels!) and also very close to the T. The hotel itself was beautifully decorated, keeping true to the historical elements while also adding subtle luxurious amenities and details. The staff was helpful and attentive (although we did miss turndown service). We will definitely stay at the Lennox again and in fact we can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, top notch service, Boston in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: Mikko C
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is situated RIGHT in the middle of downtown - a perfect location for the first timer to Boston. It is stately and charming, with a feel of Old World charm. I love this about hotels when on romantic trips with my husband, but the more formal nature of them give me reason to pause when traveling with kids. I can honestly say that after staying at The Lenox, I will no longer hold prejudice thinking that the nicer the hotel, the harder to bring children. I was wrong. We were greeted by three different personnel, all in uniform, ready to park our car, grab our bags and lead us in. This ALWAYS freaks me out as I have kids to unload, bags to dig out, and a backseat of who knows what to clean up. The staff were relaxed and calming, easily taking bags out of my hands and caring for us without rushing us or being aggressive (have had this happen numerous times at other locations). We all walked into the hotel composed and ready, not scattered as you can be left feeling when hotel staff pushes you through the door. After having scored a really nice room rate, and desperately wanting a quick getaway from home, our little family visited The Lenox Hotel in Boston, with no expectations going in. We showed up early and our girls were greeted with a complimentary stuffed animal, including an extra one for our niece (whom we decided to bring at the last minute). Are you kidding me?!? Our bags were tended to, and we were invited to walk about the city as the room was quickly prepared. They called us (about 15 min. later) to tell us they were ready. I recommend The Lenox Hotel to anyone - couple or family - looking for the easiest of Boston getaways. We were steps to The Prudential Center and shopping, walking distance to Newbury St. and the Gardens. We had no agenda, so walking around and seeing new things was an easy enough experience. The Hotel breakfast was delicious and our girls loved getting treated to fancy dining-in room service. But the best part was that all of us - even our young girls (ages 7, 5 and 4) were treated like royalty. The staff went out of their way to chat with our little ladies, making them feel just as important as the grown-ups. As a parent that has experienced enough hotels that treat children as less than human, even before they open their mouths, it was not only refreshing but a blessing to be at The Lenox Hotel. There were some discrepancies when it came to promised times as opposed to actual delivery ... but these things happen everywhere, and the staff at The Lenox more than made up for it in their attention to service on bigger ticket items. The Lenox Hotel knows how to make everyone feel relaxed and cared for, no matter how old. This is what luxury accomodations are all about. All hotels should take note.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Valerie K
Reviews.Content: First visit to Boston so it was a case of using recommendations. Brilliant choice. Very central to everything. Comfortable room, friendly staff and good food available. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling74
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. It is a welcome break from all of the major hotel chains. My room was very nice and the bed was comfortable, plus I loved the Aveda toiletries. I wished I had more time to get out and do some shopping, since this hotel is located just steps from fantastic shopping on Newberry street. The service was excellent as well, everyone I interacted with was super helpful and quite friendly. The only (tiny) thing I found fault with was that the TV picture would freeze every 10 minutes or so. Switching the channel would fix the problem temporarily. Other than that, a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TwoHams
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston at the Lenox for five nights and found it to be a great hotel. It had a lovely feel, with great decor and atmosphere. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was small but very comfortable and quiet. The hotel is in a great spot, close to lots of fabulous restaurants, shops and many of Boston's sights and tourist meeting points.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: LyndellandMarc
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with wonderful atmosphere. The staff at all times were pleasant, courteous and more than helpful. The atmosphere of the room we had was wonderful and I would say the best so far that we have stayed at in our trip to USA. We were blessed with being ugraded to a room on the eleventh floor and this also added to our impressiveness of the place.Nothing was too hard for the staff and it made our stay so pleasant. The room itself was of great ambience, larger than what we had anticipated or what it looked like from the photos of the web. We thought the tariff was VERY reasonable given the quality of the room and service. The complimentary bottles of water, chocolates on the bed each night, plus the donuts and apple cider waiting for you in the Hotel lobby/foyer when you returned from your day's sightseeing added to the whole atmosphere. Each morning there was coffee available in the foyer, plus fresh bananas available at all times through the day. The centrality of the location also made it a great place to stay as everything was in walking distance, and we did a lot of walking!!! I would definitey recommend this hotel and look forward to stay ing here again if we ever need to stay in Boston again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: redswiss
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in Boston and stayed at the Lenox. The room was great and the hotel staff could not do enough to help. The location of the hotel is great as well. You are only a 10 min walk in to the center of Boston. Overall it was great stay and we would go back again. Also check out the irish bar in the hotel. Great for a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “avoid room 624”
Reviews.Author: mi67418
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel although most of the time in Boston, we like to be at Fairmont. Should have done it as usual. The room after upgrading was 624. This is one of the connecting room, and we were able to hear EVERY THING the next room women were talking about. The voice simply came through the connecting door. They were not loud at all, just to make things straight. It was as if there was NO WALL between 2 rooms. We were shocked. When I was in the shower, I heard someone banging on the door. I thought it was an emergency or something.. like the hotel on fire?? It turns out that people above our room were walking around. I could not believe the poor condition of the hotel. It didn't help when we checked in, NO ONE came to help us with our luggage. The room was average with poor amenity. Some of the lights were not working. I want to think that room 624 had some major issue and that we were unlucky. I want to think that they were too busy carrying guest's bags. However, I do not want to go back and risk another annoying night at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lions2011
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived we were treated like family! Beautiful hotel. Wonderful staff. Great location. 12 out of 10 !!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carolecar
Reviews.Content: The Lenox could not have been better for sightseers. This hotel is ideally located near trolly access, Trinity Church, restaurants and shopping. The hotel has been updated and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. Their restaurant is upscale and the service for the meal we had there was fine. Free wifi was easily accessed. Would enjoy staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned elegance, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Finem50
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a week on business; my company put me in this grand old hotel in the heart of Boston's Backbay, a short walk from Symphony Hall. It's a great location, close to the lovely part along the river, shopping, restaurants, the best of Boston. Although I am American, I've lived in Europe for some time and was unprepared from the extraordinarily friendly welcome I received at the front desk from Kelly. This was true throughout my stay, from the excellent bartender (who recommended the superb 18 year old Glenmorangie) to the housekeepers who were happy to makeup and clean the room on my somewhat unusual schedule. The room itself was a Junior Suite on the 9th floor - comfortable and spacious with a large screen television and (more important to me), a Bose iPod dock. The free wireless without password was a plus as I had several devices connected to the internet: Speed and reliability were excellent. There was a lovely fireplace but sadly it had a metal plaque saying it was non-operational. The bed was comfortable as was the sofa. My only frustration was that I never mastered the heating/cooling system and the room was always either a bit chilly or too warm. My own fault: I could have asked. Despite this, the Lenox was a very comfortable home for a full week in one of the nicest parts of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boston in The Lenox Hotel. A wonderful friendly location for a get away.”
Reviews.Author: Bettybond25
Reviews.Content: We went on our annual Anniversary trip to the USA to Boston MA this year, and boy did we need (and have) a nice get away! Arriving in Boston on a beautiful sunset sky we were taken to our hotel for the week - The Lenox. First impressions of the lobby are of old charm and opulence. We were shown to our room and settled in, I must admit our room was a tad snug, we decided to ask if we could move and were told that if we tried the next day they may be able to help. The next day we went and asked again and were moved to a much nicer, larger room with a view over the city... We were very pleased! The room was lovely, a huge bed and flat screen TV, free WIFI and a lovely bathroom. The staff at The Lenox were helpful and friendly, happy to see us and never rude. The Lenox is situated in a good location as the city is very walkable, all in all we had a fantastic holiday and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Thatch81
Reviews.Content: Charming old feel in this 110 year old hotel. Staff was informed this was a birthday trip and promptly upgraded our room. All staff were friendly and accommodating I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “OUR REFLECTIONS ON THE LENOX”
Reviews.Author: BOBORTIZ
Reviews.Content: this is and has been my "home away from home" for 10 years now at 4 visits per year, comes to about 30 stays at the lenox. i really do get a sense that the lenox people really do care for my wife and i.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to stay at for the Boston Marathon.”
Reviews.Author: nasus74
Reviews.Content: The corner suite looking over the finish line is a great place to stay but on that "Marathon Monday", as we call it, it's usually rented out by different running groups...and so it should be. My friend got passes through her running group to go up to the top of the Lenox and watch the race with a bird's eye view. I'm not sure if it was open to the public or even Lenox Hotel guests...look into it. They had a whole spread of food and drinks with a DJ. Like I said, lots of running groups book through this hotel that weekend, so they roll out the red carpet. Of course, the best way to see the race is right on the street with everyone cheering on the runners! It's uplifting! It was such a great day!

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 5kmilesin2010
Reviews.Content: The great: Location, about 15 min walk from Boston Common, 30 min walk to Faneuil Hall, good shopping, restaurants, night life within blocks of the hotel. Two popular bars and a restaurant within the hotel, Staff was excellent, attentive, eager, bright, and effective at their jobs. I had a small cut which looked to be infected so the young lady at the front desk quickly found me a packet of antibiotic ointment they had behind the desk. Problem solved in about 30 seconds. I had a small room (not an issue) with a small fridge (no mini-bar). Rooms were quiet, couldn't hear the neighbors. HBO was great (although screen on TV kept freezing for some reason - couldn't tell if it was the TV or the cable). They had a safe in the room. Free wi-fi, no password required. Robes, iron w/board provided in the room, The bad:This is clearly an old hotel. The room I stayed in on the 10th floor is in need of refurbishment. The floor creaked in places, The smoke detector was so dusty I doubt it would ever work if there was a fire. There is no counterspace in the bathroom. I have one small shaving kit and was pressed for space (kept it on the towel rack) One pillowcase had a rip in it. The electrical outlets looked a little dodgy, and the ceiling in the closet looked a little unfinished with dirty drop-tiles somewhat askew.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Killin
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a very wet blustery, snowy saturday evening to the comfort and hospitality of the staff, Keely the receptionist was outstanding regarding her appraoch to guests. We were sent a complementary drink to our room and no request was a problem. The hotel is bu no means modern but a comfy place to stay with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & concierge, no view.”
Reviews.Author: AZMGSR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is copnveniently located in the middle of Back Bay, one block from Newbery street for great shopping. The decor is a bit dated, and unfortunately our room was a Double Queen Junior Suite on the third floor with absolutely no view (request a higher floor if you can). The Service is top notch, Justin the Concierge was great and changed our restaurant reservation easily even calling me on my cell phone to confirm. The ambience in the common areas is refined. Would definitely go back when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & elegant”
Reviews.Author: workinggirl2
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were upgraded. Beautiful classic room. Staff was courteous and helpful. Morning coffee in the lobby. The location is excellent - the is such a walkable town and The Lenox is in the middle of it all. Trains (the T), Prudential Center, Newbury Street, etc nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Service!”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Stay here!! The hotel is beautiful, always willing to serve, comfortable and quiet, and in an amazing neighborhood! Everything about the Lenox defines how a hotel should treat it's guests. You won't regret a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Peg70
Reviews.Content: We booked the Lenox for 2 nights based on Trip Advisor reviews. Once again, we were not disappointed. The Lenox is managed by the third generation of a family and pride of ownership is evident everywhere. All staff, without exception, were outstanding; you really got the feeling they loved their jobs and wanted nothing more than to ensure your stay was perfect. We booked a superior king room and were delighted with the size and layout. Extremely quiet (11th floor), despite it's central location. In addition to immediate access to Newbury St.. and its fabulous stores, we walked 15 minutes to the start of the Freedom Trail. Also, within easy walking distance (5-20 minutes) too many outstanding restaurants to mention. This hotel was fabulous value for the money - I hesitate to say I would have paid substantially more - and I highly recommend it to anyone - couples, families (with younger children or teens) or business travelers. I'm 55, have traveled a great deal - both for business and pleasure - and I am a big fan of boutique hotels and The Lenox is right at the top of my list. The difference between this hotel and ANY chain - including the Four Seasons - is evident from the moment you exit your car. I highly - and without hesitation - recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - not sure how it ranks so highly though on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: SLin96
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a very good hotel and I chose it due to its Tripadvisor reviews and comments. We booked a Junior Suite which was very spacious. It's also got a great location on Boylston with close proximity to fabulous shopping both on Newbury Street and Copley Place. Our room was clean and immaculate and I thought turndown service was a nice touch with yummy chocolates. The bathroom is a bit tired looking - something you would expect to see in a Hampton Inn (which I love but not at this price!). We had some drywall patching in our bathroom which was not painted and a weird toilet flushing mechanism where you had to close the toilet lid each time to press this huge round paddle. The toilet roll holder was so ill positioned someone might hurt their shoulder using it. It is not a soaker tub so you won't feel like taking any luxurious baths in it. Cheap shower curtain. Wifi is complimentary. After 3 days of no newspaper I called down to see what was happening and was told that it had to be requested. No coffeemaker in the room but they do have coffee and tea in the lobby from 6 or 6:30 and during the day they have bananas, apples and doughnuts. On the website they mentioned they had complimentary car service. This turned out not to be the case and they were quite evasive both when we called from our room and when we spoke to the concierge. The person who answered the phone thought we wanted to order a taxi and the concierge was very vague and was like well it might be available but you will have to come down and see at that time - we only asked once and after that response did not feel like asking again. Somehow the car became available when we were heading to the airport - we insisted on a taxi - the bellperson said well taxis are quite small and it will cost you the same (there were 3 of us) - the price for the Lenox's car to airport was $30 and our ride came out to $22 to Logan (it was Sunday though). Having previously stayed at the nearby Mandarin Oriental all you have to do there for car service is just say where and when you would like to go and they book it in an appointment book. The lobby was very very perfumed and fragrant which made me want to spend as little time in their as possible. Some people are allergic to perfume - even though it is a LEED and Eco Hotel - it might make their stay very unpleasant. Its an OK hotel but I would say the bathroom and the fragrant lobby keeps me from giving it a higher ranking.

Reviews.Title: “really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisavanessa
Reviews.Content: was thinking about changing to stay somewhere a bit more "mod" but glad I didn't stay anywhere else in boston. The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of trendy Back Bay and has a wonderful older style which is full of warmth-much of which comes from the very warm staff. Concierge Justin booked restaurants of my choice for each night prior to arrival-recommended because most good places are very busy. Room was very spacious and loved the walk in robe. Bathroom is not super modern but quite adequate. Went to the spa at Mandarin Oriental ( much recommended) so had a chance to eye off this very beautiful hotel- still glad to have stayed where I did- the human factor definitely makes this hotel work

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JKW101
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location for the nice shops of Newbury Street, restaurants etc but the other attractions were all in walking distance. Room immaculate, staff really helpful. Despite the location rooms were really quiet (we were on the 9th floor). Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only slight let down for us was breakfast - not that tasty and not that generous!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KABLancs_
Reviews.Content: Very nicely decorated hotel. Room (superior double-double) was very large, but bathroom was small. Lack of accessible sockets in the main room. Very, very clean, housekeepers obviously take a pride in their work. Turndown service is a nice touch. Friendly staff. Great location, near to good shops and restaurants. Only used the restaurant for breakfast, first time it was excellent, second time it was only so-so, staff didn't seem interested, the waitress finished a long conversation with another customer before she took our order. Food wasn't that great, but the first time the food was perfect and the staff (different ones) were efficient and welcoming. The only real problem was the fact that the walls are so thin you can hear everything in the next room. Most nights this was only tv and conversation which wasn't too bad but on our last night there were what sounded like a gang of teenagers partying in the room next door. They were shouting and screaming and playing loud music. The front desk were very good when we complained, they sent up someone immediately, who knocked on the door and told them to keep it down. Not sure if I would stay here again as it would be nice to stay in a different part of the city but I would recommend it if there was a cheap rate available.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: 50isthenew40
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is my ONLY choice when visiting my daughter in Boston. Christopher Smith is the consumate Hotelier and should be commended on his guest engagement skills. I highly recommend the 11th floor and a corner room. The corner rooms have great views of the city and are away from the elevators and stairs so your stay is serene. Aveda bath amenities are great and the hepa filter system in the room is a huge benefit. The location is perfect and central to everything Boston. I rented a car for the first time and the guys at the Valet desk were great. Front desk is always professional and friendly with my enjoyment their first priority. The Lenox just keeps getting better with age.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: HankRearden29464
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a non-generic hotel in a great, safe location, it's the Lenox. Room service is 24hr, food is great, and the ladies behind the front desk are beautiful. Friendly, comfortable beds, and the windows in the room actually open. You feel good staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dstinch
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here at the Lenox. I was here for a reunion and stayed only one night. I was impressed with everone that worked here. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and well appointed. They are very "green" and even have a basket that has separate areas for recycling. I would definately stay here again (for longer than one night).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location and very very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Claireandandrew_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox from 20th October to 23rd October. The hotel is lovely, clean and has great staff. Free coffee & bananas in the foyer every morning. The staff were friendly and very helpful - one even leant me her hair straighteners for 3 days because mine wouldn't work. The location is very close to the best restaurants and designer shops. We felt very safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Fabulous Staff!”
Reviews.Author: swebster5
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Boston and a return trip after 45 years for my husband. I chose the Lenox based on the reviews, the location, and the fact that it is a "boutique" hotel ie not a great big impersonal one. We were not disappointed! Our concierge Christy had made restaurant reservations for us per our request before we arrived. And there was a beautiful vase of roses and a lovely bottle of wine waiting for us to celebrate our anniversary! All the concierges and the doormen, porters, etc were extremely friendly and helpful. It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel. Only negatives: unfortunatley it is very pricey; and the breakfast in the hotel restaurant was not that great. The bathroom was small but functional, although it would be better with more counter space! We did enjoy the Hotel's Irish Pub-for breakfast, and lunch! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge, Nina, is AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loriwhitlow
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Lenox till the moment we left everything was absolutely "their pleasure!". The rooms are beautifully decorated & spacious. Bathrooms are a bit dark but the service by the staff makes up for any shortcomings in bathroom lighting. We were in Boston to attend the Head of the Charles & the Lennox provided an amazing VIP tent riverside that made our stay extra enjoyable. Nina wasaybe the best concierge I've ever had the fortune to deal with. She was so ind, knowledgeable & connected not to mention efficient & delightful. My new favorite Boston hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel,Great Staff and Perfect Location- Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our New England Tour. The hotel exceeded our expectations and the staff were first class. In all it was the perfect place to enjoy a last relaxing evening before flying back to the UK. The location is perfect with restaurants, shops and sight seeing all within walking distance. I thoroughly recommend this hotel whatever your purpose for being in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Very Pretty Hotel; Awful stay.”
Reviews.Author: rmsnickers
Reviews.Content: Having just spent the previous two nights at the W on Stuart Street, my wife and I were very disappointed with our stay at the Lenox on 10/17 and 10/18. Checked into our room early which was nice but the room size was ridiculously small. Asked about an upgrade and they said they didn't have anything available; not blaming the hotel for me booking a small room via Expedia though. The hotel itself is in a great location for Back Bay and is gorgeous in that Fairmont kind of way. The issue I had with my stay was both the room itself and the staff I interacted with. Upon asking for an upgrade the gal at the front desk seemed to take pleasure in telling me that my room size is what I get for booking thru Expedia; inferring that had I booked directly they might be more courteous. First night's sleep was impossible; the air conditioning was mandatory b/c the room was very stuffy and small but the vent rattled all night and we couldn't sleep. There was some type of compressor behind the wall also that cycled on and off and was very loud, sounded like an air compressor! Lastly, the small fridge in the room would cycle on and off as well and was loud...absolutely impossible to sleep. When I asked about this the next morning at the front desk I was told that they would have somone take a look and see what they could do. The gal I spoke with I think was named Ashley or something and she (along with door/bag guy Peter) was very nice...definite bright spot of our stay. Returned to hotel later in afternoon and checked with front desk about our room as instructed, unfortunately, it was the gal from the previous day who wouldn't upgrade my room. She told me that the hotel was old and all the vents rattle so there is nothing they can do about it...but she did move us to another room for that night. This room was just as bad and had the same problems as the first; I got maybe 4 hours sleep in two nights stay at this hotel. I could not wait to check out and leave; I will never stay at the Lenox again and I advise anyone else who wants a good night's sleep to avoid it as well. Incredibly disappointed since I purposely chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews; my stay at the W the previous couple of nights was much better. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JohnsFamily
Reviews.Content: The Lenox treats you like royalty from the moment you get out of your car or taxi. Everyone working there is friendly and efficient. The rooms are clean. Coffee and banana's are free every morning and great cookies and tea in the afternoon. This hotel is in the back back and within walking distance or the subway. The Irish bar Solas which is attached had the best clam chowder we have had in our 3 trips to Boston. The City bar had a nice atmosphere and friendly bar staff. I can't wait for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Artchica
Reviews.Content: The Lenox was a great hotel and one I will highly recommend for anyone traveling to Boston. The location is ideal for touring, shopping and accessing public transportation. The staff were very friendly and accomodating and made you feel valued as a customer. Upon arrival we were given coffee and introduced to the hotels features. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated and spacious. The beds were comfortable and provided a great night's sleep! Can't say a bad thing about this hotel and will be one I would travel back to the Boston area just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kathyGreenBay_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Lenox and I cannot say enough good things about our visit. Expensive, but first class all the way. The staff treated us like family, the location is outstanding, and the rooms and service are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family from 10/8 - 10/11 in rooms 1002 and 1003. Everything was fabulous. As mentioned, the location is fabulous. My wife and sister-in-law were able to go shopping during the day and at night with no worry of their safety. There were many great restaurants right outside the door. The price was less than the huge hotels nearby that lack personality and warmth. What's also great about the hotel is that they don't nickel and dime you to death. Wifi, morning coffee and tea, chocolates, cookies, bananas and filtered water are free. This is definately our home everytime we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in fashionable Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: I came here recommended by TripAdvisor's reviewers and I am happy I did. I stayed for a week while working and all was good. I particularly enjoyed the location close to 'everything that matters'. My room was huge and think it was a free upgrade to a junior suite, but they never said. It was a corner room (911) with nice views of Copley Square and other parts of Boston. A huge canape full of crisps, chocolates, peanuts and other goodies was waiting for me in the room and I thought it was part of the paying bar. It took me two days to realize it was a present from the hotel. What a treat! The restaurant and the bar downstairs are both very trendy and good and the lobby is smallish but nice. Service was excellent but the concierge and limo service could have been a bit better. The corridors are very wide and it has that charm of a by-gone era, which also means that the furniture is very old, not antique, just old, and depending on your taste you may want to prefer it a bit more contemporary or refreshed. A well-known local designer friend of mine called it ' a bit tacky'. Other than that very good but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: OttawaMike_10
Reviews.Content: From the moment I made the reservation (Thanks Scott), the experience was phenomenal. We were on our honeymoon and stayed for 15 nights. It was important to have a good hotel for that long of a stay on our special occasion and the Lenox didn't disappoint. The Lenox is a gem in Boston. Scott worked to give me the best rate he could on our room and we were upgraded to a wonderful Jr. King Suite with a perfect view of the city. We couldn't have asked for more. The front desk staff and the bellhops were so friendly everyday and funny too. We chatted with them everyday about the Redsox games and things we were doing in the city on our honeymoon. They gave us directions when we needed them, always opened the door for us when we returned to the hotel and just were amazing. I hated to leave even after 15 nights. It was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Thank you again for making our honeymoon a trip to remember. We just loved the Lenox and Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steof1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiancÃ©e a while ago, loved this hotel. Form the moment they open the door of your car to the moment they see you off the staff are truly wonderful. The doormen and women couldnâ€™t be any nicer, when we checked in the receptionist spotted the date on my passport and wished me a happy birthday. A lovely thought (even if I was a little embarrassed at the time). The main reception is very impressive with restaurants and bars branching off from it. Our room was on the top floor and a lift was a must, thankfully the lifts are plentiful and we didnâ€™t have to wait too long. The room was lovely and spacious, 2 double beds although a little redundant considering we travelled as a couple. But hay, its better to have it than not. There is an Irish bar right in the hotel Solas , it is a pretty decent bar with a good mix of travellers and business people. Shopping centres are right on your doorstep and parks are a 5 -10 minute stroll. The city centre is a bit of a walk away but there is public transport within 2 mins of the hotel Also as there is a Lindit shop in the hotel , their bed mints are Lindor Chocolates, a tasty addition Overall I would recommend this hotel, it is a bit further away from the old city centre than others but it more than makes up for it

Reviews.Title: “Room 1408”
Reviews.Author: GregandRobin
Reviews.Content: Rooms and furnishings are dated and walls are not sound proof. Reminded me of the haunted hotel that John Cusack stayed in in "Room 1408."

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Expense”
Reviews.Author: jennyt84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Boston for the first time, and chose the Lenox based on all the good reviews... We loved it. The second we walked in we were treated like Royalty. It has a very romantic, historic feel about it. The smell of fresh flowers and scents were pleasing. Our room was very large with a king size bed.We were able to open the windows and get the fresh breeze blowing in. The staff knew it was our wedding anniversary and had a bottle of Champagne sent up, complimentary... That was awesome. The staff was on thier game, very helpful and always smiling. You cant beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes 5* is not enough”
Reviews.Author: philipjhughes
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a trip to Boston, staying at the Lenox, I can only add to the excellent reviews I read on TA before booking. What a lovely hotel, comfortable, good location, but most of all the SERVICE. From the bell boys to the management, nothing was too much trouble. A special mention for the receptionists. Always happy and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. A small example: The hotel provides tea & coffee in the lobby in the mornings until about 10.00am I was late one morning, and everything had been cleared away. The receptionist noticed, and asked if she could help, I said no not to worry I'd just missed the coffee. She asked me to wait, and returned a moment later with fresh coffee from the restaurant - No charge. If you want a great stay in Boston - there can be no better experience than at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “An overrated hotel in the heart of Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Bernicez10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox during a holiday weekend. When we arrived around 4pm our room was not ready, so we waited in the lobby for about 20 minutes until the front desk had confirmed with housekeeping that our room had been cleaned. The room itself was very spacious and was elegantly appointed. The bathroom was small and outdated. The description of the room on the website had been a little misleading. I would expect that if a hotel lists having a fireplace in a guest room that it would be a working one. Overall, the room was clean however the mattress was very uncomfortable. When checking out on a Sunday morning, it took over 30 minutes for the concierge to retrieve our car. I was disappointed with the hotel staff - there seemed to be plenty of staff standing around, but none appeared to be particularly helpful. For over $650 a night (not including taxes), there are plenty of better options in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence with a capital E”
Reviews.Author: BJCashman
Reviews.Content: With out doubt one of the best old style hotels we have ever stayed in.From the very first day when we arrived and encountered a glich in our booking and not the fault of the hotel. The front desk staff could not do enough quickly to solve the issue. Concierge was amazing at getting the little things done no problems even down to the smallest detail. Our rooms were kept spotless by the cleaning staff and turned down at night with a small treat on the bed each night.The location is great 5 minute walk to the tube,great eating palces near by,along with some excellent bars and night spots. All in all loved the Lenox thanks guys for a great stay would definetly stay again if returing to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: nottsgirl487
Reviews.Content: We loved the Lenox - our room was tastefully decorated, comfy and clean - 8th floor and part view of Boylston Street. It was a good size, as was the bathroom. We stayed for three nights and ate/drank in the lovely Irish bar which is part of the hotel. Nice touches were i Pod docking station and free drinks/cookies in reception. We had drinks in the City Bar in the hotel one evening (discovered chocolate vodka) which is more 'formal' than the Irish Bar. Overall, a great hotel in a central location. We would return again and would recommend to anyone. The only reason I have given four stars is because it is 'room only' - breakfast would have made it five star, but I know this is the norm for city hotels in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox - Is it really that good?”
Reviews.Author: JT53
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in September. Like many before, I was drawn by the great reviews and it's central location. However, very much like the lady from Tipperary below, I did not get the praise heaped on this hotel. It's a lovely old building and the entrance foyer is really impressive. The staff all seem pleasant and efficient, but that is what I would expect at a hotel of this class, but I saw no clue to this great personall touch and interest that other reviewers witnessed. Maybe we didn't look like big tippers! Our room on the 3rd floor was large but a bit dull and the bathroom had no wow factor with cracked and loose floor tiles, chipped paint and discoloured plastic switch plates. Big TV, Bose ipod dock (of no use to us as we have neither iphone or ipod) and a fridge with two small bottles of water. Â£200 ($300) a night -room only - and no kettle and coffee! Granted there was coffee in the foyer, in a morning only, and iced tea in the afternoon. Had breakfast in house which was fine (to be fair they waived the charge on day 2 as they got our order wrong - even though I offered to pay for the items we had received). Overall it was fine but maybe I missed something.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wileyck
Reviews.Content: The service and location were perfect. The room and bathroom were small. Our family of four had a hard time with the tiny bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “They go the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: MrsMEG
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lenox, my first trip to The States, and they made it really special. The hotel is beautiful, service exemplary and all in all couldn't be bettered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Terry O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Hotel it was our first visit to Boston & the Lenox made our stay even more memorable, my husband & I travelled with our two daughters who had both graduated from Univercity & also my eldest daughter was celebrating her birthday, the Lenox surprised us by upgrading our room to a suite. We loved the location it was so central & Boston transport is so easy to get around, we travelled to Salem & went Whale watching the Cheers bar opposite Boston Common is also well worth a visit. After a long day sight seeing & shopping it was nice to go back to our room to find that the maid had turned down our beds & left us chocolates, just another nice touch that makes the Lenox a wonderful hotel we will certainly be making another visit here soon.

Reviews.Title: “A superb base in Boston”
Reviews.Author: stuosman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lenox and found the experience fabulous. The hotel location is excellent, just off Copley Square, 5 min walk from the shops of Newbury Street and a 15min walk to Boston Common. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area and the shops at the Prudential Centre are right next door. We stayed in a superior room and it was lovely, the bathroom had no window but this is common place in most hotels, and the furnishings were very luxurious. An ipod dock and free internet (wifi) is available in all the rooms and this is a massive positive for us. Free bottled water in the room is replenisihed daily and free coffee is also available every morning in the lobby which is very rare for a hotel these days! There are 3 restuarants/bars in the hotel, we found all to serve good food altough service can be a little slow. The irish bar (solas) is tiny and there are much better places to drink in the area so look around if that sort of evening is what you're looking for. The staff here are the friendliest we have ever come across. Everyone always said hello and anything we requested or asked for was dealt with really quickly. This is one of the reasons that we will come back. The only thing missing from here is a swimming pool / gym but overall it is a fantastic place to stay. We go to Boston every year and have not stayed here before but we will now not book anywhere else and will be back in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - lovely accomodation and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EiboNewbury
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations of the service at The Lenox based on reviews here, and that might have worked against it, as I didn't experience anything to justify the gushing comments you read in some of the reviews . That said, the staff were as friendly as I'd expect them to be in that sort of establishment and at the prices we were paying and perhaps having organised everything online in advance ourselves and not needing the concierege we didn't interact enough to truly judge. We had drinks in the City Bar twice but ate out for all meals as there were so many restaurants nearby. We had one late night room service of beer and pizza after returning from a concert - it was fine and the guy who delivered it very friendly. Unlike some reviewers on here, we didn't find Solas at all appealing, and its not like any Irish pub in Ireland ! We made two requests during our stay there, one for extra clothes hangers which didn't materialise, and one for a late checkout which was graciously granted as no big deal which we were very grateful for, with an evening flight home. The location of the hotel is superb, 2 mins from Copley T , The Prudential Centre and Newbury Street. The free wifi is high speed, and a big plus in my book. We booked a king corner suite, which averaged about $400 per night. The room was spacious with a sofa, seperate dressing area with a refrigerator (stocked with complimentary water and plenty of room for beer, soft drinks etc) and a nice bathroom. House keeping was excellent , replenishing eveything twice a day, although I found a 5pm turndown a little early and instrusive at a time when most people are resting or freshening up for the evening. The plumbing is a little noisy given thats it an old hotel, but only when you're using the bathroom appliances. In fact the only gripe I have about the rooms is the lack of coffee making facility. Yes its provided free of charge in the lobby from 6 am, however I need to have my caffeine before I put my clothes and face on, and unlike some other guests I don't wear my pjs in public. A Nespresso machine in the suite would have made it perfect in my view :) . Overall great location, friendly staff and lovely accomodation - but pitch your expectation against what you're paying, its not as out of this world as some of the reviews would indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ardithsue5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights as this beautiful hotel. The location, Copely Square, could not be better. We were one block from the subway ("T") and within walking distance to some wonderful shops and restaurants. Service was exceptional. Our room was lovely. The only drawbacks were that the bathroom was a bit cramped - very modern but to small. One other thing I would have loved would have been an undercounter refridgerator. Despite those two things, the hotel staff made the visit wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: IainP2
Reviews.Content: I had a recommendation to stay at The Lenox and I cannot speak highly enough. From the truly friendly and informative welcome at the front desk when I checked in, to the help from the concierge when I needed recommendations for shopping, to the advice from staff in the City Cafe restaurant on the best places to go in Boston. This hotel is 5 star all the way. They are genuinely interested in you having the best experience in Boston as they are obviously very proud of the city. The facilties are first class, the location is a short walk to everything and the overall atmosphere was one of "how can we help?" I will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Lenox in September for a few days celebrating our Anniversary, Its beautiful Hotel anyway dating back to 1901, which suits us. All the staff from the Manager to the porter were so friendly and helpful what a pleasure. As it was our special weekend they kindly upgraded us to a very nice suite on the top floor Wow. and the Manager presented us with wine for the occasion. The Hotel was absolutely spotless and with a wonderful smell of freshness always in the reception. I cannot praise or thank every one for making our few days really special, the only complaint i have is that we had to come home. Can't wait to return fairly soon I hope

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarvsMom
Reviews.Content: Went for our anniversary- arrived about 12:30pm and even though check-in was 3:00, they had our room ready. What a treat that was. The staff was fabulous- and I do mean the whole staff from the bellmen to the front desk. Room was nice and included a mini fridge, robes and plenty of space. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, sevice and location”
Reviews.Author: tamwil7
Reviews.Content: The staff is the best I have ever encountered! The location is walking distance to Boston Commons and Boston Gardens. Very elegant historic hotel with modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: francoberri
Reviews.Content: Set in the heart of Back Bay, this hotel righly deserves its high ratings. Great decoration, great service, relatively good value. So much better than the Charlesmark across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: busymomWestervilleOh
Reviews.Content: A charming smaller hotel, just a 5 minute walk from the Convention Center. My room was smallish and could use a decor update, but very clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. Look for coffee and tea in the morning down in the lobby, iced tea late in the afternoon.Small fridge and safe in the room. Plenty of eating options on Boylston, and a food court in the Prudential center if on a budget. Very close to the Copley T station.

Reviews.Title: “Old school style with high end service”
Reviews.Author: Runderful
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a trendy hip hotel the Lenox is not for you. However, if you want a well appointed hotel with great service from the concierge to bell staff and lobby bar bartender who made amazing drinks then you should stay here. (Pear Martini!!!!) Within 20 minutes of arriving they had a nice table reserved for or us at a terrific restaurant that was overbooked. The location as others have noted is IDEAL for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjs121
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, don't get me wrong. It has a significant amount of history behind it and the style is amazing. It is in a good location between Fenway Park and Boston Common, very close to a T line. There was just a couple of things: when we checked in, we were given directions to the room and told about the Wifi. It was only on wandering around that we found a gym, a business centre and at the restaurant did breakfast. There was no info in the room as it was all on the tv hotel info which froze regularly and was difficult to navigate. The next thing was the room: now I don't mind spending a bit extra but in this hotel, I could only afford the classic room. Just don't. The room wasn't particularly big and far more suitable for one person than two particularly, as my husband succinctly pointed out, you couldn't go to the loo standing or sitting without being at an angle due to the wall being 6 inches in front of the pan-literally! The last matter was the noise-initially, I thought I could put up with the traffic noise. Then we found that we were on the side by what appeared to be a service entrance so each morning, there was incessant beeping from one or more trucks, followed between 7am and 8.30am by the slamming of doors in the corridor (we joked it began to sound like the 1812 overture every morning) from inconsiderate guests and as the fire station was along Boylston Street, each night was accompanied at least once by fire sirens. If I could recommend anything at this hotel, grade as much as you can afford!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie36
Reviews.Content: We recently completed a 5 night stay at the Lenox and had a great stay. The hotel was clean and well kept and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely, lots of nice details like a waste bin that included recycling options, and a long list of products that they would supply to you if you had forgotten them. The location of the hotel was great, 2 minutes from copely square, and less from the metro. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price but a bit chince.”
Reviews.Author: AKWKirkcaldy
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. Special mention to girl on front desk that was extremely helpful and welcoming. Rooms were good size and very clean although hotel as a whole is a bit chince. Service was hit and miss. Majority of staff were excellent. Breakfast staff were a bit slow and seemed like they didn't know what they were doing and concierge, although very polite, missed the fact that there was a major fashion event (fashion night out) being held at Newbury street (next to hotel) even though I specifically events if any events were happening that weekend. What was worse was the Lenox hotel actually helped sponsor the event. Taxi drivers were all mad and didn't know where they were going. He didn't know what street the stadium was!? Luckily hotel helped to set him right. Good hotel at a good price and great location. I would recommend it over any other hotels in the area for the price.For all my gripes, we had a great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Back Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsanti
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a charming small hotel in the Back Bay area of Boston. It is located in an excellent location, very central, to walk to Newbury Street, Copley Place and the Prudential Tower. I was very impressed by the staff...very personalable and helpful... and the small incidentals that were offered, i.e., bottled water in your room, cookies in the afternoon at the reception counter, bananas at the reception area in the morning. The room was very pleasant. I was also impressed with the very ergonomic desk chair! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a tremendous stay at the Lennox. It was clean and elegant, but the best part was the staff. They were truly terrific! There are small things you expect in a historic hotel like a little pealing on wallpaper edges, etc. but nothing to worry about. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: sspags
Reviews.Content: I am remiss writing this review...our family stayed at the Lenox for three evenings the week after Christmas 2010. It was stormy, cold and quiet in Boston, but it was warm, comfortable and vibrant at the Lenox. The entry was wonderfully decorated and we spent our mornings there reading the New York Times and drinking complimentary coffee. The entire staff was fabulous...friendly, helpful and engaged. Our rooms were very comfortable and the health club was more than satisfactory. We would highly recommend this hotel for a wonderful, intimate stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: BwanaClay
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Back Bay. Great restaurants all around, access to everything. Elegant, clean, and reasonably priced for what you get. This is a place we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “FOURTH OF JULY IN BOSTON AT THE LENOX”
Reviews.Author: allisonlight
Reviews.Content: What an amazing week we had at the Lenonx in Boston, Ma. Overall, the service at the Lenox was fabulous- with special recognition to the concierge desk and Christie, who really made sure our trip was great. We were traveling with our 14 month old, which can be difficult, and the staff really made us feel at home. They had an amazing bath kit and even a stuffed kangaroo they gave him upon arrival. The crib was delivered to our room completely set up for him with a special blanket. They were always clean and stocked with chocolates and Aveda products. One downside, while it is a historic hotel, the room decor feel a bit dated. I utilized their gym daily during my trip and was very impressed with the equipment. They also offered gym towels and water. Although they could use a few fans! We purchased the 4th of July package that they offered for the holiday. The rooftop view of the fireworks display over the river was amazing and can not be compared. It was worth the whole trip and the Lenox made our holiday special.

Reviews.Title: “A great place and location”
Reviews.Author: HKLParis
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a great hotel : marble hall, grand, but not too much, comfortable rooms, flowery curtains, very pleasant marble bathrooms, extremely helpful staff. And a great location, close to everywhere. Add to that delicious cookies in the afternoon, coffee or tea in the morning. Computers available. And sound advice from the concierge. What more could you want? A great choice I made thanks to the reviews in Tripadvisor I always use when traveling to a place I do not know.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with amazing staff service”
Reviews.Author: Squishmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights with our 2 yr old. The reception staff were very friendly, wanted to know our daughters name. Within an hour a basket of goodies and a teddy bear arrived for her. The staff were friendly throughout our stay, the concierge was helpful and booked us tables at great kid friendly restaurants. The room was a good size, we had 2 doubles, very clean. A fridge and free water was provided along with safe but no coffee making facility in the room. Lovely hotel and staff, good location for shopping and great time had.

Reviews.Title: “Our Trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: ktdmoose999
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to see the Boston Red sox who my husbands favorite baseball team. We stayed at The lenox Hotel . When we landed in Boston the airlines lost our luggage . So when we got to The Lenox we were greeted at the front door and was taken to the front desk. The staff were so friendly and polite. We told them about our luggage and they said they would bring it up to us when it arrived. We went up to our room and it was very very nice. Every night they turn down your bed for you and leave 2 chocolates on your pillows. Well our luggage didnt make it to our hotel for a day and a half. We had a baseball game to go to with no clean cloths yet. There was a knock on the door and the staff knew we had a game to go to and no clean cloths yet. They bought us 2 Redsox t-shirts for us to wear to the game that night and a tray of snacks. We were so surprised and happy. The staff at The Lenox Hotel were the best. It made our trip there great and I just love the Hotel. If we ever go back to Boston we are going to stay there again or if anybody wants to know were to stay I will tell them about The Lenox Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Flatters to Deceive”
Reviews.Author: DeesideTraveller
Reviews.Content: We tried very hard to like the Lenox and parts of it we did like however in our view it had number of faults. Out of five nights there we had three relatively undisturbed nights sleep and one room change. We had an executive king with a fireplace. The fireplace was not being used but the extraction system or ventilation method meant that there was a very strong vacuum whistling through an ill fitting cover. A phone call to reception advised that there was maintenance going on two floors above and this would be finished at 11 pm. Not the case. The next day we were advised there had been a photo shoot and as they had lit a fire in the fireplace two floors above that was the noise and maintenance would fix it. Not the case. A room move one floor down with no fireplace. Three nights reasonable sleep. However fifth night discovered that there is some form of distribution warehouse at the rear of the hotel, bangs reversing beeps engine revving. Originally thought it was construction going on, but it had been dormant due to Labour day weekend. I would say that the receptionists at front desk were pleasant and on every occasion offered us a free breakfast at the slightest hint of trouble. An offer we did not take up as it falls flat at 11.30 at night or 3am when all you are trying to do is get a good nights sleep. So our advice. Get a room at the front. Check it out for fireplace noise. The staff are obviously really used to complaints and there are platitudes aplenty which will no doubt surface in any reply by the hotel. We did make our views known. For a free breakfast, make a complaint, it's the standard offer. We left pretty disgruntled as there are plenty of small points to irritate..like struggling through a door with two heavy suitcases with the two doormen happy to say 'have a great day' but amazingly not opening doors. Yes, flatters to deceive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, characterful hotel in the hub of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: jane_hayes
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 nights at this characterful, glamorous hotel. Stayed in a classic room which was beautiful. Excellent service. Lovely staff. Would not recommend in-room dining though as the food was poor quality, however, they did acknowledge this and didn't charge. Great location. Generally to be recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant friendly service highly recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Trishyles
Reviews.Content: Apart from a great stay and a great breakfast,all staff at the hotel were genuinely concerned re our onward travel arrangements due to hurricane Irene, they even took us to collect our hire car and let us leave it at hotel until safe to travel.They were all fantastic,with a special mention to Justin and Dan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: zippidydoda
Reviews.Content: WE would definatately go back there, fantastic service, food and hospitality great. In a crisis you could not be in better hands. We were there 1 day prior to hurricane Irene and needed to travel onto Cape Cod we were well cared for and advised accordingly for our safety. Wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location, good restaurant and helpful friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Bermuda2010
Reviews.Content: The Lenox hotel is tastefully refurbished (though some areas of our room,like the windows, looked very old and just slapped carelessly with paint and no prep done) and is prime location on Boyleston Street in The Back Bay area. One block off Newbury Street. Tons of great shops and restaurants in the area. Perfect area to stay for a Boston visit! We enjoyed the restaurant and received wonderful service from the doormen, car parks and front desk staff. My only complaint was they did not have a last minute room for us to spend one more night because we were having such a great time! Next time we will stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, Great price for Boston!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl3781
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic; close to shopping. restaurants and transportation.This place has an old world charm and luxury feeling to it, without showing any age. It is well-maintained. We would gladly stay here gain!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: NJF1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated perfectly. The 'Boutique Hotel' is fantastic. It is right in the middle of the shopping in Boston, not far from the Prudential Centre. The room was lovely and the staff were polite and helpful. A special mention for two of the lovely ladies on reception. Kelly and Meghan, they were brilliant! they were bubbly and friendly and continualy made sure that anything we required they could sort out for us. Each time we saw them they were genuinely happy to talk and check that we had everything we needed, and had enjoyed our day or evening out. Thanks you Lenox, thank you again Kelly and Meghan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, centrally located...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTorontonian
Reviews.Content: This classic hotel is in the heart of the Back Bay area and within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping including Newbury Street, Prudential Center and Copley Place. We had an elegant, spacious corner room with a faux fireplace and seating area with a nice view. The room had free wifi, a flat screen TV, an ipod stand and a mini fridge (convenient for storing milk for our young son!). A short walk from the Public Garden and the frog pond (a great splash pool for young kids). Booked through expedia for $200... Considering, would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox at the end of August 2011; it was supposed to be for five nights but in the end we extended it by two because of Hurricane Irene. I have to say that deciding to stay there for two extra nights was the easiest decision ever, because it was such a wonderful hotel. The rooms were great - very comfortable, individual and welcoming. The staff were even better - by far the friendliest, most helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered, and we experienced nothing but top quality service. This is helped by the fact that the hotel is not the largest around, and although this means that some of the other facilities (e.g. gym, business center) were smaller than in other hotels, they were still perfectly sufficient. And then, during the hurricane itself, they put on movies for the guests during the day, along with complimentary snacks and drinks. We managed to get a great deal via expedia.com for this stay; if this hotel would normally be out of your budget, it's worth searching around for such a deal. If I ever return to Boston again (which I very much hope to), I will certainly look to stay here if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with very attentive staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pam F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to celebrate our anniversary in Boston--first time there for us both and as it turns out, we made a GREAT decision. The hotel was immaculate, food excellent, and the staff was very accomodating and ALL SMILES! Our trip had been planned for 8 months and wouldn't you know it--hurricane Irene decided to show up at the same time. When TV satellites went out for several hours, the hotel converted a conference room into a movie theatre and served popcorn, soda, and candy to everyone while people watched 3 movies--they had it ALL covered! Can't say enough about this hotel--definitely a "go to" location in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and sophisticated. LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: hjdx
Reviews.Content: After a long flight what you really want is to arrive somewhere like the Lenox. So swanky and sophisticated it was like being at the Ritz. Fantastic friendly staff, beautiful hotel and rooms, really comfortable bed. Oh we loved it! We stayed on their PURE floor, where all the bedding etc is hypoallergenic which is fantastic for people allergic to down feather pillows. The lift looked original and was kinda slow to come, but really quiet - our room was next door to it and we couldn't hear it at all. They have an in house restaurant and cocktail bar, but we ate in the Irish Pub that also is part of the building (fantastic food, very chilled setting, perfect for the jet lagged!)

Reviews.Title: “elegance in the heart of the college crowd”
Reviews.Author: Occi0
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, elegant, comfy, user-friendly concerige, it deserves it's high rating. Step out the door and you are blocks from great restaurants and in the heart of the city's youth culture, 95% of those on the street are 20-something. Makes for esthetically rewarding people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbstephen
Reviews.Content: Visit started with a free upgrade to a suite which really helped with two teenagers. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Hotel well decorated and well maintained. On returning from the first days sight seeing we were greeted in the room by a large hamper of goodies for the girls which went down a real treat with everyone. The fridge in the room was a real help. Great location for all the things we wanted to do. After one mistake we quickly got the hang of the subway, which was clean and efficient. Copley station only minutes easy walk from hotel. Used a taxi out to airport which cost $25 dollars late Monday afternoon. Very quick trip. We'll come back to Boston again, and wouldn't think of staying anywhere but the Lennox.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly rude”
Reviews.Author: koipond
Reviews.Content: We used to live in Boston and remember the Lenox as a gracious, grand hotel. So this was out first choice for lodging on a return holiday. The hotel itself was perfectly pleasant, albeit a bit dated in decor. You certainly can't beat the location or the lovely views from the upper floors. The main reason for the low rating, however, was the surprisingly rude service. We are not picky or entitled people, but three specific events upset us enough to complain directly to the hotel: 1. On check in, the hotel insisted that the bell hop bring up our luggage, although we offered to do it ourselves since it contained items the children needed fairly quickly, ie: diapers(!). It took 30 minutes, despite an additional phone call, to receive the bags. To make matters worse, as he was leaving the room, the bell hop actually paused at the open door and counted the tip before exiting. Somehow this seemed astonishingly indiscreet. 2. We typically saw at least 3-4 uniformed staff around the doors, but they never seemed to be actually working. We did, however, overhear several discussion about dates, cars, and levels of drunkennous - all harmless but not necessarily appropriate on a Saturday morning in front of small kids. And to be specific, none of the uniformed "doormen" ever actually opened the door for us. 3. As we were checking out, we pulled the rental car up to the front, where the valet offered to hold the car while we went up to the room -and wait for the mandatory bell hop to retrieve the bags. The process took roughly 20 minutes. Imagine our surprise when we went back to the car to load the bags, and were told by the valet that "since we left the car with him for more than 10 minutes, he was now authorized to charge us $18 for the daily parking fee." We protested the unfairness, and he "changed his mind" but it left us wondering just what the intended purpose of the entire exchange was. Overall, the events left us feeling like the Lenox employees were more interested in tips and money than providing excellent service. Given the number of positive reviews on this site, we are inclined to think our experience may have been isolated. On the other hand, there are so many other competitive, grand, gracious hotels in Boston, I doubt we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: liamr
Reviews.Content: Visited here for 4 nights with friends and my wife in March of this year, all in all itâ€™s an average hotel, nothing special but nothing overly wrong with it either. A little bit outside of the downtown city centre but close to the train station and the big shopping centre. Door man decided to try and break my friendâ€™s bag on the way in and succeeded in breaking the handle on the way out, nice of him to then blame it on the design as opposed to his constant hammering on it. Bedroom is ok, bed was comfortable, itâ€™s decorated in a 1920â€™s motif, the bathroom was small and could have been better given the size of the bedroom and also the large walk in closet. The hotel bars are ok, overall I didn't take to the city which may be leading to the hotel not getting a 5th star. I canâ€™t fault the hotel for anything but it definitely is missing something. I prefer a more modern feel to a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost didn't stay here and that would have been a mistake”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffourPA
