Reviews.Content: We had never been to Boston and so picking a hotel was difficult. For the most part I relied on Tripadvisor to make my decision and, as usual, I am glad I did. After staying at the Lenox I now know why the reviews are so high and why it was selected as one of the top hotels in the world by Travel and Leisure magazine. This place is incredible and the neighborhood only adds to it. You are one block from Newbury street for shopping and restaurants. We walked everywhere except for Little Italy and Harvard. The service is outstanding in every way. We normally like more modern hotels so my first choice was Copley Square hotel, however, the reviews talked about the small rooms and average service and the price was hundreds more than the Lenox. Even though you don't spend all your time in the hotel I prefer a larger room. For all intents and purposes the Lenox and Copley Square hotel are right next to each other, so is the Courtyard by Marriot Copley Square so if you want to stay in this neighborhood ( Back Bay) then any hotel will do, and I highly recommend this neighborhood. Restaurants, shopping, walking distance to everywhere, safe, etc, this is the neighborhood to stay in. Anyway, the pics of the Lenox looked outdated so I almost disregarded the reviews and chose elsewhere. I am glad I didn't. This is not a modern hotel but it doesn't matter. It is well kept and very classic in every way. We were upgraded to a suite, which was enormous. The room was very clean. We will stay at this hotel again. The staff are very attentive to every need and request. One example, there was a very popular restaurant that my wife and I could not get reservations at so we called the concierge and he got us reservations at the time we wanted. We walked past the others waiting for a table and were immediately seated. This hotel is expensive but genuinely worth it if you are looking for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Much better second time around”
Reviews.Author: PaulRTaylor
Reviews.Content: Second visit and came away with a far better impression this time! All the staff seemed far friendlier than previously. We had a much better sized room (for a family of four) with plenty of towels and bathrobes. The in-room fridge with free water was particularly welcome given the summer heat. The welcome gifts for the children were also a very nice gesture after a transatlantic flight. As ever the location is brilliant for shops, restaurants and the main sights - especially the Duck Tours. Only eat in once but it was a reasonably priced good quality breakfast. Kirstie the Concierge was also very knowledgeable and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Suz00
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Lenox with our 2 small kids. We stayed in an extra large, corner room on the top floor. From the minute we arrived to the time we left, we were treated very well by all the staff. Everyone was very friendly to us and accommodating. The valet went out of his way to retrive my husband's sunglasses from our car. The decor of the hotel is impressive and grand. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed. We had dinner at City Table located in the lobby and enjoyed that too. The location was perfect for walking to nearby attractions, shops and restaurants. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel is ideally located!”
Reviews.Author: kmcleod369
Reviews.Content: Although rooms are small, you could not ask for better, more personal service than at this hotel in the middle of the shopping and financial district of the Back Bay. It within reasonable walking distance of all the major places of interest in the city itself, although a "short hike" to Faneuil Hall, Quincey Marketplace, etc. Also close to Prudential Center and excellent restaurants, including Atlantic Fish and Legal Seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jean b
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my twin sister and son while he went to a singer songwriters camp at Berklee. It was a short walk to the school. We stayed 5 nights. The Hotel was BEAUTIFUL!! The staff was very helpful, friendly and professional. The bar was the perfect spot to have a martini at the end of the day. "Say hello to John" (GREAT BARTENDER). The room was beautiful and beds were comfortable. Being a historic hotel, I didn't expect it to be so clean and fresh. Loved every minute of our stay. Thanks Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Private Club Meets Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I arrived late in the evening on a wet May spring day. I was surprised by both how welcoming the doormen were, and once past the revolving door, how both attractively laid out, lively and yet understated the lobby was. Some lobbies with a low ceiling feel cramped or somewhat unpleasant, but one immediately felt at home in the genteel surrounds of a well-heeled private club, except that the staff were all exceptionally friendly. I got a rather nice room, especially considering I booked it on hotels.com. The room size was average, but the decor was plush and luxurious, and one immediately realized one was in a quality bracket above the standard chain offerings. The Aveda soaps and toiletries were probably another tip-off. The sleep quality was excellent and thanks to housekeeping for the chocolates. It was only the next day that I realized what a find it was, as I was attending a conference at the Westin Copley Place, which was literally a 3 minute walk. It is also right next to a supermarket if you need anything, and you are also right on the main drag with tons of excellent restaurants (I highly recommend the Atlantic Fish Company). The fitness center was perhaps the only thing that was not terribly impressive (it was in a small basement room) but all the equipment was modern, and it was actually empty and had good ventilation. I would totally stay here again, and would probably deliberately stay here over the Westin even if I had to attend another conference at the same location.

Reviews.Title: “lovely feel and great location”
Reviews.Author: GD2004
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, quiet room, elegant boutique hotel lobby, adequate if overpriced for value room service. Room and bathroom decent size with walk in closet; nothing exceptional about it, and the double beds are small -- not sure why hotels in this price/class range have two doubles instead of two queens. Makes it a bit difficult for families. Staff was friendly/kind/ particularly the doormen were excellent. Was not impressed with concierge dinner recommend (I mentioned one of our party was a vegan and I received a completely meat centric option for dining) and when we first arrived, late night, desk clerk could only suggest their own pub (which wouldn't allow my under 21 son in at that hour, and had stopped serving actual dinner food anyway) and Uno pizza (really? a chain?) which was also already closed. We found a serviceable if not great sushi place just up the street; and a cute sandwich/desert place which just didn't hit all the dietary needs both open. Staff should know this! On the other hand, when leaving, lovely desk staff offered us trail mix and chocolate, gratis, for our train trip. The nice, free umbrellas during rainstorms also greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Not just a hotel - an experience!!”
Reviews.Author: CEK22
Reviews.Content: In June I had the pleasure of staying at the Lenox hotel for four nights. I've stayed in a lot of hotels and this one is at the top of my list. The rooms are nice, clean and well appointed and when you book they give you an upgrade option when you check in for just a few dollars more a night if something is available - I had a wonderful room with a king size bed and a great view including the finishing line of the Boston marathon (it was only nine dollars extra a night - a great deal!). But what makes this boutique hotel so special is the amazing staff. I felt like family from the time I arrived until I left. There was a lot of teasing going on as I was from BC and the Stanley cup final was happening at that time - but all in great fun. The concierge help was excellent - from dining reservations to trips in the area. I had an excellent meal in the dining room the first night - so score well for the food as well. Again the restaurant staff was fabulous. I loved that they had fruit in the morning and cookies in the evening in the lobby - a nice treat after a long day exploring. They also had lots of time to talk about each day to be sure that I was having a good time! They all had a great sense of humour as well which is so important in the service industry. They really undersatnd what is important to their guests - would I stay there again - in a heartbeat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel, just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Caspartje
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week for a conference. Highly recommended hotel, perfect location near shops, restuarants etc. Friendly staff, Irish pub in the building and excellent restaurant. Large rooms, free WiFi, and close to the underground rail station. Would definitely book here again. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Warmest, most relaxed staff and least pretentious hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Ross833
Reviews.Content: Stay here, you won't regret it. King rooms terrific size. Food great. Great value. Very relaxed. Concierge service great. Say on Friday and Saturdays you will meet Jimmy Fisher. He's 88. Been there 32 years and comes from Toowoomba in Qld. Australia. Magic.

Reviews.Title: “Individual style and comfort in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: ProfPatPending
Reviews.Content: I have used the Lenox asva home-from-home for the last 10 years. It has never failed to be a pleasure staying there. The staff are excellent, the rooms large and comfortable with complimentary wi-fi avreal plus. This part of th Back Bay is excellent for shops (Newbury St in particular), restaurants and spectacular architecture. Stay here and you are guaranteed a relaxing and pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: Whirling_Dervish_TR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Lenox for 5 days and loved it so much. As it is in the center of Boston, I can easily walk most of the sight-seeing places. I especially liked the ancient theme of the hotel, it looks like a boutique hotel. If I go to Boston again, I prefer to stay in there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Urban-Sombrero
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, some parts feel a bit dated but the over all is so good this only adds to the charm of the hotel. The area around is very good, nice restaurants and shopping. The tram is also close by. We payed a small fortune for breakfast at the hotel restaurant, but it was good. Complementary wifi is also very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Night in Boston for a Birthday”
Reviews.Author: AdventureSeeking
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Lenox. I had arranged to stay one night for Brian's birthday. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't make dinner reservations ahead of time and the concierge was able to get us a seating at the Top of the Hub with a great window view. There was also a complimentary bottle of wine in our room with a birthday note. An awesome touch! The hotel is really quite nice but I think the service is what makes it all the better. The bar is a great place for pre-dinner cocktails and the appetizer were delicious. I would definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home! If we ever visit Boston again The Lenox will be our hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Femke V
Reviews.Content: We loved staying in The Lenox. We stayed there from July 20 to August 2 2011, so in the middle of the heatwave (over 100 degrees a few days). The hotel has nice, big and clean room (superior king), Aveda bathroom products, the room was equiped with mostly everything you could need. And what wasn't there you could just aks for. The water in the hotel is extra filtered so for us it tasted just like the water we are used to in the Netherlands, that was super. Free wifi in the hotel was a big plus, it was quick and easy to connect to. The staff is very friendly and will help you with whatever you need. They make you feel welcome and at home. You can tell personnel enjoys working there, they seem to have a lot of fun. The hotellocation in Boston is excellent. Park, restaurants, shops, metro, major sights: everything you need and want in walking distance. Parking was expensive (43 dollar a day), but parking always is in big cities. Valet service at the hotel was friendly and quick. We frequently visited the hotelrestaurant (City Table) for breakfast, good price / quality ratio. On weekends they also offered brunch and I had something with bananas and wafles, that was really excellent :-)). We really enjoyed our time in The Lenox, Boston and its surrounding area, we definitely recommend staying here. We hope to visit Boston and The Lenox again some day!

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with nice rooms. Lovely cocktails in the bar. Great location near subway but can also walk to all the major sights. Good service. We ate in the restaurant on our first night and food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel with GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiboundToronto
Reviews.Content: I usually do quite a bit of research before booking any hotel when I travel and my trip to Boston was no different. I was extremely happy with my choice to stay at the Lenox! It was so close to everything and I loved stepping out of the hotel and having everything right there! The room was a good size for me and had a small fridge which is always a bonus! There was a computer in the lobby for guests to use for free for a quick email check. The front desk was very helpful and friendly, as was the tour desk. They also allowed me to store my luggage for the day after checking out, since my flight was later in the afternoon. The area was very safe to walk around, even at night. I would stay here again definitely when I return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Bostonian Welcome”
Reviews.Author: RoscoandLinda
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here and The Lenox delivered on nearly every front. The front desk staff were the most helpful and friendly of any hotel we've ever stayed, quite simply superb. The hotel itself, felt in need of a little modernisation in terms of decor and furnishings and our bathroom was somewhat cramped. However the complimentary snacks. free wifi and widescreen TV, made up for those minor shortcomings. The only real complaint was how noisy our room was, in part because it was located next to the ice machine in the corridor outside, but also the door and walls didn't feel sufficiently well insulated against people coming and going from adjacent rooms. So if you're a light sleeper you may want to let the staff know in advance of your stay. All in all The Lenox offers good value for money in a great part of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “old charm boston in fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: dawninwarsaw
Reviews.Content: I spent months reading reviews on Boston hotels, before choosing the Lenox. The hotel is full of old Bostonian charm, the staff are ultra friendly and helpful, during your stay you feel as though you are part of a special Boston club. At first we were a little disappointed with our room, with noisy air con, water pipes, chintzy fabric, smallish bathroom but after a few hours we decided that this was all part of the charm. The location is great for exploring all of Boston by foot yet only 200 yards from underground if you want to travel furhter and quicker. Complimentary tea and coffee and afternoon iced tea was very welcome and unexpected. We ate one night in the Hotel's Irish bar and the food was well priced and tasty, if we had stayed for more than 3 nights we would have checked out the hotel's other bars but there is so much to do in Boston we found we did not have much time to hang out at the hotel but the hotel was still a great place to come home to each night.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: willtravelforf00d
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this rather swank hotel in Boston's Back Bay area. 3 minute walk from the Prudential Center and Copley Place. 15 minute walk to Fenway Park. Room was large and very comfortable. Had a Bose ipod dock for charging/listening to your ipod. Service was very accommodating and eager to please. Had a decent view of the Charles river from the 10th floor. Fitness center was nice. Adjoining restaurant Solas, accessible from the inside the hotel as well as Boylston St., was very good. Did not eat at City Table (the restaurant IN the hotel). I was very comfortable in this hotel and whole-heartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to Stay in the Heart of Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: DMVinSD
Reviews.Content: We had to go to Boston for a family wedding and were very happy we chose the Lenox. The Lenox has everything you need and is a great value. Two restaraunts/bars with an authentic Irish bar on the street level - all had great service, execellent atmosphere and great food and drinks. The Hotel is in nice condition, the staff were all very helpful and it is located in the heart of the back bay. You are within walking distance of a lot of great spots and just a taxi away from anything else. We booked on Expedia because of th elow price - which is usually a pain to do. The Lenox said to just call them directly next time and they will match any price we could get online. I would stay there again when in Beantown for sure . . .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place - made our Boston trip memorable!”
Reviews.Author: SherrieV11
Reviews.Content: It's hard to add anything to all the great reviews of the Lenox, but I had to add my praise to this special place. It's difficult to describe, but the Lenox has a different feel than any other hotel. We felt at home here for many reasons but most of all it comes down to the staff. They are all so welcoming - it is very apparent that The Lenox truly loves their guests and makes them feel that way. Every person, without exception, was friendly and very helpful. It was our first trip to Boston, celebrating our 35th anniversary, and we received an upgrade to a corner suite - it was stunning. Beautiful furnishings and a wonderful comfortable bed with high quality linens. We enlisted the help of the concierge several times and received accurate and helpful advise. The location is excellent, very convenient. We were also very happy with our choice of staying in the Back Bay area. We took at 2 day trip to Cape Ann (highly recommended) and when we returned, we stayed at a hotel on the waterfront for our last night since it was very close to the airport. Although beautiful, it lacked the charm and grace of The Lenox and the hustle and bustle of the area was totally different than the Back Bay. Praise to City Table, too, for an excellent quick breakfast every morning. We usually avoid hotel restaurants since they are often overpriced and pretentious but not City Table. It was very convenient, delicious, and highly recommended. We are so thrilled that we chose the Lenox for our vacation and hope to return to the beautiful Boston area soon. When we do, The Lenox will be our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, character hotel”
Reviews.Author: yves_alexis
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights and enjoyed the atmosphere in the hotel. We enjoyed the food and the surroundings. Rooms were large and airy, also relatively quite for such a central location. The downside are the bathrooms which, although clean, definitely need to be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Blind Faith....can't go wrong with this one!”
Reviews.Author: loveslife64
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston this weekend with my daughter for her birthday trip and what a great time we had. I chose to stay at The Lenox Hotel solely based on other reviews and I'm so glad I trusted what others had to say. We had a truly spectacular weekend from the minute we landed to the minute we left. The entire hotel staff needs recognition by name but that's not possible. We were treated like we were the only guest in town....everything we needed, wanted or asked for was handled with a gracious smile! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dompelican
Reviews.Content: Got off a flight from Newark to Boston having flown from Manchester UK. I was horribly sweaty before I even got to Manchester, had baggage trauma at Newark (not an airport I'd recommend) and eventually arrived at The Lenox hot, tired & smelly. The door staff were utterly charming, as were the staff at reception. The location is great, everywhere is walkable. Breakfast wasn't included but there's a 7-11 over the road, and a bakery/deli attached to the hotel. Wifi was only available in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again, one of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: Mister8888
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Lenox three times and always during the peak season, when the usual seamless service of many good hotels tends to crack under pressure. But not the Lenox, From the friendly and enthusiastic lobby staff to the service staff to the restaurant staff this is A1 service all the way. Even the room cleaning staff seem imbued with the same friendly attitude. And what a comparison with the uber cool and over priced The Mark Hotel in New York. As a benchmark the Lenox spoils you rotten - and I live in Asia where top hotels are, well .. top!. Can I find a complaint? Well this is an old hotel and the lift service is a tad slow, but well compensated by that friendly Boston welcome and service. Keep it up guys.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel Focused Strongly on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: amm63
Reviews.Content: My family and I just finished a one week stay at the Lenox (July 29-Aug 5 inclusive). We enjoyed it very much. It is very well located, with access to many restaurants and shopping (Abe and Louis's, the Atlantic Fish Co., etc.), the Prudential Centre, a Lord and Taylor department store, and a variety of higher end shops along Newbury Street. There is also a Lindt chocolate store right next store (too tempting!) The hotel itself is lovely and it has two restaurants on site (very convenient) - City Table and Solas. We went to both more than once. Solas is very reasonable and has a nice selection of entrees. City Table was awesome for breakfast. We ate there more than once, and enjoyed a full breakfast and very good service. For those who wish a light breakfast, the hotel has fresh bananas and tea/coffee available each morning in the lobby. In the afternoon, it's iced tea and cookies. This was a welcome, refreshing treat after walking in the hot sun sight seeing. We used room service twice and we were impressed with the service, the quality of the food, and the pricing (comparable to the prices in the restaurants). However, what really distinguishes the Lenox is the service. Every single staff member said hello and greeted us, at all times. We were always welcomed back to the hotel when we pulled up in a cab at the end of the day. If we had a question, every effort was made to answer it, even if it meant asking someone else. The concierge was very helpful and accommodating. The front desk staff were always pleasant, and they willingly changed my $20 and $50 dollar bills into smaller denominations on many occasions. They loaned us an umbrella on a rainy day (one of the many items they offer for travellers to borrow, and in some cases, keep). Everyone went out of the way to make sure we were happy and well taken care of. We did not have any complaints, but I am convinced that if we had, they would have been dealt with and rectified. The staff at the hotel want you to leave happy, and they direct all their efforts at making sure that the hotel meets all of your expectations. In summary, we would return to the Lenox again, without a doubt. We felt that we were appreciated and our patronage was valued. I might opt for a Junior Suite next time, rather than a Superior Double room (two double beds). Pros: very centrally located near restaurants and shopping, beautiful decor and lobby, room was clean and comfortable, great on-site restaurants, great service all around, room to print off boarding passes, business centre, exercise room, bottled water in room (complimentary), complimentary drinks, treats in lobby (as mentioned previously). Cons: the only one we found was that the bathroom was a little small and sometimes it was crowded with the two of us; however, we kept in mind that the building was older, and this was a boutique hotel, so we didn't find this to be a huge problem, and we worked around it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...with excellent costumer service”
Reviews.Author: LoriMc16
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved the Lenox. We are a family of four (two adults and two kids ages 5 and 8). By far the best hotel in Boston. We travel there every year and this will now become our yearly hotel. From the time we stepped inside the lobby until the time we left, we felt very welcomed. Excellent location and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: aguyinthe818
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is clearly old, but well maintained. The old elevators and old feel give it charm. However updates have been made where it counts (baths, double pane windows etc). Do yourself a favor and upgrade to the larger rooms. The location on Boylston street is fantastic, walk to Copley, Newbury street and the Prudential center. The room was very quiet despite facing the street, high quality decor, Aveda bath products. Nice that a mini fridge with comp bottled water was in the room. A pay mini bar would be a nice addition. Odd that there were no drinking glasses in the bathroom and the in-room safe wasn't big enough for a laptop. Very nice staff who helped me navigate Boston. Free Wi-fi as well. City Bar in the lobby is very cool. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, a bit overpriced, needs a little more attention to the details”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room #621 with two double beds for one night. Not much to look at from the room (one side overlooks roof of Lord and Taylor) but the light was good and the blackout curtains worked like a charm. A spacious room with comfy beds. Check in was easy and so was valet parking ($43 gets you until 2pm the following day). Had coffee room service and it was fast & polite. Ate breakfast downstairs in the cafÃ© and it was good, as was the service. All the staff was super helpful â€“ from check in to luggage guys to valet. The neighborhood is wonderful â€“ tons of shopping at Copley and Pru Center + many restaurants. Now to the less-than-wonderful (and if Iâ€™d not paid $410 + taxes and parking, I would overlook these things â€“ but a hotel at this level should get it all just right): The doorknob in the bathroom was broken. There was only one robe. No umbrella (they did have umbrellas at the desk in lobby). The clock had a dead battery in it. The ice machine in hallway did not work. Again, these are little things that would merit no mention at a lesser hotel. I would stay here again, but not for $410/nite.

Reviews.Title: “so welcoming, I wouldn't trade this hotel for anything”
Reviews.Author: BethN25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston for a 2 night stay without out 3 children. We booked our two nights at the Lenox through travelzoo and were not disappointed. Upon arriving from the airport, we checked in at the front desk. Check in was smooth and after telling the staff we had a rough flight-they asked us what we wanted to drink. Within minutes we were given a glass of wine and ice cold Boston Lager for my husband. Now that is great service! The next day we were headed to a Red Sox game. We stopped to ask the concierge about recommendations for dinner. He gave us a few suggestions, made reservations for us and then proceeded to give us 2 tickets for the Red Sox game. When we arrived back in our room we discovered a bottle of wine on ice along with 2 wine glasses. I am not sure if this is typical, or we just lucked out, but I wouldn't stay in another hotel in Boston after this service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Newman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in July with my wife and son. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. You can not beat the location. Newbury street one block away the T one block away. We took the T from the airport. Only $2 and one tranfer takes you one block from the Lenox. Although the hotel has been there for many years the rooms a up to date. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The free wifi is very nice. Bring your walking shoes, the city is very walkable. For thoughs who prefer not to walk the T is easily accessible and will take you near anywhere you may want to go. I would difintely recommend the Lenox to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: TrioOfTravelers
Reviews.Content: I found the Lenox to be a pleasant hotel with a courteous doorman, but beyond that nothing matched up with the excellent staff reviews. I found the front desk and concierge to be dismissive. Plus, the building is not stroller friendly, lugging it up and down the stairs at the entrance grew tiring. The location is great, but there are better options if you are traveling with a young child.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bell5781 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a superb hotel in a great location. The staff were unbelievably helpful, from the moment they greeted us until the minute they summoned our taxi to leave. They arranged the booking of tickets for a Boston Red Sox baseball game (which were unavailable anywhere else). Room was spotlessly clean, very elegant and worth the money. This hotel is number one on trip advisor, a title it deserves. If you visit Boston, which is a wonderful city, you should treat yourself to a stay at the Lennox.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: AJ&HTraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at The Lenox at the start of our New England tour. The hotel is very much an older style hotel rather than a purpose built modern hotel. I like this as it means you are not in one of the any hotel any city versions. This brings some disadvantages, the room was good and well laid out. The restaurant is good and the food the standard you would expect from this level of hotel. So why is this the top hotel time after time? It is without doubt the superb staff. From check in bell hop and concierge we were treated as royalty right from the start. Out bellhop was in his late 80's-and still smiling and enjoying his work after being at The Lenox for many years. As we have found many times the staff can make or break the visit. The Lenox staff delivered, stay here if you get the chance you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: judymster
Reviews.Content: Great, historic charming hotel. I go there monthly!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pennytourslondon
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is perfectly located in Boston .It has a warm old fashioned welcoming feel . The rooms are spacious and quiet considering it is in the middle of Back Bay. It is located next to Lord and Taylors and the Prudential shopping centre and opposite the wonderful restaurant 'Atlantic Fish Company' The desk staff are very helpful and there is always lemonade and cookies to help yourself to. It has a pub attached to it as well as a smart restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff so eager to please and professional”
Reviews.Author: maureen051
Reviews.Content: Hotel was Definitely 4 star in service and rooms

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel because of the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kgirltoday
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and always enjoy the experience. Our room is always comfortable and the location of the hotel is very convenient to everything in the city. All the staff from the valet to the front desk people are just terrific. The hotel adds little touches that are very much appreciated like coffee in the lobby each morning. We have visited the bar and the restaurant and enjoyed both each time. This is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJonesy
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service. Nice little bar. Have tried other hotels, will always go back to the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for old- style luxury!”
Reviews.Author: mcallijd
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children recently spent two nights at Lenox for sightseeing in Boston. We instantly loved this hotel. The location is excellent- across street from Copley square, t-system, Boston public library, and quick walk to prudential center. Lots of great restaurants nearby. I definitely recommend Legal Seafoods, and the Duck Boat Tour. We loved both and they were very child- friendly as well. The hotel is luxurious, and little fridge is room was great little perk! We had a junior suite (room 314). The room was spacious with nice sized bathroom and closet. The only down- side was there was no view- just brick wall next door and ugly rooftop venting out of other window. Other than that, hotel was great and the stuffed animals for girls at check-in was nice touch. They also have a car which we took to airport $40, and it was much nicer than cab. In all, we highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in every sense”
Reviews.Author: hoosier16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox last September and returned with my sister in July, 2011. She wanted to see the Red Sox, but let me pick the hotel. My stay this time was even better than last year. The service in this hotel is incredible. Every, and I mean every, employee is friendly and helpful. They do go above and beyond to make your stay memorable. Two of the desk staff realized my sister's devotion to the Sox and got her a special remembrance. Also, the concierge staff is wonderful. I needed help with a day trip and with tickets and they arranged everything. What I love is they do it without the attitude that they are doing you a favor. Instead they want to help and do so. If possible get a corner room. They are more spacious and are comfortable. Also, the hotel is within walking distance of Fenway Park and other attractions and you are very close to good shopping and good restaurants. If you are looking for a great hotel in Boston, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel - excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: JACF7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lenox Hotel on Saturday 25 June and Sunday 26 June at the end of our trip touring round New England, before we flew home to London on the Monday. My wife, 10 month old daughter and myself made up our party. The service at the hotel is very good indeed, even before we arrived, as I exchanged emails with the concierge team with regards to a late check-out on the Monday and arranging a car with a car seat for our journey to the airport. They were extremely helpful and very responsive, and helped in every way they could. We had a hire car to drop off at Park Plaza, so we dropped off our luggage at the hotel before doing so, and again the staff were ever so helpful and friendly. Our check-in was slightly delayed by a late checking out guest, and the hotel staff were ever so apologetic and arranged for our room to be upgraded. During this short wait, Jimmy the bellman (you can see a newspaper article on him in the lifts area in reception) had a chat with us, entertained my daughter and provided her with a cuddly kangaroo toy which still takes pride of place in her bedroom. Everyone was genuinely friendly, and not in any "corporate, employer-required" way either. Our room was very comfortable indeed, with a closet area for our bags and a large bathroom, and a very comfortable king-size bed. The travel cot provided had more toys for my daughter, this time for the bath and which she still uses now. Unlike many hotels, the Lenox is acutely aware that children of any age are also guests and clearly work very hard to treat them respectfully as such, and make sure their needs are met as well as their parents. As any parents knows, a happy child will often mean happy parents as well, so it's an approach many hotels could opt to follow. It's worth noting too that the Lenox works very hard indeed to be as green and environmentally friendly as possible, in all that it does in servicing guests, even down to the bins in the rooms being divided up into different types of waste and different types of recycling, which is only to be applauded. The hotel has an excellent location, from which you can easily explore Boston and stroll round the city, using the Lenox almost as the epicentre for doing this. The concierge recommended a restaurant (Stephanie's on Newbury) which was only a short stroll away, and we had an excellent meal there (the Ahi Tuna Tartare has to be eaten to be believed). In all, we loved our time at the Lenox, it made an excellent end to our trip around New England, and was a superb base from which to explore and enjoy all that Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we went back”
Reviews.Author: Samandfamily101
Reviews.Content: A truly lovely hotel in a beautiful city. Even before we had walked through the door our positive customer experience began and when we did our son was presented with a very nice soft toy! Our room was great for a family. We booked a double double and had an extra bed. There was still plenty of room to move about and play. We stayed for four nights and then went to Maine. When returned to the Lenox for one night on our way to NY we were welcomed back by name. The hotel restaurant serves good food and the breakfast is good value as you pay for what you order rather than a flat price. Would we go back? In a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Original room not great, upgraded room very nice”
Reviews.Author: joannetravel
Reviews.Content: We booked on line and asked for a King room. When we arrived I asked if we had a nice room and they assured me that we did. When we got to the room, it was not a King and the room was very small. I was not happy and we called down. We were then upgraded to a junior suite and it was lovely. I would have preferred to get a nice room to start with. Staff are very friendly, and concierge was good. We did not use the restaurant. Definitely try the Atlantica restaurant across the street (its TA's number one) and it is excellent. The hotel is a great location for shopping (beside Lord and Taylor) and close to Fenway Park, and the Library. I would stay here again, but would be careful about what room I selected.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: donfre
Reviews.Content: I am no business traveller but have been all over the world on family vacations for over 30 years. I have become resigned to mediocre impersonal service especially in the US. What a surprise at Lenox! Believe me, I am no one special but they made my family feel like rock stars or foreign royalty! The rooms were great, the location perfect, but the service from all staff was beyond exceptional. Time and again they went out of their way especially to our 2 children. Other hotels should send staff here to see what service can be. I will never stay anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartyHuntsville
Reviews.Content: I went up wtih my 13 year old son and a friend of his and his father to see the Red Sox and we stayed 3 nights at The Lenox. The lobby and rooms have been renovated and are very nice. The check-in person was very nice as was the Conceirge. Everyone there was very helpful. You can't get a better location. it is about 200 yards from the Copley Stop on the T so we could get anywhere we wanted (including the airport) very quickly and easily. It was a short walk to Fenway or to Beacon Hill. We did have a problem in that they didn't clean our room the first day, however, we were provided a complimentary breakfast the next morning, which was excellent. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend of fun with my sister. The hotel definitely met our expectations, given the high marks on tripadvisor. The staff takes an interest in trying to make your stay just as you'd like it. Enjoyed their city view restaurant for a light dinner. The room was pretty large for a big city hotel and well appointed. I liked the water dispenser in the halls and free bottles of water. Best, however, is the hotel's location near Newberry St. which is chock full of shops and great, local restaurants. It's also easy to connect to tours, the subway, etc. from the hotel. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel209
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at The Lenox for 9 nights in July and had a wonderful time. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the bar was relaxing, and the staff was friendly and most professional. I truly can not say enough good things about this hotel. We will only stay at The Lenox when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further than the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: 1976Bride
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of staying at the Lenox when we were in Boston for a family wedding at Old South Church. While the room was spacious and impeccably clean, the building beautiful and the breakfast delicious, nothing compared with the excellence of the staff. Throughout the reservation process, check-in, check-out and everything inbetween, we were treated with respect. The concierge and valet were especially helpful. We were delighted to have an email awaiting us upon our return home thanking us for our visit and hoping we had safe travel. Outstanding public relations!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mfnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for my daughter college graduation. We usually use Priceline when we visit, but because of the busy time of year, we booked the Lenox about a year in advance. At the time we booked, it was the best deal for a 4* hotel in the back bay/copley area. This is a lovely hotel and the service is about as good as it gets. The location is about a block from the T, and walking distance to many of Boston's sights, shopping and restaurants. We parked at Prudential Central Parking with the coupon on their website for $25. I think the hotel parking was around $40.

Reviews.Title: “Service So Amazing I Will Never Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: CableCarBelle
Reviews.Content: it's no secret that I love the Lenox and that I stay there every time I''m in Boston. Here's just one illustration of why no other hotel in town compares. I was in town to a midterm exam that required me to be on campus at one of the local colleges. The day of the test I was logged into my office on one computer and was also working on my personal computer trying to get some last minute cramming done before the test. I called room service for lunch. Victor, my room service waiter, notice my books, papers, and computers strewn about and we had a laugh about how busy I was. Later that afternoon Victor showed up at my door with a pitcher of hot water, several chamomile tea bags, cream, and sugar. I didn't order tea. He did this just because he knew I was working hard and he wanted to show that he cared. The wonderful thing about the Lenox is that the entire staff is the same way as Victor. I always feel welcome and appreciated when I stay there. Don't think twice about where to stay when you are in Boston - the Lenox is the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Boston Favorite”
Reviews.Author: ExpertTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Great location, superb service, very comfortable beds, and lots of eye candy at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that leaves us chocolate every night is my kind of hotel !”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCanadians_10
Reviews.Content: Went to the Lenox for a business meeting, while my husband went to visit Boston. We loved this hotel, especially the friendly, can do attitude of the staff. I don't know what management is doing with their people but it sure is working. As a customer, you feel that they really want you to have a good time there. At the front desk, they gave us advice on where to shop in the evening and even gave us discount coupons for our shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ferrygate
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband and two daughters aged 18 and 21) stayed in The Lennox for five nights. We could not fault anything from the location, room or the very helpful staff. I give this hotel full marks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay & location was perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greenwell1980
Reviews.Content: Everything about The Lennox was perfect. The room was very nice, & the concierge was very helpful w/ restaurant selections, tour tips, & suggestions. We upgraded our July 4th reservation to include dinner w/ a view of the fireworks from the rooftop of the hotel. This is the way to go! We had a wonderful view of the fireworks & returned to our room within minutes afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service”
Reviews.Author: Jon_n_Court
Reviews.Content: Wife and I recently stayed for two nights. We live in the area so knew the section of the city we wanted to stay in. The location is really perfect if you want to be in the Back Bay. Boylston St, Newbury St., the Public Gardens, Boston Common, Copley Square are all right there. And easy T access at Copley, too if you want to head elsewhere in the city. The "classic" room was very clean and nicely updated. Nice big HD tv, and the bed was quite comfortable. The room was fairly small by US standards, but we have certainly seen smaller rooms in Europe, so no big deal. The bathroom was our one gripe. The shower was too small for both of us (it was a couples weekend after all!). And we literally had to maneuver to get onto the toilet, and we are both very thin! The wall jutted out by your left leg, and the toilet paper roll sat over your left thigh. Very tight by any measure! All I can say is Zdeno Chara would not be able to use that bathroom! Even so it was a great hotel and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: AG07
Reviews.Content: The service and our room at the Lenox Hotel were phenomenal. They were very friendly upon arrival. Throughout our stay, many employees offered to help in any way. If you were waiting for the concierge, another employee would come over to see if they could help you so you wouldn't have to wait. The room was very nice. We even had a chandelier in our room. The most amazing thing was how much they went out of their way when I got hurt. I stepped in a hole and twisted my ankle while at Boston Common and my foot swelled up immediately. I took a cab back to the hotel so I could put ice on it right away. I stopped by the front desk to ask if they could send up some ice. Not only did an ice pack arrive a few minutes later, but the man who brought it also brought a a basket full of treats. There were puzzle books, Clif bars, chilled water bottles, and Ben & Jerry's ice cream. This was such a considerate thing and made me smile after a bad morning. That is wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Splendour”
Reviews.Author: acy_london
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the evening that we spent at this hotel. It is old fashioned splendour. Room was nice and big with a fabulous bed. The bathroom could have done with some updating, and it would have been useful to have a safe in the room, but apart from those things, we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: azimutone
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 16 yr old daughter and we stayed in a junior suite on the 4th floor. The room was a great size with two large doubles. Everything in the room was great and the fridge was good and quite so we could chill our drinlks. The room and bathroom were very clean and the maid service was excellent each day. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is very central in the back bay area with easy access to T line and trolley tours. In summary we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice overnight”
Reviews.Author: appalachiandiva
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight stay in Boston between legs of a trip. This location fit the bill - quick ride to the airport, close to decent restaurants that would be open when we arrived (after 9pm) and reasonably priced. We found ourselves wishing we had more time to enjoy it... the hotel is lovely, clean, quiet, friendly and even a bit plush without being stuffy. We will definitely stay at the Lenox when next in BOS! Oh, and the "Irish Pub" had the best pub fare we've ever tried. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Back Bay, Great Value for Boston”
Reviews.Author: erad73
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of Boston's Back Bay. Very close to Newbury Street shopping, good restaurants, and the Hynes Convention Center. The price can fluctuate depending on the room style, but the lower-end rooms are beautiful and on the low end of the price spectrum for Boston, where even ratty hotels can charge $300 a night. I've stayed at name-brand hotels in the city that felt more like a truck stop in the middle of Kansas and been bilked. None of that with the Lenox. This is a top notch hotel, luxurious even, at a very decent price. The lobby is beautiful, staff was excellent, and the breakfast at City Table was top notch. This is a great place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay anywhere else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sstearns001
Reviews.Content: I personally wrote the VP of the hotel about the service at this hotel. Not to ask for free things or look for special privilege at the hotel, but because the people at this hotel deserve the praise. By name of whom I remember Kristie and Meghan at the front desk Peter and Mo Valet staff Other staff Concierge (whom the name slips my mind, but was wonderful) The service was way past Five Star, they went out of their way to accomodate, and went past accomodating to WOWing us at every turn. The little things matter when traveling. My kids had a wonderful time and the staff made gift gestures to them and treated them well. For my wife and I, Peter bailed us out by personally driving us to dinner and getting us a wonderful meal in North Boston during a Friday night when the Bruins were in the Stanley Cup Finals.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: The service at the Lenox Hotel is just exemplary! I've stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions now, all business, and I've never had a bad experience. The rooms are a really good size and are always clean. All staff that you meet are welcoming and helpful, and the food in City Table is excellent. Cannot ask for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, needs some updates”
Reviews.Author: wetravelalotToronto
Reviews.Content: Great location. We were looking for something a little bit different. Not a chain then room itself was alright old fashioned but with a certain charm. Thenrug needs a change though. The only complaint would be that one can hear everything going on outside. Bathrooms were clean and fairly standard (shower curtains...?) the service was GREAT!. Welcome was friendly our son got a stuffed animal on arrival which was a hit and the bellhop actually brought up a gallon of milk for the baby. Way to go the extra mile. Our drivers were polite and very professional and the restaurant staff was also very good. Example; after a long day of walking our son fell asleep and we thought we could sneak in a quick drink at the bar before we had to go and basically retire to our room for the night well of course he woke up and wasn't too thrilled at finding himself at the bar so needless to say we had to leave, however, the hostess offered to take the drinks up to our room since my wife was carrying the toddler and I looked after the carriage, I thought that was a nice gesture. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: courtney106
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived everyone was exceptionally pleasant, helpful and so friendly. The morning coffee and tea in the lobby was great. The location fabulous. Can walk anywhere from here. Two restaurants at the hotel and dozens within 2 blocks from hotel. We were there for July 4th weekend with another couple and we both felt the same. An elegant hotel in a prime location with superb staff. Parking is expensive but it is anywhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely facility and excellent staff but some annoyances.”
Reviews.Author: Benjygriff
Reviews.Content: The Lenox scores highly on some counts, with a few key problems which I will come to later. Free bottled water, while undoubtedly an environmental disaster for a hotel marketing itself as 'green', is extremely welcome when it's 85+ in downtown Boston. Likewise, free bananas and cookies are a boon upon returning from a day out. Staff are helpful and professional and the location is A+. Where it doesn't score well is in the 'noise' category: doors don't fit fully into their frames (the historic nature of the building, I guess) and you can therefore hear everything going on in the corridor, including idiots singing at 2am on Sunday night... Noise between rooms, on the other hand, is very well insulated. We were on the 9th floor and you can also hear shouting from down on the street throughout the evening. The air conditioning is effective but sounds like a 747 coming in to land. Likewise, older plumbing means that you are bombarded with a cacophony of toilet-related gushing every time somebody goes to the bathroom. Further, The Lenox evidently thinks it is wonderfully 'cool' and this can attract a very strange crowd: women on roller skates wearing neon gloves and a mini skirt exiting the lift with a suitably odd gaggle of friends at 11pm anyone? The bar is unbelievably dark: if you can't pick up there you're in trouble.... The restaurant looked great but we didn't eat there so can't comment on the food itself. Overall, a mixed stay. Too much of a clash between authentic and hip for us, resulting in an odd compound of elegance and oddity. For a hotel in this price bracket I expect at the very least a good night's sleep, relaxation, and a door that fits into it's frame.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my stars....BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: LMP4930
Reviews.Content: From the email correspondence days before confirming our stay, to the valet gentleman hailing us a cab to the airport, the Lenox completely outdid itself. Made us feel like family (the fun side of the family, not the overbearing/intrusive side). From the congratulatory bottle of wine from the staff for our anniversary, to the turndown chocolates, complimentary coffee, tea&fruit in the morning, cookies & iced tea in the evening. The Lenox is IMMACULATE: my boyfriend and I did a tour of our room (superior king-PERFECT SIZE) and explored every nook and cranny of the hotel just to see how clean it really was. No dust, no funky smells, no stains on carpets, plus the hotel has a lovely light & welcoming scent... Cleanliness: 10 The reception girls, bell hops + doormen are all very professional. Make sure you ask the concierge for advice on where to go to eat. Everything they recommended was a huge hit - not too touristy, not pretentious, but delicious and worth every penny. My bf and I look a lot younger than we really are (in our 30s, but we look very early 20s), usually resulting in less-than-courteous service. We get carded and treated like teens most places. Not here! What a breath of fresh air it was to stay at the Lenox! ....Customer Service: 10 Located in the best & trendiest spot of Boston (second probably being Beacon Hill), walking distance to EVERYTHING. We bought the Old Trolley Tour bus package (hop on/off 2 days) but barely had to use it because every sight and especially the Lenox is located in perfect proximity to everything ....Location: 10 We didn't get to try City Bar but we did close up City Table one night: excellent food, martinis and ambiance. Barmaid was a wonderfully classy girl. A Boston local even suggested it to us. He said that he always takes out-of-towners to City Table. .....Restos: 10 One thing I need to mention is an apology to room 723 during our stay! We had one too many of their amazing martinis on Sat June 25 and stumbled our way back to our room 724, not realizing how loud we were. We got a friendly knocking on our door to remind us that it was 2am.. :S Our sincerest apologies to room 723!! I honestly have no idea how this hotel got any kind of poor review. My bf and I are already planning on returning to stay at the Lenox. Well done and congrats to the excellent staff and management of the Lenox hotel! We will definitely be recommending you to everyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara255329
Reviews.Content: Service is excellent and very clean. good location being close to all destinations in town. If you require a cab it is instantaneous. Very friendly staff and coffee to go of a morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: lleeyyaahh
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Great rooms, optimal location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgwill
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves all the accolades it gets for comfort and service. For a hotel in the centre of a major city, we didn't find it outrageously expensive either. We found it particularly impressive for 2 reasons: 1)There was no annoying price-gouging - wifi, bottled water and newspapers for example are all free. 2) The staff in all parts show a warmth and friendliness to guests usually absent in city centre hotels. We didn't have to go far for great restaurants. We ate at Legal Seafoods (always great) and Atlantic Fish. The latter is a bit pricey, but worth it - the concierge will happily make reservations, which are essential

Reviews.Title: “"It was wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: KenF002
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff & Kristy (Kristi?)who helped family with surprising us with a gorgeous & delicious "goodie basket" waiting in our room Our stay was wonderful; from the moment we arrived to the moment we had to say goodbye. All were efficient , friendly & helpful. The Lenox is now "our" Hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Crescent98
Reviews.Content: The staff is so kind and very helpful. The location is great. We took subway to Fenway Park and walked to the North End and harbour area. The shopping is incredible, dozens of stores within 5 minutes of hotel. Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: julie_bloom
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room which was huge, and well appointed. Every area of the hotel was spotless, and the staff were charming. Had food in the Irish bar and ate at City Table, both were excellent. Would recommend this hotel, location was perfect for sightseeing, and a lovely place to go back to after your day out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect score”
Reviews.Author: Travellerfromsydaus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lenox for a week as part of a month in the states over december/January. The Lenox was by far the best hotel we stayed in, well and truly exceeding the waldorf Astoria in NYC. Staff, facilities and overall experience was one of a pleasant, historic and comfortable hotel. Cannot go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Twilly01
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Boston and stayed at this hotel the weekend of June 3rd. The hotel has a nice ambiance and dÃ©cor, however it was not worth the $485 per night rate we were charged--especially being that we shared a king-size bed. When I used the towel to dry my face, it felt was so rough against my skin and I didn't bother to put on the bathrobe because it was equally stiff. They felt like they were made out of burlap rather than cotton. In the middle of the night, we were awoken by an intense odor, which came into our room from across the hall. We realized it was not cigarette smoke. We called the front desk and they immediately sent security up to investigate the stench which was clearly coming from the partying guests in the room across the hall. At check out, we relayed the experience to the manager who did give us a small discount due to the unpleasant incident. Given the price I think they could include a continental breakfast with the stay. They did offer complimentary coffee but only between certain hours of the morning. When we were leaving we asked for a ride to the train station, as we had a lot of stuff to carry, and were told they did not have a car available on sundays. So I guess they don't service their guests on sundays. I wouldn't stay at this hotel unless I could get a dirt-cheap rate. Otherwise, overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: grafran
Reviews.Content: We chose this based on Trip Advisor reviews, but are surprised it is currently rated as #2 in Boston. We stayed in a Classic room. Good points: hotel location, fridge, housekeeping, complimentary water & morning coffee. Not so good: - bathroom is very small with insufficient storage space - the wardrobe is also very small, again with insufficient space - we would have liked a kettle or coffee maker - we would have liked an international TV news channel (like CNN in Europe) - on arrival, our luggage was not brought to our room within a reasonable time, and we evevtually collected it ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walkes1
Reviews.Content: You will get more personal attention in this hotel than in any other good hotel We had an unrequested upgrade to a suite which was superb and made the stay even better. One of a very few hotels that I would recomend without reservation

Reviews.Title: “Bags of old-school charm”
Reviews.Author: KevHurst
Reviews.Content: Everything is spot-on with this hotel - impeccably clean, great sized rooms, comfy beds, fantastic service and friendly staff. I stayed in a classic room and it had everything I needed for a comfortable stay. Plus, there are loads of great finishing touches which really add to overall experience: from the free fruit and refreshments in the lobby to the great range of toiletries in the bathroom. Overall, The Lenox feels truly charming and welcoming; a real pleasure to come back to each night. (P.S check out the food from the hotel restaurant - it was absolutely delicious.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: bob1w
Reviews.Content: Lovely old established hotel at back of famous public library and therefore convenient for subway, shopping malls, Boylston St restaurants. The staff are well organised, friendly and experienced (we met Jimmy who was winding the grandfather clock in reception, he told us the history of the clock and his own history - has been winding the clock for 30 years having taken over from his predecessor after a 30 year wait to take the role.) The hotel has excellent facilities- online flight check in office, good cocktails in bar, good restaurant. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, my favourite place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: GracemcCarter
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. I usually stay in the Back Bay area (great for shops, restaurants etc), and this is my favourite so far. Got a great deal by packaging my flight so really glad we got to stay here. The rooms are gorgeous, really comfortable and decadent-feeling. Massive telly, complimentary water, very old-school charming. Nice touches like a light that comes on in the wardrobe, and Bose hi-fi which sounds great. The bathroom is a bit small by US standards but everything works perfectly and is lovely and clean. The Aveda toiletries are great. Bed sheets feel divine and the room service was prompt and pretty reasonably priced. Great bar, too. Will definitely stay here again, feels like I'm on holiday, not on a business trip!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the greats”
Reviews.Author: travellingman1001
Reviews.Content: Three night break in Boston from UK, first family visit. I often stay in high grade hotels worldwide on business and can say that the Lenox is one of the best I've experienced anywhere. Great location. Lots of great restaurants locally. Concierge services absolutely outstanding and service generally excellent. Remarkable personal touches made my wife and children very at ease on their first trip to the US. Don't expect the most modern conveniences - that's not what the Lenox is about - but real style and character. We had a suite which was very spacious. Bathroom not huge but adequate. Breakfast in hotel excellent. Would not look elsewhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TakingATrip
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the positive comments about The Lenox Hotel. It is in a great location and the staff is excellent. It is older, charming and very clean. I missed having in room coffee which is not offered. However, there is a coffee and tea in the morning for guests, at no charge. There is ice tea in the afternoon and cookies in the evening. These are little touches that add to the charm of the hotel. I highly recommend The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great atmosphere & location, but expensive phone charges.”
Reviews.Author: RegularUserON
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Hotel for a weekend of exploratory sightseeing, June 9-12, after spending the week nearby on business. Neither of us can think of any other hotel weâ€™ve stayed at where the front door, front desk and concierge service was as pleasant and helpful as it was at The Lenox. The front desk staff will happily engage you as soon as you approach their desk. Wow!!! What a change from the â€œCanâ€™t you see Iâ€™m busy?â€� attitude weâ€™ve seen at so many other front desks during our travels. The hotel building is quite old, but you would not know it by how beautifully kept it is. I could not find one chipped, out of place, or even remotely mouldy ceramic tile in our washroom. The hallways are quite spacious. Our room was small, but beautiful. I can only imagine how much extensive work has needed to be done in this building over the years as technologies came and went. We found our bed to be too firm, but a welcome respite after a day spent walking around downtown. Everything in our room looked clean, modern and in excellent condition. We liked both the quaint, modern lobby bar as well as the small Irish pub that was in the hotel. The hotel restaurant was nice, but we werenâ€™t impressed with a breakfast we tried and since there are so many nice restaurants nearby, we always ate out of the hotel. As for the phone charges, we didnâ€™t realize until the end of our stay that the Lenox long distant fees were significantly higher than other hotels used for business travellers in the Greater Boston Area. It would have been nice to know beforehand, but caveat emptor I guess. Either way, the phone charges would never prevent us from returning to the Lenox in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly staff and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelCt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for my daughter's college graduation. Beautiful hotel, wonderful service and terrific location. Room was very spacious and clean. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzielewis
Reviews.Content: My family, two adults, a teen and a tween, stayed at the Lenox Hotel this past week for 3 nights. First of all, there is not many budget priced hotels in Boston. I looked at two in Brookline (we used to live there)-The Holiday Inn is the least expensive, but still not so cheap and there is a Marriott Courtyard as well in Brookline-$400 or more a night. We paid $319 a night Wednesday-Saturday in a Junior Suite. There were two double beds. The beds were very comfortable. The size was small for me, so one of our kids got a roll away bed and the other slept with my husband. They do have rooms with two queens (my preference), but there were none available when I made our reservations just a week before our trip. The room had a couch and a desk and a few of Boylston. It was quiet and comfortable. The bathroom is clean and attractive-no fancy tub or particularly large space. The location is perfect-Copley Place-intersection of Boylston and Exeter. Steps from shopping (upscale boutiques as well as less pricey places like H & M and Forever 21 which are teenage havens) on Boylston and Newberry, and another block or two from the lovely brownstone lined streets of Back Bay. A block from the T (subway) at Copley. You can walk or ride the T to the Public Gardens. The NOrth End is a T ride away. You can also take the T in the other direction to Jamaica Plains (JP) or Brookline or to Cambridge (Harvard Square, MIT). The service at The Lenox Hotel is superb. Really, I have never had better service anywhere. My kids loved that you can get a free snack, by calling down to the desk and asking for pretzels or potato chips, etc. All round nice and friendly and helpful staff that make you feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Judyloml
Reviews.Content: Since 1999 my college roommates and I have gotten together for a long weekend of fun. This year's trip was no different. We planned on Boston and The Lenox was reviewed. It seemed like a great location and we booked it. This hotel stay was by far the nicest of them all. The staff was so friendly and helpful and most of all geniune. They made us feel right at home. The room was meticulous, more towels than we could ever use, total comfort and quite lovely. When we checked in, Megan at the front desk was amazing on check in and everytime we walked through the lobby we were offered tea, cookies and if we had had a great day. I highly recommend this outstanding boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Profitness
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Lenox was fantastic. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. From directions to dinner suggestions. All was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: travellingbedbug
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Lenox for a couple of nights whilst attending a nearby conference. I am not particularly fussy but I never feel happy with a room which looks onto a brick wall or ugly air ducts. After a quick call to reception we were moved to another room - phew. It was a compact room but perfectly adequate. It's attractively furnished, in a traditional style and is in a great central location. The staff were all very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service”
Reviews.Author: ajfsurvey
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in and valet parking. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. Even though it's a "Pepsi" hotel, when my wife asked for a "Diet Coke", they sent someone across the street to get one and bring it up to the room. Several times when interacting with the staff, we were asked if they could help in any way....very solicitous. The room had a fireplace and when we asked about having it lit, a staffer came up within ten minutes and started it up for us.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Fabulous Hotel and The staff are amazing.”
Reviews.Author: LJPAD
Reviews.Content: The four of us girls stayed at The Lenox from the 3rd-9th of June. This hotel is amazing. They upgraded both of our rooms to Corner Junior Suites when they realised that two of the party were celebrating their birthdays. There were champagne, balloons and cakes in their room on arrival and the other room also had a basket of snacks, a lovely touch! The staff in this hotel really does go the extra mile to make sure that you have an enjoyable trip, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms were large and well appointed and the Aveda products were replenished daily, as was the bottled water. The turn down service in the evening was a lovely touch, especially the chocolates. The Lenox has an enviable position in Back Bay and shops, bars and restaurants are all close at hand. We had an amazing meal at The Atlantic Fish Company just down the street from the Hotel. Both the bars in the Lenox were great and their prices were competitive with other bars in the area. Boston is a beautiful city and when we were there the sun just kept on shining! We all had an amazing time and it was made all the better by the Fabulous Lenox Hotel and the amazing staff, thank you all. We will return to Boston and the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Quality customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dunbar70 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: After a long travel from Scotland, my wife and I were very disappointed at the double room allocated to us; teeny toilet and really only suitable for single person. Nothing could be done to provide us with a bigger room the first night as the hotel was fully booked but best effort to accommodate us was promised for next day. We awoke to find two complimentary breakfast vouchers had been put under our door...greatly appreciated....and great in-house breakfast. After consulting the duty manager we packed our bags, left them in our room, as advised, and explored Boston. On returning we were given keys to a splendid room with our bags already tranferred. Excellent space for moving about with couch, comfy chairs, big flatscreen telly, fireplace, two windows and a bigger toilet. This hotel was excellent with very friendly and helpful staff, great location and good quality finishings throughout. BUT big failure in allocating tiny rooms to couples (we were informed that the first size of room is allocated to single people and also to couples). Not an ideal situation of disatisfied customers having to complain at front desk. We'll be back at the Lenox if back in Boston and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, classic old-time atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: vdbgeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for 3 nights only. Conveniently located in the heart of Boston Back Bay within easy reach of both shopping and restaurants. Arrived from NY on the Acela express train which stops at Boston Back Bay station just one block away from the hotel. Very nice, old style classic atmosphere throughout the hotel and rooms. Friendly staff. Complimentary wi-fi in the room. Room A/C was not quite effective though (fortunately outside temperatures during my stay were not too high otherwise this would rather have been a major inconvenience). Overall impression was certainly positive and would stay there again. Boston hotels are just more expensive compared to hotels in most other US cities which explains my lower rating for value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: cairoArkansas
Reviews.Content: This is our third time to stay at the Lenox in Boston. It is a beautiful old hotel with nice size rooms. We stayed in a superior double, the beds are amazing , the rooms clean, free internet and a refrigerator in the rooms. Acroos the street there is a small store and Starbucks. The Lenox is in the Back Bay area and walking distance to Newbery Street and Mall stores. The Staff is outsatnding. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and we will stay there on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: ladymuckNorthWest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox once in May and then again a week later, early June. The first stay we had we signed up to their upgrade scheme and got upgraded to a junior suite for an extra $25 which was great. Usual American style chintz in rooms but very clean and comfortable and roomy. The staff were all excellent from the concierge who was always so helpful through to the door guys, always greeted with a hi and a big smile! The following week we had signed up to the same deal but were upgraded to the Judy Garland Suite! Wow! I just loved the idea that she spent time there and she was such an icon. Loved it! Great location and love the 86 year old bell boy! He was fab and soooo sweet! Anyway, would definitely always stay here when visiting Boston which is such a great city. Thankyou to everyone at the Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “Most accommodating staff I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: Griffin83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last week. The trip got off to a great start after being greeted by the most hospitable gentleman (Mark) on the front desk. The room was huge and very comfortable. Bathroom was pretty small, but it didnâ€™t bother us. Fabulous amenities. We stayed opposite the elevator which was a little unfortunate, but it didnâ€™t prove to be very noisy. Jimmy was another fantastic character worth a mention! I wouldnâ€™t want to stay anywhere else in Boston after staying at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Love Boston”
Reviews.Author: Joolsforester
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston and it was fantastic. This charming hotel was very comfortable and great location. The staff was very helpful and friendly. From the minute we pulled up, we were greeted and felt very comfortable. The room was nice and roomy. Our room had two queen beds and the free coffee in the morning in the lobby was very nice. We were just a block from terrific shopping and great restaurants were all around us. I would defiantly recommend this hotel. We took the trolly tour that departed just around the corner from the hotel and it was a great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “If you are visiting Boston do not stay anywhere else but the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: DevonUsatraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3rd trip to the Lenox Hotel and it exceeded our expectations yet again!! The service from all of the staff is second to none, nothing is too much trouble, the room was spotless, very comfortable, with a turn down service at night which was a nice personnel touch. The Lenox is in a great location, with shops and restaurants (prudential center, Newbury street) all close by, the concierge was brilliant and organised our excursions,Wrentham, Providencetown and the Duck tour which was a lot of fun! Finally all I can say is we are already planning our next trip to the Lenox we simply would not stay anywhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Impossible not to like, not absolutely faultless though”
Reviews.Author: Steinbeck1805
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so charming, their staff so friendly, their location so spot-on that I just about bring myself to rate it excellent despite a few minor caveats. The only one worth mentioning at all: the A/C in our room (superior king) was so noisy, we had to switch it off at night (and yes, both of us travel quite a lot and have some notion of the proper functioning of hotel a/c's).
