During the last two (out of 6) days there, it ceased being very effective at cooling at all. Apart from that, it is nothing if not enchanting. From the grand lobby to the nicely appointed rooms (and bathrooms), their fitness center and restaurant, the Lenox offers you practically any comfort and service you might want (ok, not sure if they have a swimming pool), without being obtrusive. I'm not qualified to properly label their interior design, but think chandeliers and armchairs while leaving out grandma. If you don't know Boston - this is one of the best locations you'll find. Just a few steps from Newbury St with countless shopping and dining options (many of them surprisingly affordable) it is also in walking distance from Boston Commons and even Chinatown or the harbour (the former would be a 10mins, the latter a 30mins leisurely stroll away). The same for the South End. Part of its attractiveness is the fact that it's not chain-owned. However, that may mean it's a bit more challenging to supply funds for the upkeep. But to this day, it has worked magnificiently.

Reviews.Title: “Really hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: Calzini-Rossi
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Lenox made Boston the highlight of our recent vacation - and we stayed at several hotels in several cities. To say the staff is superb is to under-rate them. We prepaid to make our stay affordable, but considering the amenities -very spacious room (with an Aeron chair at the desk), complimentary bottled water, a great fitness center, and personal help with our Red Sox game plans - it was worth every cent. The location is great, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, old elegance; the likes you don't see much anymore.”
Reviews.Author: playandsleep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox, in a junior suite on the 4th floor. Our stay was superb. The Lenox is the friendliest hotel we've ever stayed in. Our room had the most beautiful draperies, very plush robes, 24 hour room service, evening turn down service including chocolates on the nightstand, was very clean, comfortable, quiet, and roomy. It is an easy walk to Fenway, and is in the midst of a vast selection of restaurants, shops and sightseeing. I feel it is the perfect place to stay while visiting Boston. Instead of their valet parking, we self-parked around the corner at the Prudential Center parking garage. Get a web coupon at Boston.centralparking.com and save even more. We hope to return to Boston someday, and if so, it will definitely be at the Lenox. Thank you, Lenox, for a wonderful first visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where the customer comes first”
Reviews.Author: heandi026
Reviews.Content: We've just come back after an 8 day break in this characterful hotel. The service was first class. The staff were friendly, helpful, easy to talk to and nothing was too much trouble. On finding out that I was celebrating my birthday, a card and a very welcome bottle of wine was delivered to our room. Amazingly, we could hear no noise through the walls from other guest rooms, unlike some modern hotels! There was complimentary fruit and coffee in the morning and lemon tea and small cakes in the late afternoon but if you needed anything before then all you had to do was ask. It was ideally situated for sightseeing. A great stay and I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel anywhere!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanniemcl
Reviews.Content: This hotel thinks of everything, from the finest service throughout stay to the small refrigerator (with complimentary water) and they really care whether their guests are comfortable, happy and entirely satisfied with their stay. I stay here every time I visit my son in Boston. I look forward to going "home" to the Lenox - I'm not kidding - it really feels that way! I have never been treated better in ANY hotel and I have stayed in many very fancy hotels. This is my favorite. I have never found better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: rygsa
Reviews.Content: Having read rave reviews of this hotel, we found the "upgraded" room to be very expensive price wise, over USD 400.- a night for an old fashioned, small room with a very small bath. However, location of the hotel cannot be better which makes up for the small room. They pride themselves on service but we ordered from room service one night and after an hourÂ´s wait, the order finally arrived. We were not charged, but just the same, we were hungry and wanted our food delivered. Besides, we are both diabetics and had already applied our insulin. We were extremely worried that we would have a low blood sugar episode because of the food not arriving on time ! The server at breakfast was not nice at all !

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: NCLPride
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at this hotel the staff are attentive- luggage whisked from the taxi, a very happy receptionist (who was really funny as well), quickly settled in a lovely room witha fantastic view north over the back bay (which considering the hotel was full and we were on a budget break was extraordinary). A great introduction to Boston on our first trip there and what a first impression. They gave us a late check out, which allowed us to do a segway tour on our day of departure, and it really was the quintessence of a good hotel. The only thing that was a little (almost inconsequential) let down was one bell hop on departure who walked down ahead of us whilst we struggled to carry our cases out and down the steps without offering to help- but he was the only one out of so many for whom nothing but top flight service seemed as natural as air- a truly great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Roseonhip4
Reviews.Content: Myself & 2 friends recently stayed at this hotel. What a fabulous place to stay. From the moment we arrived we felt at home. Reception staff are friendly and so helpful. The room was large enough we didn't feel like we were sitting on top of each other and so cozy. The shower was lovely especially after a long day travelling/sightseeing. The location is ideal, centred to mostly everything we wanted to see. I fell in love with Boston and this hotel, would stay there again and would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 week in May and we loved it. This was our first trip to Boston and we couldnt be happier. The room we had was a classic room which we thought was lovely very comfortable complimentary Aveda products and a complimentary turn down service with 2 chocs on your pillow everynight - these things were lovely touches. In the morning you can go downstairs and have their complimentay coffee and tea to take away which is great if your an early riser ready to explore the city and just want to get on the move. The staff were 5 star from the maids to the reception staff, all were friendly and couldnt do enough for you. My husband spoke to reception on the 4th day of our visit to ask if we can have the use of a room with a bath due to a medical condition for 30 mins or so - the receptionist kindly upgraded us for the remaining two nights of our stay which made all the difference as we were extermely grateful and humbled at the kind gesture. The rooms have a great choice of channels including films that are still in the cinema for $17.99 on demand, room service is reasonable and the bar downstairs has terrific oysters. One great thing is their is a room where you can print out your flight tickets and boarding passes which is great for online check in, this is just off the main lobby just ask at reception. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Boston the location is second to none and the staff are a credit to the hotel. Only wish we were there now.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience, EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Tchrmomof2
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is a luxurious, family-friendly hotel in a great location. The hotel is within walking distance to nearly everything in the city. Our family (with two young children) was able to access all the major sites within walking distance. The service is top-notch, and the individuals who work at this hotel make it a fabulous place to stay! It is no stretch to say that The Lenox was one of the highlights of our family's first trip to Boston. Upon entering the hotel, our girls (5 & 6 y.o.) were immediately treated to a gift. The concierge was incredibly helpful, offering suggestions appropriate to our family's needs/desires. The valet service was fantastic--quick and incredibly professional. Each person we encountered--from the room service, concierge, valet, front desk, and maid service--made us feel valued and welcome. I cannot brag on this hotel enough!! We will stay nowhere else in Boston, and would choose this city over others just because of the wonderful experience at The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: mikethe6th
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The staff are superb - so friendly and all so very helpful. We had a great chat with the concierge, Jimmy Fisher - a charming veteran who has been working at the hotel for so many years. If he happens to be working when you're staying I highly recommend a ten minute chat. The rooms provided ample space and the TV cable was spot on. Wireless internet was included free with the room and you get a decent speed. The Lenox is about a 2 minute walk from Copley station and close to all the shops / attractions.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Mulherin
Reviews.Content: The Lenox ticks all the boxes. Great location. Tasteful and spacious rooms. Really friendly and helpful staff. A nice touch being the welcome basket with wine and snacks. We thoroughly enjoyed our five nights here and would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: travelbuttons
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. Great rooms, location and friendly staff. Definately recommed this hotel, will return!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: wblakeney
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is well situated, super staff. Thanks to everyone at the City Grill for making a memorable weekend - Judy Garland was at our elbow all night from our super suite to the Boston Pops. We love the place - it is the only hotel we would stay at in Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect...”
Reviews.Author: margarida
Reviews.Content: I think that The Lenox is the perfect place to stay in Boston!Beautiful building at the right location with fantastic service! Our room was lovely and spacious, with two double beds and amazing views!The bathroom was spacious too and everything was spotless clean.We had a very good prepaid rate considering the hotel quality and the location. Free internet acess in the Business center ( we were able to print our boarding pass) and free wireless in room if you have your own laptop. The charming Newbury street is only few steeps away.The Harbour ,downtown,the North End and the Museum of Fine Arts are all a walking distance from the Hotel.We arrived from New York by train and Back Bay station is only 5 min by foot. We only took the subway to go to Cambridge and to the airport.The subway station is 2 min from The Lenox! Boston is a very beautiful city. We have been in USA some years ago but we visited only New York.This time we decided to go to Boston too and really loved it!! I recommend the Hotel and the city to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its impressive tripadvisor rating”
Reviews.Author: Bri-anT1963
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the lenox having booked on the back of the tripadvisor ratings and comments. We took the shuttle and then the 'T' from the airport. (15 dollars for a weekly pass = great value) and walked the 100 yards from Copley station. From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't do enough. The girls on reception gave a really warm welcome and the room was great. We had breakfast in the hotel, had drinks in the Irish bar and also cocktails in the hotel bar. Boston is a great city, plenty to do and some really good bars and nightlife. Getting around Boston is easy, on the whole it's walkable but the 'T' is safe, quick and runs frequently. We had cocktails at the 'top of the hub' which offered great views. We also went to the 'wang' which is worth going just to see the theatre - it's really something else. The hotel booked meals for us at local restaurants and also for the whale watching tour - another good example of great customer service. Used the gym a few times and made full use of the free wi-fi. We certainly didn't want to leave. Well done the lenox for going that extra mile. A great hotel, excellent staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in a Beautiful Boston”
Reviews.Author: alippa
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a mix of business and pleasure actually -- my husband was at the Lenox for business for a few days and then the family showed up for Easter and spring break entertainment for the kids. We actually drove down from Montreal and ended our trip with 4 nights at the Lenox taking in the sights of Boston and visiting friends. The Lenox is perfect. We had a junior suite for a great price. The city was in full springtime bloom and was so easy to navigate. Whether we were walking or taking the T the Lenox is in just the right place. Plus it's close to the Charles River which made jogging really easy and pleasant over the bridges and around for a nice 3 mile loop or so. The hotel itself is great and comfortable, equally welcoming of business travelers or families with children. We loved the free internet -- in this day and age it makes such a difference to know the hotel isn't gouging us. It was a very nice getaway, made all the nicer because of how great the Lenox is. We will definitely chose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SianW
Reviews.Content: This hotel came up as No 1 on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Great location and friendly knowledgeable staff. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel, good location in town”
Reviews.Author: bdigby332
Reviews.Content: Really appreciated the welcoming service and location of the hotel was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, great location - LOVED it.”
Reviews.Author: travelmad9
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite because a certain publication said they have great views, I feel almost unfaithful for saying I was a bit disappointed upon arrival as the view was of the roof of Lord & Taylor. The wonderful receptionist said he was sorry the room wasn't what we expected and the hotel was fully booked but he was on duty from 7am the next morning and he would do all possible to move us. We came to love the room and wanted to stay there. The location of the hotel is so close to the Prudential 'Top of the Hub,' we had drinks up there and didn't miss any view from the room. We can't speak highly enough of the staff; the concierge booked an amazing table at a great steakhouse, in fact everyone was so friendly and helpful (at least 5 of the staff stood out) and we were a bit sad to leave. The Lenox has an amazing atmosphere, it's hard to describe but after a couple of days I defy anyone not to love it!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service”
Reviews.Author: thehankster
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston frequently and have stayed at a number of downtown hotels, and every stay has been a pretty good experience. Decided to try the Lenox on my last trip, though, and I was absolutely blown away by the service. Everyone on the staff, from the doormen to the front desk to the concierge to the staff at City Bar, seemed truly friendly and intent on delivering an amazing experience to the customer, and they succeeded in spades. They even ran all over downtown in snow and below-freezing temperatures to find us some fix-a-flat (and declined to accept payment for it) so that we could get to the nearest tire shop when we got a flat tire on the last day of our stay. The room was a little on the smallish side, but perfectly comfortable, well-appointed and exceptionally clean. Location is perfect, right in the middle of myriad dining and shopping options and very close to the T. To top it all off, this place is an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed with the Lenox !”
Reviews.Author: res51
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston.... so pleased that we chose the Lenox !. Excellent location., The Hotel provided first class service. The Junior Suite room was far larger than we had envisaged, decorated well with clean bathroom etc. The free lemon cookies at reception each evening were delicious. ! Try them !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - as usual!”
Reviews.Author: popgirl101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights; we've stayed here about 3 times before and I'd always pick this hotel when staying in Boston. The location is great because you're really close to the Prudential Center and Newbury Street. A lot of the cheaper hotels are much further out of town which is a shame because downtown Boston is so walkable and the location of the Lenox means you can pop back during the day to drop stuff off or have a nap before more shopping and sightseeing! It's not the cheapest hotel but the service is excellent, it's spotlessly clean and because it's an old building there are actually proper lights in the middle of each room! A real novelty after staying in modern hotels where there is NEVER enough light. I highly recommend the Lenox - it's probably not the most high tech or modern hotel in Boston, but it has real character and the staff are great. Stay here if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: frch-Denmark
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel lived fully up to our high expectations. We really enjoyed the touch of old world elegance it offers. The are many excellent restaurants both for lunch and dinner close to the hotel. This was our first trip to Boston and this hotel is perfectly located to explore the city. Boston Common and downtown are within walking distance and to get further away you just need to walk a few steps to the 'T' Train station around the corner. Also for shopping you do not need to go very far. The Prudential Shopping Center and the luxury shops on Newbury Street are very close to the hotel. Given the chance we would definitely stay at the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - the best staff I've ever encountered in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: runnergirl059
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Boston marathon with my family. Upon our arrival, our grouchy children were distracted by the doormen giving them cuddly sheep and charmed by the staff trying to draw them out. The hotel is fantastically placed for the marathon and the staff made an enormous effort for all of the runners - the place was festooned with marathon stuff, on the day before all the guests were given little marathon goodie bags, a wonderful book about the Boston marathon was left on our pillow at night - amazing! The concierge was fantastic for booking restaurants and all tips and advice, and the staff would not take tips for all their extra help. Taking our children into the restaurant one night, the manager immediately noticed and came across with pens and some lovely Boston guide books for them. I have NEVER stayed in a hotel where i felt more genuinely welcomed and appreciated. I loved my stay at the Lenox and will certainly stay there the next time I travel to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and friendly”
Reviews.Author: shoestrings
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Lenox and it was just as fine as ever. The staff are wonderful-welcoming, friendly and accommodating. The room was absolutely lovely and very comfortable. The bathroom was roomy, clean and well-appointed. We enjoyed the large, LCD TV in our room. The staff brought us little treats each day- mostly from the Lindt store off the hotel lobby. We highly recommend this well-situated, superb hotel for your Boston stay.

Reviews.Title: “If I can't stay at the Lenox, I will not go to Boston”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDutchman049
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lenox for the Boston Marathon this year. They checked before if we were going to run. Then they gave us a top floor room (extra quiet) with views on the finish. The hotel was really into the event with all staff dressed in training gear on Saturday and Sunday. The provided us with lots of extras, incl. a SIGNED book on the event. But most of all the staff was so enthusiastic and friendly and made us really feel at home. Therefore it's the best hotel I've ever stayed in. And as I plan to return, I will only go if I can stay at the Lenox again! Thanks, thanks, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Lesley079
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were the most helpful, courteous and friendly of any hotel I have stayed in. There was an error in our booking (by the travel company), but the hotel staff bent over backwards to accommodate us and upgraded us to a junior suite. Lovely hotel and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Boutique Hotel with Service Beyond Compare”
Reviews.Author: DabneyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before flying out of Boston. Wish we could have stayed longer! We were able to walk to all the sights of Boston from the hotel (we took the trolley tour first to get acclimated). The Irish style pub was fun. Hotel is elegant and gorgeous. Service was amazing. Busboys had our bags out of the cab trunk before we'd finished paying cab driver, then next day offered to keep them for us after checking out but before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GarryLee316
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, free wifi, good service and excellent location. I feel it wasn't great value for money but it is still an excellent Boston hotel

Reviews.Title: “The most hospitable, customer friendly hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jbsess
Reviews.Content: My husband is disabled so it was imperative that he had certain equipment that we did not want to have to bring with us. Cindy, the reservation agent, whom I initially spoke with was so courteous, going out of her way to call us back to make sure we would have what we needed. It only got better when we arrived. I must say we have stayed in rooms that were more grand, but the personnel was the grandest we have ever encountered and everything that we needed was available. I can only add that when I come back to Boston whether alone or with others I will definitely stay here. On a note of vanity, I loved their hair dryer better than my own. Usually I'm happy to get home, but I certainly was not ready to leave the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jmhmomma
Reviews.Content: Although we had some troubles at check-in, The Lenox more than made an effort to make it up to us. The hotel is very elegant and the staff is very friendly. We never met a person who was less than willing to help. The location is absolutely wonderful and you can explore all points of Boston from here. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: UncleBuck6679
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox for my wife's 40th birthday and our first trip to Boston. Upon our arrival check in was easy as they accomodated our request for an early check in. The hotel is very nice and the entire building was immaculate. When we entered our room (junior suite) there was a birthday card from the staff with a complimentary bottle of wine. I must have mentioned the reason for our trip when making the reservation and they obviously ran with it. Since we were eager to see the city we dropped our bags and immediately headed out. The concieerge and front desk staff were incredibly helpful with directions, maps, reservations, anything we asked they took care of. When we arrived back at the room later that night we started to settle in but noticed the stale smell of cigarettes. We grabbed someone from the housekeeping staff and asked for a spray air freshener. They apologized for the smoke (and yes it is a non-smoking hotel) and freshened the room. We said no big deal and thanked them. Five minutes later the phone rang, they apologized again and said that Vincent the bellman will be up shortly to move us to another room. We said it was fine but they insisted. Needless to say, we were quickly relocated to another junior suite. All in all, the customer service was out of this world. The location was perfect with easy access to the T, shopping, restaurants and more. The rooms were large and comfortable for the most part, but I can't help but think that the staff is what really made our stay fantastic. Kudos to the entire group, we will definitely return on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Byebyegolf
Reviews.Content: The Lenox had a really nice feel to it, all the staff were very friendly with a hello everytime they passed you. Our original room had a very small bathroom and it was no trouble to move us to a larger room at no extra cost. The location is superb, close enough to the centre but in a really good area with many eating places and small shops nearby and a large mall 200 yds away and easy transport links via the metro. The Charles river is only a short walk away and you can walk into Boston City centre in 25 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Will never consider another hotel in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: joyflyer
Reviews.Content: Start to finish, these folks know what they're doing. No one we came across failed in any capacity. Not only are they a capable and professional crew, they are also very cheerful and friendly. You really got the idea they couldn't wait for you to have a problem so they could solve it! I loved, loved, loved everything about our stay and will never consider another location. My husband and I traveled with our 2 year old and met a single friend who bunked in our suite. We were there for the marathon, and it was great to have a front-row view of the finish line. We stayed a couple of days after the race to see the city, and couldn't have had a better location for that, either. But this isn't just the best place to stay in Boston. It's the best place to stay, period!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marathon -- Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: david_wyman
Reviews.Content: The Lenox covered the A-Z and Z-A in friendly service, real neat little surprise room trinkets daily and Marathon support. Was a total pleasant experience in the heart of both the Marathon Finish area and the incredible Shopping and dining area of Boston. The Price -- well ya high -- perhaps all of Boston was during the jam packed marathon weekend too. If you can afford some luxery treat -- the Lenox definately will exceed your hotel expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Vacationingisthebest
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff. When making the initial reservation, It is nice to speak with people actually in the hotel, and not in a central reservation center. Thank you Christie for your assistance with the hotel reservations (the room was perfect), and Keith for the fantastic dinner suggestion. Totally worth giving up the points you would get if you stayed at other hotels. There will be no doubt, my next trip to Boston will include a stay at The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: TravelinfromSD
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Lenox for business and leisure and the location in the Back Bay was perfect for fulfilling both purposes. The Copley T Station for the Green Line is a block away and Hynes Convention Center is just a short walk down the street in a bustling but safe neighborhood. Shopping, restaurants and taverns are all within the immediate area, and there is a slice of history across the street with the McKim public library building and Trinity Church on Copley Square just up the street. You can easily walk to all that Boston has to offer, or take the T if you want to shorten the trip. Beyond the convenient location, our room at the Lenox was the most comfortable and elegant hotel room I've ever stayed in. It has the warmth and atmosphere of a historic building, with all of the amenities of a modern hotel, including filtered water in the halls, complimentary internet, a gym and a pub on site. Without exception, the staff was terrific. Wish I could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CJPNorfolkEngland
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week staying at the Lenox and would we go back,definately. We booked through Virgin originally as a couple, but later added our 18 year old daughter to the booking and checked twice with Virgin that we would have two double beds in our room. On arrival the hotel told us they had not been informed of this, but sorted it in seconds and upgraded to a junior suite at no extra cost. The room was fantastic, with massive space and could not be faulted. Through the week the staff ranging from Krista on the front desk to the Old Australian fella in the lobby and the Big tall doorman and too many others to mention were so helpful and went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one to such an extent that i mentioned i had tickets to the Redsox v Yankees games and returned one afternoon to find a load of goodies including a T.shirt and eats for the game with a lovely message from the Front desk staff. The only part of the hotel we used was Solas Irish bar for eats and drinks which was excellent. Overall a great hotel in a very good location and i can only echo previous reviews on this site and when we visit Boston again will stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Nicki78_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lenox for 4 nights in March for my sisters 30th Birthday.When we checked in we were delighted to find out that we has been upgraded to a junior suite,then when we got to our room there were balloons and cupcakes waiting!! This was such a lovely surprise and i can't thank Meghan and Christina at front desk enough for this,then to top it all off later that evening we were bought a bottle of bubbly and chocolate cake,such a wonderful start to our trip and the most amazing service ever!! The hotel itself is lovely,the decor is great and the rooms are spacious,the location of the hotel is fab too,near to the pru and a t stop.Overall we had a wonderful time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: aleea8
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely blown away by the sheer elegance of this establishment. From the complimentary turn down service to the amenities that are thoughtfully provided, one feels like they are treated with the VIP experience. The room was bright and clean. The noise from the street was minimal. Also, complimentary wifi was available -- a bonus! The location simply cannot be beat. It is close to the subway and shopping areas. Also, it was across the street from The Atlantic Fish, which happens to have fantastic clam chowder. The Lenox was a wonderful experience and I look forward to revisiting this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service-beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AvidVacationer80
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here April 4 & 5. It was an amazing hotel. The exterior & interior was absolutely beautiful! The service was out of this world. Everyone of the employees treated us like we were VIP. Always addressing us & welcoming us when we came in or went out. The room was gorgeous. The only complaint I would have which is minor is that the room was a bit on the small side, as well as the bathroom. Eat at the Atlantic Fish Company and Joe's American Bar & Grill. Both are soooo good. The Atlantic Fish Co is a little more dressy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Homely Hotel with Exceptional Comfort”
Reviews.Author: sconey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Jan 11, just got in before the big January Norâ€™easter! We had a junior suite with dual aspect windows and a corner fireplace; however the fire place was un operable. The view from the floor 8 was great, our room was comfortable, clean and spacious - the bathroom was a little on the small side but was fit for purpose. The beds were very comfortable, I was like a child at Christmas the first night, I kept getting up to look and see if the snow had started. At 6am the snow was thick on the ground and still falling, it was magical looking out from the cosy hotel room. The aircon was a bit weird though, it was either too hot or there was a draft blowing. Breakfast was great, we had breakfast each morning of our stay in the City Table restaurant, it wasnâ€™t cheap but it did leave us filled up for the morning. The only problem I had with this was that a cup of coffee cost $4 in the restaurant, but outside in the lobby it was complimentary. The best thing was on the last day we were offered complimentary breakfasts for both of us - nice touch. The first day we were more or less snowed in! We watched the unfolding weather and its story on the local news channel then went out for a wander in the snow covered streets. When we got back there was a note saying due to the weather and subsequent staff shortages, there would be no turn down service but we were welcome to join in the lobby for hot chocolate and cookies. There is a small business centre, fitness centre but no pool, an Irish bar adjoining the hotel which served food, the City Bar and the City Table both serving food, the Irish bar and the City Table had large screen TV's. We ate most nights in the City Table and found the food to be very good quality and value. The hotel is very central and everywhere is walkable, even in 14â€� of snow! The city has some of the most beautiful features and buildings and of course the story of the city is a tale to be told. I just loved this place, I have very fond memories of how cosy and comforting it was during the January Norâ€™easter!

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jdtraveler65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few months ago on a business trip, usually I have little say in where i stay, but I was given the choice on this trip, and after consulting trip advisor, I went with The Lenox Hotel. I have to agree with the high rating, the hotel is in a perfect location, right next to the T, and allowed me to feel at home while i was in a city I rarely visit. The free wifi was a plus as I had work to do, and the concierge was great in his dinner recommendation, and helpful with directions as well. Would love to stay in this hotel when I'm in Boston again!

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: alipet8
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Virgin and only later found it was no 1 on trip advisor. What a real gem! From the moment we arrived the service was immpecable the staff so friendly and welcoming. The hotel is ideally situated easy walking distance from many historical sites, close to shopping malls and a wide variety of resturants. A tube station is close by that allows safe easy access to all parts of Boston and Cambridge. We would definitely stay at the Lenox when visting Boston

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Elegant and Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Blackbeard007
Reviews.Content: The Lennox came highly recommended and it did not disappoint. Th location is ideal, it's very central, perfect for the first time visitor to Boston. The hotel was charming and very traditional in style. The restaurant food was very good. The staff were always helpful. Free Wifi was reliable and fast. Noisy air con can be a problem, but other than that I did not have any issue. A few of my colleagues did complain that with only two lifts it was a problem getting one during the busy period.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: corkgurl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two daughters stayed here for 5nights from March 14th to 19th. We had a wonderful stay. The two rooms we were allocated were of a very high standard. We can't speak highly enough of the hotel staff from the friendly helpful doorstaff/reception staff/bar staff to the cleaning staff. I really hate to say anything negative about this hotel because it really is fantastic, however it is let down by some of the staff in the 'Solas' bar. They are ignorant, surly and the most unfriendly staff I have ever encountered. We had drinks and dinner there on our first night and the bartender was surly and rude. Not a very good first impression! The food wasn't bad so we decided to try it again after a long day shopping in Wrentham 2days later. We were met with the same rudeness from a different barman and the waitress was positively agressive! We were waiting to be seated by one of the staff, the only nice one we encountered, when my daughter spotted a vacant stool to sit on. She stepped over to get it and as she did so this most aggressive waitress roared at her to get out of her way, she had two empty glasses in her hand and was approaching the bar with them. My daughter was very taken aback. We continued to wait for our table, 30mins at this stage, then just when we were told we were next and a table became free, the aggressive waitress embarrassed the boy seating us, by sweeping in with 3men who had just entered the bar, and sat them down at the table. We had enough at this point and just left. It was disgraceful behaviour. I made a complaint though to the concierge and he went and got the restaurant manager for me. He was appalled when I told him what had happened as it is definitely not the way they treat their guests in this hotel. He invited us into the City table restaurant and treated us like royalty. He was most apologetic and more than made up for all the messing about we had. A big thank you to Micheal for making our night special and for showing us once again how truly wonderful the hotel staff are. I have to say there is a huge difference in attitude and standards once you enter the Solas bar. Itâ€™s a shame as this hotel is otherwise faultless. I would still give it 10/10 and I would definitely recommend it and would return, but I would avoid you know where! I must say the meal we got in the City Table restaurant was exceptional. We had dined in Mortons across the road from the hotel the previous night and though it was good, it was expensive. But I must say the hotel restaurant was definitely on par with it, if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service - hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: AlexGBuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for one night for a business trip. From the minute my cab pulled up, the service from every single staff member was UNBELIEVABLE. The concierge was amazing and fit in a much needed very early massage and great dinner into a very tight schedule. One interesting note - this is the fastest wifi I have ever experienced at any hotel. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The bathrooms are a bit small, but the overall experience was fantastic. And the location! Can't beat it for downtown Boston. I will stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good...but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: JAPLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 return flights to Boston and 5 nights in a double/double with BA for a total of Â£1200. Deal involved an upgrade to a junior suite. Check in was very smooth, except they had no record of an upgrade to a junior suite and I was given a superior (standard) double/double room. This room was ok. Not huge with a tiny bathroom and large walk in closet. Phoned the BA rep, and he sorted everything out. Following day we were upgraded to the junior suite. Corner room with double aspect, fireplace (though it was not operable). 2 very comfortable double beds (I loved the pillows), larger bathroom, sofa, fridge, large flat screen. The staff are all super friendly and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Free wifi throughout the hotel worked well. Location is good with great shops and restaurants all around. There were a few negatives. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room (although coffee is freely available in the reception up to about 10am). City Bar does not open until 4.30pm (although there is an Irish pub connected to the hotel which opens at 11am). Fitness room is very tired and needs a refit.

Reviews.Title: “yes, yes, yes”
Reviews.Author: Joanieyh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very convenient location, very friendly and helpful staff (they gave us a complimentary upgrade). We also got 4 nights for the price of 3. Only downside is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. They offer free tea and coffee in the lobby, but only at certain hours, and we always seemed to miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: catlorayne
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. We booked on of the corner fireplace rooms and we had a fire both nights we were there. The staff was always friendly as they answered questions about Boston, the hotel, or brought something to our room. The location in Copley was very easy for us. We could walk most of the places we wanted to go our hop on the T at Copley Station. Everything was wonderful and we would love to stay at the Lenox the next time we visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Classy charm and warmth, plus great service”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler5220
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Lenox often - maybe 12 times a year. So I'm very familiar with the pros and cons of this establishment. Overall, this is my favorite hotel and preferred choice in Boston. Here's why: The hotel is independently owned by the Saunders, a family who obviously care greatly about sustaining the quality of the hotel and ensuring a consistent customer experience. This telegraphs through in many ways, especially in the dedicated attitude of the hotel staff and their desire to provide great service. Many of the staff members have been Lenox employees for years and you can sense their loyalty to their employer. There are other reasons to love this hotel, from the perfect location in Back Bay and the hotel amenities, to the commitment to environmental stewardship. City Bar is one of three dining options in the hotel and depending on the evening, it can be a quiet, intimate spot to grab drinks and a bite, or a hopping destination for 25-35 yr olds to meet up with friends. At both City Bar and City Table, an upscale, full-service restaurant also located on the premises, the food is good and not overly priced. In my opinion, there is only one drawback. I find the small fitness room a disappointment. The two treadmills are old, clunky â€œdreadmills" and there's not enough equipment to meet the morning demand of the hotel guests. I have to get up extra early just to dash down there and claim an elliptical machine, but sometimes that doesn't even help. I'd love to see the Lenox dedicate more space to the fitness room, replace the cardio machines and add even more of them, as well as expand the weight room options. Despite this, you can't go wrong by staying at the Lenox. It's a perfect destination for visitors to Boston who want to be in the heart of things with easy access to site seeing, shopping and restaurants, and then return to relax in a warm and charming hotel environment.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly lobby”
Reviews.Author: Sharon1025
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel smelled from "essential oils" air freshener. The chemicals from this air freshener made me very ill and I would not recommend anyone with allergies or chemical sensitivities breathing in the toxic fumes.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox met all my needs and I am not so easy to please.”
Reviews.Author: phyllisnewyork8
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston to look at potential colleges with my niece and her mom. From the moment I entered the Lenox and saw the warm fire in the lobby, I knew I would be at home. The room was spacious and immaculate, the concierge catered to our every need--from recommending restaurants to inquiring about how our day went and everyone seemed to be intent on pleasing us. I am pretty fussy about hotels and the Lenox is a winner. I will definitely come back the next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Anniversary Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: janiecap
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is the best. When we want to celebrate an important event in our lives, we go to the Lenox. My husband and I both went to college in Boston and we are quite familiar with the area, the location is fantastic! As a matter of fact, we used to go to the Pub at the Lenox and grab a burger and a beer, way back when! When we walked in last weekend, we were greeted, by name, by Meghan Murphy, a front desk associate. We were treated like royalty and Meghan gave us a BIG â€œHappy Anniversaryâ€� wish. It meant a lot to us. Weâ€™re both public school teachers, so weâ€™re not members of an elite travel group; however, we were treated like we were! For our anniversary, my husband always wants to know where I want to go; I always want to go to the Lenox in Boston. Meghan, and the Lenox, upgraded us to the most beautiful suite we have ever occupied. Jokingly, my husband said, â€œThis must be the presidential suite.â€� She replied, â€œI think it is close.â€� It was! When we walked into the suite, we were amazed. On the dining area table was a card addressed to us and a bottle of Cabernet. The handwritten note wished us a Happy Anniversary and asked if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable. It was signed by the chief concierge, Keith Loveless, and associates, Mary and Christian. Our suite had a large sitting area, dining area, a granite wet bar, glass doored cabinets with an array of wine and cocktail glasses, a complete entertainment system, built in mini refrigerators, luxurious furnishing throughout, a master bedroom with a fireplace, and a marble bathroom with a sunken whirlpool tub, separate shower, and lighted sink; the fixtures were in the shape of beautiful swans. This suite was beyond our wildest imagination! In addition to Meghan, Mary, and Christina, the entire staff was extremely cordial and efficient. Our requests were few, but were attended to in a highly competent manner. I honestly canâ€™t say enough about our wonderful experience at the Lenox. Weâ€™ll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel - Staff exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: sunnykim67
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12 girls who decided to go to Boston to take in a concert, a hockey game and some shopping. I cannot say enough about how well we were treated at this hotel. The sfaff here are amazing. They could not do enough for us. We were absolutely delighted with the kindness and helpfulness of the employees at this hotel. A huge thank you to concierges Nina and Jason, you guys are great. The rooms were large and bright and we did not have any complaints about the bathroom size (as I had previously read), it was quite fine. We stayed for 5 nights and spent most of those evening with 8 - 12 girls in one room socializing and never once heard a complaint about noise, which we were expecting. I would have no hesitation about staying here again. The location is great, we used the T for all our transportation needs and it was just fine. Some examples of the hospitality here are - my luggage scale broke and I went to the concierge's desk to borrow a screwdriver to fix it and three men came out and fixed it for me - also on Saturday, they tried to get us hockey tickets for the game that night and couldn't so later that night they sent complimentary drinks and snacks (for 12) to our room. -- Just unbelievable services, our entire stay we were treated like this. If you are thinking about booking this hotel - go for it - you will not be dissappointed. I cannot understand why anyone could give this hotel a bad review. Thank you Lenox, you made our stay in Boston so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to go in Boston”
Reviews.Author: CROSSO78
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the city. It's only a 2 min walk to fancy Newbury Street, to the Apple store and the big Prudential Shopping Center. Free nice 24h gym and a small but also complementary business center with free printing and Internet. Free fast WiFi. The junior suite was really huge lacking only a big wardrobe. My next trip to Boston will lead me to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BethAmherst_NH
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were friendly and helpful. The room decor was outdated but by no means shabby. We had a corner room which was a very nice size and quiet. We also had a wood burning fireplace and enjoyed a nice fire made by the staff. All calls made to the staff were promptly responded to. The location is wonderful and many attractions, dining and great shopping are all within walking distance. Also has free wireless! Very nice amenity.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best stays EVER !!”
Reviews.Author: ajbike
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the only negative of the whole weekend, we tried to eat late Friday night at the Solas irish Pub and after 20 minutes of sitting at a table, never saw a waiter or was even acknowledged by a staff member, so we got up left (again no acknowledgement) and walked across the lobby to City Table and had a wonderful time. other than that, this may be the best place we have ever stayed ( and we travel ALOT), every and I do mean EVERY employee here wants nothing more than to serve you in the best way possible. No request is too much and all the little touches are unbelievable, from the staff at the door to greet you ,to leaving a hand written birthday note and bottle of wine for my wife's birthday, to the poor gentleman that came to our room twice to help us with our fireplace fire, everyone had a smile on and seemed generally happy to be working here. The rooms are a perfect mix of century old luxury and modern day innovation. While the bathrooms are on the small side, i will totally accept that for the GIANT corner fireplace room we had !! Two employees need to be singled out Christine the bartender at City Table (see seperate review) and Nina at the conceirge desk, no request was to great for Nina, she will go way, way out of her way to help you. I can honestly say we will NEVER stay anywhere else while in Boston. thank you to all the staff for making my wife's birthday so special.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to it's reputation and reviews”
Reviews.Author: MarkKirsty
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston for three nights before taking the amtrak to New York. We chose the Lenox based on the reviews here and were not dissapointed. From the moment we arrived the staff were polite, smartly dressed and knowledgeable. From the front of house to the maids, we always got a cheery 'hello'. All the public areas we're spotlessly clean and decorated tastefully keeping the character of the hotel. How many hotels do you walk into and there's an open fire in the lobby? Our room on the 9th floor was huge. We liked that added touch of the night light in the bathroom which meant you weren't tripping over things to pop to the loo in the night or waking up your partner by turning the lights on. Nice touch that i've not seen in any other hotel before. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning and the quality of food and service was second to none. Special requests were never a problem. After dining out in the evening we returned to the hotel bar for a nightcap. Again, excellent surroundings and staff. If we ever venture back to Boston we will be staying at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in every respect”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and professional. Any issues were dealt with immediately and in a friendly manner. Well located, environmentally aware, very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways imaginable!”
Reviews.Author: knicknat
Reviews.Content: As many people said, a delicious whiff of orangey-like scent hits you once you enter. The service is extremely awesome; everyone is so polite you feel at home immediately. It is also conveniently located in between Prudential towers, Copley place and Newbury Street - how much more can you ask for? The room service was delicious too, and very reasonably priced in my opinion. And I really appreciated the fact that they provided filtered water that you could get at any time of the day without having to worry about boiling water. That was so easy and convenient and green too, which is greatly emphasised in the hotel's mission. Thank you for the wonderful stay - I hope that I can come back some day (soon)!

Reviews.Title: “Lenox is in a Class of its Own”
Reviews.Author: kierkegaardly
Reviews.Content: From Logan I took the shuttle to the T, bought a Charlie card that gets you around town on all T lines, then took the Blue Line to Government Center & Green Line trolley to Copley. Getting out of the subway I was right on Copley Square, one of the most beautiful squares in all of Boston, --Trinity Church, Boston Public Library, Old South Church are all right there. If you walk alongside the library for a block or so down Bolyston St. you can walk into the Lenox and immediately relax in front of a fireplace with a warm cup of cocoa drawn from huge silver urns. You're at once comfortable and starting to feel pampered. Your eyes start to feast on the elegance of the place and you're hoping for early check-in because you can't wait to see the room. Yes, the room was ready three hours early. Amazing--I know how that happens once I saw that the maids were working late at night to make sure the rooms are ready and to attend to the special details of turning down the bed and adding a few chocolate truffles for sweet dreams. I loved the non-instrusive service and friendly staff. The room was a standard queen, --seemed smaller than a room I had stayed in at the Lenox a few years ago. Although small and the bathroom without a tub, it was more than perfect for me--nothing like a hot shower with the freebie lotions and potions, and wrapping up in the heavy terrycloth robe from the closet. I thought for sure there would be a coffee maker but there is only free morning coffee in the lobby. The room comes with a list of all the pantry items that guests can choose from in case they forgot something or even if they want a snack. Yes, mostly free with a few things that could also be borrowed or rented. The only negatives were that the room vents somehow carried the voices from guests in the rooms on both sides directly into my room, which wasn't great when both had invited friends over and were playing music. Someone did a flamenco for a minute and the rat-a-tat almost blew out my ear drums so I put in ear plugs I take on trips just-in-case (<travel tip). But the guests left and all returned to peace and quiet by 10:30 PM. However, next morning I also could hear a guest giving her credit card information over the phone...so beware. I ate at the restaurant for dinner one night--surprisingly good and the wine was superb. The next morning breakfast also was good--even the coffee was delicious. The restaurant decor is not like the opulence of the rest of the hotel--instead it is gorgeous in its own right,-- eco-friendly, simple lines and dark tones. The vases were imitations mini trees with peeling bark full of silver branches,--most original and exquisite. The Lenox for all the luxurious atmosphere is eco-friendly --in fact, in one of the desk drawers is a book about how to be a socially responsible corporation. I assume the hotel practices what it preaches--at least I noticed there was a wood repository for recyclables in the room, and the hotel claims to have lead the way in pushing guests to ask for clean sheets and towels only as needed. The hotel is close to cultural and sports events and in the neighborhood of art galleries, fine and simple dining, casual-to-upscale shopping, public transportation (bus and subway) and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water and it comes with attitude.”
Reviews.Author: Itsamystery
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great location. No hot water. Ok it happens. But how you deal with it is everything. We got disinterest and a rude response. No offer to help or provide some recompense. Had to debate with the front desk manger to get any attention. Refused to refund any of the rate or offer anything. I literally had to argue my way into having them pay for lunch. Stay elsewhere unless you are looking for disrespectful and uninterested staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps not the Best Option for the Business Traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Shivan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: I am normally the first one to gloss over the "one star" reviews and simply chalk it up to someone who is simply impossible to satisfy. I am perhaps one of the most laid back and easy going travelers you are going to come across. Give me a nice location, a comfortable room, and a decent hotel restaurant (if its too cold to go exploring) and I am a happy camper. We were flying in for a morning meeting and opted to come in the afternoon prior to rest up and be close and well rested for the meeting the next day. The check in at the Lenox was very quick and very straightforward. They were able to check us in quickly, make some suggestions about what to see in the area as well as were to eat if we were looking for something interesting. The hallways on the floors that have rooms are very interesting and very wide, it was nicely done with nice accent lighting which truly offered that "boutique" feeling, however the rooms themselves are small. It doesn't really bother me, as long as you can fit a King sized bed, a TV, and room for my suitcase I am fine, however I couldn't have stayed there for more then a few days without feeling like I was in a cage. The most disappointing thing was the bathroom, I kept looking around for hooks to confirm my fear that they simply converted a closet into a bathroom. I am not a massive man by any stretch but the space around the toilet did not make for comfortable sitting, and I kid you not I almost stepped into the toilet as I came out of the shower. The bed itself; solid. No complaints, I slept well, the alarm worked. However and perhaps this just me, I was a little thrown off that there was no phone on either bed side table. That is annoying for me but perhaps would be a non factor for many travelers who simply do not use the hotel phone anyway. The following morning however was when it all came apart. We had shipped a package to the hotel, which had arrived the day prior to our check in. We asked the front desk if they had received it, and we were told they did not. They insisted that hotel policy required any packages to be delivered immediately to the guest or handed over at check in to the guest. We were told several times that any packages for guests were left at the front desk and if it was not in their hands they had not received it. Originally we assumed it was a FedEx issue; We went to our meeting and apologized that the material had not arrived with the hope that the package would have arrived by mid morning, we called the hotel twice in the morning to see if it had arrived and they very adamant that it had not. We were finally able to reach our logistics department to get a tracking number, and it had been delivered and signed for by the front desk the day prior. Once we called back and explained it had been delivered they found the package within five minutes, I guess they actually took the time to look this time. Aside from embarrassment this caused at our presentation, the main reason why this was so frustrating was because no one took the time to look for the package. Three different employees insisted that hotel policy was to inform the guest immediately on receipt or during check in. They relied so heavily on this policy that no one bothered to even look for the package, which as explained took all of five minutes for them to hunt down once we explained it had been delivered the day prior to the front desk. This is an aesthetically stunning hotel; the curb appeal and the lobby appeal are wonderful. Its in a great neighborhood in the heart of Boston and very convenient if you are seeing the sites. In short; as a tourist this is not a terrible place to stay. However its very clear that the tourist is their niche, and there is nothing wrong with that. From a business travelers stance, this hotel simply lacks the mindset or the interest. We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel during our next stay and they seemed to be far better suited for the basic needs of a business traveler, so its pretty clear a Boutique hotel can be the best of both worlds; just not in the case of the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay to see all of Boston on foot”
Reviews.Author: Dvbdmd
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of bustling back bay neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants to walk to. The hotel is a great starting point to walk to beacon hill, the freedom walk, the harbor, and the north end. It was freezing cold outside and my wife and I were able to make the walks from the hotel easily and really experience Boston as it should be done, on foot. The staff here is wonderfully polite and we found the concierge services to be excellent as well. The only thing it is missing is coffee in the rooms in the am, but they do serve coffee in the lobby all morning, which was quite good. Also, there is a dunkin donuts across the street, and a star bucks a block away across the street as well, so it was a good excuse for us to get out of the room early and go exploring. Check out the back bay social club for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Coming to Boston? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HappyinNewEngland
Reviews.Content: This is my forth stay at the Lenox Hotel within the last year, and each time I think the staff can't possibly treat me any better than the time before. Each time, I'm totally wrong. They have wowed me with their service, their sincerity, and the family atmosphere that pervades the place. I traveled with a friend to Boston for my birthday and was awed by the warm welcome I received by all of the staff. They feel like friends now. I've never stayed in a place which had such a warm welcoming atmosphere. Peter, the amazing valet, Krista, Christine, Bill--all at the front desk, Jason the over the top wonderful concierge... I could go on and on about each person who works there regardless of the position they hold. They are all competent and super. I truly will never stay anywhere else in Boston regardless of how good the deal. The rooms are amazing, and all of the little extras made me feel like a celebrity, even though my friend and I are just everyday women from rural New England. I've talked up the Lenox to all of my friends and colleagues. A must for any traveler. If you can ever stay in the Judy Garland suite, do it!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: gaelcheek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox for three nights in late February. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were extremely quiet. We love the location of the hotel. It was close to the Museum of Fine Arts, Back Bay and the Prudential Center where we enjoyed eating at Wagamamma a fusion noodle restaurant that we had eaten at in London. The concierge comped us tickets to the MFA. Fantastic. The hotel seems to be a favorite of Europeans. Be sure to ask for Spa privileges at the local club. We took the subway, called the "T" everywhere. The closest stop was only a block a way and a 7 day pass which we got at the airport only cost $15 a piece. The only thing we didn't like at the Hotel was the overpowering citrus fragrance used in the lobbies and the halls. Too much of a good thing. Overall for value and convenience - a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from the not-so-jaded crowd”
Reviews.Author: helensw5
Reviews.Content: I just read the review of "Lincoln Adams" and have to say, I am not the extensive traveler this person seems to be. I am very happy with my stay at the Lenox. It's a small, boutique hotel. I am not expecting huge rooms, but a historic and quaint hotel. Yes the lobby was elaborately decorated. The rooms were beautifully appointed (although I think that guy got my room as I was promised a room on a high floor with a view and I did not.) The staff went above and beyond. They were courteous to a fault. They held our bags all day in a secure way and helped us figure out parking on the street (I guess I saved money on that although I missed out on the snique away rate). We had a late dinner downstairs. The late night menu was limited but still delicious. The full dinner menu looked delicious. The breakfast was fine; all the usual suspects. The decor was modern and luxurious. It's a small boutique hotel and it was grand as it needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Erin2131
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a wonderful weekend stay at the Lenox Hotel. I have been to Boston numerous times and this hotel is perfectly situated to many attractions in Boston. Newbury Street and the Prudential Center are all within walking distance. Our room was extremely clean with a comfortable king size bed. My boyfriend loved our complimentary bottles of water, free wi-fi and a copy of The Boston Globe. The hotel's restaurant also offers a wonderful breakfast in the morning. The only regret about our stay is that I wished our room was further away from the elevators. It does get quite noisy with them running all through the night. We will definitely be back to this hotel again, only next time far far away from the elevator banks.

Reviews.Title: “Who's writing these reviews??”
Reviews.Author: LincolnAdams
Reviews.Content: It's funny how I've been rating hotels lately that have been rating average as superior, while hotels with superior ratings have been rated as average. Such is now the case with the Lenox Hotel. This was the first hotel I booked via TripAdvisor's SniqueAway membership, getting an absolute steal for only $99 a night right in the heart of Boston. I've been to Beantown before and stayed at the Harborside Inn in the financial district, and since the Lenox was rated #1 I was expecting an even better experience. Well, not quite. The lobby was lavishly decorated but nothing I haven't seen before. I've gotten quite a few hotel stays under my belt now, and I've no longer become impressed by lobby decor as I used to be. The elevators here are absurd. Two/three elevators that move at the speed of a government employee who is just about to retire. I was on the 5th floor and was so aggravated by the wait that I just zipped down the stairs while others continued to wait it out. To my surprise, it was only three flights before I hit the lobby, and the people on the 5th floor were STILL waiting. Only a few days earlier I was staying at a hotel in Portland, Maine, and despite being on the 12th floor, those elevators were rocket fast in comparison. No excuse, Lenox. When I arrived at my room, I was surprised by just how small it was, and noticed there was a board left on the bathroom floor that was supposed to cover up the plumbing underneath the sink. How did the cleaning service miss this? The wifi also was pretty underwhelming. I used Speedtest and clocked it at only 250Kbps. Wow. Plus, the view from my window was also... indescribable. I can only surmise that what was outside was THE most enormous air duct I have EVER seen. Ugly and vile in appearance, you could almost hear the slow and subtle WHOOOOOOOOOSH as the fan rotated maybe once every 3 minutes, it was that huge. The bellhop/valet parking attendants were as friendly as you could hope for, while the front desk was also equally pleasant and accommodating. I asked for a different room to get better wifi and was given another room down the hall, this time with a better view of nearby Bolyston Street, and slightly better wifi (750kbps). Still worse than my cell's data speed, but this was the same speed I clocked down in the lobby so I wasn't expecting better. Hulu worked fine at these speeds, so I left it alone. As for the amenities, the huge LCD TV was a crowd pleaser, and this was the first hotel I found that boasted a Bose sound dock for my iPhone. Nice. The bathroom stall was old and not much of an improvement over a shower stall inside a men's locker room. Room service was also disappointing. $14 for a small bowl of macaroni and cheese? They will want to pick up the tray about an hour later, so if you don't want to be bothered again, just leave it on the floor outside the door. Or just forgo room service altogether unless you're desperate. There is a supermarket next door and a ton of places to eat along Bolyston Street, so you'll be fine. Overall these are very old rooms that I suspect are only being treated with minimal maintenance, with the finances being invested more towards the frills of the hotels, including the ground floor bar and restaurant. It does have historical appeal, but I've been in hotels before with a lengthy history to them and in my opinion the Lenox can do a far better job of maintaining the rooms while still preserving its heritage. Comparing my experience with the Harborside Inn, I eminently prefer that hotel (which did not even have room service) to this one. Mainly because the rooms were spacious, modern and spectacularly kept. I only stayed at the Lenox because they were $40 cheaper a night, and really, any quality hotel that's available for less than $100 is going to be a steal in Boston, even if it's not my first choice. As for parking, nearby Copley Place garage offers paring for $35 a night, but with no in/out privileges. You are better off paying a few dollars more for the valet, at least in this case. Bottomline, only stay here if you get an excellent deal like I did. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Back Bay Crown”
Reviews.Author: Brandy146
Reviews.Content: We arrvied on a cold Friday night to be greeted by a roaring warm fire in the reception area. The staff were really welcoming. We got to our room, which was lovely. A junior suite which was very large with two double beds which had luxurious throws over them. The decor was really good. There was a sittting area with a large settee, occasional chair and a lovely table. There was also a writing desk. The bathroom was small but very clean with all the amenities you need for a pleasant stay. We heard no noise from either the astreet or from other guests. Our beds were extremely comfortable. We had drinks in the bar, which were yummy. We also ate breakfast in The City Table restaurant on Sunday, which was lovely. To top our short holiday off we had a ride in the Hotel Limo to catch our plane back to London, which made our short holiday perfect. This hotel is lovely and such good value for money. What a find!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Boston Adventure with my young son”
Reviews.Author: Babette_35
Reviews.Content: My school-aged son and I escaped to Boston for a special winter adventure to celebrate my birthday. We requested a room with a working fireplace and were upgraded to a gorgeous suite when we also needed to escape down and other allergens (asthma). Location was amazing-- views of Back Bay and Boylston St/Copley Square-- beautiful room. Loved the cozy fire at night. Special touches at every turn-- service was wonderful, friendly. Really great was their response to our allergies-- I informed them ahead that my son has nut allergies, so there were snacks and cookies in our room for him (watch out: cookies at front desk have peanutbutter, which I was told ahead of time, and the pub fries in peanut oil), and an employee gracefully presented him with a stuffed animal when he found out he couldn't eat the lobby cookie (my son was thrilled). I had been left a bottle of red wine, and it was replaced when they found out I cannot drink red wine. Was offered coffee or tea when I came back from shopping (after having checked out) to pick up our bag. Our only complaint was that room service food arrived cooler than we would have liked. Overall, our experience was outstanding. We left feeling refreshed and rather spoiled. Great location from which to explore Boston--it is easy to get anywhere; lovely hotel. A great birthday treat for my son and for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dodgy_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox in early December 2010 for 3 days and was a fantastic surprise. I booked it after reading the reviews on this site so was a delight when it met and exceeded our expectations. The rooms were fabulous, service was friendly and attentive and the location was so central to everything. Shopping is at your doorstep and the city is a leisurely 10min walk. We asked for a room with a view and amazingly they actually fulfilled our request which is so rare these days. Definitely consider the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Stay at The Lenox”
Reviews.Author: WWK
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another great stay at The Lenox. I got upgraded to The Back Bay Suite on the second floor, which is beautifully decorated and so comfortable that I really didn't want to leave. Management at this hotel should be applauded for taking such great care of their guests. From the friendly doorman to the outstanding staff at the front desk, everyone seems to go out of their way to make guests feel like they're part of the family in a gorgeous private home. And then there's the location.... steps away from all the shopping on Newbury Street, and only about two blocks from more shopping and restaurants at the Prudential Center. The T is across the street for quick access to the rest of Boston and Harvard Square/Somerville. I have stayed at other hotels in Boston- The Taj, The Marriott, The Westin, The Sheraton- but none of them come close to the level of luxury and comfort I've found over and over at The Lenox. I'll be back, and I hope it's soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Touchbase
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for a week-end with 13 year old daughter with the goal to shop. The Lenox is in a perfect location for this, just minutes walking distance to Newbury Street, Copley Place and the Pru. For those sight-seeing, this is also an ideal location, close to T stops and within walking distance of key places to visit. The staff and service we experienced at the hotel were one of the best of anywhere I have ever stayed. We had a beautiful junior suite on the 3rd floor, an absolutely enormous corner room. Loved the turn down service and the free waters, and the option for filtered water as well in the hall. We ate a breakfast and dinner at City Table, also extremely good. Highly recommend staying here when coming to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and personalized service”
Reviews.Author: Mainer89
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Hotwire and lucked out to get the Lenox. From the moment I stepped in the front door, I was amazed by the quality of service at the hotel. From the front desk to the bellman to the concierge the service was wonderful. The room was comfortable and gorgeous. There was chocolate cake waiting for me in my mini-fridge after turn down service. I stayed on the allergen-free floor (11th floor), and it lived up to its expectations. I have fairly severe allergies to dust and mold, they did not act up at all. The Lenox is definitely the best place I have stayed in Boston and I recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel for the proper Boston feel”
Reviews.Author: KDS61
Reviews.Content: The charm of the hotel starts upon entry and accompanies the guest up to the room and through stay. The public areas and rooms are well appointed and the staff is keen to please. A great location to enjoy the sites and shops of Boston. Overall a pleasant stay in a quite comfortable non-generic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: travelizzie
Reviews.Content: This is the only place to stay in Boston, all the glowing reviews are true! They really know the meaning of hospitality. I have never been attended to with such attention in a US hotel. The room was on the small side, but at $159 (trip advisor discount) it was a great value. I really appreciated the "control it yourself" thermostat, great water pressure, quiet building, great breakfast, ability to walk to everywhere I needed to go, including Back Bay Station. The TV remote needed to be rehabilitated, but otherwise, I am looking for reasons to go back to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel, perfect. It feels like a B and B. Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: stephaniegould77
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you are well taken care of. The rooms are lovely, perfectly appointed, comfortable bed and clean bath and room. Room service delivers excellent affordable food. Breakfast delicious in one of two restaurants on site. Convenient location! Nice work out room.

Reviews.Title: “The best city break we ever had--beats new york--hands down”
Reviews.Author: SEANPMC
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treatred with kindness and glowing frendship..check in was painless and quick...corner room..clean,warm,and so so comfy. Breakfast service was excellent--bar service was super...specail thanks to the staff and DEBORAH FOLEY...

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blueberryhollow
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend with my wife at the Lenox in Boston. The best older hotel I have ever stayed in. The charm and decor was awesome from the grand foyer all the way to our room, nice details abound everywhere. Besides the first class service, the next best thing was the real wood fire place in our room, that the staff would set up and light with a call down stairs. The location is great, with plenty to do within easy walking distance, ie shops, pubs and great resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place in the heart of Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: CarrieBradshawShaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I *LOVED* our stay at the Lenox... It was our first visit to the Lenox and we plan to return -- the location is perfect, the service is second-to-none and the amenities are great. Rooms, washrooms and common areas are very clean and beds are turned-down at night. A business centre offers you access to the Internet and a printer. A small exercise room features free weights and exercise machines. Staff is very friendly. *LOVED* our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox Hotel - Boston”
Reviews.Author: cin966
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed in. The beds are fabulous. Atmosphere is fitting to the Boston architecture. The staff are there to fullfill your every request (with a smile and friendly greeting), first class customer service! Location is perfect, lots of shopping, restaurants and in the heart of tourist area. Rooms are comfortable, slightly smaller than the new modern hotels but full of character and every modern amenity you will need. Make sure you check out "Stephanie's" restaurant, about a 5 minute walk! You will not be disappointed!
