Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: Toppmans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Boston only three times, and each time we've stayed at the Lenox. The Copley Square location makes everything from Fenway Park to the Boston Common easily walkable, and the T-stop a block away connects you to the rest of the city. The rooms are comfortable and more quiet than in many big-city hotels, and the $155 winter rate (through a special offer, in our case) was terrific for such a facility. Two things set this place a cut above on this trip. First, we were served two large pots of complimentary hot chocolate in our room, which thawed our frozen bones nicely on the night we arrived. Second, we had a bulky, heavy package we didn't want to check or carry around on the day of our departure; the staff agreed to let us stay in our room at no extra charge until 3 p.m. and go straight to the airport, which made life much easier for us. I would try to stay here any time I went to Boston, even if I had to spend a little extra to do so.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: KAS57
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Lenox twice. The first time was for business. This trip was to take my daughter to college. The Lenox is not near her school, but I had to go back. The rooms are great, but what drew me back was the staff and service. We had a ton of shopping to do and Nina gave us a list of what stores to go to for what we needed. Her recommendations for dinner were spot on. The hot chocolate in the lobby was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff - Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: raschulte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two great nights at the Lenox where we celebrated our 25th Anniversary. The staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. Our room was upgraded at no charge. The concierge(s) we spoke with all responded with "not a problem" and changed a few reservation times we had asked them to initially make for us. The location is terrific - easy walking to the shops and restaurants on Newbury and Boylston Streets, the Pru Center and not too far from the MFA where we checked out the new Avenue of the Americas.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: LHC20
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Junior Suite at the Lenox Hotel, Boxton in December, 2010. Our room was very comfortable and spacious with 2 double beds and a sitting area. We found the staff to be very informative and friendly. Hotel was located in Back Bay area of Boston and near Prudential Centre, Copley Square. Complimentary coffee/tea was served in the lobby in the mornings between 5.00 - 10.00 am. The hotel was also in close proximity to train stations. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Great service, Kind staff - Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kd43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to the Boston Library. The location is fabulous. The lobby smells great, and the wallpaper and decor is beautiful. The front desk staff is very kind. About an hour after arrival in our room, they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and a thoughtful note - totally unexpected! The room was great, a good size for the middle of a city, with a view of the Prudential Building and Citgo sign. The mattress was on the hard side, while I like soft mattresses, but that's not a big deal. The bathroom was beautiful and the toiletries smelled great. We ate at one of the restaurants downstairs, and the food was great. I can't believe the low price I paid to stay in a hotel like this. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, top service, top people!”
Reviews.Author: Christinaki
Reviews.Content: My two grandsons, a friend and I shared two suites at the LENOX at the end of August, on the occasion of one of my grandsons' beginning his studies at Boston University. Before we flew to Boston, I had done a lot of "investigating" for the right Boston hotel, which would be conveniently located to the university, but which would also offer us the maximum of comfort and service for our ten-day stay in Boston. I had read all the raving reviews of the tripadvisor members about the LENOX, still our experience with the hotel was above anything described! Before going there, I contacted the managers of the hotel several times, trying to make sure, that we would have all we needed, since we would not be there for a short stay. They answered all my e-mails immediately, giving me everything I demanded. We were treated like royalty during our stay. It is a lovely hotel, with impeccable service, they fulfil all your requests and demands right away, they make you feel you are at home and everybody at the hotel gives you the BEST service. I would need a lot of space to mention all the names of the people, working there, because they were all wonderful. My younger grandson made a great friend with Krista at the front desk, who treated him like her own brother. I am an avid traveller and I must say, that I have never felt so "at home" in a hotel before. I plan to go back several times, while my grandson is a student at B.A.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: Seb28London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for his 30th birthday in February 2010. On arrival, we were upgraded to a suite for free and they'd put a bottle of champagne in our room at a family member's request. It's a great hotel, right in the middle of everything. And the staff were amazingly helpful and friendly - they couldn't do enough for us. The food was also lovely - massive portions. I would and have recommended it to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location & great staff”
Reviews.Author: MunsterLiam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days over Christmas and were very happy with almost everything. Upgraded to a pure room on the top floor, very large room but the toilet was small by comparison with the room. All staff very very friendly and helpful and the location is second to none with plenty of shopping and dining options in the immediate vicinity. Small complimentary gym and business centre(2 computers and printer) with free internet access and printing which you do not get in the bigger chains. We ate in the City Table a couple of times for dinner and reasonably priced and good quality food and service. City Bar was a bit dark inside for my liking. Only real negative we encountered was some late night partying in a neighbouring room on one of the nights and would have expected better sound insulation in such a hotel but not enough of a negative not to give Lenox top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: KingChili
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional. The staff were helpful and extremely friendly. The location was superb. The facilities were great. Without a doubt it was the best experience I have had in any hotel anywhere. I will never again waste time looking for a hotel when i stay in Boston again. It will be the Lenox evert time for now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer081
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a single night right before Xmas in a corner fireplace room. We arrived late in the morning, but were still able to check in early, and the staff was very helpful. The room was clean and spacious. There also was a small refrigerator (not a minibar) for our use which was handy. As part of the turn-down service, we received Lindt chocolates from the shop downstairs which was a nice touch. There was little to no wait when we asked the bell-staff to light a fire for us. The lobby bar (City Bar) is small. We wanted to stop in for a drink before going out to dinner, but there was no room at the bar or at any of the side tables. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was just okay, and, like most hotel restaurants, over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: svejdani
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Lenox to celebrate my 2-1/2 year anniversary with my girflriend and also set up a surprise engagement. The Lenox staff was more than accommodating with their 5 star service from the bell-hops to the management staff. I worked with the concierege ahead of time to go into the room to set everything up while we were out at dinner. The staff was more than accommodating and even gave me a discount on the room (corner executive room w/ fireplace overlooking the city). They also surprised both of us with chocolate cake and a bottle of Merlot to celebrate our 2-1/2 year anniversary. I'm very pleased with the service I received and would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation. Oh and I almost forgot...she said yes!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old style hotel. But getting a little tired...”
Reviews.Author: London1975_10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Lenox for a week on a trip to the city. The reviews on here are warranted, it is a great hotel and a welcome break from the big chains that lack individuality. Room: we stayed in a junior suite. Good size, lovely comfortable bed to die for! But the room itself was a little dated and really felt as though it needed a facelift. No mini bar, just a fridge in the walk in closet. Bathroom again was dated, as was the plumbing...whenever you used the shower or flushed the toilet, there was an almighty bang of pipework...terrified me the first time! Food: we ate I'm the restaurant on the first night. It was ok, not wonderful. Service was very good however. Breakfast was excellent, particularly the fruit plate and pancakes... Front desk: Wonderful staff who make you feel incredibly welcome. Reception felt like a country house with a lovely fire. Concierge very helpful. Bars: There are two bars in the hotel. We tried to get into the city bar a couple of times but it was busy and given it's limited size and seating,we gave up and went elsewhere. There is also an Irish pub which was great, good pint of guiness! Overall: we really enjoyed our stay. Despite my comments about the tired feeling of the rooms, there is something about this place that would make me stay again. Like I say, if you are tired of the big chains, give this place a shot. I don't think it will disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox in very early December for 5 days and it was a lovely experience. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. Had dinner at City Table on 2 of the evenings and the food was excellent. The best thing about the Lenox is it's fantastic location. The only negative I found was that there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Boston!”
Reviews.Author: whodoumeflip
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in Boston between Xmas & New Year at the Lenox! The staff are the happiest, friendliest and most helpful we have encountered. Room was allocated on arrival at 2pm and was a junior suite with dual aspect with good views! The only snag with the whole experience was the soundproofing, we were awoken both nights several times by 'loud' voices. Breakfast was great, drinks & a snack in the bar was great too! The whole experience was really great...we would recommend it to anyone & would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Longmeadow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to celebrate my Mom's 80th birthday. The Lenox was superb! My daughter was welcomed with Lenny the Lenox Lion stuffed animal. The staff was outstanding. Dinner and breakfast at City Table was fantastic - loved the granola. The view from our room was incredible. The bathroom, although smallish, was more than adequate (and loved the Aveda products!) You can't beat the location. There is a reason it is #1 and well-deserved!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Xmas Break”
Reviews.Author: Miami6304
Reviews.Content: Having been to Boston for the last 3 Christmas', we thought the Lenox would make a good change as we have visited the hotel for lunch and dinner before but never stayed. Was it good, no it was brilliant!! and would stay again. After a very long journey from UK, we were diverted via Chicago!, we were shattered when we finally arrived. The staff were fabulous from the moment we arrived to the time we departed. They could not do enough for us and made the stay even more pleasureable. The rooms were very clean, big and the beds were wonderful. In fact I can't recommend it enough. The Hotel's location is great as it is a very short walk to the large Prudentuial shopping centre, Newbury Street with its fantastic boutique shops and Copley square Tube station. So getting around Boston's key attractions and taking the shopping back to the hotel was easy. It is hard to fault, the only very minor draw back is the lack of coffee making facilities in the room, however this is more than made up for by the complimentary coffee (Hot Chocalate late afternoon) in the lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1? I seriously doubt it!”
Reviews.Author: Zed2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Lenox for three nights and what we saw completely contradicts many of the reviews on this site. Let me put it this way, the bathroom was so small that you had to maneuver onto the toilet to avoid injury and hitting the wall. The reviews that say you can hear EVERYTHING from your neighbors are spot on. Happy to be back home where sleep is possible.

Reviews.Title: “As great as advertised even for family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: lehouxp
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat all the accolades that this hotel gets on this website i'll just say that they are well deserved. But for those of you who want to have example of the things that make The Lenox special besides all that's been mention in previous post here's some inside on our experience. First as we arrived and the concierge (that was helpfull throughout our stay) saw our kids he greet them with teddy bear. When we left after dropping our stuff in our room for a walk and dinner we came back and found those two bears all tuck in in our children's bed with a box of lindt chocolate. Those attentions are not necessary but they make all the differenceand they are two out of bunch of things that make this hotel special (our kids are convinced that those bears are magical and that they would clean their room and give us chocolate back home too...) We're leaving tomorrow to enjoy christmas day with our family in Quebec but we'll comeback for sure to The Lenox on our next visit to Boston cause you can't go wrong with a stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in center of shopping”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarriors
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small very perfectly located hotel. The staff at all levels are very impressive; very service oriented. Lobby is small but elegant; staff seem to go out of their way to make your stay trouble free. Check-in and check-out is very fast. My room was a very nice size, the bathroom was a bit on the small side, but met my needs. The hotel is more on the classic old style but with a young fresh slant. There is no parking but there is valet service and taxis are easy to get. The hotel is right in the center of any type shopping you could want; either the small boutiques on Newbury Street to the larger upscale stores in the Prudential Center. Plenty of very good places to eat at all price points are within walking distance. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HolidayQueen77
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and a few comments had worried me(customer service and rooms). On our arrival to the hotel my daughter was given a soft teddy bear by reception, and we were told our rooms had been upgraded! A great start and we hadnt even checked in! Our room was ok, and had everything we needed=Another soft toy and a bath and duck set had been left in my daughter cot-another nice touch. The location of the hotel was great, we managed to get around really easily and the guys on the door were always very helpful and friendly. We had breakfast once, and it was nice, but a waitress was quite rude to my husband, which resulted in her not getting a tip! Overall our stay here was really good. All the staff(apart from one waitress) were all very helpful and had lots of knowledge about the area.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: strawberryeater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a tour of the US, the hotel is in a great location, nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. The only tiny issue was that the size of the shower room but thatwas a minor issue. Friendly, helpfull staff, nice food, a good buzz in the bars . Would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: drumasca
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Lenox Hotel because it is the number one on trip advisor reviews. And the hotel rate was ok. LOVED it! The hotel is fantastic! Staff is extremely polite! The hotel lobby smells like orange! The location is excelent, in back bay, near everything. Near a subway and a train station (Back Bay Train Station). Inside the hotel you can find a bar, nice place to drink something at the end of the day. The internet is free! Now I can say: STAY THERE! You won't regret!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had...”
Reviews.Author: X0GORGEOUS0X
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews at the Lenox and was looking forward to getting there.. It was everything I had imagined the service was amazing and the rooms were great... I had the best sleep I have had in yearssssss ............... I recommend this hotel to anyone the only con is the room service . I didn't entirely like the food .. I just ate the Uno chicago grill across the street .....

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could take the Lenox with me on all my vacations”
Reviews.Author: erinlis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for three very cold days and nights just last week. Being west coasters we're not so used to the weather and having a warm, comfy hotel room to return to after each outing was a true blessing. Even as you step up the front door they start heating you with heat lamps. :) The lobby is a warm and happy place. The first person to greet us was smiling and offered to help with our bags, and that wasn't even the front desk. I had arranged a week prior with the concierge to have a six pack of beer chilling in our room for my husband - sort of a welcome to vacation, lets not be grumpy after a day of travel treat - upon learning that this trip was for our 10th anniversary they gifted the six pack to us. Such a nice little thing to do. But it gets better! We went out for dinner after checking in and when we got back the front desk had sent up a bottle of bubbles and dessert for our anniversary as well. Such a treat, and so thoughtful! People and places just don't do things like that anymore. The building itself is lovely. We love staying in older places full of character and The Lenox did not disappoint. If you're looking for a great room in a nice area try The Lenox. Their staff is amazing, it's a close walk to multiple T Line stops, there are lots of stores and restaurants around. It's pretty great. I'd love to be there in the summer so we could truly enjoy all that Boston has to offer. If we make it back we'll be staying with The Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghbased
Reviews.Content: This is a much better than average hotel, reasonably priced and ideally situated. The staff is exceptional, every one.

Reviews.Title: “Over achieved in service and value”
Reviews.Author: SUFAN4LIFE
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Lenox after reading several previous reviews. First off, the rates were extremely reasonable considering the location and comparison of rates at nearby hotels. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very friendly bellman who brought our bags into the hotel and took care of our car with valet as we checked in. Like everywhere else in Boston, parking is not free at this hotel. If you have never been to Boston and are driving or renting a car, be prepared to pay for parking anywhere you go and expected to pay top dollar. The Lenox offers valet parking with in and out privileges for $43 overnight. Yes, its expensive, but if you park your car in a public parking garage, the closest one to the hotel is in Copley Place and it will cost you $39 overnight without in and out. For the most part, I wouldn't recommend driving anywhere once you get to your hotel because you are going to pay at least $30 to park your car anywhere else in the city, especially later in the week and on the weekends. Unless you get lucky and find a spot at a meter on the street, but you pretty much have a better chance at winning the lottery. My advice is to either take the subway (T), or a taxi. There is a T stop right around the corner at Copley Square. I was greeted with a smile at the reservation desk and to our surprise, were given a complimentary upgrade to a Jr.Suite. The bellman then brought our bags up to our room, placed them in the huge walk in closet and informed us about the FREE bottled water in the fridge. That's right, FREE bottled water, and as much as you want too. The room also includes FREE wireless access. The room was great. A nice King size poster bed with very soft sheets and a down comforter. We also had a nice flat screen HDLCD TV, a large coffee table, small sofa, desk, with a very comfortable Herman Miller chair.These are like $500 office chairs and are awesome if you are there to do work which I did for several hours.The bathroom was nothing special, but it served it purpose. The bottom line, the room was clean and smelled nice. The hotel also offers a restaurant, lounge bar, and Irish Pub. I actually used all three during my stay. City Bar: Beautiful, Hip, intimate, great people watching, amazing cocktails, and you can also order food offered in the restaurants. City Bar can get quite busy on the weekends. I also had drinks and apps at City Table, which offers the same yummy cocktails as City Bar. The bar is pretty nice, and the food was not bad. I also visited the Irish Pub located in the front of the hotel to watch the MNF game which the Patriots were playing. The bar had a good crowd and the Guinness was properly poured. The hotel also has a nice fitness room which I used twice during my stay. For a hotel gym, it was one of the nicest ones I have used. Tons of FREE bottled water, headphones for the TV connected to the treadmills, bikes, and ellipticals. The other thing I liked where the nice hoist dumbbells, and bench. CLEAN. The best thing about this hotel, is by far, the service. Our car was retrieved in a very timely manner, and the bellman always remembered us and asked us how we were enjoying our stay. Every time we walked through the lobby, every single employee would say hello and welcomed us back to the hotel. Yes, they were aware when we would leave and then come back. The other great thing is the location. If you like to shop, well, you are one block away from Newbury St, one block from the Prudential Center Shops which are connected to Copley Place. You are a brisk 10 min walk from Boston Commons. Its easy to find taxis, the T stop is a block away. There are tons of AMAZING restaurants nearby. You are a five minute drive to the South End which has tons of great restaurants! If you want to go to the North End, take the T. DO NOT drive there. In conclusion, this was a great choice and I will without question stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Took a second stay, but this time one word for it "Perfection"”
Reviews.Author: Amazing1672
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the Lenox last year during the Christmas break but there were small nagging issues that prevented me from giving this hotel anything but 3 stars. We decided to give this hotel yet another try during the Thanksgiving weekend and this time around, our stay could not have been better. Right from the old world charm of this hotel, the service, the location, their rooms (we stayed in one of their PURE guest rooms), the dining, the heavenly bed (I slept more peacefully there then I had in a number of months) - everything was amazing. Even when we stayed there the last time, the service was exemplary and we were happy to see the same standards a year later. All the nagging issues we had last time - there was nothing to spoil our experience this time around. The location (right next to Prudential and Copley and a block from Newbury) was perfect for shopping and taking the T. The close proximity to some of the best Boston restaurants (L'espalier and Mistral) does not hurt either. The breakfast in the dining room was also a perfect start to the day and the drinks at the City Bar in the evening were great (one of the best Mai Tais I have ever had). All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our weekend at the Lenox. Big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox was a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Songbird811
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. Beautiful hotel, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is off the scale: Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Ganesh9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for just three nights the week before Thanksgiving, November 2010. Everything you've read about the Lenox is true. First of all, from the moment you enter the lobby you almost feel that you are not in a hotel but rather are living in an elegant apartment building. Everybody greets you. The rooms are very comfortable and make you feel right at home. The place just oozes history: from the wide hallways to the staircases, there is wood and marble everywhere. I did not try any of the restaurants but there are a lot of options available. The location can't be beat: about 1 block to the Copley T station and a short walk to Prudential Center. There is a Shaw's market a block away where you can get any food item you need. My *only* gripe with the room is that the bathtub did not drain water fast enough (may have been partially clogged) and that the toilet was the type that we used to have in school (you operate the flush by kicking the lever). The bathroom amenities were great, as was the free wifi and flat panel TV. There was also a Bose radio which I did not use. Nightly turn-down service with Lindor chocolate and complimentary water in the mini fridge was the final touch. The price I paid was very reasonable, and the overall experience was excellent. I will put the Lenox at the top of my list the next time I come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gillk123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first Thanksgiving trip to America and we just want to say how wonderful the hotel and staff were. We stayed for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The staff and concierge were so helpful they book us a table for thanksgiving dinner and organised our city tour. The food in the restaurant, City Table was really delicious. The location is perfect, you couldnâ€™t ask for a more central location especially if you are looking to do some shopping during your time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Perfection”
Reviews.Author: norfolk23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while visiting family and friends in Boston. Not alot to add to the other glowing reviews. It really is everything all the other reviewers rave about. Location, Staff, Rooms were all perfect. Caters to individuals not coach parties - so relieved to see no breakfast buffet in the restaurant which was very reasonable priced. Minor Minor criticism would be the annoying in-hotel TV system which pushed pay on demand films and TV shows. Given the room cost it's pretty much the preserve of middle-aged couples, out of town shoppers and families - mostly upscale Americans but the Irish Pub on street level was very popular with a younger crowd and as the hotel is in the middle of all the action anyways it hardly matters. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, roomy”
Reviews.Author: jameseagle1
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a business trip and found the location and staff superb. We were near the subway, library and shopping. When we had a late flight after the usual checkout time, the hotel allowed us to stay in the room. The restaurant was average.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with attentive, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: RiversideLady
Reviews.Content: One of those grand hotels, updated, that still knows how to make you feel like a welcome guest. While I was sitting in front of the fire in the lobby, an employee came over and offered me a complimentary bottle of water! Room was ample and very comfortable; beautiful textiles throughout. Unlike many of the new hotels, it feels solid and true; maintains tradition while keeping in step with today. Try the waffles for breakfast in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Lenox...”
Reviews.Author: mjnas
Reviews.Content: LOVE the Lenox. We stayed here for one night, to celebrate our 20th Anniversary. I reserved my room online and just happened to mention it in the comments section. To our surprise and delight, they upgraded us to a fireplaced room, and had a card and complimentary wine waiting for us. Even the valet upon our departure said Happy Anniversary to us. The concierge was very helpful in our selection of a special restaurant. The hotel is everything the previous reviewers said and more....loved the robes, chocolates on the pillow, free Globe and coffee in the a.m, complimentary water and wifi. Location was great in the middle of everything. Husband enjoyed the small but very safisfactory fitness room too. The value was incredible. Will definitely be my # 1 choice for Boston hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a week in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Manatee609
Reviews.Content: Our party was made up of four sixty-something women who have been friends for years. From the moment we arrived until we departed six days later, we enjoyed everything about the Lenox. Chief among its charms, for us, was its location and the excellence of the hotel kitchen. Because we did lots of sightseeing during the day, we loved coming back and relaxing both at the City Bar and the City Table and watching a movie or two in our rooms. We booked two junior suites and they were lovely and very roomy. The front desk looked after our every need and, like many others, we found the doorman, Peter, very charming. Sasha, in the City Bar, was typical of all the staff; friendly and natural without being a bit phony in her desire to please. We agreed with a couple of criticisms that we read - the bathrooms are rather small and could use a shelf for personal items, and the parking is very pricey. However, neither of these things dampened our enthusiasm and we would all return in a minute. What a plush experience without being a bit pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NickAgo
Reviews.Content: The staff really went out of their way for you. Very helpful and friendly. The room was a bit small, but very nicely done with all the amenities. The style is definitely an updated "old fashioned" but comfortable. The gym is great and there is free WiFi! Central location for just about everything you want to do in Boston with a T stop right nearby and lots of shopping around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: tripsurfer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visted Boston to look at colleges. We stayed at the Lenox for two nights. We arrived at 10AM (check-in is at 3PM) after a very early flight. We were both tired but did not expect to be able to check-in. However, upon pulling up to the front of the hotel, we were immediately taken care of. Pete, the doorman, met me at the car, asked my last name and told me not to worry about a thing....he told me that they would have a room ready for us and he escorted us to the front desk while he took care of the car and the bags. The professionals at the door as well as the front desk were ALWAYS very welcoming and looking to address any needs that we might have. It's an older hotel with small rooms but very well appointed. The best part though was the SERVICE...would definitley stay at the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: bcavers
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 kids 8&11 years old) travelled to Boston for a 3 day mini break - the Lenox was a first class esperience from the moment we checked in. The staff were friendly, they gave our children stuffed animals & sent up wine & cake to our room when they learned it was my husband's birthday. The room was spacious and the hotel was very quiet. The hotel is a block from Newbury Street (great shopping) and less than a block from the Copley T station - it took us less than 10 minutes to get to the Boston Gardens for a Bruins game.

Reviews.Title: “Top rating deserved!”
Reviews.Author: Hammer328
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel takes you back in time with its spectacular marbled lobby and old fashioned charm. The hotel is a refreshing change from the relative uniformity of the branded hotel chains. The service is also refreshingly old fashioned - at your service! The location could not be better. The finest shops and restaurants are all within easy walking distance. Although there was no coffee maker in the room, the lobby was equipped with complimentary coffee and tea in the morning. In any event, there is a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts directly across the street. The room had a flat screen TV and safe for valuables. The bathroom was completely updated. The Lenox deserves kudos for its commitment to the environment! A full service hotel WITH full service and very competitively priced. Oh yes, free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- can do a little better!”
Reviews.Author: jogijogi99
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel a perfect 5 except for the bed that I felt was not as good as everything else in the hotel. I stayed on the 11th floor which is kept allergen free and indeed the room was refreshingly clean and the sleep (except for a little hard bed) was very nice. The hotel is proud of its green credentials and justifiably so. Everyone in the staff was exceedingly courteous and made you feel special. They have a great list of things that they can provide should you be missing them or if you just felt like having a snack at 3 AM. The Bose speaker for IPod was a very useful thing to have. Did not use their restaurant but I know where I will stay when I am back to Boston. The location is excellent and great dining around. The hotel is very close to Coply station from where you can easily get to the airport or elsewhere. Do stay at this hotel and feel special!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtran_99
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best customer services. Atmosphere was relaxing and classy. We have stayed at many hotels in the city, this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest, most hospitabile hotel in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: gshaheen2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent our weekend in Boston, visiting our daughter. We stayed at the Lenox in Back Bay, a hotel I haven't stayed at in more than 30 years. It was outstanding. Definetley the largest most spacious room we've stayed at in Boston. The staff was incredibly friendly and warm. After finding out that I had not stayed at the hotel in some 30 years, they left us a gift card for City Table, the hotels restaurant. We had brunch there this morning; it was outstanding! I would highly recommend the Lenox to anyone planning a relaxing weekend in Boston's Back Bay. I will be back well before another 30 years go by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sim0n4
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel, the staff were very helpful, they could not do enough to make our stay "something to remember".

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Expat_wife
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a lovely, old-fashioned kind of hotel where the staff greets you every time you step into the lobby. We really enjoyed our short stay, due mainly to the lovely service and kindness of the staff. The lobby area is beautiful and cozy with a big fireplace. When we were taken up to our rooms, the bellman noticed that our girls were given a very small room and quickly called to upgrade them to a bigger room with 2 beds, across the hall from our room. His attentiveness was really appreciated! Both rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. My only complaint would be that the bathroooms were a little small and a little worn. I enjoyed the Aveda products. The best part of the Lenox is it's fabulous location next to the Prudential Center, in the heart of the Back Bay area. We were within walking distance of the Boston Common, the shopping on Newbury Street and loads of great restaurants. We didn't use the T but it is very convenient to the hotel. Breakfast at the hotel is delicious (a la carte) and very efficient. The plates appeared almost as soon as we ordered! This is the great hotel for a city getaway -- a perfect place to enjoy Boston. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn E
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in October lovely hotel good location great for getting around as it is right in the shopping area fo Back Bay. Room was lovely and big we had corner room with 2 windows so views were good. The reception staff and concierge were very helpful, the restruant staff at breakfast time were not! services was not good even when it was not busy. I would stay here again if ever in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and service. I'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAKABecky
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is ideally situated in the Back Bay and on the T line. We had two rooms. Both were clean, comfortable, and quiet. I liked the furnishings, including the linens, robe and Aveda toiletries. The rooms were equipped with safes and even umbrellas to use. There's a crackling fire in the lobby. The hotel offered free coffee and tea in the morning and apple cider in the afternoon. Internet was free. Parking was very expensive. Wish I could have stayed longer, and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations to this fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: balloballo
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! We were so happy with all aspects of our stay here. A great location , friendly, helpful and professional staff and a lovely room. We were particularly impressed with the hotel's Green credentials, as this hotel really makes an effort to "walk the talk". Well done green team - we chose this hotel especially because of the green policy and it certainly lived up to it. it certainly proves that it is possible to have luxury style and be working towards cutting down greenhouse emissions at the same time. There are more and more of us who really value this when we choose a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Runner88
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a great base for a city break in Boston. An easy walk to the main attractions, close to the tube if you want to go further afield, and in a lovely area which feels very safe. The shops and restaurants around Newbury Street are just a couple of minutes away. The room was spacious with a comfy big bed - the turn down service and free bottled water is a nice touch. Only niggles were a pokey bathroom and a noisy lift which kept us awake. Some of the communal areas do lack character and it does feel like a big hotel. Breakfast is good, although there are plenty of coffee shops nearby if you fancy a lighter option, and both the bar and the pub offer friendly service and a good atmosphere. The concierge service was great for recommending trips and booking tickets.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pretentious, but comfortable and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Turtle07
Reviews.Content: This is an older building and the room was a bit small, but comfortable. Pretty expensive, but a really good location. Everyone was very nice, easy check in and check out. Both restaurants in the hotel had good food and good service. I would recommend this hotel, but if I go back I might try a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Without Hesitation, Book The Lenox”
Reviews.Author: ThreeGirlsTravel
Reviews.Content: An experience so free of worry that I almost felt like I was traveling for pleasure as opposed to business. The Lenox team is outstanding and rival the "famously-trained" hotel teams in the country. Service is second to none. No need goes unmet. No want left unattended. Book a fireplace room and have a "real" fire built for you by one of The Lenox's attentive staff. Bask in its glow...and knowing that you are sleeping (very comfortably) in the best hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “It's a delightful place to stay - on the doorstep of downtown boston - a home from home”
Reviews.Author: MSC1989
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Europe and the USA but the Lenox Hotel has an edge from check in to check out. The staff are warm and friendly and wiling to help with any queries. Nice touches complimentary tea, coffee and water. The rooms are spacious and comfortable - all have a fridge and the bath products are high quality.

Reviews.Title: “well worthy of the #1 hotel in Boston rating on TA”
Reviews.Author: pamn5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at this beautiful old establishment. The service provided by all the front desk and extended staff was second to none. The words 'exceed expectations' come to mind and they truly made it a memorable stay. A nice touch was the credit on the bill offered in light of an errant late night fire alarm set off by mistake....although by no means necessary. The rooms are spacious with great facilities including a fast free wifi connection which I found particularly useful. Will have no hesitation in recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Classic,Old & Awesome In Boston”
Reviews.Author: AmericaOverEasy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a double-hitter when I visited Boston for the Boston Book events in October and this property and its people took top marks with this "Book Mark". I know I'm on a winner when the doorman lets me know he takes owership of his curb-front, the front desk darlings smile like Cheshire cats with cheerful service and the bell-hop hops-to with gusto matching a Red Sox fan with season-long dug-out passes. The bifockled old fella at the informtion desk could have easily filled a book with local information I needed to tick all the boxes, and when I was all done at the end of the day, I had no fewer than three in-house watering holes to enjoy a cleansing ale or two. Its not just the location, location location that's great about this place... I love a wide-beamed corridor, and old-time elevators that can still manage to hold a baby-grand piano or two to slip into the Judy Garland sized sweet-heart suites... any room in this bit of Beantown history is a keeper in my book... My top-hat's off to the owners, whom I can only guess take great pride in the team... I left the hotel with the suggestion that my floor maid is a solid candidate for cloning. And to think of it, I might have sadly picked a property on the outskirts, been condemmed to cabfares and conjested intersections... I was in this one property, under the skin of one of America's best cities to take-on by foot! I can count on one hand, the number of hotels that tick all the boxes of this Beantown property. My next visit from Australia, will be with my family troops in tow, and I know where we'll be resting our heads! Mark Sheehan, Sydney Australia Author of "The Scent of a Dollar" by New Holland Publishing

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox, the only choice!”
Reviews.Author: TomMansfield
Reviews.Content: Arrived in late afternoon, and was asked reason for visiting Boston. It was a birthday trip, and immediately, wine and desert or whatever we wanted was offered, and we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. Thanks Krista, it was very much appreciated. Room was spacious, and well equipped. The Lenox itself has everything a traveller wants, restaurants, gym, bar, and a very genuine welcoming staff with no exceptions. We will be back, and I would imagine that many of our friends would choose the Lenox on our recommendation. Thanks Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “A good TripAdvisor recommendation”
Reviews.Author: clarkio1066
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the best area of Boston. Because we booked through expedia we were shown a small basic room with queen size bed.We asked reception if we could have a king size bed and we were taken to a much large room with a bigger bed at no extra cost. A good hotel although a bit dated but I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If service is important to you, this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: id0c
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TA reviews. Great location, boutique hotel with a nice historic feeling, but the most outstanding feature is the service. We travel a lot, but don't review a lot as not too many experiences truly bowl us over. This place had the best service of any hotel I have ever stayed in. Warm friendly staff at check in. Happy to update us on the imminent arrivals the rest of our party (10 guests/3 rooms). We were starving and the concierge was busy with another guest. No problem, one of the doormen was happy to step in with suggestions for dinner in the neighborhood. Less than 12 hours after our arrival the doormen and all the valets knew my dad and were greeting him personally each time he entered and exited the hotel. We had questions about tours and logistics and the concierge was so able and informative, tours were booked and reservations made with no hesitation (none of that "well we'll see if they can fit a party of your size" or "hmm, perhaps you should have booked ahead") The fellows at the door hustled to get us cabs in the Boston rain; during rush hour! Eternal optimism. They made it happen! But the absolute clincher was the help they provided AFTER we left the hotel. We no sooner arrived in Cape Cod (a 2 hour drive), for the destination wedding we were attending, when my dad realized he left his suit in the closet at the hotel. A few phone calls later and the front desk staff (shout out to Christina) drove his suit across town to Cambridge to drop off his suit so a guest at the wedding could bring it with them. We had hoped they would put it in a taxi and charge it to us, but no they were concerned the suit might not reach the meeting spot so it was personally delivered to the meeting place by the Lenox staff. We are "nobodies" (polite nobodies who express our gratitude appropriately) but were treated as though we were VIPs. Although we never had any interactions with management, I must congratulate them as well as they have obviously done a wonderful job of coaching their staff. Stay here and you will feel like a "somebody ", which you are :)

Reviews.Title: “Old, musty rooms, bathrooms small and not much better than my daughters bathroom in her dorm.”
Reviews.Author: 5thseason
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel is rated #1 in Boston. Rooms very old, like staying at your grandmas house. Had a corner suite, view unimpressive, windows dirty. I could not get out of there fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liamoIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back from Boston where we stayed for 6 nights in the Lenox Hotel and what a delight of a HOTEL IT IS. Our check in was so quick and we were in our room in less than 10 mins after arriving at hotel. As we were celebrating our anniversary they provided us with a beautiful bottle of wine and chocolates. Our room was cleaned daily and towel changed if required. A turn down services in the evening with chocolates and daily water. There are 2 bars located at the hotel City Bar and Solas we did have food and drink in Solas and was very enjoyable. What stands out for me at this hotel are the staff nothing is too much for them and they are so polite at all times. We had friends with us and decided to take the train to New York we had an early start and did not get back till midnight when we arrived back to our room there was a hamper of goodies of crisps peanuts choc bars etc and a beautiful card from the staff hoping that we had a great day in NY and as we would be arriving back late and might be feeling a bit hungry they hoped there goodies would be of value to us. What a services and the only reason they knew about our day trip was that we spoke to the night porter and told him where we were going as we had left the hotel that morning at 5.45am. I can't say enough about this hotel and all GOOD. We are looking forward to a return trip to the Lenox soon. Thank You again for just making our trip so special.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sparkler98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox at the end of September 2010. We had a corner suite which was lovely and had a great view. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were great; really friendly and helpful. The hotel is in Back Bay area and is a great base from which to explore the city. It's also a great area with loads of good restaurants and shopping. Thoroughly recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox Hotel exceeds expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jcu604
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is a great place to stay while in Boston. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Newbury Street and Copley Square. The service is the best, the rooms are very clean and the staff is very polite. The staff is there to assist you immediately and enjoys helping you. I would recommend this hotel to friends, family and co-workers for leisure and business.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: PatioPete
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Lenox in the past, and we have always enjoyed it. But now (October, 2010) they seem to have new owners and the hotel is even better than earlier. The staff is extremely helpful and courteous, the rooms are beautifully maintained, and the restaurant is excellent. WE could not have been happier. The location of the Lenox is excellent, because it is out of the main commercial districts of Boston. For a vacation experience, we would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: lorinurse
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 day stay @ The Lenox in Boston. Best hotel I've stayed at in a long time. Staff was beyond courteous, helpful, and friendly- every single one of them. Got a room upgrade for having to wait a little longer for the room to be ready without even asking. Expected to have to pay extra for a bottle of wine and snack basket I asked for ahead of time to celebrate 10th wedding anniversary and they did not charge me for it. Rooms very clean and nice. Great location for shopping on Newbury. Hotel Irish pub Solas was really good as well. Would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “We had the most wonderful stay at The Lenox Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: btag21
Reviews.Content: Four of us from 3 different states met for a quick girlsâ€™ overnight getaway to see â€œWickedâ€� and spend some time catching up in Boston. From the minute we arrived, we felt as if we were the only guests. Since it was still mid morning when we met in the hotel lobby, the front desk person cheerfully offered to safeguard our travel bags until we returned later for check in. Within what seemed only a moment, the bags were officially tagged and efficiently whisked away â€“ only to reappear later at our rooms at the same time we did. Our corner rooms were spacious, beautiful, quiet and immaculate. The dÃ©cor is plush, but not overly so, giving the rooms an elegant but still cozy feel. The beds were extremely comfortable and luxurious. We had a nice view and plenty of daylight from our windows on both sides. The hallways are pleasantly decorated and exceptionally wide â€“ no claustrophobia here! The already positive atmosphere was further enhanced by amenities such as complimentary bottled water in the room, 24 hr room service, extra special toiletries in the bathroom, and turn down service complete with chocolates on the pillow. The coffee and pastry we ordered the night before arrived at our rooms in the morning fresh, and right on time. The Lenox staff is a large team of congenial and very professional people who obviously take extreme pride in the quality of services they provide. This was evident by their stellar appearance and in everything they said and did. Their knowledge of the Boston area is extensive, and they will assist with any plans you may wish to make. Our extra special thanks go out to Cody. Without his kind assistance, our weekend wouldnâ€™t have been nearly as wonderful. Cody, you are our hero! A final note: AFTER checking out the next day, The Lenox again seemed delighted to check our bags and hold them indefinitely while we wandered about Boston until our departure times â€“ an invaluable and unexpected service. We cannot wait to make another visit to The Lenox!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb old-fashioned welcome with modern style”
Reviews.Author: dashworth27
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Lenox we knew we were in for a different service experience. Bell staff and reception were all warmly welcoming (loved the Boston lobster toys for the kids!) and the suite was just beautiful! This hotel sets a brilliant service standard unlike any other I've stayed in - your every need is met but in a very warm and inclusive way. Facilities and location were great. We only ate at the restaurant once but the food and service were top notch. I'd definitely choose the Lenox for our next stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “style and comfort with great food , great staff and courtesy”
Reviews.Author: caroger2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June.This hotel was a highlight of our USA holiday.Style and class in all aspects.Great location,attentive staff,wonderful room,food in restaraunt was first class,also food in Solas pub next door(belongs to hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite As Good As I Remember”
Reviews.Author: Mainers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Lenox a number of times over the years, and I remember it as being a first class hotel. Not sure if we've been staying at better hotels recently, or if Lenox has slipped a bit. It is still a very good hotel in an excellent location. But, our room was quite small and the bath was tiny, without any updates to provide additional storage space or light. The desk lamp was broken, and flickered non stop, the radio didn't work, there was no coffee maker in the room, nor were there any menus for the on site restaurants. And, no newspaper was provided. Those are all relatively small complaints, but they added up to making this a 4 star v 5 star review. There was complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby, but we didn't discover this until we were on our way out for the day. Would be nice to be told about coffee at check in, or to have card in room giving that info. Is it only me, or does it seem like more and more hotels are removing their coffee makers from the rooms? The hotel prides itself on being eco friendly, which may be why they don't provide every guest with newspaper. But maybe they could ask guest at ck in if they'd like a newspaper delivered to room. I look forward to having coffee in morning in room, as well as scanning the newspaper, whenever I travel. Sad to see this little luxury is being less common even at best hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base”
Reviews.Author: Mickey_d31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for a few days at the start of a two-week vacation to New England. We were looking for a centrally located hotel that would allow us to explore Boston without having to travel too much. The Lenox fitted the bill nicely in this respect. In the middle of the Back Bay district, within easy walking distance of Boston Common and close to the Copley T station. We found the staff and facilities at the Lenox to be very good and had no complaints. The room was small by American standards, but to be expected as the hotel is an older building with lots of character, rather than the mass-produced motel type rooms that you would associate with a modern US hotel. The plumbing was a tad noisy first thing in the morning, and if we had been staying there for more than a couple of nights, we would probably have asked to be moved, but it was no great issue.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Nina the Queen!”
Reviews.Author: RunningTraveler53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday and run the Boston Half Marathon. After checking in, I stopped by the Concierge desk to get some information. Nina, the woman on duty, commented on a crown shaped pendant I was wearing. I told her it was a gift from my husband and that I am the queen of our home. She laughed and said that she is the queen of the Lenox. In fact they call her QB (queen bee) for short. We chatted a bit more and my husband and I headed for a quick lunch at her recommendation of Pappa Razzi for some carbo loading. (excellent) We went back to the room and Nina appeared with a basket of goodies (power bars, etc) and a giant helium balloon. It was a bumble bee of course! How special and unbelievable! I have never had such a thoughtful gesture made by a complete stranger. There is no need to look further in Boston than the Lenox. The location could not be more convenient, the bed was comfortable and you are treated like family. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in Baahston”
Reviews.Author: roseee311
Reviews.Content: The Lenox was a treat from the second that we got there. Their staff was inviting and polite and was even helpful on the calls that I made before we arrived. We had large bags of Lindt chocolates waiting for us in our room to celebrate our anniversary. We went with another couple and they had a fantastic experience too. Peter, the bellman, was extrodinarily helpful. He called ahead for great places to eat (which were in our price range) and got us great service at the restaurants. The concierge was also helpful to give us tips, order us tickets to the Red Sox game and give overall good recommendations. The location was great! It is truly within walking distance of EVERYTHING, which was perfect. We did take a few cabs, but wished that we would have taken better advantage of the subway system. We did dine for breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good. We also went over for drinks at night and it was very pleasant to sit in their bar. What would I change? - The rooms weren't huge, but they had plenty of room for what we needed. Overall, I LOVED the service - I truly think the service provided made for a better experience for our first time to Boston. We would absolutely go back to the Lenox and recommend it to friends that are in Boston. A great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: value-shopper-100
Reviews.Content: Travelled with family in August 2010. Stayed one week using Travelzoo special rate of $169 per night and Anniversary rate of $155 per night. Good sized rooms for family of 4. Convenient to Fenway. Enjoyed shopping at Lord & Taylor next door. Lemonade and cookies in the afternoon and coffee in the morning in the lobby were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant room, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: suite250
Reviews.Content: ! block to subway stop, shopping. Room very small. One bedside table, not enough room in toilet for toiletries, one drawer only open in bureau, one person at a time between bed and bureau, to read at night one person in a chair, one in bed and had to turn off overhead reading light if one person wanted to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jbird37
Reviews.Content: I took my niece to Boston in June and we stayed at the Lenox. I could not ask for a better hotel experience. They picked us up at the airport and immediately changed the radio station to the type music my niece likes. The room was beautiful. Any time we needed anything they were there to help. My niece wanted to take a pedicab to the Red Sox game and one of the doorman ran up the street until he found one for her. The one negative thing was when our air conditioning broke. But, they moved us, comped us a night's stay and gave us free breakfast so they handled it well. It was fixed by the next day. All in all it was a perfect place and I can't wait for my visit back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Lenox during Boston Visit”
Reviews.Author: Eddie011
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Lenox for four nights at the end of August. Our stay here was terrific. To start with, we received a room upgrade which was a lovely surprise. All staff were helpful & friendly. The location is extremely convenient for sightseeing around Boston. We would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: mountainsandbeaches2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Lenox for four nights and my experience could not have been better. The front desk staff was excellent, always greeting me as I came through the lobby, helping me find my way around Boston with excellent directions, and accomodating my needs. All of the staff members were attentive and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, clean, comfortable and in a perfect location for sightseeing; many attractions are just a few blocks away.The T (subway) station just a short walk. I will most certainly stay here again. I appreciated the history of the hotel and enjoy staying at boutique hotels over large chains. You can always tell when an establishment is a family owned operation by the personal service and pride that is displayed. The Lenox is my hotel of choice when I return to Boston, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: lovelocalflavor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Lenox for two nights and our experience could not have been better. Christina at the front desk was very personable. If she saw us in the lobby she would ask about our day and if we needed anything. All of the staff members were attentive and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, clean, comfortable and in a perfect location for touring the city. The Freedom Trail starts only blocks away and the best shopping is only a block away. We would most certainly stay here again. We appreciate the history of the hotel and enjoy staying in hotels that give you a feel of the area. Staying in unique properties that tell a story make our travels much more interesting and educational as this one certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: Swindoneric
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here from 22-6 Sept and then again the night of 29 Sept. Granted, we paid a litle extra for a jr suite, and the room was just as nice as you would expect given the reviews on here. But as always, it's the people who make the difference. We got in about 4 hours late (finally arriving at about 11.30pm) and Vincent the bellboy asked how we were and whether we had been to Boston before. We said it was our first time and he immediately produced a local guide for my wife. Didn't have to do that but a lovely touch at the end of what had been a very long day. Then there was Keith the concierge for whom nothing was too much trouble. Sorted us out some great places to eat. The guys on the door were exceptionally friendly. If I had a gripe it would be the lack of a coffee maker in the bedroom (they do comp it downstairs though) but apart from that, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Really superb”
Reviews.Author: Jon_1556
Reviews.Content: We had left it rather late to book a hotel in Boston and decided to try the Lenox to have a taste of luxury living. It did not disappoint and we were sorry that it could accommodate us only for one night. Our room was very large and well equipped, in the style of a room you'd see in a mansion with grand fireplace and windows on two sides with an excellent view of Boston. Oddly, they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and our sons a complimentary collection of candies. Free internet, always a plus. Breakfast was pretty good, a bit better than average for choice and quality. Avoid the pretend Irish pub next door which I think is owned by the hotel - there is hardly any room, it certainly has no pub atmosphere, and when I took a few steps up a staircase to see if there was more room upstairs an employee rushed up to me to tell me not to go up there, and was then disrespectful to my son, demanding his age ID before we'd even decided whether we wanted to stay let alone tried to order anything. So avoid the crummy pub, but enjoy the hotel which really has a feel of old fashioned Victorian luxury. In many ways the best hotel I've ever stayed in, provided that money is no object.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: ColinFGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at The Lenox staying in a superior king room. Staff friendly, room reasonably spacious, clean, well appointed and good location for exploring Boston. We stayed room only and, if hungry enough for breakfast, ate at the Paradise Bakery in the Prudential Centre nearby. Would happily recommend to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cricket23chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the beginning of our 35th anniversary trip to Cape Cod and it was perfect. I dont think we ever slept better in a hotel (which is very important). The beds were so comfortable and it was so quiet. We were on the top floor which were pure rooms ( air purifiers in rooms) and we had a corner room which was very large and lovely. Kieth & Tom the concierges were so helpful. If you want an old worldEuropean feel hotel this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, excellent service, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Potterers
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is well-situated for shops, ideal when it rains, public transport and not too far to walk to the Freedom Trail. The reception was extremely friendly and helpful as were all staff throughout our three-night stay. The rooms were decorated in a traditional style, well-maintained and very comfortable. We used the hotel for one evening meal and were impressed by the sensible menu and good food. We also had breakfast each day, and once we had modified our orders to reflect the generous portion sizes, thoroughly enjoyed the meals and had no need of lunch! As a hotel for tourists looking for comfort, individuality , friendliness and an efficient yet relaxed ambience, it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie1247
Reviews.Content: This was the most outstanding hotel , perfect in every way. The location, the friendly staff, the beautiful rooms and the food. We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our holiday and couldn't have found a better place,. Close to the Prudential building for the Sky Walk, and also the Common and Copely Square. Very helpful staff who booked the "hop on hop off " trolley tour for us. Excellent restaurant with good service.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think our stay at the Lenox could be better than the last time. I was wrong.”
Reviews.Author: HappyinNewEngland
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I returned to the Lenox after staying there last Spring. We were participating at the Idealist.org graduate fair at BU. Our last stay had been so fabulous, I was worried we would be disappointed. Little did we know we would be upgraded to the Judy Garland Suite. It was the most amazing opulent room in which I've ever stayed at a hotel. The blue velvet couches, wonderful woodwork, heavy gorgeous drapes, full refrigerator, beautifully appointed bedroom area and wonderful bathroom caused us to stand still with mouths gaping. If that weren't enough, we continue to be charmed by the wonderful staff at the Lenox. Each person, who we've come to know by name, is extremely pleasant, helpful, and seems happy to be working at this extraordinary hotel. They all are genuine, and go out of their way to make us feel at home. We've vowed to stay only here each time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: iamconfused
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel with graet staff who go out of their way to be helpfull and friendly. Only slight drawback is the meals in the evening when the same menu is served in the restuarant and both bars, so eat out. Breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location--this hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: hoosier16
Reviews.Content: If you want location and service stay at this hotel. My husband and I just spent a week in Boston and stayed 7 wonderful nights at the Lenox Hotel. First the service is wonderful. From the moment we arrived we were greeted warmly and felt they were happy we came. Every employee we encountered from the doormen to the maids was helpful and friendly and this lasted a whole week. The concierge helped with our of our needs--trolley tickets, tour information, Red Sox tickets, restaurant reservations, in a friendly way. He also gave great advice about buying city passes which saved us a lot of money. Our room was wonderful, large and comfortable--but it was a corner executive room--which I highly recommend. The location of this hotel is superb. Boston is a walking city and we were able to walk to Boston Common, the Freedom Trail, Fenway Park, the Museum of Fine Arts, the convention center, the Prudential Center and Copley Square. Having never been to Boston before, I took TripAdvisor's recommendation that this was the No. 1 hotel in Boston. I absolutely agree with that. We would stay here again in a heartbeat and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Location, service, amenities--it has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth its TA rating”
Reviews.Author: BOHSMAN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while attending the RUSH concert in Boston Garden. On arrival at reception, I was delighted to be offered an immediate upgrade. There's not much more I can really add to all the previous contributions, all I can do is endorse all the posative ones. All the staff could'nt have been more helpful. We had stayed in the Back Bay Hotel back in April, but the better location of the Lennox was a factor this time. This will be our choice of hotel next time we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay in Boston's Back Bay!”
Reviews.Author: dgr1968NewJersey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 2 nights at the Lenox with my partner and can't say enough good things. From the friendly service at curbside, check-in, and concierge service, to the spacious, ultra clean rooms, and wonderful extras, the Lenox is top drawer all the way. Nothing is as fulfilling as a wonderful bed to come "home" to after a day of touring New England's most charming city, and the Lenox did not disappoint. Comfy beds, wonderful views from the room, and just all around GREAT service...and who can beat chocolate chip cookies in the lobby each afternoon?? I travel extensively for work and MANY hotels should take note of the services and customer service the Lenox offers. Many thanks to the entire staff for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “keep doing what you're doing....Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Monica_Muchacha
Reviews.Content: It seemed to me that every person that was working at the Lenox really wanted to be there. From housekeeping to bellhop,reservations to bartenders, a smile and a greeting. Let me tell you that's huge! Tom and Jason thanks for all your help and making our trip to Boston even more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: DGregory1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 6 nights and what a treasure. This property is small considering the scale of neighboring hotels in the area. What a treasure it is, 1st Class accommodations and staff. I arrived early morning but was checked in and shown to my room without hesitation. The room was smaller in scale but decorated and furnished 1st Class. The room was spotless and felt warm and inviting. The staff was extraordinary in making me feel welcome and comfortable. I flew in and took the T (subway) into the Back Bay. Public transportation is not an issue here, the transit system is remarkable. There are boundless places to dine and shop within blocks for the hotel. If Dunkin Donuts is your thing you will be in heaven. Loved this hotel and would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fametravel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Lenox Hotel. Initially, we were thinking of staying in the harbor area (because we have small children and wanted to be close to the Aquarium and the Children's museum). We are glad we didn't. Service was great! The staff was very friendly. My kids got hungry at 10:00 pm so I called room service and asked them for cereal and milk - and I got it! We forgot the kids jackets in the car, so we asked to be brought in - and they did. Also, after we checked, out we asked if we could leave the car with them, while we grab breakfast and walk around. That was not a problem. These may be little things but made our stay so much more pleasant and hassle free. The location does not get better. Close to everything, including T. We, however, walked everywhere. We stayed in a junior suite and it was the perfect size. Free internet is a big plus. Other hotels we looked into charge per day. I highly recommend it. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: KVTLondon
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is in a great location for sightseeing and shopping, only 5 mins walk from Copley Sq T stop. The hotel itself is comfortable without being too grand, and the service was good without being obsequious, the concierge in particular was very helpful. We didn't use the restaurant, but did eat in the "irish" pub which was fine, and had a drink or two in the bar which was good if a little too dark - I'm all for some atmosphere, but I also like to see what I'm drinking! Our room was quiet and spacious. My only small quibble would be with the definition of the Lenox as a "boutique" hotel, while it is a very good hotel it is still fairly big (11 floors I think) and I didn't find it particularly different to some of the more upmarket chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: _-rachella-_1
Reviews.Content: Situated near Copley square in the historic Back bay, the Lenox hotel is a beautiful old building with classic decor. I travelled here with friends for 4 nights whilst touring New England. Check in was great and both reception and door staff were friendly. Rooms are lovely and huge with a nice small bathroom. Extras make the stay better than staying in other hotels, such as evening maid service placing chocolate on pillows and free water and morning coffee and tea service etc. Hotel is exceptionally clean and has a business center, restaurant and cocktail bar, neither of which I actually had time to try! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, only negative is the expense and the fact that I overheard one rude doorman complaining (and using quite horrible language) about receiving only a $1 tip! I am from England and know that even a 50p tip is much appreciated here! So I was taken aback by this but otherwise hotel was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Boston...”
Reviews.Author: KNPeacePal
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively throughout the U.S. Hands down, our stay at the Lenox was one of my most memorable at a hotel. Not only is the location ideal (i.e. in close proximity to the Public Garden/Boston Common, the Prudential Center, shopping and dining on Newbury St., etc.), but the service is some of the best I have experienced. Every staff member was authentic, helpful and hospitable. In honor of my dad's 60th birthday, the front desk had a cake with a 60th candle and balloon waiting in our room. What a special touch! Keep in mind that the Lenox is not a new, resort-like hotel. Given its proximity to historic sites dating back to the 17th century, its age is part of its charm. Just depends on what you are looking for. The rooms are clean, comfortable and environmentally-friendly. I will definitely stay at the Lenox again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish I Were There Now!”
Reviews.Author: Zilana
Reviews.Content: When choosing a hotel in a big city, is it best to be slightly out of the center, where prices are lower and parking is available or is it best to be in the thick of things and pay extra if you've got a car? In this case, we chose the latter, to stay in the famed Lenox, right on Boylston, within walking distance of almost everything. We were a bit afraid of getting road noise, but as it turned out, the only thing that disturbed us were noisy people in the next room, who talked and shouted way past a civilized hour. The Lenox was perfect from the moment we pulled up and the valet whisked the car away ($43/day!). The room was luxurious, all necessary amenities were available, everything worked perfectly. Boston is an extremely charming city and we were only sorry to have had only 2 days to spend there. We'd certainly return to Boston, and definitely to the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: cmullins66
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. We stayed in a superior twin room for one night which was easy and comfortable. The hotel staff were very friendly and attentive - our daughters (9&6) were presented with red cuddly lobsters as soon as we arrived and were told about Cookies and Milk time - 5-7pm. Didn't have breakfast, but instead got fresh bagels and coffee a couple of blocks away. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive. I would come back tomorrow.”
Reviews.Author: acava
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, elegant, very well located in central Boston, money very well spent. Top notch rooms fairly priced, staff very helpful. It could not be better. Tripadvisor was right.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: adms
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Lenox hotel was wonderful. Although we had rain throughout our trip in Boston we could not have asked for a better hotel. Great location, gorgeous hotel, comfortable, beautiful and super clean rooms. The staff was exceptionally helpful, friendly, and attentive. The general manger Dan Donahue was phenomenal and we thank him and his staff for such a wonderful time at the Lenox. His customer service went above and beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, but no "it" factor”
Reviews.Author: ATXMike
Reviews.Content: If there is any such thing as an "average" luxury hotel - The Lenox would fit the bill. I ultimately picked this hotel based on it's #1 TripAdvisor rating and while it was everything I would expect in an upscale hotel, I never felt anything special about it. The hotel is nice, service is attentive, and they have a full list of amenities. The location is great and there is a subway stop just down the block to get to places further out. I haven't stayed in Boston before, but my guess is the rooms in the Lenox are probably larger than most in the area - which is a definite plus.
