I was able to find a great rate, but would have felt that I overpaid if I paid the full price that I was seeing during that time. Bottom line - it's a great hotel in a great location. If you can get a good rate, book it and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “It's the only place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: mladd
Reviews.Content: Since April, we've had the pleasure of staying at the Lenox three times; a long weekend in the Spring, celebrating my husband's 50th birthday in May and celebrating our 27th anniversary in August. Nothing beats the lovely decor of the hotel, the beautiful rooms and the amazing staff. If you want to get away and feel like being treated like gold, you will love spending time at the Lenox Hotel. It's truly a gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bonniede
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a king room, and liked everything about this hotel. Professional willing service. Nice location across from the Atlantic fish restaurant, and down the street from the Prudential centre. Walking distance to Fenway. Nice clean rooms with great linens. Good fitness room with bottled water. They have restaurants but we didn't try them as we wanted to be out and about. Room price was reasonable. parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel that gives the 5 Star Experience without the price tag.”
Reviews.Author: bjd3
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping and walking to parks. We were welcomed with a flourish of attention and helpful, smiling people. All the carpets, linens, etc. were new and the beds are like sleeping on a cloud! Very quiet hallways, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: FirstClass1
Reviews.Content: The Lenox exceeded our expectations--the location is perfect, the staff exceptional. When I return I will not even look at another hotel. The extra special treat of the chocolate truffles each evening were so good that we had to buy some downstairs as gifts.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonMcA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely brilliant. What great, great service from absolutely everyone. Even down to the handwritten card in our room - our surname is Lennox - 'To the Lennox family, Welcome to Boston, from the other Lenox family'!!! We have paid a least double for luxury family friendly hotels in the UK, and I have to say that without making a fuss about it, the Lenox is the most family friendly hotel I've stayed in in 10 years of being a parent. Loved it all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Location, Service. - A credit to the City of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Iolaire
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived it was clear that we had picked a winner with the Lenox. Staff were attentive as soon as we exited the taxi upon arrival. Swift check in, complimentary drinks and then shown to our Junior Suite on the fourth floor. I loved the homely nature of the Lenox. It does not forget that you are the customer and demonstrates that through excellent customer service. We stayed in a Junior Suite with two Queen beds. The suite had a corner aspect with two windows and fireplace. Reasonable size bathroom. Complimentary water and wi-fi was most welcome. As many have said, the location could not be better. Close to all attractions and most things within walking distance. If not, then the cheap and easy to use T (underground system) is a mere block away. ALL the staff, Door, Reception, Concierge, Bell Hop and Housekeeping at the Lenox took great pride in their work. Nothing was too much trouble. It gave you a great feeling of security knowing that you could rely on them to help sort out any problems you may encounter. I would go back at the drop of a hat and also recommend the Lenox to anyone considering a visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaRoxy
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. As previous reviewers have said the service is outstanding. The positive attitudes of the staff & the desire to make your stay an extraordinary one is what makes this hotel special. From the minute we walked in people were friendly & helpful. The room was clean & even though it was on the 3rd floor of a busy city, it was quiet. The little things were much appreciated such as the coffee in the lobby in the morning, lemonade & delicious oatmeal/chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon, cold water in your in -room refrigerator (& waters available all day in the gym) & finally the delicious lindt truffles at turn down - When I mentioned to one of the front desk women that I loved the cookies & would like the recipe, she informed me they didn't make them but she'd contact the place that did & send me a sampling of their other cookies. When we got back to the room later that night there were 6 delicious cookies waiting for me - Wow - that was above & beyond. The location is terrific - 1 block from Newberry St., a block from the metro, around the corner from the Duck tour, and a few block from Abe & Louis - a great steak restaurant - I highly recommend the Lenox - Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Take_Me_Home_Now
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is your typical vintage hotel. It's well kept and the service is OUTSTANDING. It's been a very long time since I encountered such fine service. Our room was a little on the small side, which I expected. We had just one complaint: on several occasions we heard a very loud banging from the water pipe in the bathroom. The first time it happened with just about jumped out of our skins. Despite this, I would stay here again if for no other reason that for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: OsoBear
Reviews.Content: From thee doorman Lou's friendly greeting upon arrival to our checkout, we found absolutely nothing that was not well carried out. Place was spotless, staff friendly, Location great.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service!”
Reviews.Author: suzini55
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed anywhere that had better customer service than this hotel. They simply could not do enough for you. Until our visit at The Lenox, I had decided that customer service and courtesy were dead in big cities. They even provided bottled water free! When you are tired and hot after a long day of sightseeing that water was heaven! The other thing I loved about this hotel was its location and the fact that it had been at that spot since 1900. You feel like you have stepped back in time, but you do not feel like it's old. The renovation of that building is beautiful. Restaurants and shopping nearby were great.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect pick for a stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JPell224
Reviews.Content: After spending a few days in Cape Cod for a dear friend's wedding, my husband, parents and I headed to Boston for four days. We selected The Lenox because of it's prime location (in Back Bay), it's ranking as one of the top 500 hotels for 2010 in Travel & Leisure and the great deal I found on travelzoo's top 20 listing. Boy, am i happy with the choice we made!! The hotel itself is just gorgeous! We were upgraded on arrival which was a pleasant surprise. The staff was remarkable. The front desk staffers were extremely welcoming, and the concerige and bellman were fantastic!! Located just about a half-block to the nearest subway station was also extremely helpful if you plan to use the system to get around the Boston area. We enjoyed dinner at Atlantic Fish was was outstanding and also enjoyed great meals at the Trident Cafe, Stephanie's on Newbury and Bocco's in the Italian North End. The dining (especially seafood) was great! (most of these were recommended to us by concerige after we indicated what we were looking for) I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fantastic trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: melarossa
Reviews.Content: I spent five days at the Lenox, a very nice hotel perfectly located in Boston (right next to the Public Library). I had asked for a quiet room on a high floor, far from the elevator, and that's just what I got. The staff are always kind and helpful, and the free bottles of water and free WiFi throughout the hotel are a very welcome touch. The only problem is that the water pipes are really noisy, banging loudly every time you turn on a faucet or take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Clancy35
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Lenox and will definately return. The staff went above and beyond to accomodate us from the minute we stepped inside the door. The City Dining and Bar were fabulous and Solas was great fun. Back Bay location was perfect to see the city of Boston. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lharrissmith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2-night stay at the Lenox Hotel. We had decided to spend a few nights in Boston before heading out to Martha's Vineyard. We now wish we had planned to stay longer. The Lenox is a meticulously run boutique hotel in absolutely the best location in Boston. It is right across the street from the Boston Public Library, a block from Newberry street and a short walk to Fenway Park and the public garden. We had a beautifully designed, spacious room overlooking Boylston street. Even with the street side location the room was incredibly quiet. The Lenox provides complimentary bottled water which was so refreshing after paying the typically overpriced mini bar fees at most hotels. Our room, and the entire hotel, were incredibly clean.. so much so that I actually inquired about their choice of cleaning products. Our room was large enough that I was able to practice yoga which I have never been able to do in a city hotel. We traveled with our little pug. I recommend the lenox for anybody traveling with a dog. They hotel is dog friendly and we were welcomed each time we returned with a dog treat. This was in addition to the complimentary coffee and tea left out each morning, lemonade and cookies in the afternoon, and chocolates left on our bed in the evening. It is obvious that the hotel is well managed by how happy all of the staff appear from the bell staff to the front desk agents and housekeepers. I highly recommend the blueberry pancakes at city table.. and we loved sitting outside on the patio at solas people watching. The Lenox really offers a true Boston experience - couldn't have been happier with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great location”
Reviews.Author: sophlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband while we were in town for a good friend's wedding. I should have known it would be a wonderful place since it was recommended by the bride who has impeccable taste. I think what impressed us most was how accommodating the staff was - they even offered to run out to CVS at 2am when we realized that my husband had forgotten his allergy medicine. Throughout the weekend we had a number of small errands and forgotten items and the hotel staff was on top of ensuring that everything was taken care of for us promptly. And since we were located so centrally in Copley, it was easy for us to get to and from the Back Bay train station and to run all of errands (any type of store you need is somewhwere nearby). The only small thing that I would note is that the walls aren't the most soundproof out there. We had a nosiy neighbor who watched TV until 3am and then woke up again at 7am to watch some more. The second night, however, was blissfully quiet and restful. All in all, this we truly enjoyed our stay - the rooms are not huge but spacious enough and tastefully decorated as you would expect a nice boutique hotel. And I love Aveda products, which they happened to use! All in all, we had a great time and would most definitely consider coming back in the future (although hopefully we will have a less active TV watcher next door!)

Reviews.Title: “Stylish comfort”
Reviews.Author: Karabiber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful building and rooms are large and comfortable. It stands in pleasant contrast to the heartless monstrosities around the corner (Mariotts etc.) where the convention took place I attended. It has it's own little pub with decent food. The location is overall good for that part of Boston, but not ideal if you want to be close to the historical center. The only quibble is that wifi cost extra and was not cheap which is really a rip off for a hotel of this category and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: MReeves229
Reviews.Content: Great decor and atmosphere give this hotel a real Boston feel. Rooms are big and the staff are always keen to help and offer advice on the best places to visit and the best way to get around the city. Top customer service. Ideally situated for taking in a Red Sox game at Fenway and the Duck Tour (both recommended), though it's a bit of a trek to the harbour area for whale watching (more whale sightings than we imagined possible). The tube works well, though, so that's not a problem. Also recommend a trip to Harvard, where the student-lead tour is superb. We really enjoyed our 5-day stay and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Linnty
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Boston, we picked the Lenox purely on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. We spent the first two nights of our honeymoon here, and it was amazing. Staff knew who we were on arrival, were aware that we were on honeymoon, and made us feel special, welcomed and honoured guests with restaurant suggestions for dinner made almost immediately by the concierge, and offers of assistance with anything we required. We had champagne and chocolates waiting for us in our sumptuous room. Due to a 3hr delay in flights out, this was by now 5.30am - to us - due to the time difference, and we just wanted to collapse into bed. I think the champagne had arrived a lot earlier as this was actually sat in a bucket of water rather than ice! An offer to replace the ice was declined and Room Service was deemed appropriate to our level of tiredness. This was served beautifully. We treated ourselves to breakfast in our room the same way throughout, and the standard of service was top notch. The concierge was superb. We had suggestions for places to go, clear directions, offers of help trying to connect with a later place of accommodation so we could plan our trip properly; and assistance with finding somewhere to buy footwear locally. We cannot fault anything we experienced here. For a quick whistle stop tour, to give a flavour of what Boston has to offer I would recommend the 'Duck tour', a pickup point for which was just around the corner; also the Trolley tour which is great as it allows you to get on and off as you please. I would also recommend Legal Seafood for the best ever clam chowder!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with amazing service and an enduring sense of history”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Dressler
Reviews.Content: The cool hotels come and go. The Lenox endures. I love this hotel because itâ€™s like stepping into another century. Was that Judy Garland who just passed me in the lobby? Are those two Kennedyâ€™s plotting strategy over drinks at City Bar? Kudos to the Saunders family and the staff at The Lenox for finding a way to preserve this history and sense of place while also upgrading the hotel with the expected (and many unexpected) modern amenities. (Judy Garland â€“ for example â€“ would enjoy the television that appears in the bathroom mirror of some of the suites.) Other favorites/tips at The Lenox: -The bouillabaisse at City Table. So good I had it two nights in a row. -The super friendly front desk team. After getting my elbows smashed three times by the flight attendant on UAL (the second two times on purpose) itâ€™s such a welcome surprise to talk to team members at the Lenox front desk. They are friendly, well-informed, and work hard to personalize your stay. - Rewards: The Lenox has joined Stash Pointsâ€“ a rewards program for other great independent hotels. -Coffee: stop searching for the coffee maker in your room. There isnâ€™t one. But thereâ€™s coffee available downstairs every morning. Youâ€™ll need that after your Dark and Stormy. (see below) Caution: The Dark & Stormy at City Table is actually 3 drinks masqueraded as one! 1 is plenty. 2 and you may forget your room number. 3 â€“ donâ€™t order 3 Dark and Stormies. But if someone orders you a 3rd D&S (maybe the front desk overheard or just sensed you had a long day and a 3rd drink just magically appears in front of you), and then you find yourself talking to Judy Garland, Enrico Caruso and Joe Kennedy late in the evening -- just go with it. And when it's time to leave, Enrico will remind you that itâ€™s just a short walk back through the elegant lobby to your room, where youâ€™ll find a couple of Swiss chocolates, and perhaps some aspirin, waiting on a silver tray.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: jab58
Reviews.Content: Having chosen this hotel from previous reviews we were not disappointed. An upgrade to a corner suite was very nice and spacious. The location is very handy for most sites and just around the corner from a Duck tour (do this) departure point. The only thing to avoid is the breakfast which can work out to be $50 plus for two, eat out for rather less locally.

Reviews.Title: “Very deserving of #1”
Reviews.Author: Wyyll
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed here for 5 nights to tour my home town of Boston, and see a Red Sox game. I must echo again all of the reviews that listed this hotel as #1 for Boston. The staff was efficient, friendly, and very supportive. No detail was too small, or over-looked. The rooms were clean, spacious, and above all, quiet, with no street noise on the 6th floor. Everyone from the valet and doorman to the maids were top notch, friendly, and extremely helpful. The hotel is in a great location, close to Fenway, shopping, the Pru, the Common, and a quick cab ride to the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic hotel in Boston's best neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: athey58
Reviews.Content: From the moment Peter greeted us at the door to our simple, hassle free check out four days later, our stay and The Lenox Hotel has been exceptional. The thoughtfully appointed room with two queen beds accommodated our family of four comfortably. We did order a roll-away bed for one daughter and were able to keep it all four nights. My girls appreciated the wireless internet, the Lindt chocolates and the complimentary bottled water. My husband and I appreciated the comfortable beds and high thread count sheets. All of us benefited from the tips on restaurants and things to do in Boston the friendly staff willngly offered us. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best service EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: suedil
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Lenox in beautiful Boston and had to take the time to write a review. First of all....great location in the Back Bay area - we walked to most places, including Fenway Park, Trinity Church, Newbury St., Prudential Tower, Boston Common, and of course the Boston Public Library (which was right across the street). The hotel itself is absolutely lovely - old Boston architecture and lots of character within the lobby and hotel spaces in general. The rooms were spacious, especially for a hotel within a city, and everything was very clean (even to my picky standards). By far the best part of the stay was the service - we have stayed in some excellent hotels around the world - but none come close to the service we experienced at the Lenox. When we checked in, the hotel was unable to secure us connecting rooms (we were a party of 8) - which, by the way, we were never guaranteed - Krista at the front desk was so kind and offered a free upgrade to the Judy Garland suite for 2 nights until another room could be found next to the rest of our party. The suite was fantastic - definitely a touch of old Hollywood feeling in the decor and extra touches (including full sized fridge,2 tvs, living area and a walk-in closet). In addition to the upgrade, the kids were given a large stuffed lobster toy each and then were surprised with a decadent box of cupcakes that were sent up to the room. The staff went out of their way to make the kids feel welcome (even providing a stroller when our 5 year-old complained about all the walking!) -and it was much appreciated! Even the small touches - like free bottled water in the room, and lindt chocolates on the pillow added to the feeling that this hotel makes great service a priority. We were overwhelmed by the helpfulness of the staff -from the front desk to the concierge to the valets and doormen....and we were especially happy to get to meet Jimmy - the 87 year old employee who told us he's been with the Lenox for over 60 years (and even knew Judy Garland when she stayed in the Judy Garland Suite!) - what stories he must have! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - it will be the only hotel we choose to stay at on return trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Without a Doubt, Best Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: NapaRiverInn
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our stay, lovely rooms, great location and the staff was amazing. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant but we heard rave reviews. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Earned the Ranking”
Reviews.Author: marism
Reviews.Content: Wasy to see why this hotel is ranked #1 in Boston. Perfect in everyway!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Wishuponnastar
Reviews.Content: I changed my mind and booked the Lenox for my recent trip to Boston after reading the reviews on this site. I only wish I hadn't..... The hotel was very average in my opinion and not the best location for a tourist trip. The bedrooms were very pleasant but then the cost of the hotel would deem this as expected. We arrived at the hotel at around 5-00pm tired after a long journey. We were persuaded to leave the baggage for the bellboy to bring to our room, after waiting for nearly an hour in our room I resorted to going back to reception to complain as none of the service numbers via the bedroom phone were answering. After assurances of immediate delivery of the luggage I returned to our room to wait a further 20 mins. The hotel service information must have all been available on the interactive TV, however I am afraid I was not able to access this during our stay, the facilities may have been excellent but without any information I wouldn't know what was available. I make my comments merely as a warning to others who may well choose this hotel after reading other reviews, the experience was not what I had hoped and hence I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ruthiegee
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a lovely hotel in a perfect location - Back Bay - for sightseeing and a lively area. The staff are all friendly and very helpful. Lookout for Jimmy who has been working here for 46 years and you may even get a serenade, he is such a character. The rooms are spacious, clean and the beds comfortable, however I would say that the bedrooms could do with a bit of updating as they aren't quite as elegant as the rest of the hotel. The bathrooms are fine just a touch cosy compared to the huge bedroom. Shame about the 2 queen beds instead of a king as there was so much space. The wash products are all Aveda, so are good. There are 2 bottles of water a day in the fridge, but there is also complementary coffee in the morning and lemonade in the afternoon near the lifts. We did not eat in the hotel as the breakfast seemed quite expensive (as usual) but found The Paradise Cafe and Bakery in the Prudential Shopping Centre (enter further down Boylston St) to be a favourite with many people. Very fresh muffins, cookies and eggs, bagels etc. There are many excellent restaurants nearby including our favourites The Atlantic Fish Co (opp hotel), Abe & Louie and great steaks at Grill 23. We will be back to Boston and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit!”
Reviews.Author: andersonfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for one night with family, including 3 children. What a beautiful hotel. As soon as we walked in the door all the kids were given stuffed lobsters! What a wonderful surprise! The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The customer service was simply outstanding! There was always someone available to hold open a door or answer a question - even helped my husband carry the stroller down the steps each time we went in or out. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pamper yourself in a beatiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Fiftyfourandcounting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for 4 nights as part of a trip to celebrate our 30th anniversary, our other destination was New York City. We found the Lenox online, and were impressed by the reviews and pictures we found there. The Lenox is a beautifully appointed hotel. It has 200 rooms but you would not think so, it is very homely and welcoming. The staff are scrupulously attired and very polite. Our room had 2 double beds and was furnished to a very high standard, with a good en suite including shower. For 4 people including two teenage, appearance conscious girls, it was...well, cosy. We did not eat at the Lenox, tempting though it was. At around $20 per person or more for breakfast, we would soon have been bankrupt, but very close by the Prudential Center Mall has an excellent Food Court, offering a wide choice of meals at very reasonable prices. We ate there most days either for breakfast or supper, and most times the 4 of us could fill ourselves for around $50 including drinks. If your budget will stand it, do try the restaurant and bar grill at the Lenox..The menus look great, they are just pricey when you are in a family group. If you are on a special celebration with just the two of you, then why not go for it and treat yourselves? We happily recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not so sure about #1”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: I travel alot, mostly to the carribbean and am lazy about reviews although, I do when I feel I need to make a statement. I therefore, had to go by what my tripadvisor friends said about the Lenox hotel. I had contact with the concierge for dining reservations before hand and was very pleased with his quick response. I arranged this quick Boston trip with the promise that we would get an early check-in upon arrival. I e-mailed and called and was told they would do everything posible to accomodate us. That being said we arrived at 11:00 am and didn't get a room until around 2:00. I understand we still got in early, but was told that people had not checked out and that the room was a mess. After complaining they offered to give us an upgrade, which I accepted although we had already booked a jr suite. They also offered to pick up our breakfast the next morning, and I agreed. During our conversation about when my room would be ready, in all the misinformation, I asked how they could be #1 on tripadvisor and that I just didn't see it. I believe this is why we were offered the free breakfast and believe it or not, they picked up our dinner appetizer at the restaurant the concierge had booked for me before we arrived. So why am I complaining, I guess I just wonder if they would have been that over the top had I not mentioned that I knew they were the #1 ranked hotel on tripadvisor, and were they trying to get a great review. Also, when I went to take a shower that first night, the maid never left us shampoo and had to use bar soap to wash my hair, as I haven't brought shampoo to a hotel in 15 years, and I was already in the shower !!! I'm giving it a 4 for effort but don't know if I'd say #1.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Sox lost - but the Lenox won”
Reviews.Author: bigcheeser
Reviews.Content: OK - so our Red Sox tattoos got us off to a good start with the staff - but I think they were very personable and customer oriented anyway. Lovely central, Boylston Street location. Great for wandering to Fenway Park for the Sox. Great for wandering to Pru Centre food court for breakfast. Great for shopping. Bedroom was very nice. Solas pub was a great asset - especially for our family of three and our two groups of friends (families of 3 and 2) who also stayed in the Lenox. Atlantic Fish across Boylston Street was absolutely first class for a reasonably priced fine dining birthday celebration. We had originally intended staying in the Marriott by the Harbour - but all three families got a great deal from the Lenox. And delighted we did as we really enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Terry090
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the lenox on july 18th for one night only. The hotel has an excellent location, close to shopping and sights. On arrival at the hotel you get the feeling of something special and historic. However the real beauty of this hotel are the people that work there. From the first minute to the last all of the staff we met were so friendly,helpful and genuine. The rooms themselves are very nice but quite small, about the size of a cruise ship room. It has the regular amenities but with a few added twists which was very nice. The shower was quite nice but the bathroom on the whole was very small. The emails in preperation and after the stay were a nice touch. Im still not sure of the one email that gave us the opportunity to upgrade to a better room should one be available(for a price). In my experiences its always nice to come to a place and have those magic words said "we have to upgrade you" After you receive an email with the offer, I was looking forward to something that wasnt delivered. Overall a very nice stay and worthy of the fine reviews

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FionaGuildford_UK
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a lovely place to stay and I'd return without hesitation. It's in a great location, the staff are very helpful and friendly, it's very well maintained, and very comfortable. I would normally choose a hotel with more contemporary decor, but all aspects of the Lenox work well and the Edwardian decor has been tastefully revamped. Only one very small niggle. We didn't think breakfast - the only meal we ate in the hotel - lived up to the hotel's other standards. It's been a long time since I've been to Boston and it's even better than I remember it. A meal in Legal Seafood is a must, but the Aquarium is disappointing - which is surprising - and it's not cheap. I think the Aquarium authorities should visit some others - Vancouver, London, Cape Town and Sydney aquariums are all much better.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it Finest!”
Reviews.Author: Markthebest
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Lenox Hotel with family. Large rooms with many amenities. The service provided by the eager members of their staff is second to none. If things are not to your liking, they go out of their way to attempt to meet your requests and if they are unable to do so for whatever reason, they see to it that you are ultimately satisfied. Management truly cares about their guests and seeks their input. A stay here is well worth the time and money and represents a welcome respite from the competitors, big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Char20
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed two nights at the Lenox and absolutely loved it! The staff was very accomodating and the rooms were beautiful. This is an older hotel with a lot of character. My teenage son was very impressed (this says a lot from a teenager!). The location of the hotel was wonderful. We were able to walk to Fenway Park and also to Faneuil Hall Marketplace (the marketplace was about a 30 min. walk but we enjoyed seeing the Boston area along the way). We were out most of the day, so when we returned to our hotel in the evening, it was great to find a few chocolates on the night stand and two water's in the mini fridge. The morning coffee, which is provided in the lobby area, is fantastic; so all we needed for breakfast was a quick walk across the street to the Dunkin Donuts for a bagel or breakfast sandwich. Also loved the bellman Jimmy. A sweet gentleman with a lot of years with the Lenox! I would highly recommend staying at the Lenox. It was a great experience that we have already shared with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “i was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny69
Reviews.Content: I went by all the great reviews on here and chose The Lenox for our stay from Thursday June 24-Monday 28th. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by valet. One thing to note is that it cost around $43 a night to valet your car and there's no chance of you finding a parking spot on your own so you are forced to pay it. I only wish we knew this ahead of time as we would've been better prepared. They were nice but wouldn't let us carry our own bags in and said it was because they were union and got a little rude. To us, it seemed like they had this policy to ensure they get a tip. We are not wealthy and work hard for our money so we are used to doing things like carrying our own bags instead of having to pay someone to do it. Also, there were SO many employees standing around at the front door and in the lobby it was very intimidating. The front desk were very pleasant as were the bell hops. The room was such a disappointment. For $275 a night we were put in a small room with 2 Full size, VERY uncomfortable beds. NO continental breakfast. On Saturday we left our room at 8:30am and were out all day, didn't come back until 3:30pm and the housekeeping had not come! When i called down they told me housekeeping could come anywhere between the hours of 9:00-4:00pm. Really? So they were going to come between 3:30 and 4?? They did ask if we needed anything and sent towels right up, since we didn't have any clean ones..... The restaurants in the hotel are good. We ended up leaving on Sunday and losing out on a full night that was already paid for which we could not get a credit for according to their rules. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend on vacation, maybe to someone on business. i

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Kerricakes
Reviews.Content: Right from the get go it was amazing! Pulled the car up and the attendant was smiling and happy. Opened our doors for us, took our luggage all in for us. Front desk staff was just as nice. Always happy to see you and ask you how you were. Room was spacious and beautiful. Although the room was showing a little wear, it was spotless. Beautiful bed and bathroom. Flat screen TV was nice. It was an added bonus that there was complmentary bottled water in the rooms, and if you ran out you could ask for more of just go to the exercise room where there was a cooler FULL of bottled water. They even came back and gave us another robe as there was only one in the room and left us Lindor chocolates which was nice. There was also a business center with internet on the bottom floor which was great as we needed to print out a map of Cape Cod. All over this was an amazing experiance. We will return again when we plan another trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 10srules
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. It actually was quite a bit fancier than we expected, but we adjusted. :) When you pull up and valet is ready to whisk away your car, be ready. We had bikes and various objects in the car we wanted access to and they didn't want to disclose where our car was parked. Parking was about $40 a day. They wanted to bring the car up for us each time. (more $$$$$). The room was beautiful and had everything we needed. The location in Back Bay was just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service. Corner rooms are a treat, but 2 queens would be even better.”
Reviews.Author: HHdreamin
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of a great deal on a internet travel site and chose to stay here on a recent trip for work and fun. The back bay location is ideal, and this historic hotel fits in perfectly. There is a list in your room of 'in case you forgot' items that you can ask the front desk for. I fell right into this category on the first night when I forgot shaving cream, and was exhausted from the trip in to go to CVS and buy some. I used this complimentary service and within 5 minutes they were at my door. The service at this hotel actually stands above everything else..from front desk, to room service, to doormen, and housekeeping. I would love to stay there again. But only slight negative comment is I stayed in a huge corner room with two double beds...maybe two queens were offered at a higher rate, but with all that space it did seem like they could fit the bigger bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: thinplace
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at the Lenox - returning to Boston for our 25th anniversary. They obliged us with an extra big corner room, a hand wriiten card of congratuations from the manager, and a complimentary bottle of wine. Two bottles of water were added to our refrigerator every day. The bed and pillows were comfortable (read firm enough for my preferences) and while the bathroom was small, it was modern and everything worked properly. As one with a particularly sensitive sense of smell, I did find the public areas of the hotel to have strong "perfumy" smell - maybe this is how they dress up the old dowager. Not a criticism as much as an observation. As others have said, you can't beat the location and the staff were friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: travelfun12
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Lenox for 4 nights while visiting Boston. We initally were placed in a small room with a King size bed in the back of the hotel but were moved to a much nicer and larger room with double beds and a view upon request. The room was older but elegant with a chandelier and nice amenities as well as view. The staff were exceptional - with a personal touch. They answered all questions and greeted you upon arrival and departure from the lobby; the concierge was also helpful. The location was very nice, just one block away from all the shops on Newburry street and within walking distance of many restaurants and sights to see. Out of five hotels we stayed at on our travels this summer, the Lenox was defintely the nicest. We also got a good price through booking during an advertised special on Travelzoo; the staff still treated us with the same courtesy as all the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Lenox consistently for several years as part of extensive business travel. They are so good to me I made it my businesses "team hotel" and my persona. "family" hotel of choice as well in the past (although I've just moved back so the family stays will be at a minimum now). The manager, Daniel, is first rate, as is all of the people that work there. The place was renovated the past few years and it is clearly one of Boston's hidden gems. HIGHLY recommend the place. I love the location when I'm going to Sox games. The irish pub, Solas, is first rate. Can't say enough positive things about the place. This review probably sounds like an employee wrote it but I assure you this is legitimate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service...rooms are average”
Reviews.Author: 5baileys
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and found the location was awesome. We had an easy walk to most attractions and the subway. The service was great and the staff was very helpful for a first time visitor to a great city. My only real complaint is the actual room. The furniture was dated and the bathroom was very small. We paid for a "Jr suite" and I think it was a wasted upgrade. It was all one room with a small bath. Most standard rooms at big name hotels are just as big.

Reviews.Title: “Extra touch”
Reviews.Author: Boston-FloridaBase
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Lenox. The hotel is the right size for our taste and is in a good location. The staff was extremely friendly and added that extra touch that made our stay on my birthday special.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireChrisE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I together with two friends stayed for three nights (sadly it had to be only three) on our second and their first trip to Boston. The Lenox was not where we had previously stayed and was recommended by a friend who had. A great decision to stay there. Our room was spacious (very) decorated to a high standard and spotlessly clean. The staff in all areas could not have been more welcoming, helpful and genuinely friendly (if it is an act then it is very well done indeed) and we would have no hesitation whatsoever in either staying there again or in recommending it to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good as advertised”
Reviews.Author: yafman
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is as nice as everyone else says it is. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and you don't have that "hello my name is" generic feeling you get from the corporate chains since it's family owned. The room was ready for us at check in and there wasn't any waiting at the time. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower had decent water pressure. Unless you're determined to be in downtown itself, Back Bay is a good central location that's a short distance from other attractions like Fenway and the college campuses. The T stations (both orange and green) are a short walk from the hotel so unless it's the dead of winter you don't need a rental car to stay here. The only down side (for us) was that we we missed our flight on the first day, but since we booked an "advance" rate thru Expedia, neither Expedia nor the hotel had any flexibility on a partial refund. basically we paid $300 for an early check-in. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JK57
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel in the Back Bay area of Boston. 1 block away from Newbury St and Copley Sq. 15 minute walk from Fenway park and 2 minute walk from the Prudential Centre. Room was excellent, large and grand, very clean. Solas pub was also excellent and reasonable prices. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough

Reviews.Title: “loved, loved the Lenox Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bailey89
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Lenox Hotel. It was situated in a great spot where we could walk to Fenway, all the shopping and the Parks. There was a Dunkin Donuts and STarbucks right across the street which made breakfast easy since we were with another family. The staff was extremely helpful and nice about everything. Free waters, lemonade in the afternoons, coffee in the mornings, papers available, etc. It felt like you were staying in a smaller , special place and they wanted to make sure you were happy. There was a screwup in a room charge per night but they pleasantly adjusted it to the reservation rate. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: funw3boys
Reviews.Content: We started our East Coast trip in Boston at The Lenox. I knew I wanted to stay in Back Bay and that was definitely key to the trip. You can walk everywhere, even to Fenway. The hotel was cute but old. They did have coffee available in the morning and lemonade and cookies in the afternoon which is a nice touch. I was a little disappointed when I got in the elevator and the woman told me she was paying $65 a night to stay there and I was paying $250 each for 3 rooms. She also was in an upgraded room for $65 and I had requested an upgraded room (with which I was going to have to pay) but didn't get it, so I am not sure about how that works. Otherwise it was a nice stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SummerKesa
Reviews.Content: We had a two day stopover at the Lenox Hotel in Boston. The hotel location was perfect: next to a mall, shopping street and great restaurants. The hotel itself is very classy, cozy and quiet with great staff. We had a double room with real working fireplace which crowned our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Lennox made our vacation a special memory.”
Reviews.Author: JujK
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the lobby, we were treated warmly by everyone of the staff, and by the time we left we felt like pampered special guests. Our highest recommendation is the wonderful staff. I wish we knew all of your names. A particular Thank You to Nina who made us feel like family! This was our first stay at the Lennox and it certainly will not be our last. We enjoyed our stay in a spacious corner jr. double suite which had two windows, but was very quiet. The beds and the down comforter were so comfy it almost made it difficult to get out of bed in the morning. Everything was very clean and in excellent condition. The rooms come equipped with small refrigerators that are stocked daily with bottled water. A nice touch in the evening is turndown service with Lindt chocolates placed on your bed. The lobby is beautiful and smelled fresh and inviting. There is complimentary coffee in the morning and lemonade and cookies in the evening. We were able to walk everywhere, but there is a subway station just one block away. Perhaps, the most memorable moment of our stay will be the delightful surprise that awaited us on the second day of our visit. Returning to our room after a busy day of sightseeing, we discovered the front desk staff had treated us to a bottle of champagne and two large pieces of chocolate mouse cake. My sister happened to mention to the conceirge that we came to Boston to celebrate her birthday and to see the Boston Pops and the July 4th fireworks. These special touches and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff are what makes The Lennox a first class hotel. I encourage the readers of Trip Advisor to go to Boston, be a "guest" of The Lennox and discover what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond the call”
Reviews.Author: chez48
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with friends, one of whom was celebrating a special birthday. We'd made the reservation months in advance, and had reserved two junior corner suites on the same floor, with we were told was not a problem. When we checked in however, boy, was it a problem! The front desk person was quite nice and apologetic in telling us that we couldn't have what they'd promised, but the front desk assistant manager was pretty nasty...assuring me that they would never have promised such a thing, wanting to know who I had spoken to, and so on. It left a very bad taste in our mouths and was not a good beginning. Our rooms weren't ready so we went out and walked, came back at the appointed time, and only one room was ready. We went up to the room and waited and waited for the other room. After checking twice over the next couple of hours, and being told the room still wasn't ready, I asked to speak to the manager. He returned my call promptly, was extremely apologetic, and tried to move heaven and earth to accomodate us. When that wasn't possible, he sent champagne, candy and offered to buy us dinner. We declined the dinner offer, but did go to the restaurant he recommended in their Lexus courtesy car! As we were finishing dinner, he appeared at our table and told us he had taken care of the check! I've had a few bad hotel experiences in my life, but I have never had one that started so badly and was completely turned around by a single individual. The manager's efforts to make right their mistake ( and owning to the mistake) were really appreciated. He is a credit to his organization, and the tone that he sets is obvious by the way the vast majority of the staff handles its guests. The hotel itself is charming..on the historic register but nicely upgraded. Great location for walking and access to the T and shopping. I would definitely return and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Lenox”
Reviews.Author: tpgowen
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Lenox Hotel in Boston. The location was perfect for restaurants, shopping, MTA, and walking. Felt the location was safe. Cannot say enough about the hotel staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. There were 2 concierges there for the weekend. They were wonderful to work with and always took the time to make sure all our needs were met. The room was beautiful and clean. The housekeeping staff was friendly and willing to help. I had forgotten to take one of my medications with me and they called the Pharmacy and took care of it for me and even insisted they go pick it up for me. I cannot say enough "good things" about our stay there. If I ever go back to Boston, I will definitely stay there and would recommend the Lenox as the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is the best in boston”
Reviews.Author: soccermom13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Lenox Hotel in June with a group of friends, occupying 3 rooms for 3 nights. From the moment we arrived it was apparent that the service at The Lenox was top notch and the hotel itself in a prime location for getting around the major sights of Boston. The concierge and front desk were extremely helpful and made our stay effortless. The hotel bar was so nice we didn't feel the need to go out for drinks and socializing. Already planning our trip back next year and it wil definitely be at The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location and great staff but small room”
Reviews.Author: Mike_and_Gabriela_S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, next to Prudential Center and Copley Square. It is close to many attractions, shopping and restaurants. The staff is great and the room is very clean. However the hotel gave as the feeling of an â€œold-gloryâ€�, which is trying to keep up with the new times. On top of that our room was quite small and dark. We also find the parking quite expensive ($43/night with in-out privileges) but we managed to get a better price next door at Prudential Center using vouchers from internet ($25/night without in-out privileges). The hotel is a good choice and we recommend it but we believe that there are better choices for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: healysa
Reviews.Content: I took a lot of time to research a hotel to stay at for our trip to Boston this year. I kept coming back to the Lennox as our hotel of choice. I am so glad that I did! Great service from the moment we walked into the lobby, the desk staff were first class, friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and comfortable. I loved the historic atmosphere at the Lennox. The location is great for shopping and restaurants. We will definitely stay at the Lennox again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Back Bay Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt N
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful older hotel with extremely high quality public spaces and good quality rooms. We got the room at a steeply discounted rate through Travelzoo, so for the $159 price, it was a seriously good bargain and a nice weekend getaway. Pros: Copley Square area; within 2 blocks of a T stop; Newbury Street; safe area; short 10 minute walk to Boston Garden or Fenway with lots in between; helpful staff; clean rooms; quiet at night; great Irish pub at street level. Cons: Very few. Beds were comfortable, but I've had better in cheaper hotels; room was clean, but not new; rooms are small, but normal for an inner city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Your trip to Boston would be remiss if you didn't stay at the Lennox.”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina90
Reviews.Content: I took a lot of time to research hotels to stay at for our trip to Boston. I kept coming back to the Lennox as our hotel of choice. I am so glad that I did! Great service from the moment we walked into the lobby. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and comfortable. I loved the historic atmosphere at the Lennox. I felt that I took a part of history with me in staying there. Also, we were so close to many shops and great restaurants. The location couldn't have been better! We will definitely stay at the Lennox again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Pi314
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel with great staff. We stayed 2 nights in a Jnr suite on the 11th floor (top) which had a very big room, king bed, sofa, working fireplace, luxury bathroom as well as the usual tv, wireless etc. We were made welcome from the outset and nothing was too much for them to make our stay perfect, including organising a great table at Top of the Hub restaurant at very short notice for our anniversary. I will stay here every time I'm in Boston from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: mrs0
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Lenox Hotel. The room seemed VERY clean and the bed was VERY comfortable. Excellent location with many restaurants and shops and great people-watching. We ate lunch at the nearby Atlantic Fish Co. which was very reasonably prices and had wonderful food. One BIG tip--I googled "printable coupon" for the Prudential Center Garage and found one valid until 7/15 for $14 off my parking--brought it from $39 to $25--YEAH!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel that ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: MSLEastSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an all too brief 2 nights recently and were very impressed with the whole package. Every one of the staff are polite and accomodating (especially Vincent who took our luggage and made a special effort to greet and help us every time we saw him). The hotel was quiet and very comfortable which given its excellent location in the heart of the action is quite an achievement. I would thoroughly recommend the Lenox to anybody visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: concerted
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay to see a great city, very friendly and helpful staff and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox will continue to be my preferred choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: elsal
Reviews.Content: A three night visit to Boston was all the more pleasurable thanks to the hospitality of the Lenox. I have visited before & was very comfortable with their level of service, the spacious junior suites with a large closet & bathroom, as well as their convenient Back Bay/Copley location. What made this trip worth mentioning on this site was how the hotel took pains to accommodate my uncle who was traveling with me. After not being comfortable with the suite's mattress, a member of the staff came to the room & literally took the bed apart, working with him to make him comfortable... eventually calling maintenance in to bring a wood board to insert between the box spring & mattress. It was a very generous & time consuming example of the extraordinary customer service that the Lenox offers. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to even the most demanding of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Bellou2
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish hotel which is very convenient for visiting Boston. The rooms are not large but very comfortable. Breakfast not included , but there is coffee available in the morning (from paper cups, very incongruous in a posh hotel for visitors from the UK) Staff service good and they leave chocolates on the bed in the evening. Lovely..but not good for the waistline!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it- Great location & Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hooper191
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for 4 days for a conference at the Wyatt convention center which was conveniently just a few blocks away. The hotel is located downtown with plenty of restaurants within walking distance, in fact so many it is hard to decide where to eat. There are some historical sites within walking distance, I highly recommend visiting the Boston Commons area, it a beautiful park. The hotel itself was clean, the staff were extremely polite and helpful, and for the price you couldn't beat the all around experience. I don't recommend renting a car if you plan to stay in the city, overnight parking is very expensive and you can get everywhere by subway for $2 or grab a cab quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: avaric
Reviews.Content: We're actually here at the Lenox now and I love it so much I'm perfectly happy to spend a few minutes of my vacation writing a quick review....Great location....Older hotel, but quite well kept, very clean and our room is more spacious than I had expected and with four people in a room for 6 days I am most grateful for that! Yes, as some of the other reviews have mentioned the bathrooms are small...not much room to spread out our things and the blowdryers hang from a bag on the back of the door so you have to either put it away each time you use it or leave it on the counter which as I mentioned is some pretty precious real estate in a small bathroom...but that is all pretty minor stuff. More importantly the staff is attentive...they remember your name....anything you ask for appears and FAST. One of the doorman, Peter, especially is just a super guy....my husband is a smoker and goes out to have a cigarette a few times a day and spends some time talking with Peter and the other guys...he thinks they're fantastic and being an airline pilot my husband stays in hotels all the time...so I guess he knows what he's talking about! The location is phenomenal...a great place to hang out, but when you venture out you'll be very near a T stop. Parking is costing us a fortune, another downside-- the kids insisted on a driving vacation this year, otherwise I recommend that you not bring a car into the city...you won't need one. Boston is a great city and one big reason we're having such a great time is that we chose to stay at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: jbcohn
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming staff. Concierge staff was very helpfull. Great location. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Boston and we would highly recommend staying at the Lenox. the Location is perfect to walk the city and see the sights. The room was very nice, clean and a comfortable bed. The service from the time we got there, until the time we left was excellent. Without hesitation we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox Hotel- Top Shelf all the way!”
Reviews.Author: cruisersinct
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and stayed for the first time on June 18, 2010. The service was amazing and the ambiance... first class. Perfect location for downtown Boston. The hotel staff could not be friendler and accomodating. The ONLY compliant is the cost of parking your car...$43 per night!! But we understand that is the going rate for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Treated as if we were the only guests there”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee76
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Everyone is so very friendly and helpful, as well as being professional. The head concierge had our room set up with the wine we ordered our step mom and threw in a cheese, cracker and fruit tray. We can't say enough about the other concierge, Jason! He was fabulous! He did everything he could to make our stay exceed any of our expectations. The rooms are clean and spacious and the city view was nice. If there had to by any complaint, it would be that we had no coffee maker in our room -- really not a complaint, just an extra we would have liked. But they offer complimentary coffee in the lobby, as well as fresh lemonade in the afternoon. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in the back bay district.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Fault”
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming hotel in an excellent location. My room was on the 9th floor, quiet and spacious with a good view. There are many bars, restaurants and cafes nearby and it is right next to the Copley Square metro station. There is a small gym in the basement, an Irish pub on the ground floor and a smart bar off reception.

Reviews.Title: “Glamourous and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticuTourist
Reviews.Content: The lobby was gorgeous and the staff was friendly and eager to assist at all times. We were charmed by the smiles of a youthful eighty something staff member who unexpectedly came to our aid with napkins as we munched cookies in the lobby. Everyone from the valet parking to thebellmen and housekeepers to the front desk and concierge provided excellent service. From reading previous posts I was concerned that the room would be very small, but that was not the case at all. The double bedded room was very comfortable and the appointments quite nice. Sidewalk cafe seating at Solas was great for people watching and the service and food at CityTable was very good. I highly recommend the very Good Lobster Bisque. It was a good walk to the amazing Isabella Stewart Gardner museum. It's now one of my favorite museums! Lots of restaurants and shopping in the area. Parking at the hotel was pricey, but we'll overlook it because the rest of the stay was fabulous.We enjoyed our visit so much that we extended our stay by one night! Looking forward to staying at the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bob0913
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was by far the staff. The doorman, the concierge, and the woman who came for the turn down service were delightful. When my sister was looking at her reflection in the mirror in the lobby to check her post tourism appearance, a doorman passed her and said "no worries, you look wonderful" this was an excellent start to our stay. Then, we carried on a fun conversation about the world cup with the staff member who helped us with our boatload of bags. He insisted that we must not help him transport one of our 8 bags. When we were about to make a break for the subway in the rain, the doormen stopped us and offered us hotel umbrellas. Later that evening, the doormen were asking us about our dinner plans. When they discovered that we didn't have reservations on Saturday at 6:00 on a Sox game night, they rushed inside and got us a reservation at one of their strongly recommended restaurants. The concierge always had helpful advice, and he was never unable to entertain our talkative family. Jimmy, a bellman at the Lenox for over 60 years, was our favorite staff member. He always spoke to us when we got off the elevator, and he had a wonderful personality. Each night when we returned to our room, we found some Lindt chocolates on our beds (yum). We stayed in a lovely corner room with two windows, a nice tv, a fireplace, a walk in closet, a bathroom, and enough space for four people. The historical architectural details of both the room and the lobby were beautiful. The business center was easy to use, and the location of the hotel made it easy for us tourists to see the city no matter what direction we went. We never got to use the workout facility, or go to the restaurant, but we loved our entire experience here at the Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant introduction to Boston”
Reviews.Author: VECAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Lenox was outstanding. The staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were lovely - just beautiful. I was there for work and had a room to myself, but I would definitely also feel confident about staying at the Lenox with my children.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: bad1012
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff could not have been more accomodating. The Manager even sent a bottle of wine to our room because we had to wait 10 minutes while the staff was getting our room ready. The location is the best... one block away from Newbury Street which has an abundance of restaurants and shopping. Our room was beautifully appointed... super comfy bed. I highly recommend this hotel. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with their stay at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: citurnberry
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a very fussy hotel traveler and found it to be a wonderful, pleasant experience. In fact, I can not say anything bad about this hotel. The service was really wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Room, Great Location, Paper-thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: pvillan
Reviews.Content: For a one night stay on business, the location is excellent. The room was a bit small, but enough, and very elegant. Clean and nicely appointed. The staff was very attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel - Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jamela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lennox for 3 nights at the start of a 3 week tour of New England and Niagara for our 25th Weddining Anniversary. We were worried that we may not make it there due to the volcanic dust, but luckily it all worked out. On arrival at the hotel, we were congratulated on our Anniversary and upgraded to a beautiful corner suite on floor 7 so that we had a great view out as well. In addition soon after checking in they delivered a very welcome bottle of wine and a large Lindt chooclate hamper, with a card signed by the reception staff. All the staff we came encountered were superb, so friendly and helpful. The hotel is elegant and has great character and the Lennox has kept the decor in keeping with its age. You have to appreciate that it is a grand old hotel so I would not agree with other reviews that it is dated. We had breakfast in the hotel which was perfect, I would recommend the eggs benedict with crab cakes - amazing! We used both bars, but really liked the Irish one, which did great snacks, their curry sauce for the fries was really tasty. Unfortunately our 3 nights came to an end and we needed to get back to the airport to collect our hire car for the rest of our trip. Instead of getting us a taxi they took us in their own luxury car, making us feel really special. This was a great stay in an elegant hotel, but what really made it was their great staff. I would definately saty there again and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Cottonhead
Reviews.Content: As locals, we forget how nice it is to visit Boston. I won a weekend away so we packed our bags for the Lenox Hotel 1. because of its wonderful reputation 2 its perfect location for walking everywhere 3 if it snowed there is plenty to do close by We were not disappointed. The hotel is lovely, the service is excellent and we didn't need the car all weekend. I can't imagine anyone being disppointed unless they were looking for a modern/trendy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue047
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a short break in Boston staying at the Lenox Hotel . We had a lovely time, Boston is a beautiful city and The Lenox is a fantastic hotel. The staff could not have been more helpful and informative. I was celebrating my birthday and on two occassions returned to my room to find lovely gifts waiting for me. The room was large and extremely comfortable and we were welcomed back every time we returned to the hotel and asked how our day had gone. The hotel was in a great location, convenient for many of the sights and we were able to walk almost everywhere. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: intlfoodtrvl
Reviews.Content: Known as one of the top hotels in Boston, the Lenox taunted me with high hopes for an elegant stay. As I walked into the palace-like lobby, I felt like a true princess. Never had I stayed at such an opulent and classically beautiful hotel. I picked my jaw up off the floor and headed over to the check-in counter, where I was greeted by a helpful, friendly staff. I grabbed my key card and giddily rushed up to my Junior Suite. I walked through the door and down a tiny entrance way, which opened up to the decently-sized bedroom and average bathroom. In addition to the standard business desk, this so-called suite showcased just a small round table with two chairs. I would scarcely call this a "suite" by most hotels' standards. The bulk of the room was actually unused space. Other details also made my room far from perfect. The decor was outdated, without much character to rectify the situation. The bed sheets had burn marks from an iron, as well as several hairs. The towels were hard and covered with lint. Plus, the television was not facing the bed, making it hard and uncomfortable to view. Lastly, the room service quality was atrocious (see separate review). The hotel was not all bad, though. The valet was extremely fast and accommodating. The modern gym was equipped with several cardio and weight machines, as well as bottled water, headphones, and televisions. Each hotel room was gifted with Aveda beauty products and complimentary Lindt truffles during turn down service. Lastly, the location was perfectly in the heart of the Back Bay action, with easy access to anywhere in the city via T or on foot. Essentially, the Lenox Hotel has all the makings of a classic, historic hotel. However, they need to upgrade their furnishings and perfect the little details that set other hotels far ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Central Boston”
Reviews.Author: HotelBlogs
Reviews.Content: I was dying to experience the 1st hotel listed on TripAdvisor in Boston and understand the reasons of past travelers. At checking, reception was very warm and welcoming. The lobby is also very much welcoming. My room was a standard one. Not the biggest room I have experienced in a 4 * hotel but still decent size. I had a flat TV screen with HD channels, a small bathroom with only shower. I also had a fridge in the room which I turned off during my sleep as it was making too much noise. Every day in the evening, you can find some fresh cookies and lemonade by the elevator which is a delicate attention. In the morning, in the same place, you can help yourself with coffee and tea. On my last in the hotel, I have asked if I could do a late checkin at 2pm in order to work in my room. The hotel said that was not a problem and didnâ€™t charge for this. I ordered a burger as room service. The burger was served very quickly and was delicious with thin French fries. Last but no least, the hotel is very well located in the centre of Boston where all the night life you need and all restaurants around. Definitely a good hotel to stay in if you discover Boston for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Service of the Lenox staff is second to none”
Reviews.Author: Texron54
Reviews.Content: Our recent first time trip to Boston was very special in large measure due to our stay at the Lenox. The location at Copley Square was ideal with the great shopping on Newbury St being in easy walking distance. The staff at the Lenox went above and beyond our expectations in every way. They all seemed to love their jobs and this attitude came through in their service. I can not recall having this special service at any hotel that I've ever stayed at. You will not regret it if you visit the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Best welcome in Boston !!”
Reviews.Author: TJHEngland
Reviews.Content: We arrived early evening after a long journey with children. What a lovely welcome, gifts for the children, efficient staff and personel checkin. Staff throughout our stay were so warm and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. Room service was super fast and lush. Rooms were clean, kids loved the ipod dock. Nice little touches like a decent hairdryer and plenty of space for luggage, once unpacked. Ate at the bar and again staff were attentive and friendly. Would highly recommend this great location hotel as a base for boston. also handy for the boston duck tour the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Old School charm.”
Reviews.Author: st5om
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lenox for 5 nights on a weekend break. The hotel is gorgeous and apparently Ali McGraw and Ryan O'Neil stayed here whilst filming "love story". The reception and concierge go out of their way to help. On our 3rd night a terribly rowdy party of americans in rooms around ours forced us to ask if we could be moved to another floor as clearly after an hour they weren't quieting down any time soon. This the concierge did within fifteen minutes of calling down to reception - mind you it was 02.30am so there shouldn't have been too much else going on. The city bar in the hotel is lively and you get gorgeous breakfasts there too. Fresh ground coffee is available in the morning from the lobby and just the boost you need to get you up and about! Can't see we'd ever be going back to Boston but if we did I would happily stay at the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: we_travel_much
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 5 year reunion with a trip to the east coast (a few days in Maine and a few in Boston). We stayed at the Lenox and couldn't be happier. The staff is incredible. The Consierge is very helpful and always willing to help and always friendly. We were looking for a good place for live music one night and the consierge reccommended a great place and also gave us a VIP card that we could use to bypass the line to get in. Room was smaller, but very adequate. Great TV - not that we watched much. Bed was comfortable. What we really loved about this place was the location. It is one block off the very charming Newbury St and within walking distance to Fenway and the Boston Commons and Freedom Trail. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox feels like being at home”
Reviews.Author: Featherfox
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Lenox for 6 nights and we had a lovely time. Everybody was very helpful and friendly and you could sense that the atmosphere between the employees is excellent. Very centrally located in Back Bay, near Newbury Street and several shopping malls, wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality deluxe”
Reviews.Author: cherrypie45
Reviews.Content: I would always stay at the Lenox when in Boston. The people there are so friendly and they go out of their way to do things for you, such as they went out and got us a newspaper when we ask for one. They also gave us FREE bottled water and a snack at night as well as chocolate chip cookies each evening. The location of the Lenox is great also.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Cherry2109
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. My husband and I stayed there for a week and the staff could not do enough to make our stay special. There is a special floor for allergy suffers which we got upgraded to for free. There is a full time concierge and all the staff are willing to help out were they can. The hotel is amazing, well located and well priced. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Boston. There is a Lindt chocolate on your pillow every night and Aveda products in the marble bathroom. The rooms are quiet and the view we had from our room was breath taking!!!!! There is free internet with printers on the lower ground floor and a gym. Big Thanks to all the Lenox staff!

Reviews.Title: “My new Boston favorite”
Reviews.Author: linfer
Reviews.Content: I picked the Lenox because of Trip Advisor and I was VERY HAPPY!!! EXCELLENT location. Beautiful lobby and rooms. The service was excellent and the entire place was so clean and elegant! The food in the restaurant was great! A bonus was that there were two trendy busy night spots in the Hotel. Very nice and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “has it all”
Reviews.Author: tomandbridie
Reviews.Content: centrally placed hotel offering good accomodation excellent staff and abig buzz factor .great shopping and restaurants on its doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old fashioned hotel with service but, ...”
Reviews.Author: jamaica6100
Reviews.Content: The rates are high but our company would definitely return; with their costs they should up the ante on maintenance and train their help - our suite was lovely but could not get air conditioning on nor lower the heat, the book was missing the page with directions; our tub drain did not work and my nails were broken ( normally I know this sounds quite absurd but we were in town for business and to shop for a wedding gown for our daughter ) when I attempted to drain the tub. I had just had them done as a gift from my daughter ! I hope we get a response from The Lenox as we did stay two nights , dined at the restaurant, Solas ( the Pub ) and had cocktails at the bar. Lovely cookies and lemonade were offered Sat night but not Sunday; we were told we would get the newspaper but none were delivered

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, quality.”
Reviews.Author: daimo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Close to Prudential, Newberry, subway, bars & restaurants. Great staff. So polite an obliging. Excellent facilities. Will provide almost anything from their "at a moments notice" pantry complimentary (or on loan or for a small fee for certain items) - brilliant idea. Concierge Jason Lloyd was great - very knowledgeable and friendly. Great work, Lenox. Love your work.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gutdoc1982
Reviews.Content: This past weekend was our second stay at the Lenox. The staff is exceptionally cordial and eager to make your stay comfortable and hassle free. The location is perfect for us. The concierge was very helpful in getting us high demand tickets for the Pops. The in room amenities are exceptional from an umbrella to Bose iPod player and Herman Miller Aeron chair! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wilkos_on_tour_10
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Lenox based on a previous visit to the area where we spent some time in the pub (Solas) in the hotel complex. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The service was consistently high quality - from the doormen, front desk staff and service staff - all were friendly, helpful and happy. The room was clean, comfortable and of high standard; Aveda bathroom products appreciated! And to top all that, the free Lindt ball on the pillow each night (part of turn down service) was the icing on the cake. We used the gym daily, it was sufficient for our needs, with good equipment and supplies. The wifi was quick enough and didn't drop out. The City Bar was nice for cocktails. We didn't use the restaurant, so can't comment on that. But the pub does the best chips and curry sauce I've ever tasted (highly recommend these)! The location of the hotel is perfect; close to Copley Station and really close to the shops. We walked from Fenway Park easily. We would definitely stay there next time (assuming we get as good a deal as the last time).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, sets the standard for service”
Reviews.Author: Hardscrabble34
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a perfect location to get to most anything in Boston. The staff were universally friendly and helpful.
