We had a basic room, competitively priced (for a top-flight hotel), that was small but nicely appointed and perfectly prepared (great bed, sheets etc...) Would certainly recommend The Lenox to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CJWood
Reviews.Content: A truly beautiful hotel, outstanding service and a great location close to Newbury Street and Coply Square. I stayed for five nights and could not fault any aspect of my stay. I'll definitely be back and I will strongly recommend the hotel to friends visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: cbsweeney
Reviews.Content: I've had to travel to Boston several times this year, staying at the Mandarin Oriental, The Fairmont, The Liberty, and most recently, The Lenox. From this point on, I'm only booking The Lenox. The rooms are ample, the amenities are supple, and the location is fantastic. But what really put The Lenox on the next level when compared with Boston's other luxury hotels was the staff. I was pressed for time, but still wanted to eat well, see Boston's sites (not go on a Duck Tour or hike the Liberty Trail) and feel like I was on a vacation. Everyone that made a recommendation, reservation or booked tickets absolutely nailed it, making the trip one of the most stress-free and enjoyable I have had in years. The other bonus about this place is the fact that the building itself--both the architecture and interior design--is lovely. Furthermore, there's a legitimate eco-friendly vibe at this place, which seems forced at most other hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great touches, great area - definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: ToddParis
Reviews.Content: One of Boston's most interesting areas, great shopping and restaurants. The Lenox has a great dedication to the environment, AND they give you Lindt chocolates each night, a combination which is hard to beat! Standard rooms are a bit small, but very well appointed. Bar is very good, concierge recommendations excellent. Totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The stay of dreams”
Reviews.Author: Ane_feierabend
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel is wonderful. The room was big, clean and confortable. The staff was very efficient and friendly. The location couldnÂ´t be better. Only a few steps from Prudential Center and Newburry Street. I loved it, I definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petal57
Reviews.Content: This place has real character. I loved it. Rooms were elegant and lovely, as were the public areas and restaurant. The bed was heavenly. As many people have said, the location is amazing- right in the middle of everything. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an alternative to the ubiquitous chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “As great as promised”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler33
Reviews.Content: Was in Boston with my husband and son looking at colleges. Read about the Lenox on Trip Advisor and booked a room with high expectations. We were not disappointed. We got a good rate with AAA (about $200/night). At the hotel I asked for an upgrade and they put us in a junior suite. I admit, the "suite" is really just a larger room, but the service was so terrific I didn't mind. The hotel gives free bottled water, which I love. When the bellman noticed that there were three of us in the room, he came back 5 minutes later with an additional bottle of water because the room only had 2 bottles in the refrigerator. Without any prompting from us. This kind of attention to detail continued. I was waiting in the lobby for my husband one afternoon and a member of the hotel staff came up and asked if I wanted any coffee or tea or water. Everyone was pleasant and helpful and we definitely will stay there again. They have a special program for parents of college students in the area with increasing discounts for each year of college. Also, as a tip--the valet parks your car in the Prudential garage (valet is $43 a night). I went online and found a coupon for the Pru garage for $25/night so we self parked and saved some money. I highly recommend this hotel. My only quibble would be that the foam pillows are rather hard (I am allergic to feather). An extremely minor hiccup in an otherwise wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: proftravlr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here based on the fact that it is rated #1 on this site. This hotel is in a great location and close to the subway also. Pros: Great service, chocolates/turn down service, super helpful and nice concierges, beautiful hotel. Cons: Bathroom is really tiny and door almost hits sink, the fragrant odor they pump in the lobby can be a little much, also, I could hear the tv in the next room a little (but I am a light sleeper with super sensitive hearing). I would stay here again esp for the location.

Reviews.Title: “It's the staff that make the Lenox...”
Reviews.Author: Clifftopman
Reviews.Content: It has to be said that (having read the reviews on Tripadvisor) we were a little bit disappointed when we first walked into the Lenox tired after a long flight from Seattle. First impressions were of rather grand old style hotel in need of something of a refit, and â€“ as it turned out â€“ this was true of our room too. Nevertheless, by the time we left 3 days later none of that seemed to matter. Our room was spacious (apart from the bathroom which was not)...the bed was very comfortable...and when things were not quite as they might be, the staff always seemed genuinely concerned to put things right....even to the extent of the Bell Captain taking us over the road to buy a phone card to help us contact the UK after our own mobile stopped working (a problem we had in Boston and Washington...but not New York strangely enough!) The only irritation (a common one in US hotels in our experience!) concerned internet access which was important to us (for domestic reasons). Basically it didnâ€™t work in the rooms. Eventually we discovered the Hotelâ€™s own Business Centre and were able to communicate erratically with our son via webmail. We only used the restaurant for breakfast which was very good, and not too expensive. Apart from the main hotel restaurant, they are also linked with the â€˜Irish Pubâ€™ next door which served simpler food, even if it could get rather noisy! Overall, it is the staff the makes a stay in the Lenox a good experience; and â€“ after a good bed â€“ that is as it should be. Thank you everyone at the Lenox for putting up with us...and thank you especially for the Hotel car taking us to South Station when we left on a rather wet Saturday morning to move on to New York. That was a very nice touch...and very unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: faxdoctor
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay even though it was quite expensive. The location makes it worth the money. everything was great except you do hear quite a bit of noise from the halls but the character of the hotel makes up for that. You wont be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best whiskey bars in the world!”
Reviews.Author: S_plus_P
Reviews.Content: I'd visited the bar at the Lenox many times before, but I'd never stayed in the hotel, and always wanted to. When we visited friends in Boston in October 2009 we finally stayed. On check in we were upgraded to a large corner room. The mod cons in the rooms were appreciated and although the bathroom was of an older style, everything worked. The bed was comfortable, and the room was quiet enough for this part of Boston. The breakfast was good, and the City Bar was excellent as always!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: HelenEastSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox last week for one night. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a beautiful large room with a working fireplace and amazing double aspect window. When we arrived there was a card, some wine and beautiful chocolates in the room as this was a very special occasion. We were overwhelmed by the generosity of the the staff. The hotel itself is really classic and homely. I travel a lot with my job and stay in so many hotels, but The Lenox has such a special feel to it, I simply cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller66
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at the conference center several blocks away and we didn't want to stay at the cookie-cutter chain hotels directly next to the conference center. For the SAME PRICE as the bland chain hotels, we loved our 5 night stay here. It is a central location for sight-seeing and shopping. There are also lots of restaurants in the area (for breakfast, lunch and dinner). The fitness center was never crowded and was clean with modern equipment. The hotel is also well located near the river for joggers who want to get outside. The staff was indeed really friendly and go out of their way to chat and make you feel at home and give tips when asked. It was the little things that mattered - I needed a AAA battery and instead of sending me across the street to the convenience store, they had one brought up to the room within 5 minutes, for free. There is also free purified water (from big water bottles, not the tap/ not a water fountain) in the hallways. We've traveled a lot around the world and I wish I could duplicate their service and value for money elsewhere. The only 'negative' I could say was the room sizes - we saw another double room that was rather small, so I think it depends what room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good location, not modern nor 5 star service.”
Reviews.Author: TRlPADVlSOR
Reviews.Content: Took the rating here as a sign that this meant it was over the top service/hotel but learnt my lesson. While the hotel has a great location the hotel itself doesn't match what I think of when I think of top hotels. For me a top hotel isn't just the location or the value its about simply being over the top amazing, great service, amazing design and comfort. So the Lenox has a very old charm to it, some people might feel that is really amazing and really enjoy it here. But for me when the furniture is old, miss matched and just not very functional its not for me a typical modern/high-end business traveler. Reason I gave them a average for cleanliness is NOT that they are at all dirty but in that the furniture is old/worn. So yes thats part of the style but it gives a sense of dirtiness even if there is no dirt on the items. Some people will absolutely love this style but just wasn't for me. This is also why I gave them an average on the rooms, but the rooms are good in they are big and top floor rooms have a good view. So the only area where I have them a poor rating and which they sadly deserved is in their service. During my stay I had a couple problems, they where: 1) I had made a request to have a clean toothbrush sent to my room everyday. Now that might seem odd, but I was having a major gum infection and don't like to re-use germ invested toothbrushes. This request wasn't remembered, had to reminded them several times and in the end I just gave up asking. 2) Room service really needs to figure a better way of dealing with things. As when they bring you the food they'll either come back in 1 hour and knock on the door asking for the tray back or call you doing the same. I just found this a little frustrating as I'm trying to relax in bed and unwind and have to get a robe on answer the door just to give a try back. I'd sure hope with the room rate I and others are paying they could buy a couple extra trays and not have to bother guests. 3) Now a case of I wonder what they will do in this situation happened. During my stay I had bought something from a local store. It came in a box, i took it out of the box, saw it wasn't what I wanted and put it and the box together with my bags as I planned to return this to the store. A few days pasted and went to my bags to get this item to return to the store, while the item was still there the box wasn't. I was confused and called down to front desk. It turned out that housekeeping had thrown the box out thinking it was garbage. But this puzzled me as to housekeepings logic as this box was with my bags and was new and nowhere near any garbage bin. So the wonder what they'll do part started. I didn't demand or direct the lady, I simply asked what should I do as I needed to return this item to the store. Her response was I should take the hotels business card and if the store didn't like that i was returning an item without any packaging that they could call and verify the story with the hotel. Now I rate this as a poor response to this situation, for me to have to go back to the store, give a story and may or may not get my money back just seemed a little put all the work on the customer. Had it been in my opinion handled better they would have apologized, taken my receipt and the item, given me the refund themselves and either themselves attempt to return the product or simply absorb the costs if the store refused to return the item. But sadly thats not what they did and in the end I myself just went to the store, said nothing and was lucky that the store unlike the lenox handled the problem professionally. So yes those 3 things might not be the worst things in the world, but they are not something I'd expect from a top rated hotel. Which is why I gave them a poor rating as to just ensure that these items are hopefully noted and addressed. I'd still recommend people to stay at this hotel if you don't drive, as if you drive the cost of the hotel really isn't a value point. But if you are in the train or taxi around, the hotel has a good location and the rates are lower then some of the others in the same area. But if you want modern style with high-end service this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: KDHNYC
Reviews.Content: Direct quote from my 13 year old daughter, "Daddy, why are they treating us like royalty?"

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service”
Reviews.Author: HappyinNewEngland
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I visited the Lenox for a conference and were wowed by the friendliness and service of all of the staff. We were whisked inside after the amazing valet helped us unpack our car. We were met with friendliness at the front desk, and were helped with an alternative dinner option by the concierge after we found the restaurant where we wanted to dine was closed. The bed was one of the most comfortable ever, and the room was spotless. Everyone went above and beyond to make us feel like royalty. They may treat every guest the way they treated us, but it felt like we were their special guests for the night. The location of the Lenox for getting around in Boston can't be beat. We had such a wonderful experience that we canceled a future reservation at another high end hotel just so we could return to the Lenox, and haven't stopped talking about it since our return home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, brilliant staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyL21
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 teenage daughters) stayed at this Hotel during April, it was the first time we had visited Boston and went on the recommendations using Trip Advisor. The hotel lived up to its reputation as the No' 1 rated hotel in Boston. The staff couldn't do enough for us, particularly Jason the concierge, who was extremely helpful, finding us restaurants to eat and recommending places to visit. We upgraded to a junior suite (room 723) and it was very comfortable, if you like soft beds, the standard of cleanliness was of a high standard, and the turndown facility each night was a nice touch. I would recommend trying the Atlantic Fish Restaurant; it is only a few blocks from the hotel. The food and service was superb, however my experience of eating out in Boston, is that all restaurants are very noisy, and the Bostonians eat early â€“ the restaurants are busiest from 5 â€“ 7.30pm each evening. Overall the hotel and city were fantastic, I would recommend staying at the Lenox

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: CableCarBelle
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this hotel and the level of service I am writing this review while I am still staying at the hotel! Every single staff member from housekeeping to the front desk to the waiters in the restaurants has treated me as if I am royalty. The concierge is nothing short of amazing - patiently answering my questions and efficiently handling my requests. The front desk person who checked me if refers to my by name whenever I'm in the lobby. My waiter in the restaurant could not have been more attentive. Rooms are immaculate, baths are large, marble, and come with Aveda ammenities (a real plus - I didn't have to pack shampoo, conditioner, etc.). I stayed in the standard room (one bed) and found it to be quite spacious and just fine for my needs. Also, free internet, free bottled water if you ask at turndown, and nicely decorated rooms. I will never stay anywhere else when I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: shed7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of March. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and welcoming - the children especially loved the cuddly toys that they were given on arrival. The room was fine although noisy the first evening - there seemed to be something wrong with the aircon in the neighbouring room. This was remedied however as soon as we pointed it out to the front desk the next morning. The hotel is in an excellent location - In Back Bay which was lovely. Definitely a good choice in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: With one suitcase in hand, I took the subway from Logan airport and found myself 2 blocks away from the hotel when I exited at Copley Station. The location is great. One can either walk the Newbury Street & Copley Square areas, but can also take the subway to other parts of Boston with relative ease. The Boston Common is about a 10 to 15 minute walk from the hotel. I wouldn't however recommend taking the subway if you have lots of suitcases for the trains can get crowded. I booked my room rather last minute, and was able to find a deal at the hotel's website for a junior suite with two beds. When I arrived, I inquired about the availability of a room with one bed, and was given a room that was dark and with a horrible view of the a/c units of the hotel. I returned back to the front desk and requested that I could be moved back to my original assigned room, and was then given a higher floor corner room with plenty of light and a decent view of the neighborhood. There were two beds and a non-working fireplace. The bed was comfortable enough (but on the softer side), and the Aveda bath products was a nice touch. They handed out Lindt truffles during turn down service (the Lindt store actually is one of their lobby stores). There is a Irish pub, and a bistro/bar located at the hotel. I dined at the bistro/bar one evening, and found the atmosphere on the darker side and rather noisy. Folks sitting next to me on either side had to speak rather loudly so that their dining companions could hear them across the tables. Service at the restaurant was hit or miss at times. During my 5 day stay there were many parties and groups arriving and checking out of the hotel, making it rather chaotic. It can also get rather noisy, but staying on the upper floors I didn't hear any of the commotion going on in the lobby or in one of the hotel's conference/banquet rooms. The hotel staff was efficient, friendly, and greeted me every time I step off out of the elevator and when I return in the afternoons. Plenty of bottled water available in the room fridge, and umbrellas at the valet desk during the rainy days. I spent most of the daylight hours at a meeting a block away or wandering around town. There are plenty of hotels in the immediate area, and I would like to try out the newly opened Mandarin Oriental next door. However, the rooms at the Lenox is of decent size (at least for my room category), and the decor not of the stereotype usually found in "hotel chains". It was a comfortable stay. Plenty of dining options around the hotel, and the Copley Place/Prudential Center shopping complex is right behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Boston w/ the best customer service!”
Reviews.Author: bellullabob
Reviews.Content: I don't usually bother to leave comments unless I am either very upset or very impressed. In this case it's the later. The Lenox clearly puts tremendous emphasis on it's customer service. From the moment you pull up, every staff is out to make your stay as flawless as possible. The Hotel itself is very clean, very comfortable, and updated. Best of all, it's location is superb, right off Newbury str. making going out for good food/drinks a snap. It's also in walking distance of all good shopping, and the parks (including the esplanade). We visit Boston quite often and have found our "go to" hotel. The only disappointing experience was the cost of Valet parking which we had not initially considered in our price estimate.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel we have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: scully1888
Reviews.Content: Much has been said about the Lenox before and we can only agree with many of the comments. I have never met such helpful and friendly staff. Everyone from the bar staff, waiters, porters, doormen and concierge were pleasant, helpful, full of great tips for eating out, shopping and pubs. Overall we had a great stay and would highly recommend this hotel to all visitors to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: AFA86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and they were amazing. The location is just fantastic and the service is impeccable. I highly recommend this hotel for travelers on business or for leisure. It truly gives you the sense that you are at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in prime Copley Square area”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Lenox Hotel pretty regularly when in Boston for business and pleasure. It's an older hotel with well appointed rooms and lots of charm. If you pay a bit more the rooms are very spacious, but even the standard rooms are fine. There's a lobby bar, an Irish pub and a more upscale restaurant (which has changed management and cuisine recently). The staff is unfailingly helpful and pleasant. Prices are moderate for such a prime Boston location. It's an easy walk to Boylston St or Newbury St. shopping, convenient to the Public Garden, Common, theater district, symphony and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GoJetsetter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Classic Room at The Lenox for five nights in July 2009. My room was immaculate on arrival and was kept to a high standard of cleanliness by the maids throughout my stay. It was quite spacious, and there was a walk-in closet with plenty of space to hang clothes and store luggage. The en-suite bathroom was well-stocked with complimentary Aveda toiletries which were a luxurious treat. The furnishings in both my room and the communal areas were elegant with a stylish, rich colour scheme. My room was ideal for a peaceful nightâ€™s sleep â€“ the bed was extremely comfortable and there was virtually no noise from the other guests or the street below. I particularly enjoyed having a refrigerator in my room to keep snacks and drinks cool especially as it was very hot outside. There was a turndown service every night which included tasty Lindt chocolates on the pillow and fresh bottled water in the refrigerator. I had two minor problems on my first night: firstly, I could not remove the plug from the bath tub; and, secondly, I could not get an on-demand movie to load on the television. I telephoned reception for each problem and, on both occasions, a handyman arrived at my room within a couple of minutes to quickly solve both problems. The hotel is located in the Back Bay area of Boston and, as the city centre is so easy to get around on foot, it is ideally situated. There were plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, and the Lindt chocolate shop underneath the hotel was very convenient! Because I was sightseeing for most of the time during my stay, I only ate twice in the hotel: once for breakfast in the restaurant; and once for an early evening meal in the Irish pub, SÃ³lÃ¡s. Both meals were delicious and I particularly recommend the shepherd's pie in the latter! I found all members of staff who I dealt with (bellhops, receptionists, handyman, maids, dining staff and concierge) to be extremely friendly, polite and helpful. The best things about the hotel were its individuality, charm and hospitality, and the worst thing? Leaving it behind, of course!

Reviews.Title: “The superb hotel lenox”
Reviews.Author: tonyDoncaster_Uk
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start, firstly we received a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite which was stunning. Every member of staff we came into contact with were friendly, courteous and highly professional. We had a few drinks every night in the city bar within the hotel and this had a really good atmosphere and reasonable prices considering the weak pound against the dollar. The location is second to none really central with prudential tower only 5 minutes walk away. At the end of our holiday we were sat in the lobby area with our luggage and we were approached by the consiege asking if we had enjoyed our stay etc. He then asked how we were getting to the airport, we replied taxi, the next thing we new we were being introduced to a driver and our luggage was loaded into a limo and we were on our way to the airport in style for the same price as a taxi. The whole experience from start to finish was fantastic, boston is a fabulous city and staying at the lenox just makes it more memorable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will be returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: texan123Austin
Reviews.Content: Staff was warm and jovial. Met our chidren and gave them stuffed animals as gifts. Would recommend that if you stay in junior suite, opt for rooms that end in "23. We stayed in 823 which was more capacious than in the original junior suite 514, which someone smoked in. Breakfast was pricey and not worth $$. Would give breakfast a pass and go to Au Bon Pan buffet in Copley Square mall.

Reviews.Title: “Fully deserves it's No 1 Position.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler267
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit and even better than the first. From the moment I arrived to the moment I left, I was treated like I was the only Guest. Doormen, Concierge,Reception and Housekeeping were really friendly. My room was spotless and I looked forward to coming back late at night for my 2 Lindt chocs(thanks for the extra choc). If I had one minor quibble it would be the a/c. I was in room 920 and found the fan very noisy. I did not need the air so it was not a problem for me but it might be for some. Overall an excellent Hotel in a Fantastic City. I will Return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in every way”
Reviews.Author: blountstreetadvisors
Reviews.Content: If I could secure an economical rate, I'd move in like Eloise at the Plaza and make this my Boston home. It is a lovely, gracious hotel and the service is exceptional. Friendly, helpful faces and voices everywhere, and that attitude added immeasurably to the lovely physical facilities. Beautiful lobby, warm and inviting fireplace, fantastic location, first class environmental ethic---the Lenox has it all and I very much look forward to a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: sox313
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Lenox for our wedding anniversary, and we were very impressed with the level of service. We were given a complimentary upgrade, as well as gorgeous flowers and chocolates. Our room was beautiful, equipped with a fireplace, which they light upon request. From the valet, to the front desk, to the concierge, to the housekeeping, the entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. The concierge, Jason, was especially helpful (even running across the street in the rain for an errand). Overall, this is a very nice hotel with exceptional and genuine customer services.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Kaydub08
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Lenox with my 73 year old mother. Service was as other reviewers have said, very friendly and helpful. We had a nice room on the 11th floor overlooking Boyleston street with the Charles river in the distance. We got an Expedia rate of $175 a night for two doubles. Pros: Room was clean and comfortable without being too fancy. Decor reflects the age of the hotel. Maid service every day, and they make up the beds and straighten up even if you elect not to have the sheets changed. Room has small refrigerator with complementary bottles of water (2), which they refresh every day. If you need additional bottles, you can grab them from the small workout facility below the lobby area (need your room key to access). Room has an air purifier, a Bose speaker thing you can plug your iPod into, and a cd/clock radio you can also plug your iPod into. Aveda amenities in the bathroom. Hallways are wide, carpeted, and furnished enough to absorb sound. Our room was very quiet. Location can't be beat. For shoppers, you're next to Lord & Taylor and a nice indoor shopping mall. Filenes and Marshalls are an easy walk up Boyleston. Boston Commons is within walking distance, as are the local theatres (including Loews) and the T, from which you can get everywhere. We walked over to where the Freedom trail starts and saw all the historic places. Also took the T over to little Italy where there are a ton of Italian restaurants. Avoid Ricardos--the food there was one step below a Stauffer's frozen dinner. The hotel has a nice (but dark) restaurant with interesting food. The Parish Cafe on Boyleston is good, as is Legal Seafood (in the mall but we later found a location down on the wharf which would have been better atmosphere). Cons: The ventilation system is relentless and a bit loud. We couldn't figure out how to turn the fan down or off. I'm sure if we had asked for help we would have gotten it. The flat-screen TV picture isn't the best. It's one of those wide ones and it seems to stretch people out and make them look fat. But you aren't traveling to Boston to watch TV, so that's a nit. The makeup mirror in the bathroom is one of those on a little post that swivels marginally. You pretty much have to be sitting in the sink for it to be useful. The lighting in the bathroom could be better, but I think that about most hotels. There was another con, but I can't remember it now so it must not have been that bad. Overall very enjoyable and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I chose the Lenox as the hotel for five colleagues and myself during a 3-day business trip to Boston. We booked an excellent rate through Travelzoo - $129/room on Sunday night and $139 on weeknights. The location was extremely convenient for our meetings, some of which were in the nearby Prudential Tower. Overall, I was satisfied with my choice of hotel. Service was good overall, though I had just come from a brief stay at the Back Bay Hotel nearby, where I felt that the service was superior - more genuinely and consistently welcoming and helpful. Some of the staff at the Lenox were marvelous, others (esp. the housekeeping staff) seemed to be going through the motions. One evening when I was in my room working, the housekeeping staff knocked on the door and asked if I wanted turn-down service. I said yes, so they came in and went about their work while I was seated at my desk working on my laptop. They gossiped to each other quite loudly the entire time they were in my room. It wasn't a big deal, but it just seemed a bit intrusive and unprofessional. Also, that one night, they left chocolates on my bed at turn-down, but on other nights, they didn't. One day they didn't replenish toiletries as needed, so I had to call to get those delivered. When I first checked into my room, my TV didn't work - it turned out that some cable hadn't been properly plugged in in the back. I ordered room-service breakfast every morning, and one morning, there was no milk for the coffee; on another morning, the OJ I'd ordered was forgotten. To give the hotel credit, all these problems were rectified quickly once I reported them. My room was spacious and very clean, but it had very little desk or table space. There was one very small nightstand, which was already crowded with a lamp, a phone and a large clock radio, so there was almost no room to put my own things there. The bathroom, while also very clean, had very little counter space. I spent some time doing work in my bedroom, and had to spread my work files out on the spare bed. The room lacked electrical outlets in convenient locations, so I had to ask the engineer who came to fix the TV to lend me a polarized extension cord so I could keep my laptop plugged in while working on it at the desk. Again, none of these things was a big deal, but just minor hassles. All the same, I was a little surprised at the hotel's No. 1 ranking on TripAdvisor. My south-facing room had a rather hideous view of the roof of an adjacent building, but it was very quiet at night - no traffic noise. Some of my colleagues had rooms with much nicer views, but they mentioned street noise being more of an issue, so overall, I was probably better off with my unattractive view. To balance the service lapses, I should mention that I also experienced gracious service from the Lenox staff as well. When sitting in the lobby waiting for a colleague, I was often approached by staff asking whether I'd like a cup of coffee or some water. Also, the doormen and bell staff were really helpful and efficient in summoning cabs, giving directions and helping with luggage. Overall, my stay was more than satisfactory, and while I might not rate the Lenox as Boston's #1 hotel, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, especially at a similarly discounted room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: tpallcare
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox for a recent conference at the Hynes Convention Center - easy 5-minute walk to the Center, excellent overall location, comfortable room with many amentities (including Bose iPod docking station), and very hospitable service.

Reviews.Title: “Totally impressed with our first visit to this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: niceblueeyedblonde
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel. I mentioned we were celebrating our birthdays. They upgraded us to the best room in the hotel and sent a card with a bottle of wine to the room. Appreciated and unexpected. From the minute we walked into the hotel, we were impressed with the warm and inviting atmosphere and friendly staff. We had drinks and appetizers in the City Bar in the hotel. Loved the bar, the food and drinks. Bartender was friendly. Hotel is extremely well maintained. We had room service. Food arrived in a timely manner and was hot. My husband and I have stayed in many hotels in Boston but this is the first time that I have felt such attention to service. Loved the complimentary internet service and the coffee and tea in the lobby. Location is great as well. I give this hotel my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...cant wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Mmostek
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip to Boston along with a hockey game for my husband for Christmas. I waited to book a hotel because I was not sure where I should stay (what area of Boston). I received an email from Tripadvisor and there was a special for the Lenox. I booked it after going to the website and seeing pictures....I was not let down! As soon as we walked into the hotel...the clean smell was amazing. The employees go out of their way to make you feel special and answere any questions you have about their city. There are a lot of nice little touches as well....great coffee in the AM in the lobby followed by a hot chocolate/chocolate chip cookie service in the afternoon. The workout room was perfect if you wanted to blow off steam and they even have a cooler full of bottled water for free in the work out room. The Aveda bath products were also a great touch! The area is perfect for shopping and browsing the city. The subway is accessible within a block and cheap if you buy a pass...we used the subway to get EVERYWHERE! Cant wait to return to this beautiful city....nicest people we have met any place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonypa60
Reviews.Content: there are many hotel managers who should go stay at this place and see how a hotel should be ran!!! Room was excellent, service outstanding and very well placed for local shopping etc, if i ever go back to Boston, i will be booking in here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: cotogal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting our son, who goes to Emerson College. Since we are from California and didn't know anything about Boston before our son started college here, we try to stay in a different hotel each time we come. I cannot say enough great things about the Lenox Hotel. The staff went out of their way for us in every area. We stayed in a corner room with a fireplace, and had a wonderful view of the city. The hotel's car was available to take us to Emerson college when we it was raining and we didn't want to walk. They also arranged a car to take us to the airport. The workout room was small, but had everything we needed, and was spotless. Honestly, everything was perfect. Even though the weather was cold and stormy, it was warm and cozy inside.

Reviews.Title: “A super charming small hotel...and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: 123Believe
Reviews.Content: We love the small hotel ambience and courteous staff. This is an older building, but nicely maintained so as not to lose its charm...although the bathrooms can be a little cramped. Great bar and restaurants on-site and close to shopping and other great restaurants. This is our hotel of choice whenever we stay in Boston. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tink94
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are lovely and the beds very comfortable everything is top quality. Very central location, we would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: annieRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lenox Hotel for three nights and I cannot begin to say what a wonderful experience this was! I had dreamed of staying at this hotel ever since I was very small when my family visited my grandmother in Boston. The entire staff was exceptional from the hotel desk managers to the bellhops -- incredibly helpful and they recalled many details we had told them about ourselves, our interests and things we liked to do. I had a leg injury and required a small couch which I notified them of just one day prior to arrival and they quickly accomodated us -- in an absolutely beautiful room. We ate at both the Irish pub and City Table both of which I would higly recommend and both meals were wonderful. At the end of our trip the only comment I had to make was that I was a bit disppointed that the turn down service did not feature any dark chocolate! Lo and behold, two days after our return home we received a bag of wonderful Lindt dark chocolates with a note stating "enjoy"!! Now what other hotel would do this??? The Lenox is Boston's brightest gem and one of the most delightful hotels I have ever stayed in. We plan to return to the Lenox for all our future get-aways to Boston. Lifelong Lenox Fans Annie & Bill McMullen, Bristol, RI

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesMuse
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to its reputation--just two standout examples. We arrived on a red eye and got to the hotel at 6am and they were able to give us a room--very unusual. Second, I was going to a wedding and needed a curling iron, and they loaned one to me free of charge. Staff is incredibly friendly and accommodations are clean and luxurious. I'd stay there again, and have told all my friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two young children for two nights on Valentines Day weekend and we had an excellent experience. From the time we arrived until the time we left, we were greeted with friendly faces and can-do attitudes. We had a corner room on the 10th floor which was elegantly appointed with high ceilings and classic furnishings. I love having a chandelier in my room when it fits the scale of the room and this one did perfectly. The room also had a fireplace in the corner which I never inquired about lighting because of our children. The bathroom was a good size and water pressure was great. The room was extremely quiet at night and I could not hear any noises from any of the other guests or any street sounds from outside . The large flat screen tv was terrific. While waiting to go out or before falling asleep, it was great watching the Olympics in HD. We dined at City Table in the hotel and my wife and I agreed that dinner was delicious and service was rock solid and professional. The Manager even took my son on a tour of the kitchen, which my son still talks about. The next day, we visited the Aquarium, "Old Ironsides" and the Science Museum. That night, we had dinner at the Summer Shack which was alot of fun on a cold February evening. After dinner our wonderful friend Danielle watched our children while my wife and I had a few cocktails at City Bar in the hotel. City Bar was stylish and my wife and I had a relaxing time enjoying our drinks sans kids. It was a pleasure staying at the Lenox Hotel. The Boylston Street location is fabulous. Every member of the Lenox Hotel team seemed to like what they were doing and it showed throughout the hotel. What a true gem of a hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: xxtorxx
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Feb 11th after a 6hr flight & the service from the word go was amazing. The check in/reception staff are very helpful and attentive. Jason the concierge is great and gave us champagne & strawberries when the florist messed up my Valentine flowers! City Bar & City Table are both excellent - Boston really is the cocktail city! We had barsnacks, dinner & breakfast at City Table - all excellent quality food & fantastic service at different times and different days. The room was spotlessly clean and the linen changed every day if you wanted it to be. There was a card to leave if you were happy to keep the linen another night as part of an eco -initiative. Beds made everyday & turned down every night with chocolated left on pillow (heart shaped on Valentines night & the saturday!). Bathroom compact with everything you could need & toiletries. Central location - we walked to Fenway Park & Boston Common, but easy transport links. Great Mall at Prudential & other shops nearby! Will definitely recommend in a heartbeat! Thank you to all at The Lenox - Boston's best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay the the Lenox Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donebyme
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent the long Valentine's Day/President's Day weekend at the Lenox Hotel. What a pleasant experience! For various reasons, we have always stayed at the Marriott Copley Place , the Sheraton Boston or other Boston "chain" hotels but wanted something different this time. We live less than an hour west of Boston and enjoy going to Boston for a quick & easy weekend away. The Lenox was #1 on Tripadvisor so we decided to stay there. It did not disappoint! Upon entering the lobby, you will notice a subtle scent which actually was quite pleasant. Barely noticable and relaxing. The lobby is not large but it contains a seating area w/fireplace, entrance to City Table restaurant and City Bar along with the check in desk and concierge desk. We were in & out of the hotel the whole weekend and although busy, the lobby never felt crowded. Everyone, from our arrival to our departure, was polite & professional. There is complimentary coffee and tea service in the morning along with newspapers. The restrooms have L'Occitance soap and lotion- my all time favorite! Although the Lenox is not a "new" hotel it has been kept more than adequately updated and renovated throughout the years. Actually, the age of the Lenox is one of the things that attracted us to it. We LOVE Boston and the history of Boston and felt like we were staying in a bit of Boston history. That is fun for Bostonians such as us! We stayed in a Superior King room. It was a standard size hotel room, as we expected. We did not hear any noise from either outside on the street or from the hallway and heat is not noisy either. The king bed was very comfortable. The room had a nice sized walk in closet, refrigerator with complimentary bottles of water, umbrella, iron & ironing board, flat screen tv, Bose radio/IPod dock, clock radio/ CD player and the usual. The marble bathroom was rather small but efficient. The toiletries were by Aveda. In our opinion, the room was spotless. There is a nightly bed turndown with chocolates (Valentine heart shaped Lindt truffles!). The only thing that I can find fault with for our ENTIRE stay was the one arm chair in the room was not so comfortable for reading and could have used an ottoman, and it was a bit hard to finely control the temperature in the room. But, really, these were just minor inconveniences over the scheme of things. We ate dinner in the restaurant, City Table and it was very nice. Our server, Karla, was very friendly and efficient. We had drinks and a snack at the bar, City Bar and enjoyed that very much. We did check out the Irish restaurant, Solas, but it was already crowded with no open seats, so we left. The locaton of the Lenox is great. It is in a great location for tourists to experience & move about Boston. It is convenient to shopping, restaurants, and public transporatation. It is on the corner of Exeter St. & Boylston Street and next door to Lord & Taylor & the Boston Library. Lord & Taylor connects inside to the Prudential Shops & Copley Place. In fact, via Lord & Taylor, you can even connect to the T & Commuter Rail at Back Bay Station without ever going outside. Boston is known for it's over-the-top parking fees and the Lenox is no exception. Valet parking is right next door at the Prudential Parking Garage and costs $41 per night. That is the usual & customary rate for Boston parking. You can self part for a little bit (and I mean a very lttle bit) less but we felt that valet parking was worth the $2 or $3 more to us. You don't really need a car in Boston and I suggest that visiters do NOT rent a car while staying in the city if they can avoid it. Boston can be a difficult city to drive in and there is good public transportation. Walking is a nice alternative too. In the past, we have sometimes taken the commuter rail into Boston and left our car at home, but this time we chose to drive in. We never used the car while we were there. We walked or took the T everywhere. So , as I said, we LOVE Boston and now we LOVE the Lenox Hotel too! No, it is not brand new like the Mandarin Boston. But it is NOT old as in "run down". It is OLD as in "historic"- one of the grand dames of Boston! Boston is an old, historic city and we felt that the Lenox fits in perfectly with the ambiance of Boston and New England. For sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and old”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller2010
Reviews.Content: yes location is perfefct however the hotel is old, floors look like an hospital ward!! Bathroomss really old and in need of urgent renovation. We had a corner room, fireplace could not be lit. Clean was not spotless. Receptionist are really unfriendly however the concierge was excellent. There is no lobby. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, great location”
Reviews.Author: kathysa
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I decided to do a quick girl's trip to Boston. The Lenox was great. We could get off at the Back Bay train station and walk to the hotel via underground/indoors until the last 10 feet or so. This was nice as it was snowing and cold. Huge room with 2 queen beds. Easy walk to Newbury St. and right outside the entrance to Saks, which then takes you into the Pru shops and Copley. The front desk staff was very friendly and the concierge helpful. Boston was beautiful in the snow....but we didn't have to drive in it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, THE place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mjcexf99
Reviews.Content: Wow! is all I can say. From the time we checked in until the time we left we were treated like royalty. The rooms were large an comfortable and ours even had a fireplace that was started and extinguished for us upon request. They offer Lexus RX 450 Hybrids for their customers use upon request and the concierge was extremely friendly, accessible , and knowledgeable about all Boston has to offer. I travel to Boston for business often and have stayed just about everywhere; from now on the Lenox is the only hotel I will consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - 2 small issues”
Reviews.Author: freddvolvo
Reviews.Content: The Overall stay was wonderful and a great experience with 2 exceptions. The Toilet in the bathroom was not easily accessible - a counter top was built over the back and made it quite uncomfortable and did not allow the seat to remain in an up position. Also, there was an odor of cigarette smoke coming from the heating vent. I was under the impression that this was a smoke free hotel. Everything else was really good - in room dining was excellent as was the food and services. With an assurance that these items were resolved, I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Niamh_012
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, really friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were really nicely decorated, loads of space. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Location was great, lovely area and could walk to Boston Common. Really enjoyed the stay. Free wi-fi was also handy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but noisy airconditioners”
Reviews.Author: teshil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my wife! You can't ask for a better location and most places are well accessible, shopping and tourist locations are close by. HOWEVER, a big put off is the noise coming out the airconditioning/heating units. It is simply too loud and I have tinnitus! Did not help and we moved to another hotel. The rooms were smaller too. The hotel staff were polite and nice!

Reviews.Title: “Lenox Hotel is a fabulous find in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MadameButterfly
Reviews.Content: The Lenox Hotel combines historic ambiance with top of the line services. Our king room was beautifuilly decorated, quiet and comfortable; the Aveda toiletries a lovely touch. We enjoyed the Irish pub as well as a excellent breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful. All this at an affordable price for a city hotel in an excellent Back Bay location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant customer care at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: TileKiln
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week stay at the Lenox. All the staff we came in contact with were totally professional, friendly and efficient. Reception was unfailingly polite and extremely helpful as were the Concierge, who pre-arranged our trip to Wrentham Village. The Doormen were always willing to help and suggest best dining options. All the staff were well coordinated and seemed genuinely happy to make visitors stay memorable. The whole atmosphere in the hotel was positive and pleasant. The hotel is extremely inviting, an open fire in the lobby and a lovely aroma as you enter the hotel. Hand cleansers are at every station, someone has an eye to detail and hygiene which is so important. The cleaning staff are unobtrusive and do an excellent job. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean. There is a nightly turndown service with chocolates, bottled water is provided. Eveything has been thought of. The beds are marvellous with pillowtop mattresses. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the hub of Boston and very near to excellent shopping and dining. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning . The food and service were both very good. We can highly recommend the Lenox and will definitely return someday. Thank you all at the Lenox for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. .. Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: bradwana
Reviews.Content: Two of us shared a room at The Lenox in December last year for two nights because of it's convenient location just west of the city centre. The hotel is ideally situated for tourists and businessmen alike being close to public transport and local shopping centres. There is a great choice of bars and restaurants to suit your budget in the locale. The staff at The Lenox are very attentive and polite and we were made to feel welcome immediately upon arrival. The rooms are large and well equipped with everything a traveler needs. The bathroom in particular was spotlessly clean and well stocked. My only regret was that on the first night in Boston I took full advantage of the excellent cocktail menu in the hotel bar and regretted it the following morning. The Lenox has been voted the No1 hotel in Boston for two very good reasons. It's in a great location and is excellent value for money. I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Everything the Reviews Say it is”
Reviews.Author: Momsdayout
Reviews.Content: Staff is excellent AND warm and friendly. Lobby is lovely, room also - good beds, office quality desk chair, lots of lighting, armchair and ottoman. Huge well-lit closet. Marble bath with lots of Aveda products, great towels. When we arrived we saw a Lindt chocolate store in the outside corner of the building and I thought - "wow, maybe the mints on the pillow will be . . ." but it was even better - three Lindt truffles (my favorite) for each of us! Location is also excellent - one block from the Prudential Center mall - high end shopping, but also fun just to look. There is even an Au Bon Pain at the far end (a little hidden - check the map). One block north is Newbury St., with lots of boutiques, etc., and one block east on Boylston is a Green Line "T" station - Copley stop. To take public transport from the airport, take free, easy airport shuttle to the Blue Line Airport station, then change for the Green Line at Government Center. Very easy, if you're travelling light. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is that it's not inexpensive. We got a very good deal online. If I can stay there again at a price I can afford, I definitely will.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for an Intimate Wedding”
Reviews.Author: MagLady00
Reviews.Content: My son and (now) daughter-in-law were married at the Lenox on New Year's eve and it could not have been more perfect. The two families and our many relatives and friends arrived days early and everyone made us feel as though the hotel was our own special place. The wedding itself was so beautiful, so elegant and intimate and SO much fun--not stiff at all. And the personnel--planners, staffers, even corporate who helped us with personal issues--were exceptional in spite of the fact that we were nervous nellies about SO many things and needed a lot of hand-holding. The rooms (our suites), restaurants, bars etc were wonderful, and the wedding staff were top-notch. And the food at the event was very, very good. If you are looking for a special room that does not feel "hotel-y," visit the beautiful Dome Room and look up at that lovely white-gold ceiling with its romantic pendant lights. Very special and very intimate--just like the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: txorig
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in TA. What a wonderful hotel! I had a conference in mid-January and all the conference hotels were getting booked and those left were pricey. I decided to find a good hotel that was not part of the conference recommendations but near enough to the others. After reading reviews on several Boston hotels, I decided on the Lenox. The fact that it is a historic hotel and was listed as having fabulous service made the decision easy. My husband accompanied me to do some sightseeing, and we were not disappointed. They were attentive from the very start. They responded to e-mail questions prior to our visit quickly and clearly. We will be celebrating our anniversary this month, and wanted to make this trip a bit more special than a conference trip. To help us with the celebration, the hotel gave us a free upgrade to a corner suite with a working fireplace. The room was large and very comfortable - the bed was great - with a European style comforter to keep us warm throughout the night. The chocolates and turn down service are also a very nice touch. We were greeted quickly and efficiently at the door and were soon settled in our room. We stayed in a Chicago hotel in June. As a contrast, the Chicago hotel charged for everything -- wifi, bottled water ($12 a bottle!, etc.) all these were included in the room charge at the Lenox. We were very pleasantly surprised to see the room mini-refrigerator stocked with complimentary water. Our first night, we called to have the bellman come up to start a fire for us. He was friendly and happy to build a nice warm fire to make us more comfortable. In other words, our room was pretty much perfect. The staff at the Lenox is wonderful - from the desk, the bellman, the concierge doormen -- all friendly and very helpful. The concierge helped us plan out our places to see and gave us a VIP comp card for the Old Town Trolley. We would recommend starting your visit with the Old Town Trolley which will give you a good feel for the city. The hotel is well located and we would highly recommend it to anyone going to Boston. We plan to return as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: FrazierLondon
Reviews.Content: Everything about that has been said, is so true. Now I have stayed there, I would not dream of staying anywhere else. We had breakfast in the Hotel, every moring, which filled us for most of the day, location was wonderful, and surrounded by shopping malls, and the local supermartket - Shaws was nearby. If you are going to Boston and only staying a few nights (shame)! Get the Charlie Card which is very good buy, and you can use on all transport. Also get a cab from the Airport, as this works out cheaper then getting the airport shuttle. Have a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SeguinTexasgal
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to EVER write a review about a hotel, but in this instance I need to. I was leary about reviews on Trip Advisor. However, I trusted them when making my hotel choice in Boston. The reviews were absolutely correct about the Lenox hotel. If you are going to Boston, this is the only place to stay. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. Stay at this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just great - staff, location, rooms, food”
Reviews.Author: thefraylay
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston with my Mam and sister for some retail therapy in mid October. President Obama was staying just around the corner from us in the Westin at the same time. Unfortunately we didnt catch a glimpse. I booked the Lenox on www.hotels.ie because they had a good deal on and after reading the reviews on trip advisor which were great. Firstly I got a better rate on www.hotels.ie than on the Lenox Hotel's own website so I contacted the hotel by email because their website states "Best Online Rates Guranteed" and it clearly has "You won't find a lower rate online and available to the general public for the room of your choice. If you find a rate that is viewable and bookable on another website for the same room type, dates and length of stay, please contact us. If the claim can be verified, we will match it!". However, I received an email from them stating that "We are able to only match the rates seen on the US version of hotels.com, we are unable to match rates seen on the international websites. The international websites do often have specials that are available only to their sites and are not bookable elsewhere due to their volume of business." This was very disappointing and clearly a contradiction to their website guarantee. So I booked with hotels.com. When we arrived at the hotel I wasnt disappointed. The location was perfect and the staff were so helpful and friendly. They really went out of their way to ensure our trip was perfect especially the concierge who was always on hand to give us some tips and advice. The room had been set out for 2 people instead of three (even though we booked for 3) but the hotel corrected this immediately. The added touched like chocolates etc was brilliant. The only and I do mean only downside - was not having tea/coffee making facilities in our room. The hotel do provide complimentary coffee in the morning but it is luke warm. There is a dunkin donuts across the road for tea & coffee though and they open from early til late. The location is a two minute walk from Copley MBTA station and about 5 mins from Hynes station. Plenty of shops, restaurants etc nearby. Lord & Taylor, Filene's Basement, the Prudential Centre, Marshalls, CVS, are all along the same road. Its everything you need in the one location (if you prefer not to venture too far). We did some sightseeing and will definitely be returning to do more. I would definitely stay at the Lenox next time but I will be shopping around for good deals on other websites.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for my husband's birthday and my expectations were certainly met. The customer service was outstanding from the valet, to the bell hop, and finally to the concierge. "Orbitz," a travel booking site, boggled my reservation and the Lenox quickly rectified the situation with little issue. In addition, the concierge provided a delicious piece of cake from a local bakery and a gratis bottle of champagne. I really appreciated their attention to detail. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was good. Also a great location to travel from, close to the South End, for really good dining. Thank you Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: kaether0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for New Year's eve and we were very impressed with the hotel. Our room was spacious, there were 3 of us staying in two double beds, and the big dresser was a big plus. The room also included a bose ipod dock and a plasma TV, which were nice for hanging out in the room while having a couple of drinks. The location is great, there were a ton of restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel itself has a restaurant and a couple of bars that had good ambiance, and did not look like your typical hotel restaurant/bar. The food was a little bit pricey but good. The staff was very professional, courteous and helpful. Our sink had a leak, and we reported it as we were going out for dinner. When we were back it was already fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Service and European Elegance Sans The Price”
Reviews.Author: travel2muchNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem. From the inviting lobby to clean, charming rooms; terrific location and overall warm, intimate setting. What makes this hotel though a true stand out is the staff. They simply go above and beyond to treat their guests like royalty. I will be forever grateful for the hoops the staff went through to return personal property I had accidentally left behind. I have stayed at several five star properties and many of these places could take a lesson from the Lenox staff on how to deliver exceptional service. They have a guest for life!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, lacks some comforts”
Reviews.Author: RogerThornhill
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is so good and professional that it pains me not to give it an excellent rating but there are some modern comforts missing at the Lenox that should not be lacking for the price you pay. Aside from the top-notch staff, the place is beautiful and welcoming and in a perfect location from which to explore Boston. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the workout room was small but well-equipped for its size. Now the negatives. The room's heating system was extremely noisy and the bathroom compared to your average Holiday Inn, way below what one should look like at a hotel of this category. Plus, the toilet lid refused to stay up. In addition, I think a hotel that professes understated luxury should at the very least provide guests with a morning paper and a better coffee service than the one station they place by the elevator bay. When I booked I also requested a room with a view but ended up on the third floor looking over an ugly roof and a sliver of street. Do have to say that upon checkout they were apologetic and compensated us with a nice quick lunch and a ride to the airport on a nice Escalade driven by another outstanding staff member. I left the Lenox having had a great time and wishing those negatives I cited were irrelevant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bradneel
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a great hotel. I have traveled all over the country and abroad on both business and personal travel, and my stay at the Lenox was great. Nice room, good restaurants, and ideal location. I recommend it to both leisure and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox Hotel - Could have been perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Amazing1672
Reviews.Content: We had read a lot of good things about the Lenox on Trip Advisor and perhaps our expectations were very high, but I would like to highlight some issues we found in this hotel that led me to give it a 3 star rating instead of the 4 that I believe the hotel should get if we hadn't had these issues. First the good: 1. Great Location 2. Friendly staff 3. Good sized rooms for a downtown hotel in a city like Boston 4. Good environmental program Problems/ Issues that we had: 1. First problem we had was with the Vanity mirror in the bathroom. I touched it and it almost fell down. I managed to save it but it looked like it was just barely hanging on for dear life and all it required was a gentle nudge for it to fall down. We called the front desk and they sent someone from maintenance to look at it immediately. 2. After just one use of the flush, the flush got stuck and the water would not stop. My husband used his best handy man expertise and opened the flush tank and managed to fix the problem on his own without another visit by the maintenance guy. 3. Next day morning, the shower tub kept filling with water and the drain did not work. Another call to the front desk, who by the way were always very courteous and another visit by the maintenance guy and this was fixed. 4. The night light had a burnt out bulb which we had ignored the first night but told the maintenance guy of the problem when he was there to fix the shower tub issue and by the time we came back to the room after our dinner, it was taken care of. 5. Second morning, while getting into the shower, I opened the small complimentary packet which said - Shower cap and it was empty. I took a shower without the cap as I was in no mood to yet again place a call to Maintenance/ Front desk. All the above look like trivial issues but are an example of just not enough attention to detail. In my opinion a 4-5 star hotel would take care of these small issues so that their guests have an extremely smooth, trouble free stay with them. I also know that sometimes these issues can crop up in the best of the hotels, but when more than a couple of such issues come up, your experience is impacted negatively. We found the people who work at the hotel to be very helpful and courteous but found these small nagging issues quite troublesome. Hopefully, the hotel will be able to better take care of these in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Krissy80
Reviews.Content: I just came back today from a 3 day trip to Boston to attend a concert at the House of Blues and this hotel is fantastic! The location is great and it is close to many shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and elegant. Best of all, the Lenox has the friendliest and most helpful staff that I have ever seen at a hotel! I was very impressed with my experience at the Lenox and in Boston in general, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mmiller72782
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first visit to Boston. We just happened to book during their first snow storm, but that did not stop us from having a wonderful trip and stay at the Lenox. The hotel was wonderful. The bellhops greeted us with friendly smiles, even though the temperture was a low 18!! We arrived at the hotel at 10:30am and we anticipated having to wait around until 3 to get into our room, but were very surprised when they were ready for us. The lobby is so nice with a fireplace and free coffee/tea each morning. There are two great bars in the hotel and several restaurants and bars within walking distance. The staff was very attentive and made us feel welcome. I truely believe they wanted us to enjoy Boston. The only tiny complaint that I have was that it was hard to figure out when housekeeping were making their rounds. Sometimes they would come early in the morning and other times later in the afternoon. It was a very small inconvience. Once again, great hotel and I HIGHLY recommend it. One last comment, we really enjoyed the restaurant across the street" UNO". Good bar, good food, good staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: aebcpama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox Hotel for the weekend and have only one beef. We checked in on Friday afternoon. All of our luggage was put on a wagon by their doorman, when we went to our room, there were no bellman so I grabbed the cart to go to our room. The desk clerk said we could not take the wagon?? (why not ?no one else could use it with our luggage on it?) She said a bellman would bring it right up. I felt uncomfortable leaving it in the lobby unattended. We went to the room and waited for 25 minutes for the luggage to arrive. At that point I went out to the elevator to go back down and retreive it. I met a bellman in the elevator. We went down to the lobby and the wagon was gone. Another bellman must be delivering it. Back to the room and no luggage. It took over an hour to get our luggage. We needed an extra glass for wine in our room. I called the desk for one, will be right up. I waited for 25 minutes, went downstairs to the restaurant, got two glasses myself. Never did see the ones I called for? And it was not busy? Service is below par! Otherwise room was good, concierge was good, .Staff was helpful and friendly. $41 a night to park!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as always”
Reviews.Author: GeneralManager96
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at the Lenox Hotel and everything is still perfect. The location is absolutely the best, the staff the friendliest and most helpful, the rooms are comfortable and beautifully furnished, the restaurant and lounge top notch. Wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless in every way”
Reviews.Author: RobSu
Reviews.Content: Special weekend for the family in the first week of December. I can truly say The Lennox Hotel and it's staff made this really special and memorable for us. The Hotel is fabulous architechturally, without the shabbiness you sometimes find in the older Hotels, the rooms are large, clean and in keeping with the style of the Hotel. The staff are friendly, efficient and nothing is too much trouble for them. I had e mailed a request for some items to be in the rooms before we arrived as a surprise for my family, this was done exactly as I had requested without any fuss or disclosure to my family. Brilliant. The Lennox is one block away from Newbury St, 10 min walk from the common and 15min from the center of Boston or 2 min walk from the transit system. So the Lennox is within easy reach of every thing in Boston. Wouldn't now stay at any other Hotel in Boston. If you wish to eat in the Hotel Restaurant at a time convinient to you, book early, as it is pretty popular, although you are not short of places to eat in the area. This is the best Hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in the US. Honestly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DUNTRAVELING
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for four nights on a short break ,it is as has been said before a great hotel in an excellent location the staff were excellent throughout. We booked via Virgin Holidays it was cheaper tor us to take a package than book it ourselves. We used the 'T' from Logan to Copley it cost $2 each and took about 35 mins from picking up the bags in reclaim, the hotel is a 3 minute walk from the Station. We easily walked from the hotel to all the tourist attractions in this fine city, there is a good selection shops and Malls within 5 minute walk, take a stroll along Newbury St for top end shops!. There are numerous bars and resturants within a 5 minute walk on Boyleston st. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other members

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: erictcow
Reviews.Content: I can't really say much more than has been said before. This hotel is very good, and one of the best that I have ever stayed in I really can't find fault. A major reason for this hotel being the success it is, must be the staff who are very polite and helpful. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough

Reviews.Title: “very nice room w/ fireplace, great location, but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Hovard
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room with fireplace and king size bed. It was all very nice if a bit ornate. Bathroom was small but comfortable. Water pressure a little wanting. Room tended to be a little warm, but the windows opened easily. Very comfortable bed. Wireless internet was free but slow by most modern standards. In-room breakfast from room service was terrible, on a par with the worst breakfast buffets at X times the price, though the pot of tea was quite good. Staff was very helpful, and the bellmen who made our fire at night were a hoot. Room was clean and housekeeping was attentive. Great area for restaurants, shopping, walking into downtown areas. Not sure I would go back, but it was a fun experience. From reading other reviews, I think we got one of the best rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: donalmca
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, usually about 3 months of the year to Asia, US, Middle East. I say that in order to put some context on what follows; The staff at the Lenox were very welcoming and continued to be helpful at all times, the rooms were always clean and the whole environment was warm & traditional but with a nice mix of the modern (free internet, Ipod docking station, HD TV's) to make it a very satisfactory stay. The location was superb with all of the major sights within walking distance. Shoppers have Newbury Street and the Prudential and Copley Square malls right on the doorstep. I will definitely be staying here on my next visit to Boston and can honestly say that this is, Dollar for Dollar, one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service and location unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: J0Sydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox for 2 nights for our wedding anniversary just before Thanksgiving and our immediate impression was the elegant lobby and how helpful and attentive the front desk and concierge were in helping us with sightseeing options. The service was impeccable, the best we have experienced in any 5 star hotel and the room with the fireplace was also amazing. On our first night the staff kindly left a gift of chocolates and red wine in our room for our anniversary which was a very nice touch and for our last night we had dinner at the hotel's restaurant - Azure. The food and service was equally enjoyable and the crispy pork belly fondue was delicious. Boston is one of our favourite holiday destinations and we highly recommend The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Choice Location, Outstanding concierge service”
Reviews.Author: urbantraveler61
Reviews.Content: The perfect location for a weekend stay in Boston. One block away from Newberry Street, Boston Public Library and Back Bay amenities. Just a block from subway to North End and other points of interest. Concierges Keith and Jason saved our Thanksgiving by arranging transportation for our daughter whose airplane was diverted to another airport. All of this on a holiday! Add 24 hour fitness center, free internet and late night service at the restaurant. We will definitely stay here when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding service, stunning hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: John340
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Lenox hotel while visitng Boston. The staff were very welcoming and attentive at all times. In particular the Concierge were extremely helpful and made lots of recommendations for things to do ensuring we had a trip to remember! The rooms had all the facilities we needed and the hotel is beautifully decorated throughout. We'd recommend it to anyone, and go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service to be Found”
Reviews.Author: ewcooke
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel are amazing, however they do the hotel little justice. All of the staff is amazing. They make you feel like you are the only person staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Good starting point in Boston before exploring beautiful New Eng"”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOlic
Reviews.Content: We had 2 x Nights at the Lenox, Boston before the start of a New Eng tour. To be honest travelling from the UK & being slightly jet-lagged we were tired & it was great to arrive to a clean Hotel. But why is it you always persist in putting us Brits in a room right next to the elevator ! Noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of Class....as we expected”
Reviews.Author: clano76
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Lenox. We booked it (2 couples) based on the reviews here. To be honest, there is not a lot I can say about the hotel that hasn't been said already by other reviewers but here goes anyway.... Check in friendly and efficient. Nice Porter brought bags to our room. The concierge was extremely helpful (Jason) - he made dinner reservations, rental car bookings, gave directions, anything we asked of him basically.
