We had the breakfast one morning - $88 for 4 people. Expensive but worth it we thought. Rooms were clean, and well presented. We had the junior suite double/double and our friends had the superior double. Both rooms were nicely furnished with clean bathrooms etc. Maid service was good and not obtrusive like you can get in other hotels. Overall would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody thinking of travelling to Boston. It is clear why it is currently no. 1 on the TA list for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: archie1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lenox for 4 nights: the location, room, service etc was all excellent. No complaints at all. Will stay there again when I am back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “its all been said really.......”
Reviews.Author: Carnadem
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a five night stay at the Lenox, we visited boston about five years ago and had such a good time we decided to go back. We chose The Lenox this time, after reading all the glowing reports on trip advisor, and i have to say the reports really are spot on. The reports about the staff being very friendly especially, every one always acknowledged you on entering and leaving the hotel and i must add they came across as very sincere. they really were a great bunch! The hotel itself was very comfortable and had a lovely cosy feel to it. The room we had was quite large with two queen size beds which were lovely and comfortable. Also, the hotel is perfectly placed on Boyleston street for shopping, restaurants and bars. Other than that, it really has all been said in the earlier reviews

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: FionaSwansea
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped through the door into the lobby, we felt at home. From the bell hop to the manager, the staff were fantastic. We have travelled all over the world, but have never stayed in a hotel like this. A wonderful experience. When we go back to Boston, there is only one hotel to stay, and that is The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great location, staff amazing.”
Reviews.Author: erinDublin
Reviews.Content: Five family members spent 2 nights in the Lenox Hotel. From the moment we arrived at the Hotel to the time of departure the staff could not do enough for us. We were always greeted with a smile. No complaints whatsoever about the room. It was spacious and there was a turndown service at night with Lindt chocs left on bed. There was tea/coffee in the lobby in the morning. Only complaint no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast was perfect. Our waitress was very efficient, welcoming and friendly. There are also plenty of eateries nearby. Concierge was a gem. Nothing was too much trouble for him. Location was great. Within walking distance of most sights. Shops on Newbury Street, and the Prudential Centre was a short walk away. Had organised tickets from home for a Show in the Opera House. There was a kiosk 1 block from hotel selling half price tickets on the day. Am looking forward to my next stay at the Lenox Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Lanno
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a lovely comfortable corner room with 2 king size beds. The staff were all very helpful and had lots of local advice. We could walk outside into an interesting area with shops and restaurants, or wander into downtown Boston. If you have a car you should be aware that the hotel parking is very expensive and should make your own arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend with the girls!”
Reviews.Author: MJohnsToronto
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend with some girlfriends in Boston and the Lenox was a great place to stay. We had two junior suites and the rooms were extremely large for the price we paid. The furnishings are a bit ornate, but the suites worked well since we had 3 people per room. The location of the hotel is fantastic for shopping and the lobby bar was a great place to start and end our evenings out. Lots of locals actually come to the Lenox just to go to the lobby bar. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: I do not understand what other reviewers on TripAdvisor experienced at The Lenox unless they were mesmerized by a martini at the hotel bar. I paid over $300 for a "Deluxe" room and was given an aged room with furnishings and decor at least 10 years old. While the room was a decent size, there was no mini bar, just an empty old miniscule refrigerator with a dusty ice bucket sitting on top. The wooden desk had nicks and gouges and the vinyl wall paper was in disrepair. A fake, cheap Colonial chandelier didn't compliment the dime store lamps on either side of the bed. I constantly had to squint to read anything. The bathroom had plenty of thick towels, but it was small, dingy, and it dire need of an upgrade and renovation. It would have been rather appropos in 1978. While the location of the Lenox in Back Bay is excellent, there is a plethora of better hotels in this area. The Lobby is small and crowded at all times and both bars are loud and crowded constantly. We came back to the hotel afetr a fine meal at Number 9 Park and wanted a quick nightcap, but were denied entrance to both bars because they were too crowded. Shameful! It is almost criminal with what this hotel charges to what it delivers. I advise you to look elsewhere for a decent hotel experience in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Overrated but an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cajeju
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel from the inside. However, in our room on the upper floor we could hear the elevator moter, every time it went into service. Unfortunately the main restaurant was closed for renovations the week we were there and we had to eat breakfast at the Irish Pub in the hotel. This also needed a redecoration, maybe it is already on the list of management. Service as to be expected from such a hotel but considering the room rates, this hotel is overrated.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenos knows customer service!”
Reviews.Author: getgoingtoday
Reviews.Content: Weather was bad, but had a great experience at the Lenox. Very relaxing atmosphere and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNesterHawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for four nights mid-October, couldn't have been more pleased with the stay. The hotel has the right combination of that old world charm (because of it's historic status) and modernization to the common areas and rooms themselves. The staff, everyone that we dealt with were first class and made us feel like we were VIPs. Being that this was our first trip to Boston the information, directions, recommendations were perfect for our needs. I can't say enough about how nice a property the Lenox is- great central location, great service, great "people" staff, The next time we visit Boston, the Lenox will be at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: MollyMacLeod
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one evening at The Lenox so she could attend an interview at Tufts University. I can't say enough about the friendly and helpful staff at this hotel. When we realized that an important item had not been packed, the concierge actually ran to the store for us in the pouring rain. To me that is exceptional service. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. If we need to travel to Boston in the future I would not hesitate to stay at the Lenox again. My only complaint is that we could only stay one night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel, full of character but with 21st Century touches.”
Reviews.Author: alMossah
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Oct. Generally hotel is excellent. Specifically, Good: Room size, furnishings, bed size and comfort, en-suite. The window opens, so source of fresh air. In-room fridge. Staff very attentive (look out for 80-year old Aussie Jimmie in reception). Solas Irish pub; good Sam Adams and snacks. Quiet; very thick walls, carpeted corridors. Free WiFi. Free internet access in business centre. General old-fashioned ambience. Modern wide-screen TV. Poor: No tea or coffee-making in the room; when it's 4am and you're wide awake because you're still on UK time, a cup of tea is sorely missed. Once the water wasn't hot, despite running the tap for 5 mins. Breakfast was pricy and not brilliant; go to Charley's on Newbury and Gloucester St instead. But the positives far outweigh the negatives; this is a lovely old-fashioned hotel, and I'd recommend it to anyone unless you have mobility problems; both entrances require you to get up stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service...always with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: pinkylala
Reviews.Content: Went here as a group of 4 for father-in-laws birthday, fabulous location near to great shopping areas. The staff were always brilliant with any thing and at any time of the day or night, and they sent up a present of wine for the birthday boy! The restaurant and bar were fabulous, and the irish bar had charm-we tried them all! Free coffee and tea in the mornings too which was great! Definitely recommend this hotel! p.s. for a true-feel breakfast head to Trident books on Newbury Street!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Andisea
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of reviews and were not disappointed! Although booked into one of the smallest rooms, it was cosy and sufficient, and the hotel is close to all attractions and events. The staff were all pleasant and in particular Tom the concierge and all the girls in the bar were friendly and helpful. A highly enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: agoura
Reviews.Content: the hotel and its staff are absolutely the best. The gardenia fragrance in the lobby is very pleasant. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The beds are plush and linens crisps. The location is very central within walking distance of exclusive shops and restaurants, Beacon hill and the Commons. The staff is super nice and helpful. Great hotel and a great value. We have recommended this hotel many times and everyone has had a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Great warmth & personal touches makes this hotel a winner”
Reviews.Author: Bebe38
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here, in a Corner Fireplace Room, a Classic Room and a Doubles. I loved the hotel because of it's staff - everyone warm and friendly, from the doormen to the housekeepers - everyone seems to have a smile all the time. An elegant hotel but very unpretentious, large rooms (we were on the 6th floor), clean and comfortable, and the location is superb for Back Bay shopping. The only thing I didn't like is the room decor - it's old fashioned and rather dated in style. I wouldn't pick this hotel for a sophisticated couples weekend, (would want more luxury and more modern decor) but as a friendly family trip, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great accommodations overshadowed by staff”
Reviews.Author: Jake001
Reviews.Content: Our three-week trip to Boston and Nantucket started with the most incredible and comfortable stay in The Lenox in Boston, where the accommodations were truly excellent but paled in comparison to how helpful, informative, and simply pleasant the staff was throughout our four-day stay there â€” from recommending restaurants and a great art exhibit to directions and the simple amenities. We highly recommend it; weâ€™ll stay there again on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WWK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favorite hotels anywhere. It has old world service ( similar to what the Ritz Carlton used to offer before they were taken over) in one of Boston's most central locations with excellent shopping just outside the door. The rooms are mostly gorgeous, especially the ones that end in double zeros, which are executive kings with working fireplaces and sweeping views of Boylston Street/Back Bay. The staff is wonderful, and they definitely go the extra mile in making sure that each guest has an efficient check-in and a perfect stay. The only complaint I can really make is that this hotel is becoming so popular, it's sometimes hard to find availability!

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: asturias2905
Reviews.Content: convenient free internet great staff free chocolates free water

Reviews.Title: “Service makes it # 1”
Reviews.Author: jbags39
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Lenox Hotel after a fall foliage trip through New England. I see now why everyone rates this hotel #1 in Boston! From the moment we stopped our car at the door, we were greeted as though we were special guests of this lovely establishment. The doorman, Peter, was extremely gracious and helpful and set the bar high for the service to follow. Well, the bar never dipped and everyone we encountered during our stay was extremely friendly, always helpful, and NEVER too busy to attend to our needs. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was a fabulous corner room with 2 beds that were absolutely some of the most comfortable I have every slept in. The room was very spacious and the cold bottled water waiting for us in the fridge was a nice welcome. Other hotels could learn a great deal from this establishment. I highly recommend spending a few extra dollars when in Boston and stay at the Lenox. You won't be sorry!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZakRichardson
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, staff and location. I would recommend this hotel to anybody for leisure or business. Deserves the billing of no.1 hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Schrink
Reviews.Content: Everything functions. You are downtown, staff is fast, efficient, friendly and attentive. Umbrellas are at hand, good breakfast in the pub, free and fast internet, clean rooms, good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2511
Reviews.Content: location is excellent, tube journey from airport is only $2 pp and about 30mins (take free bus 33, 55 or 66 to the T), close to pretty much everything, the only reason why I put a 4 out of 5 is because I was slightly disappointed with our room, it was very small and very dark, but to be honest I might a bit picky since the room was clean, quiet and service perfect! I really recommend the aquarium, whale watch and quincy market were the food is fab and very good priced!

Reviews.Title: “First-rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: clubmanana
Reviews.Content: I just finished a short stay at the Lenox Hotel and have to say that my stay far exceeded my expectations. I agree with the person who compared it to the Ritz Carlton. The service and attention is about the same, except at the Lenox it is even more personal as the hotel is smaller. The staff is excellent, the place is spotless and well-furnished, my room was charming and large enough, and the location is superb. The Lenox is a delight from A to Z. I usually stay across the street at the larger Marriott and Westin hotels in Copley Place, but will always try to get a room at the Lenox first from now on. My one complaint is that I felt housekeeping was a little too loud in the hall a little too early and, judging from the way the criticism was received, I would expect it to be perfect on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: lamboil
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive till the moment you leave , the service is impeccable and they just make you feel like the most important person on earth . The location is great , near Newburry st. where you find good restaurants and nice shops . My wife was as happy as me . It is just a great place to stay and don't forget to talk with Jimmy the valet who is now 85 years old , in perfect shape and can talk to you about the Worl War 2 like if it was yesterday , Just a great person . Thanks for the great service .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: soccergal_34
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip for my husband as a surprise before our first baby comes in January. I work in the Hotel industry and found myself taking notes about how to improve my 4 star property through stealing ideas from the staff of the Lenox. Upon arrival, valet was prompt, quick and informational. Led us into the front desk for our check in. The front desk staff answered all of my questions, pointed me to great restaurants, shopping ect. Asked if I needed anything special and why I was visiting Boston. I felt like family! We walked into our room and immediately, the phone was ringing to see if "everything was to our liking". I had prearranged for sparkingling cidar and chocolate covered strawberries to be delievered and they were waiting for us! The room was a handicapp accessible room (which we didn't need) but enjoyed the space! The view...there wasn't one, but that was not on our list of important details. The bathroom was VERY spacious and clean. The only little problem...the sink counter space is way to small to put any of your toiletries on. If that's all I have to complain about, then it was a perfect stay. The conceirge knows his stuff and doesn't hesitate to reccommend places to eat, shop ect. Also, the manager on duty in the lobby greets EVERYONE with personal contact of a hello, nod, smile or a question about their stay. Perfect location for the Hotel, as we walked all over the city. Close to Newberry, Fenway, and if you're up to is, Faneuill Hall. I would absolutely go back to this hotel!! The restaurant was under construction and closed, which we didn't know about ahead of time, but again, not a big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations, good location and Best Service I've EVER experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Nor_Cal_Foodie
Reviews.Content: My wife, 1 year old daughter, and I recently stayed for a week at the Lenox. We LOVED our experience. The hotel staff were ALL attentative, gracious, friendly, and helpful. From providing a hotel car and driver to get us to our anniversary meal to providing extra pillow chocolates to giving directions and assistance, the staff (from manager to maid) were great. If we ever find ourselves in Boston, we'll definitely stay at the Lenox again. The room was clean, the TV was nice, the shower and bathroom worked well, our bed was always turned down well, and all of our requests were handled promptly and properly (crib, duck tour tickets, etc.). And get this, not only did room service come quickly, but the food was actually tasty and still warm!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: staffstraveller15
Reviews.Content: I only booked this hotel 4 days before departure, after reading terrible reviews about a different Boston hotel and got a good weekend rate. The room was lovely, I booked a Queen Bed room and it was far bigger than an equivalent room in London, a small fridge in the room was a pleasant surprise. The bathroom was small but very nice, with a large walk in shower, Aveda products and an excellent hairdryer, also a bathrobe. There are larger rooms available, (I always study the floor plan on the fire instructions), but this was perfectly adequate for 2 people. There is a turn down service every evening with Lindt chocolates. We only ate breakfast on the first morning, it was rather expensive and disappointing. The restaurant was closed for refurbishment the following day, so it may change when it re-opens. The Irish bar downstairs was okay, but not much Irish atmosphere, they also serve food, but we didn't try it. There is free coffee in the lobby, but limited hours during the breakfast period, possibly until about 10am. It only takes about 5-10 mins to walk around to the Prudential Centre, a local mall. The Prudential Tower is open for a panoramic view of Boston which was good, but don't expect a similar experience to "The Top of The Rock" in New York. It is possible to buy a discounted ticket for this and the Duck Tour, the ticket desk is in the Mall, upstairs from The Cheescake Factory. The nearest MBTA station is less than 5 minutes walk away, it was manned and we were given assistance to get the correct "Charlie Card", which is similar to the Oyster card.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: AH1111
Reviews.Content: Booked due to Trip Advisor rating & not disappointed. They fall over themselves to help & got a free upgrade to a bigger room due to 6 night stay. Fab location only a couple of hundred yards to the 'T' underground which is clean, cheap & safe. Neighbourhood is lovely, old Victorian mansions & now all the posh shops have moved in too on Newbury St, the next street over. Also a mall which is open late. Tip - if you only want a light breakfast then the public library (fantastic building) has a cafe - bagel & juice is only $4 with a great location in the open courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...Trip Advisor was right!”
Reviews.Author: foredeck
Reviews.Content: What a treat. The staff was beyond great! Vincent took our bags to our room, filled our ice bucket, set the thermostat, and told us about breakfast. Tom was an A++ waiter at breakfast. Told us about some VERY good places to eat. There was a hotel car (Lexus) to return us to the airport. My camera died and they gave us a set of batteries (at no cost).The room was cozy and well appointed. The hotel is close to almost everything. We could walk to the places we wanted to see or walk one block to the subway (the T). We WILL come back to The Lenox!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Krefelder
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of September/beginning of October. It was a superlative experience from the moment we entered the lobby and were greeted by reception (with a complementary upgrade), to the moment we left shepherded to our airport taxi by an attentive porter. The hotel occupies a prime location in Back Bay with easy access to transport links (including the T!) Our room, with twin queen beds was spacious and well furnished. We didn't manage to catch the magic fairy who turned down our beds every evening (and left Lindt chocolates on the bedside) but if we had, she'd have come back to UK with us! (We didn't eat at the Lenox, preferring to breakfast either in the Prudential's food court or at The Quincy food market, with evenings in Harvard or one of Boston's seafood restaurants). Overall an outstanding, traditional hotel with a dedicated and attentive staff who provided us with a memorable experience in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: upstatedoc
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at The Lenox. From the moment I pulled up to unload until checkout I received excellent service from the hotel staff. From the Front Desk to Bellman to operator to restaurant all were excellent ...professional and truly seemed to enjoy their job. My room was excellent ...very clean...well appointed and comfortable. My AAA cost was lower than all the nearby large chain hotels. The only negative from me was the $40 /day parking fee...I think quite common at Back Bay Hotels. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IreneS_9
Reviews.Content: My family, including two twenty something year olds, stayed at your gorgeous hotel over this past weekend. The great experience started the minute we got out of the car. Jimmy, who took care of the luggage is a gem and so is the rest of the staff. The hotel is beautiful and the location could not be better. We cannot wait to visit Boston again and stay at this fine hotel. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms1605
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great, got excellent rate directly online for a Junior Suite which was fab. Location was brilliant and near everything, able to walk everywhere. Staff were really friendly and helpful and provided maps and directions whenever needed. Will def be going back to Boston and staying at this Hotel again. The bar next door to the Hotel was also good and busy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Kmaxx
Reviews.Content: In brief, top class hotel right bang in the commercial heart of the city. Walkable to everywhere. The hotel even gets a mention on the Duck Tour (another must do) as a historical listed building. 3 of us stayed in the junior suite which was more than adequate. They supplied a 3rd bed without any charge.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: we booked The Lenox as we wanted to stay somewhere nice in Boston at the end of our travels. It had great write up on tripadvisor which is why we selected it and we weren't disappointed. The location is great, really close to Newbury Street - shopping, bars and restaurants and also has some other great restaurants nearby. There are also several malls nearby and the main part of town is not far to walk. We loved it. The room was large, huge comfy bed, fridge, bathrobes....perfect. We didn't have breakfast included but Trader Joes and Shaws are nearby if you are on a budget as we were. The staff were lovely - all very helpful. We liked the free wi-fi, water and chocolates when they came to turn down your bed in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: weddingvisi2r
Reviews.Content: We visited the Lenox for 3 days and had a marvellous time! Our room was lovely, we had free bottled water and a fridge for our own use (not a silly pressure sensitive minibar). It was in a great location with plenty of local restaurants, and the turn-down service was very nice (particularly the Lindt chocolates on the pilows). But the thing that made the Lenox so special was the service. Lauren on reception who greeted us on our first day was really friendly and welcoming. Our first evening we ordered room service and after we received our first course complimentary wine and puddings were sent up to our room with a note from Lauren welcoming us and wishing us the best for our wedding next year. Throughout the rest of our stay all staff were so friendly and approachable they really made our holiday special. Definitely a hotel I would stay in again and would recommend to anyone staying in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Lenox staff made our trip very special...”
Reviews.Author: kimfromoc
Reviews.Content: First time writing a review, but felt compelled to share my wonderful experience and stories of the great customer service from the staff at the Lenox. Called the Lenox to reserve a room to come out to Boston for a one night stay to see U2 play at Gillette Stadium for our 26th wedding anniversary. I asked the reservationist if we should rent a car to drive to the concert or take the train. She said she would have the concierge call me to discuss options. Sure enough, Keith called and let me know that there is no train going to Gillette and recommended we rent a car. Had he not called, we would have relied upon a train that was not available. We asked Peter, the doorman, how to coordinate picking up heavy tailgate essentials (beer, cooler, sandwiches, chips, dip and ice) from Shaw's grocery store down the block, and getting it back to our car at the Lenox. No worries, says Peter! He coordinated Sam, the other doorman, to drive us in our car to Shaw's and waited on the curb while we shopped. We were in and out of there in no time, and on the road to the concert and the tailgate party. How amazing is that? I'd informed the reservationist that it was our anniversary trip and we were upgraded to an Executive King room with a great view of Boylston Street. Awesome! Bed was extremely comfortable, the room was spotless and they turned down the bed, which is a very nice touch. The nicest part was a bottle of champagne and a personalized note was left in our room upon our return from the concert. Classy! Tom, the concierge, was wonderful and organized our fantastic duck tour, which is a short walk from the Lenox at the Prudential building. Highly recommend, especially our tour guide, Hardly Davidson! Great overview of the city in an hour and twenty minutes. Also,the bellman recommended the Atlantic Fish Restuarant across from the Lenox for lunch. I ordered the Maine Lobster Roll and my husband had crab cakes. The food was absolutely delicious and the outside seating on Boylston was perfect for people watching. Can't wait for the next trip to Boston.The Lenox....here we come! (hope I got all the names right!)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dgbint
Reviews.Content: A really nice, comfortable classy hotel. Just a little old fashioned much like me. Superbly located and only a few minutes walk to many Boston icons. I will make this my first choice when I next return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 10, and then some...”
Reviews.Author: stillgoneDC
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I don't believe in perfection and pride myself in the ability to find the smallest of imperfections. I'm more likely to be spurred to file a trip advisor report when I've been annoyed about something than with praise. However the Lenox hotel is one of those rare occurrences in life when you truly experience perfection. The location is ideal, walking distance to just about any part of town. I even walked (ok ran) to the Bunker Hill Monument from there and walked back from the north end in less than 30 minutes at a leisurely pace. And you don't even have to leave the hotel as you can dine and enjoy some very hip cocktails in a very popular lobby lounge where as a guest you'll be treated very well by the professional doorman minding the rope line. To their credit, at max capacity, the lobby lounge, called City Bar, is still refreshingly easy to navigate, and you should dress to impress. The last time I had stayed at the Lenox was when I was a very young child in the 1970's, when the hotel was in dire need of an upgrade. Well, I'm happy to report they did it, and it couldn't have been done better. Large, spacious rooms, extremely comfortable rooms, huge flat screen TV, Bose sound dock for your ipod, I had a walk in closet, a refrigerator with two complimentary bottles of water a day and a very well appointed set of bath supplies. The service made me check to make sure I was still in Boston (I can say this as a Boston native who moved away 20 years ago). Although you take your life in your own hands on the roads of Boston to get to the hotel, once you enter the the protective embrace of the hotel you'll be well taken care of. Starting with the very polite and efficient valet service ($41 a day) you'll be handed off to Jimmy Fisher, a doorman who's been working at the hotel since 1949 (yes, 60 years) who will make you feel like a long lost and adored relative. If you have the time, Jimmy will entertain you for hours with his stories of the movie stars and the mobsters that have passed through the doors of the hotel during his tenure and make sure he shows you the Jimmy Fisher Suite, which they named in his honor for such long service. I could go on and on about the service, room, overall experience, but instead I'll sum it up by saying I easily spend more than 120 nights a year away from home on business and during play and have done so for most of the last two decades. This hotel stands out as one of my top ten hotel experiences and shares a place in my personal hotel hall of fame that includes the Four Seasons Bangkok, the Pi Pi Princess Resort in Kho Pi pi Thailand, and Starpass Resort in Tuscon.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: thejollyfarmers
Reviews.Content: All the staff were great - we were upgraded which may cause bias. The desk staff and Concierge (particularly Keith) were unbelievably helpful and polite, making our stay special by arranging tickets for a ball game and great restaurant recommendations. However, the doormen and bellhops were the best I have ever come across - so good our only regret is not tipping them more!! If you visit Boston, this a a great hotel in a fantastic location, so stay here - you won't be disappointed. (room service is expensive though)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experiene”
Reviews.Author: RIfolks
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a gem of a hotel. It is a bit of a walk to Fenway Park but it is a nice walk. All of the shopping in the center of the city is nearby. The restaurant is wonderful and we enjoyed the pub.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, the best service. Absolutely 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: PinkCrabNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend, and had a wonderful stay. Everyone (concierge, bellman, bartender at City Bar, and the housekeeping staff) was fantastic. A top-notch hotel in a great location. Bedding was fabulous. I have not slept this well in years. The City Bar was great. Our bartender was fabulous. Everyone welcomed us to the hotel, and made sure our stay was perfect. And the location can't be beat. I would definitely stay again. I would not even consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: tkbama
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston to celebrate my wife's birthday Since this was our first trip to Boston I carefully researched hotels by reading just about every tripadvisor review on top rated Boston hotels. I didn't think any hotel could live up to the incredible reviews written about The Lenox. I was wrong. The Lenox met and even exceeded every expectation we had (and we had high expectations going into this trip). The location is excellent (we walked or rode the T everywhere, even from/to the airport), the hotel is beautiful and comfortable, and the staff is excellent in every way. When they found out that it was my wife's birthday they did everything they could to make her stay special. In her words she felt like a princess. The only downside is the pressure that puts on me now that we're home. I hesitate to mention names for fear I'll leave someone out. Suffice it to say that Dan Donahue, general manager has assembled a top notch staff who understand how to be professional without being pretentious. It's no mistake that The Lenox Hotel is number one in Boston. They certainly deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Infomaniac_1
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston on a very hot and humid day and it was lovely to be greeted so warmly as we checked in at the Lenox, and to be shown up to our room. Our corner room on the 10th floor was quiet and well away from the elevator, both of which I had specificially requested. It was a very spacious room with two large windows and a fridge complete with complimentary bottled water, a large desk, a very large chest of drawers, a decent sized table and two comfortable chairs, lots of storage, a flatscreen TV and very nice Aveda toiletries in the bathroom. And black-out curtains, which really did work well. Furnishings were traditional and the two double beds were really comfortable with very nice quality linens. The air conditioning worked extremely well - vital in temperatures into the 90s during our 5 day stay. Breakfast in Azure and dnner one evening in the Irish pub, Solas, were each delicious and the service was very good. The standard of service throughout the hotel was exemplary - we were very impressed. The location is excellent - a short walk to the shops and restaurants in Boylston and Newberry Streets and to the shopping malls of Copley Place and the Prudential. Copley 'T' station was just a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel and the trains were air conditioned! A real delight when you're used to uncomfortably hot London tube trains in the UK. Providing you don't have mobility problems you can walk pretty much anywhere in central/downtown Boston without any trouble. When we return to Boston we'll have no hesitation in staying at The Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: cyberbob2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox for one night. We arrived late at night and left early, we really only needed a bed for the night. The room we got was very good value for the price. The neighbourhood is good, with many shops and restaurants nearby. We had dinner in the old part of Boston and it's too far to walk. The room was nice. The window pointed to the next wall, but that didn't worry us. The bathroom was very small, though. That's the only real drawback and annoyed us a little. Otherwise a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nevrstp247
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for one night at the Hotel Lenox. Our room was huge and beautifully decorated. We were in a quiet corner room. The hotel is in a Great location. Just up the street from Newbury. If you plan on going to the Granary or touring up that way, it's quite a hike, but a wonderful walk!! The hotel concierge was the greatest! He was very helpful and polite! I would highly recommend this hotel and we plan on going back this winter!!

Reviews.Title: “Life is short”
Reviews.Author: kathy601970
Reviews.Content: So why not stay someplace luxurious? Gave my husband and me a treat by staying overnight in a hotel after a Red Sox game. My decision to stay at the Lenox Hotel was the right one. The hotel staff is wonderful, the rooms large and comfortable. The view from the 10th floor, unbelievable!! The location of the hotel can't be beat. Can't wait to stay here again......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: bevo02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lennox with my husband and 11 month old from August 18-22. This was great hotel for us. We would stay here again if ever come back to Boston. When we arrived we were greeted by the doorman, who also helped us with our bags. As we were waiting to check-in one of their employees brought over a stuffed frog for our daughter. Right away, this sent a great message to me about their level of service. An example of their great service: we needed to find a thermometer for our daughter and they sent the security guard out to get one for us. The service at the hotel was beyond what we expected. Our room was on the 4th floor. It was big enough for the crib, stroller and our stuff. The closet in our room was huge. It was by far the biggest closet I have seen at a hotel. The bathroom was tiny and there wasn't a lot of counter space. Howerver, my husband and I still didn't have any problems when trying to get ready. This is a quiet hotel in that we never heard the people above or next to us during our stay. The location was very central to everything in Boston. It was only a couple of blocks from Copley Square. There was a Dunkin Donuts, Uno Chicago Grill and Starbucks across the street from the hotel. There is a Shaw's Grocery store one block behind the hotel. We walked everywhere and it was close to the freedom trail, the Public Garden, The Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever, said my husband,”
Reviews.Author: hellomissk
Reviews.Content: and I agree completely. What was at times a very trying trip with two children under 2 1/2 was made so much more pleasant by the Lenox. We stayed twice, on either end of a weekend trip to Maine, and were very well taken care of by the outstanding staff. From the toy frogs for the kids to the extremely considerate and thoroughly appreciated room upgrade, we couldn't have asked for more. The location was ideal, and we always received prompt help with our stroller and baggage. Before we stayed, I emailed the hotel with a list of questions and almost immediately received and thorough response - big points there. I am not much of a review writer, and I have travelled extensively, so for me to go through this process means the hotel was really something else. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and elegance in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Janeite
Reviews.Content: My room was on the small side, but perfectly comfortable for one person. The bed was heavenly--down blanket, fluffy pillows, luxurious sheets. The bathroom was small but beautifully appointed. My window had a very nice city view, and my room was deliciously quiet. The only downside was room-service breakfast, which is something I really look forward to on a trip. The Oj and coffee were excellent, the bacon very good, the French toast mediocre, and the potatoes inedible. The desk clerk removed the charge very graciously, and apologized. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Susie077London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel for 2 nights this summer and loved it! The staff were friendlier and more helpful than anywhere I have ever stayed--nothing was too much trouble. The concierge was great, too. Why stay at a huge, faceless chain hotel when you can stay at a very elegant hotel with personal service?? The rooms were very large, too. Finally, the location could not have been better--very central!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Central Location, Great Service in Central Boston Location”
Reviews.Author: epharma
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston to visit colleges with my family (two teenagers) and decided to stay at the Lenox (I know Boston and visit on business often, but never stayed at the Lenox). Hotel is older, classic building but in mint condition. Had a junior suite ($285/night), room 923. Room was large with 2 queen beds, a loveset/sofa, arm chair, and coffee table. Large closet and lots of drawers. Very nicely decorated/furnished. Large, nice bathroom with excellent shower. Just a note that the Fireplace was not a working fireplace. Hotel staff was extremely helpful. Free WIFI internet. And the Staff understands service--they are quick to respond and very helpful. Had breakfast in hotel restaurant. Good, American breakfast, reasonably priced. Location is perfect: Center of town, right at Copely Center, 1/2 block to Newberry Street shops and "T" (subway) station (Green line, Copley stop). Can take "T" a few stops to get on Red Line and be in Cambridge in 10-15 minutes (Harvard Square). Also CVS and other stores nearby (Lord & Taylor right next door). If this is in your price range, I'd strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveANiceHotel
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in every way. The location, the price, the amenities . . . and the SERVICE is top notch. EVERYONE from the facilities crew to housekeeping to the concierges to the manager is helpful and pleasant. I felt like a guest in their home. I will always stay here when in Boston. Great food in their Azure restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Perfect--Absolutely Heaven (complete with angels)”
Reviews.Author: kw2001
Reviews.Content: As a travel journalist, I've been blessed to stay in some of the world's most wonderful properties--but never have I experienced the level of service that I had the absolute pleasure to experience during my recent stay at The Lenox Hotel. I was in Boston, not on business, seeing my son off to the Navy, and wrote the concierge to ask for several things...a cutting board to use for the homemade bread I was bringing, ripe fruit for the soon-to-be sailor for replenishment after his workout in the hotel gym, and a disposable razor for him to take to Basic. Not only were these requests fulfilled and cheerfully, but the entire staff went out of their way to thank him for his future service--bought him a Guinness in the Irish Pub downstairs (great Shepherd's Pie too), left him Gatorade and me chocolates (for being a "great mom" the handwritten note said), even made a point of introducing him to an 85-yr-old bellman who served in the British Navy during WWII. The valets, concierges (especially Jason and Tom), desk staff, bellmen even the maids and bartender were first-rate--helpful, polite, friendly and thoughtful. From a gorgeous room with a sitting area for long chats, beds so comfortable he was even able to sleep the night before his induction (if I could have packed the comforter, I would have), hot showers with Aveda products (my favorite), great water pressure and fluffy towels, Bose dock for my ipod (to play a few Irish rebel songs to see him on his way), an all-important fitness center, a great location (just minutes to the induction center and perfect for shopping or site-seeing) and a lovely lobby and terrific Irish Pub just downstairs, The Lenox Hotel could not have made our stay anymore enjoyable and... On the morning of the induction ceremony, when an emergency loss of paperwork almost kept my son from shipping out, the staff was right there--one and all--helping me to rectify the problem (even though it was 4:30 AM!) and off the young man went--in no small part thanks to the staff. If hotels could be rated 6 stars, The Lenox would deserve them all.

Reviews.Title: “Must be at the very top top of mid range options”
Reviews.Author: jadeb
Reviews.Content: Very good value stay here with no extra charge for teenage son in a spacious double double' junior suite. As is clear from their website the rooms are traditional and 'flouncy swathes of curtain' in style but had very modern large flat screen tv and wi fi access included in the price. Location was great and we enjoyed a decent 'home cooking style' reasonably priced meal in their adjacent Solas Irish pub. Room service breakfast was also good and their huge portion of blueberry pancakes was very much enjoyed. Service was efficient and super friendly, If anything it was perhaps a bit too 'over the top' and artificially friendly for our British taste but that is hardly a major criticism ! Bathroom was a tad small given size of pour room but everything worked, thier were lots of fluffly towels and it was spotless. We were able to arrange late check out to accomodate our early evening flight back home and this effectively afforded us an extra day on holiday and so was very good news and well worth the cost. All in all a very good value option for Boston in a hotel which offered many genuinely higher range comforts for a highly reasonable price that undercuts the more securely five star places such as 'the four seasons hotel' by a considerable margin.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: faithfan01
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at The Lenox! The bedding, window treatments, and carpet were all very nice. All of the staff were wonderful, and it's right in the middle of everything. We could easily walk to the Boston Commons, the original Cheers, and much more. It's definitely more pricey than most hotels where I have stayed, but you definitely get what you pay for at The Lenox! We did not dine at any of the restaurants, but we did order breakfast from the room service menu, and everything was great. This might sound weird to some, but I even felt like I could walk around barefoot in this hotel (for most, I wear slippers or flip flops). I feel like that's saying a lot for a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: whererwegoing
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I decided to book The Lenox after reading the many reviews here on Trip Advisor. When I booked it was ranked number three and now its at number one! From the moment one enters the door, the delicious sent of something....still trying to figure it out filled the air. It was lovely! Everyone is so helpful and ready to anwer a question, give a suggestion, or just smile and say hi. These things are so important when one is traveling and in a new area where you dont know one street from another and all the faces are strangers. We were there two nights but we have many thanks to Sid, the bellhop the who gaves us recommendations of tours, Kevin who told us the best place for Seafood, and Keith who got our room ready for early check-in. We loved the turn down services with delicious chocolates, the bottled water, and the real live bamboo plant in the bathroom. (You always see them in hotels photos on their web page but the somehow disappear upon one's arival.) and the Aveda products! Everything about The Lenox was stellar. I hope now that they are number one they maintain there quality of service as well as value. When we arrived home from out long journey the one thing we raved about was The Lenox!!! P.S Location was convienent to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Back Bay Hotel with Gorgeous View of the City”
Reviews.Author: CAPECODSPLASH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights @ the Lenox with both small and teenage children. The night view from our room on the 11th floor was nothing short of spectacular. I should have asked about parking prior to booking...it was $41/day! We parked at the "T" for $8/night (Quincy Adams/Red line), which was more economical and made sense since a "T' stop is just a block from the hotel and we used it to get around the city. The room was clean, and attention to details was appreciated (two bottled waters, Lindt chocolates @ turn down, free late night candy bar snack!). I only wish the concierage knew more info. re: discount tickets for blue man group and other venues. We were sent to a kiosk next to the Boston Public Library, but not told that they open at 10 a.m., and tickets typically sell out by 10:30! Since this was not shared, we waited until late afternoon and it was too late! Maybe next time. There is great night life/dining beside the hotel on Boylston, which was fun for us parents. The beds were comfortable, although a tight squeeze for two small kids to fit on a double, so we asked for a rollaway ($30/night charge). The locations of this hotel can't be beat. It's so easy to get around on the "T". We enjoyed the historic feel of both the hotel and the area. A most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is my favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: solanaMillValley
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Lenox Hotel just about every other week for 18 months. From stay number one to now, they have been nothing short of amazing! What makes this place so special is the staff. Everyone -from the doormen, to the front desk staff, to the bell service, to housekeeping - truly understands what it means to make a guest feel welcome. The rooms are big and comfortable, the ipod station is a great little touch and free water in the room fridge every night. The location is perfect, with lots of great restaurants and shopping just outside the door. If you are a runner (or walker) it's so close to the Charles River paths. Don't forget to check out City Bar, right in the hotel lobby. It's the perfect place to start the evening and also has a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MeganFlorida
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better location. The staff was very nice and helpful. My only complaint was the tiny bathroom. Otherwise great!

Reviews.Title: “Really a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NHakim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were surprised by the all-around quality of this hotel. The rooms were clean, spacious and had many amenities - I definitely stole the Aveda toiletries and Scope! I loved the free bottled water in the mini-bar and the environmental consciousness. We even received turn-down service for some reason so there would be Lindt chocolates on our bed and music playing when we arrived back at our rooms at the end of the day! SCORE! Free coffee every morning was great, free wi-fi was great, free headphones and bottled water in the awesome fitness room was great. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful so thanks to them all. Hotel location was perfect - close to great shopping and Copley subway station, which we made use of on numerous occasions. Only complaint is that parking our rental car at the hotel was $41USD per night...outrageous, but didn't spoil anything. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay at a gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallas
Reviews.Content: I loved The Lenox. From check in to the end of our stay hotel staff were courteous, friendly and very helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful - even the standard rooms are excellent and the Aveda toiletries provided were lovely. Other nice touches included bottled water replaced daily and a nightly bed turn-down with Lindt chocolates on the pillow. The location was perfect - on busy Boylston with the gorgeous shops and restaurants of Newbury Street running parallel, and a subway stop nearby. Internet access is free and umbrellas provided in rooms proved useful with this summer's rain! The hotel bars are also great. I loved it and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: OhNoTan
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, great location near lots of nice food and drink places. Fab coffee in the morning and free bottles of water a nice touch. Very environmentally friendly, but doesn't make you feel bad about having travelled there in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: VidiCi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Lenox Hotel and it is definitely an excellent place to stay when you are in Boston. The room was perfect, a good bed, and all features you can expect in such a classy hotel, there's even a docking station for ipods in the room. Very friendly and helpful receptionists and concierge, they make sure that you get a professional answer to all your questions. You can easily discover the city as the subway (Copley) is just next to the hotel. If we'd ever go back to Boston, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well-appointed but small!”
Reviews.Author: sno_pea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night.Â  I definitely got one of the smaller standard rooms - the bathrom was shall, we say "European" sized - shower stall and there was virtually no counter space on the bathroom. But I got one of the smaller rooms. But the bed was comfortable and the service was professional.Â  The room was well appointed, with some modern conveniences - flat screen tv, Bose iPod dock and an alarm clock.Â  Good location to Back Bay, close to Newbury street shopping.Â  Overall, would definitely recommend, and it seems to be pretty good value for the money (even if it was on my employer's dime!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: culrossJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel for its rooms, excellent service and great value for money. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I never believed reviews were authentic, but they are...great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DKNY61
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights which extended over a weekend. The service was outstanding. The staff so pleasant and willing to assist. I rate their staff with 5 Stars. They were exceptional! I stayed in their classic room and it was clean and fresh and the AC worked great. They are environmentally conscious and have a "green" program to support their beliefs. The amenities were wonderful too. We ate at their pub which was good food. The gym was perfect to maintain my workouts. The location is perfect easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding to describe in one word!”
Reviews.Author: lupilove04
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few days ahead of our convention and found a great deal in this lovely hotel through skyauction.com. It was a block from the Hynes Convention Center and also from the Copley Station (The "T", BostonÂ´s major public transportation system). Also an easy walk to great shops, restaurants and 15 minutes from the Charles River, where we enjoyed the 4th of July fireworks. Newbury Street is charming and is 2 blocks away, with abundance of unique shops and great restaurants. But back to The Lenox: Outstanding service. I cannot say enough and will always be grateful for the staffÂ´s endless efforts to accommodate us. Upon arrival, we learned that with my friendÂ´s luggage had arrived with all of her clothes almost damaged due to another passengerÂ´s syrup that seeped from their luggage to hers during the flight (actually, we think it was cherry liquor!). We became aware of this at almost 10 pm upon checking into our beautiful room. We had arrived a few days ahead of our convention, and almost all of her clothes were practically ruined! This major cause of distress, after not sleeping for over 24 hours to take the flight from Venezuela, was easily relieved by Mr. Thomas, the concierge, who was kind enough to help us with the hotel laundry to solve our problem. She had clean clothes at 8 am the next morning, and we were also treated that night to two wonderful complimentary drinks that night. This wonderful, hospitable service is something I have not experienced even in 5-star hotels IÂ´ve been in. The staff is very helpful and accommodated our need every time we needed it. Team effort is something you sense in this fine hotel once you walk in the front entrance and everyone is polite and exceptionally friendly. Beds are very comfortable and they leave delicious Lindt chocolates every afternoon! Mattresses and pillows are divine! The taxi service booked from the hotel concierge was a van taxi, and my two friend and I paid $30 ($10 each) plus tip, which I think was a pretty good deal. If you have patience and want to save a few $$, you can take the "T" from the airport to Copley Station (youÂ´ll have to make a transfer to the Green Line), which is a block from the Lenox ($2 ticket). We took the "T" and it was fast and reliable and anyone will give you information at the airport if you need it. Nevertheless we had done a lot of shopping and had 2 luggages each, so a taxi was far more comfortable to go back to Logan International Airport. I hope I have another reason to visit Boston just so I can stay in the Lenox again! You will be very happy to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Once again....”
Reviews.Author: ebboboy
Reviews.Content: Once again The Lenox lived up to our expectations, stayed in April 08 and i think this time was slightly better. Requested a high floor twin room on our booking but when we checked in they gave us a double complained to bellboy who took us to a twin room with no problems. Also before we left i e-mailed asking if we could have an early check-in at 08:00hrs no problem, what made it more memorable we went onto the roof to watch 4th July fireworks, asked on day of leaving if it was possible to keep the room on for extra time and was told we could keep the room until 13:30hrs with no extra charge, also hotel run's a car to airport for $40 very comfortable and made you feel a special customer. When we go to Boston again only 1 hotel we will use.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidgriffiths
Reviews.Content: Very good central location, helpful staff and smallish but comfortable rooms. Pricey but in this part of town par for the course.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: tracynhaley
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the 4th of July weekend and were surprised at how quiet the rooms are considering the nightlife around you. Our room was a bit small, but cozy and well equipped and the concierge was great as were the valets in helping us find our way around Boston. We loved the fact they had umbrellas handy for you at the front desk as every day was calling for rain...which never did come. The pub was lively and fun and the cocktail bar served fabulous homemade potato chips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: DaveHealy
Reviews.Content: Great stay in a great hotel. Really couldn't fault the rooms or service.

Reviews.Title: “We want to live here”
Reviews.Author: Jager66
Reviews.Content: My son says "I want to live here" in the Lenox that is we'd be happy with Boston! Staff are so helpful, hotel is so clean, conveniently located for Newbury ?Street? and Copley Sq shops and the tube- sorry subway at Copley Sq, Also close to Duck tour; trolley stops; Prudential Tower. There are plenty of photos on here which do it justice- so I won't add mine. Next time we're in Boston we will be staying here, and will recommend it to friends too>

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boston Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Sport526
Reviews.Content: My new husband & I didn't have time to take a long tropical trip to Hawaii so we went to Boston instead because I went to Wheaton College & wanted to show my new hubby where I went to school. I reserved my airfare, hotel, & car on Orbitz & The Lenox was definitely the right choice. Everyone was very nice when we checked in & our room was very clean & comfortable. The view wasn't that great but why would you be spending time in your room in Boston. The first night we went down to the restaurant next door which is an amazing little Irish pub with great irish beer & food. Definitely try the cheeseburger because it's one of the best I've ever had! When I had called before our arrival to purchase Duck Tour tickets, I had told the concierge that it was our honeymoon & I'd be celebrating my birthday on our last day of the trip. When we went back up to our room after dinner there was a birthday cake with my name on it, a bottle of wine, a bucket of beer, & cards for our honeymoon as well as my birthday signed by the Lenox staff! What an unbelievable surprise! It was one of the nicest things I've ever had done at any hotel I've ever stayed at! The staff was great the whole trip & I would definitely stay there again & recommend it to anyone & everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Where2Gowhere2go
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful building and comfortable rooms. The hotel staff is remarkably friendly and helpful. Perfectly located in the heart of Back Bay/Copely Square area. The only thing I didn't like is that there are no coffee makers in the rooms - but there is complimentary coffee in the morning at the bottom of the elevator. The hotel is nice enough that the coffeemaker wasn't a signficiant drawback (and I'm a big coffee drinker). I love the free internet. I'd stay here again in a minute - it was one of the highlights of a multiweek, multicity trip.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing stay at The Lenox”
Reviews.Author: vinasol
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing five night stay at The Lenox. The first thing that greeted us was the most amazing fragrance in the lobby, the receptionist explained that it had been especially created for the hotel. The check in staff were excellent and we were promptly taken to our room. On inspection of our room we discovered we did not have a bath tub, therefore another room was available immediately and we were transfered. The Hotel is spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds. The rooms are well appointed with, air con, flat screen TV, fridge, iron and board, hairdryer and great Aveda hair and body products, oh, and Lindt chocolates at turn down!! What really made our stay at The Lenox extra special was the amazing team of people who work there. Everybody was polite, helpful, friendly and genuine. Jimmy (60 years service) and Vincent (20 years service) the guys in the lobby, really made us feel at home and we really had a great time chatting to them about Boston. We cannot wait to stay at The Lenox again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary at the Lenox in Boston”
Reviews.Author: txdoctor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing! We did the romantic package, which included a private tour of Boston with a private limo. Our limo driver, Frank, is also the former limo driver for Ben Affleck and Al Gore. He was so nice! We ate at the Tower Restaurant, which was exceptional, had a private tour of Harvard, Old North Church, and a favorite pizza hangout of Ben Affleck's. This tour and stay at the Lenox is still our favorite anniversary trip- even after eleven years of marriage! The pub downstairs is an Irish Pub that has the best " Chicken Curry"- ya- the irish make a great chicken curry! We ate that dish three nights in a row- it was that good!!! The bed is incredible! I suffer from severe nerve pain, and durring my stay I was very comfortable with the glorious bed accomadations. The room is old world and very quaint, but cozy. There are great views of Boston from the rooms, and the Lenox is in a great spot! Shops, museums, the musicals, and most of all you don't hear the noise of the city. The people at the hotel were very helpful and very friendly. We also did a swan ride at the park- which I highly recommend! This is very clean and very spacious. Our room was about 650 sq feet- which included a fire place. I recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kentishmayde
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in two rooms, both rooms were great, clean, quiet, well appointed, with comfy beds. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Perfect location for visiting Boston sights, plenty of shopping, restaurants and parking nearby if needed and within 50 yards of the 'T' and 100yds from the Prudential Centre and Trinity Church. Excellent value for money, would definately revisit and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay at a chain hotel when you can stay at The Lenox?”
Reviews.Author: StanWashington
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with the Lenox. It has a great history, excellent location one block from trendy Newberry Street in Back Bay, and directly behind the historic Boston library. The rooms were spotlessly clean, the staff unfailing helpful, and we slept unusually well! It is a great base to explore the many wonders of Boston, as well as a welcome 'home' to return to each night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JuJay
Reviews.Content: location was perfect - walking distance for most of the downtown sites. Hotel was great luxurious but very helpful friendly staff and room was the best. Coffee in the morning was a nice bonus

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting Boston”
Reviews.Author: salrice
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days in the hotel and enjoyed it very much. We were upgraded for our second night to one of the corner rooms which was considerably more spacious and also had a bath tub in the en-suite as well as a shower. The food was good and we also ate in the Irish bar attached to the hotel which was lively and good fun. Our only down-side would be that the parking seemed a little expensive at $41 per night but taking into consideration that the hotel is right in the centre of a large city I suppose this is to be expected. Overall very nice stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: KAZ068
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 day stay at the Lenox Hotel in Boston and I cannot recommend it enough. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel special and totally at ease. As we were on our honey moon we were awarded an upgrade at no extra charge and we also received a bottle of wine and an especially nice note from the Manager. The staff are exceptional and nothing is too much trouble for them, including the reception staff bringing drinks to your room after a hard days sightseeing. The beds in this hotel are the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the bed linen was soft, crisp and clean. The maids were wonderful and ensured that your fridge was stocked with complimentary water and even offered to bring you ice. They were also very generous with the chocolates on your pillow when they turned down your bed at night. The hotel is well positioned for all of the sights and you have easy access to the 'T' at the Prudential Centre. There are plenty of bars close by and we were in easy walking distance of Fenway Park, where we attended a baseball game on the Sunday evening. We had some problems whilst in Boston with our debit card, the dreaded Visa Electron, and we were devastated when we could not draw cash or use the card in shops. We told the concierge and he advised that he would be happy to arrange for cash to be drawn at the hotel for us....a true Godsend. After a wonderful stay here we checked out on our last day at 12 but were not leaving the hotel for the airport until 4pm. The Manager found out and gave us a room to rest in until we were leaving....a perfect finishing touch to a wonderful experience at this top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartandJackie
Reviews.Content: Even before we checked into the hotel the service we received ws excellent: second to none! We were going to be celebrating our anniversary and my wife's birthday during our stay and the hotel were happy to help arrange a few surprises for my wife. They were also happy to book a few activities for us prior to our arrival, so all we had to do was get there and enjoy them. As soon as you walk into the hotel you are made to feel welcome from the Doormen, receptionists, Bell Boys and all! The turn down service was excellent and the girls who looked after our room did a great job. If I have any complaint at all it's that you don't get any tea/coffee making facillities in your room, although complimentary drinks are put on in Reception in the morning (but we did miss that first drink of the day in the room). Everything else was faultless, the location is excellent (we were 15 minutes walk from Fenway Park) and not too many minutes more from the Waterfront. Newbury Street is on the doorstep, but Boylstone is even closer with loads of shops & restaurants as well. The restaurant that the concierge recommended to us was fantastic and again just 5 minutes away. If you get the chance to eat at Turner Fisheries take it!! Again the staff were fantastic and the food was absolutely stunning, with plenty of it! We'll be going back to Boston and we won't even think about stopping anywhere other than the Lenox, it's the best! Thanks to everybody there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeroNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: The Lenox couldn't be in a better location......on Boylston, one block from Newbury, 2 blocks from the Prudential Center, next to the Boston Public Library, and 1 block from the Green Line T stop. Rooms are decent size but the furnishings were a bit over-the-top for my taste. I couldn't get the air-con to function in the room, called down to the desk to ask for maintenance, left for the evening and came back late to find it still not working. It took another try the next morning before it got repaired. Hotel has a fitness room, two computers for client usage and free wi-fi. I think the Lenox is a bit pricey, but given its location and the generally high cost of hotel rooms in Boston, it's a good selection for either tourists or business folk.

Reviews.Title: “Dan's the Man at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Jollyhols_9
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Boston,my friend Sara and I love to shop best of all in the USA.We have stayed at various hotels but this takes the biscuit! Boston isone of the few places for 2 ladies on their own to wander around safely and easily.The metro is close by and plenty of cabs not pricey.We had a beautiful room dual aspect overlooking Boylston but it was'nt noisy. The friendliness of the staff and level of service was outstanding,location brilliant too.The GM,Dan,could not have done more to make a memorable stay,in fact I think Sara would have put him in her suitcase had she not done so much shopping! Our only little moan was having to tiptoe down to the lobby in our nighties to grab an English early morning cuppa! Apparently health and safety and all that! However the hotel more than made up for that,it was THE BEST....we'll be back. The English Teaparty

Reviews.Title: “The staff and hotel was truly a delightful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Iheartboston6
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a friendly smile and a genuine greeting by the door man. The lobby is elegantly appointed with beautiful artwork and helpful staff. The concierge immediately acknowledged me and offered his assistance. Although I didn't take him up on his offer at the time I knew that if I needed suggestions during my stay that I would feel comfortable going to him with any concern. The front desk agent was so friendly, I was impressed with her knowledge of the rooms and was excited for my stay in the highly anticipated "Pure Room". I have really bad allergies and when traveling I tend to react to dust and poorly ventilated hotel rooms. I was delighted to walk in the room and experience a clean, fresh feeling. I thought to myself, I wish I had found The Lenox Hotel earlier in my traveling career. Needless to say the air purifier and the oxidized sheets ensured a pleasant sleep for me. The pillows were amazing and I slept a full night through with no sneezing which makes all the difference for me!!!! I enjoyed my pure room experience immensely and can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city. I also have to mention the location is the best in the city. I got to make it to all the good sales in a pinch!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Stunning Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fcj1005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox for three nights prior to flying back to the UK at the end of our US family holiday. We arrived, and straight away the service was exceptional, better than anywhere we had ever been. We were guided to our room which was very elegant and in keeping with the beautifully kept Old-Fashionned style the hotel was in. The room was extremely spacious. The hotel lobby especially was stunning, as was the hotel bar. The Munster Rugby team were staying at the time, and my brother is a huge rugby fan, so this was great, we even spoke to a few of the players. The location was good, the hotel extremely stunning, we would love to go back there. We also stayed at The Liberty in Boston on the same holiday, which was also wonderful, but The Lenox topped it in our opinon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely spot on.”
Reviews.Author: BellabedsUk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. great location . Staff superb every one of them always saying good morning etc... offering assistance and going out of their way to accomodate. Comp tea/coffee in lobby. comp bottled water in rooms. Azure restaraunt food exeptionally good. Comp upgrade to a suite ,room large spotlessly clean couldn't ask for anything else .Fab establishment all round . highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: GilbeyWiltshire
Reviews.Content: All glowing reviews on this site were correct - just returned from five night stay in Boston. Hotel was brilliant - everyone friendly and helpful. Boston excellent place to visit - hotel situated perfectly to reach all sights. Would definately recommend this hotel for anyone looking to visit Boston - don't bother looking elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Lenox!”
Reviews.Author: TMichael2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for 5 nights. This hotel is everything a "big city" hotel should be. The rooms (we had 2) were spotless, large, and well-furnished. The staff was helpful, friendly, and very professional. The location is perfect for access to Fenway Park and Newbury Street shopping. There are several excellent hotels within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Cause1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small-ish, but efficient. Can't beat the location with much in walking distance and a T-stop just 1/2 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: CtLifeisGood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night so we could see the Boston Redsox. We choose this hotel by all the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor. I'm a firm believer in Tripadvisor and won't book a hotel or B&B without using it. On that note The Lenox lived up to all the great reviews that were left by other satisfied customers. The Lenox staff were very friendly and genuine. The room was a little small but very clean and beautiful and comfortable. The maid came by our room and offered us turn down service and replenished our refrigerator with complimentary bottled water and Lindts Chocolates very nice touch. The location was very convienient to T station, shopping, and restaurants. We dined at Mortons Steakhouse right across the street. One of our favorites. So i hope this review helps you make your decision to stay at the Lenox. I know i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Stroy9
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been easier or better! I'll most certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place To Stay In Boston!”
Reviews.Author: chicagosteve13
Reviews.Content: We go to Boston at least twice a year, and this is the ONLY hotel we stay at! The Lenox is located in one of the best areas of Boston, Back Bay, and you are close to so many things. Fenway is a short distance away, and you are a quick walk from Newbury St, Commonwealth Ave, the Boston Public Gardens, and so much more! Stop looking for hotels, and book here! The staff is absolutely fantastic and first rate, the food is good, and there is a complementary business center and fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Great Value for Money and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: varneycon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Lenox for 5 nights The Room that we book was a double Superior and it was huge! The Hotel is Clean and the staff polite and very helpful. The Hotel is located in a good part of town 2 minutes from the Prudential Centre and 5 minutes to the Common. The Hotel Has 2 Excellent Bars which we tried and features a top class restaurant that unfortunately we did not have time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox Hotel is where you want to stay while in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: SnoopysMom24
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my girlfriends and I have treated ourselves to a stay at the Lenox Hotel for an annual get-together. From the moment you reach the curb to the moment you step off to say goodbye the staff makes you feel like a special guest. The bellmen are friendly and helpful and you will find the front desk staff also very friendly, attentive and professional. As you turn to go up to the rooms, the fireplace in the lobby will becon you to sit and relax. Our two rooms were beautifully decorated and exceptionally clean with a postcard view of the city (don't forget to look out at dark as well to see the city lights). The updated bathrooms are spa-like with Aveda bath products, fluffy towels and even guest robes to use during your stay. The Lenox is also in a great location near Newbury St. and other fun shopping, many fine restaurants and tourist attractions. You will not be disappointed in choosing this hotel for your stay in Boston and I suspect your first stay will not be your last!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kerrs001
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Husband stayed here for ou 10th wedding Anniversary. I emailed the hotel before leaving the UK and they gave us a free upgrade to a Junior Suite. On our arrival the staff congratulated on our anniversary and informed us that whatever we needed to make our stay special, we were only to ask. When entered our room and wow. Large, comfortable bed with nightly turn down service, that included bottled water and chocolates. The staff were outstanding, we were greeted in a friendly and helpful way everyday. All the staff are approachable and knowledgeable of the area. We did not try the hotel restaurant but heard from other residents that it was good. Overall, the stay was a memorable and enjoyable experience and will definatley return to the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
