Reviews.Author: chingy98
Reviews.Content: I think the Lenox gets overshadowed in this city by other hotels such as the new Mandarin Oriental, 4 Seasons, the Taj, and such -- but the smaller size of this hotel really lends to greater service and detail from the staff. In the hotel there is Azure, one of my favorite restaurants in Boston -- and City Bar, a very swank and hopping bar at night. In addition, it's in an ideal location for visitors, as it is in the middle of the Back Bay, so walking distance to everything. But really, it's just a high quality hotel -- I only put the value as 3 stars because it can be expensive, a;though recently deals were found on hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great People, Great Location...Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: love2gonow
Reviews.Content: The Lenox was perfect from the time we got there until we left! EVERYTHING was perfect! People nice and service great! Room was clean and nice and spacious. Location was perfect...right next to the Prudential Center, only a block away from Newbury Street and the T station...We walked all over Boston from there and it was just the perfect place to stay!!! Price was right too! Very reasonable in November!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Staff is great, Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: ksampso3
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in Boston. We chose the Lenox Hotel after finding a great deal on travelzoo.com. We got a Classic room for $129 a night, which was a good price. Although the classic room is very basic, it was good enough for us to stay for a couple of nights - we weren't in the room very much anyway. Our room was small but nice and clean, with a Queen sized bed. The bathroom was also very small, with only a shower stall (no tub). But, my friends who were staying in the hotel had a bigger room, so that just depends on the style room you end up with. Also in the room, there was a fridge you could use to put drinks in, which included a complimentary bottle of water (BTW, if you stay here, there is also complimentary bottled water in the fitness center for guests). There was an in-room safe available, which is always nice when you're traveling. One downside to parking your car at the hotel is that it cost $41 a day for the valet. We knew that beforehand, but used it anyway for the convenience, but if you really want to save money, I'm sure you can find a parking garage that is cheaper per 24 hours - or consider parking a little outside the city and taking the train or subway in to the hotel. As far as location goes, that depends what you plan on doing in Boston. The Lenox is in the Back Bay section of the city. But, if you are familiar with using the subway system ("the T"), you will be able to get wherever you want to go. The hotel is very close to the Copley T stop on the green line. From the Lenox, the Prudential Center is just a couple of blocks away, as well as lots of places to shop (we didn't do any shopping this trip), and there are a bunch of bars and restaurants too. We walked to Fenway park from the hotel, in about 15-20 minutes (as another point of reference). The service at the hotel is wonderful! I can't say enough about it. From the minute we pulled our car up at the door, the valets and bellmen were so friendly. They welcomed us immediately, and the service and friendly staff did not stop the whole weekend. Any time we stepped in the door, off the elevator, or anywhere else in the hotel, there was someone there to give a friendly hello, help us with directions, or give other help. For any weaknesses you may find with this hotel, the service of the friendly staff will more than make up for it. Overall, I really liked the Lenox - it was a great hotel for us to do some exploring of Boston's Back Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, rooms compare to Marriot..not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: melissa16
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting to walk around Boston and do some sight seeing, I would not recommend this hotel. If you want to shop at places like Coach and Armani, then you are right in the middle of Copley. It was too far from anything to walk and we ended up taking mostly cabs. Try the Omni Parker House. This hotel is VERY expensive and the rooms are NOT worth the money. We had a delux king room. The room was just like any marriot, holiday in or howard jouhnson. The staff was very friendly, and the rooms were clean. Be aware that this is pretty much the only hotel I have ever been to in Boston that actually charges you to park your car on top of your room charge ($43 for 24 hours). I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kindest staff I've EVER met”
Reviews.Author: priceg3
Reviews.Content: I simply cannot say enough about the kindness and efficiency of the gracious staff of this historic hotel. As beautifully restored as the Lenox is, it is the caring attitude of its marvelous employees that makes it stand out as unique in the very best sense. And after ensconcing myself next to the fireplace in the lobby for the afternoon (happily reading purchases from the Boston Public Library Sale), I was able to witness that the staff are this way to EVERYONE--from the honeymoon couple canoodling on the sofa to the aupair playing Go Fish with her charge and the businessman proclaiming success to his colleagues. Each member of the staff makes you feel sincerely cared for, no matter why or how long you are there. Their attitude brightened a gloomy February afternoon even more than the fireplace and good reads! Please, don't miss this one!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: babs58ct
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox on 2/6-7. I have to say that I have never stayed at any hotel in which ALL of the staff were so friendly and helpful. From the minute we got near the front steps upon arrival at the hotel, to the minute we left, everyone was cheerful and ready to help. The room was very neat and clean, the bed comfortable, the flat-screen TV nice and big, etc. There was plenty of drawer space and a huge closet also. The bathroom was very small, but nicely done and well-equiped with quality toiletries. We appreciated the strong flow of water in the shower, and plenty of hot water. The breakfasts that we had in the hotel were typical of any hotel of this type, but again, the wait staff were terrific. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location and a great hotel chioce for a first visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: LondonParis&Roam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Lenox at the start of the holiday season for 2008 and checked out on Christmas Eve to transfer to The Commonwealth Hotel, also in Boston, simply as a change of venue on an extended break. I booked through Expedia as it was a better rate than the hotel offered me directly and got a great deal. I had originally intended to stay at The Boston Harbour Hotel but when I telephoned they were a bit snotty in attitude and the price quoted went up between quote and confirmation, so I cancelled and I am pleased I did ! The Lenox is far superior in so many ways. The Lenox is a very nice hotel in a great location, especially if you are going to Boston for the first time. It is walking distance to all the main attractions, Newbury Street, Boston Common, Beacon Hill, Trinity Church, Copley Place and very close to the T stop for the underground at Boston Public Library. My room, a "Double Double Deluxe" was on the 7th floor, on a corner overlooking Boylston Street and Exeter Street. The room was spacious and clean, but a little dated in decor and just a little lacking in maintenance, but not in cleanliness. Don't let this description put you off staying here as it has an old hotel honesty and feel to it and super modern decor wouldn't suit this hotel. The welcome and service from the staff was extremely good, particularly the door staff. There was complementary tea and coffee in the lobby each morning, but not in the bedroom. Breakfast was care of Dunkin Donuts accross the street as the hotel breakfast menu was overpriced, as is regularly the case. Why more hotels dont offer a simple buffet breakfast at a fair price is beyond me. The other niggle I had was the bar in the hotel. It is totally inadequate in size to service the hotel. The thought of a quiet drink at the bar on an evening soon falls away when you can't get a seat as there are twice as many guests as there are tables and chairs. There is another bar downstairs, an Irish bar, but this suffers from the same fault. There are plenty of other bars to choose from locally so again, don't let this put you off. I would definitely stay here again as it offers a high overall standard, great value and a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: LBD48
Reviews.Content: Although we live just outside Boston, my wife decided to surprise me for my birthday w/ a weekend in the city. We normally go someplace warm but weâ€™re watching what we spend. She booked a room at the Lenox Hotel after a friend had raved about it. We couldn't have enjoyed it more! We checked in Friday night and were amazed at the greeting we received. It seemed that everywhere we turned there was a smiling face! We went to City Bar and tried a few of their funky martinis. When my very fashionable niece visits from NY Iâ€™ll be sure to take her there. It turns out my wife had several conversations w/ Keith, the Guest Services Manager, before we even arrived. Everyone knew we were there to celebrate my bâ€™day! Normally Iâ€™d be embarrassed about the attention but it was always just enough. Keith was able to get us a table overlooking the Public Garden at Excelsior and was kind enough to send over champagne to begin our meal. The food and service were outstanding but thatâ€™s another story. We decided to walk back to the Lenox after dinner, just imagining how lovely it would be to live in the Back Bay. When we arrived the lobby was busy w/ the â€˜fabulousâ€™ people. We happily headed to our room where the bellman chatted while lighting a fire. After a great nights rest we woke up early, had some of the fabulous coffee in the lobby, and began day 2. Some shopping, lunch, a stroll along Comm. Ave into the Public Garden and finally dinner at a new restaurant the concierge recommended which even impressed my 'foodie' wife. I could go on and on. I didnâ€™t think you could find service like this anymore! The entire staff was kind, professional and eager to please; even the housekeeping staff seemed happy to be there. Not to mention that the hotel is gorgeous, very 'Boston Old Money.' Our room was huge, the bed was great, w/ beautiful linens and my wife loved the Aveda toiletries. The location couldnâ€™t be better. Everything is in walking distance. Not only will I being recommending this hotel to friends and clients visiting Boston but weâ€™ll certainly be back to try Azure. My wifeâ€™s birthdayâ€™s just around the corner. Back Bay must be beautiful in the springâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Lenox..favourite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ClannParis
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old daugher and myself had the most marvelous weekend in Boston and it was made really special by staying in the Lenox. First of all its situated really conveniently for shopping and sightseeing. We were made to feel very welcome on arrival by the extremely friendly and professional staff. Nothing was too much trouble. By the time we left we felt like family. All staff (doormen, consierge, waiting staff, management seemed to go out of their way to be helpful. We really liked the classic opulent style of decor in the public areas of the hotel. Our room (deluxe) was very spacious and beautifully furnished. The bathroom was very large, richly decorated and had excellent quality toiletries. Breakfast wasnt a high point. You would get better value outside the hotel but dinner was super.

Reviews.Title: “Smoked Out of Room!”
Reviews.Author: wiheba
Reviews.Content: Although we enjoyed our stay to start with, we found that the hotel was unwilling to provide fair compensation for a major safety issue that occurred to us. While staying in the room we had a fireplace and enjoyed it our first night. Two nights later we had the staff start another fire for us. This time I came into the room to find my wife in a room filled with smoke. The flue on the fireplace was not working properly. We called up a mechanic who informed us this was an ongoing issues. Thus the Lennox had the opportunity to have us stay in another room or suggest we do not use the fireplace if it could not be fixed. There was no such suggestion until after hours of having the fire backing smoke into the room in my absence. Although we were moved they made no adjustment to our bill. After complaining a number of times we finally got only one night stay removed. It is unfortunate that this happened but even more unfortunate and telling for future visitors that the management was unwilling to provide a fair compensation for damages. Be very wary of this establishment until management changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: lbeachbum
Reviews.Content: Our room was very good and the front desk staff very friendly and helpfull. The location is good for the Back Bay area but quite a long walk into the downtown area. What annoyed us was that on check out I requested a taxi to be called. The bellman asked if we would prefer a hotel car instead for $35. I politely declined and said a taxi would be fine. He then persisted stating how much more comfortable we'd be in a hotel car as opposed to a taxi. Again I declined the offer and requested a taxi. He appeared quite annoyed by this. We then exited the hotel and the doorman said to us, "so you've got the hotel car folks". Again I declined and requested a taxi, which the doorman then summoned for us. I think three tries at getting us to use their hotel car was over the top and actually quite rude as I consistantly declined. The eventual taxi cost, $20 with tip. And we were quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: EGEM
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is excellent!! People at the front desk, maintenance and Azure restaurant are polite and helpful at all times. Fast check in and check out. The room I got was big, although the bathroom was of medium size. There was also a walk- in closet and a safety box. The hotel offers bath toiletries, bathrobes and hair dryer, but no slippers, so please bring a pair with you. Room service is fast but a little expensive ($9 for a cup of tea/coffee). There are no tea/coffee facilities inside the room but you can make tea/coffee at the lobby every morning. Bottled water is complimentary which is great! Internet access is free and fast, although it might take a while to get connected the first time you loggin. Breakfast is wonderful (both hot and cold dishes are served). Good quality food and well priced in my opinion. Location couldn't be better. The hotel is near numerous good restaurants, shops, Starbucks, CVS, supermarket. Overall a very good experience! I highly recommend this hotel, mainly due to the friendly and excellent customer service they provide!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Horrid Room Service”
Reviews.Author: hauntedisle
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a gorgeous hotel in the perfect location. Boylston Street in Boston is the heart of the city. My wonderful, romantic, precious boyfriend booked this hotel for a romantic New Years/30th birthday surprise for me. We attended a wonderfully festive and delicious 7 course dinner gala at the Top of The Hub for NYE, and spent two days enjoying the Lenox's amenities; we also took in a Blue Man Group show on NYD. We came across a few problems, however during our stay. First, beware of booking a Junior Suite: They boast having wood burning fireplaces, yet very few of them actually do. It was my 30th birthday, New Years Eve, (they were well aware of both!) and we booked several months in advance, yet we could not be accomodated with a fireplaced room. Strike one. The room was unneccesarily gigantic, therefore not allowing for proper climate control. The massive walk-in closet and bathroom were sub-arctic when the room itself was a smoldering 70*. Strike two. We ordered room service for breakfast two days in a row, bacon eggs toast and coffee for 2 people: $184 later, and one hour after eating (my fault) cold, runny eggs, I became very ill. I have been sick, with a so far undertermined foodborne illness (so far called a GI bug until my test results come back), still 6 days later. I contacted the hotel manager who referred me to the person in charge of the food and beverage department who never called me back. Stike three. The bathroom was clean and the sheets were clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was well-appointed. Thr free WiFi access and bottled water were pluses. The list of freebies for guests was impressive including bath salts and cufflinks to borrow in case their guests have forgotten theirs. The only reason I would not recommend this hotel is because of their ridiculously overpriced toxic food. I am not sure who they have working down in the kitchen, but they need to be fired immediately; I understand that food is a catch-22 at most hotels and restaurants, but this is their business! The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous, clean and well worth the "double-priced room rate" in comparison to other beautiful hotels in the area, if simply for the gorgeous reception area including a magnificent fireplace and guilded crown mouldings. The beds are comfy and the tv is a pretty nice flat screen model. The valets and bell-people were fantastic. I truly enjoyed my stay, minus the intestinal infection I got from the room service, and the ruined birthday plans because I've been chained to the commode for going on 6 days... By all means, stay at the Lenox; JUST DON'T ORDER ROOM SERVICE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley321
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend as a surprise for his birthday. I advised him that it was his birthday when I booked, and they left cheese and champagne and a card in the room on arrival which was a great touch-he loved it! The reception staff were so friendly right from the moment we arrived. Concierge very helpful-nothing too much trouble for him. Modern bar with good selection of cocktails and drinks. It was Christmas when we went, and the lobby was decorated beautifully. As it was below freezing when we went, the fire in the lobby was great. Rooms modern and comfortable with great views of Boston. The location was excellent, pretty much next to the underground station and shopping centre. I love this hotel and would definitely stay here if we were to return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving treat”
Reviews.Author: butlerbejay
Reviews.Content: Hotel package was excellent - would have liked to have been given the breakfast incl but not an option at time of booking - it was nevertheless worth eating as food quality very good. First room offered was very small and bathroom poor but replacement was fine, lovely decor and very clean. The hotel is perfectly situated for visiting/walking to all shops/amenities. All staff very good, particularly the concierge dept - they were incredibly helpful. We booked the hotel chauffeur service to return to the airport - a very pleasant way to return home from a truly memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “v nice”
Reviews.Author: twoplusonetravel
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights for a wedding. Had a classic room which was small and no view, might have been disappointed if had been staying longer, but for a quick stopover it was fine. Old fashioned decor charming, bathroom small but fine, robes nice. Room service was efficient (if pricey but that is what you would expect). It just has a very nice feel and atmosphere, classy and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with The Lenox”
Reviews.Author: jabiru
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our stay after reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked a deluxe room and on arrival we were shown a room with peeling wallpaper, marked skirting boards. After pointing out the description of a deluxe room to the Manager we were offered another room which initially seemed fine. However the view was of a department store roof & service yard. There seem to be some sort of electrical engine running somewhere below our room, which could be heard throughout the night. On the final morning we were woken at 4:00am by the waste disposal truck. When using the shower the whole room vibrated! No tea or coffee facilities in the room, it is available in the hotel lobby in the morning. On a positive note the staff were very friendly and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Goodmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox for the second last weekend of November 2008 and left just before Thanksgiving -- we went to Boston as a shopping and site seeing trip. Loved it! Flew with BA out of T5 at Thiefrow, which was okay, but not as impressive as imagined it would be. On arriving at Logan Airport cabs were easy to come by and we paid $30.00 to get to the hotel which took about 20 minutes. The hotel had just been dec'd out for the holiday season and it was very classy -- we got a very friendly and proffessional welcome and our room was very impressive in terms of comfort. Not the biggest room in USA terms but had a big walk in wardrobe (which became handy!) and a 42" flat screen HD TV at the end of a huge King size bed. The bathroom was adequate. The Lenox staff are superb and nothing is too much for them - they get 10 out 10 for this. The location is top notch being just off of Newbry Street and around 15 to 30 minute walk (dependant on route) to the furthest shopping area of Quincy / Faniuel Market. The Prudential Centre and other shops are right on the doorstep. There's also plenty of sightseeing within 5 minutes walk and the Duck and Trolley Site Seeing tours can be picked up just around the corner. Also loads of eating establishments to suit every taste are on your doorstep and an Irish pub which does good food and lovely Baileys coffee is attached to the hotel. The hotel lobby offers "The City Bar" which is quite a trendy spot by all accounts (locals queuing to get in on the Saturday night) but is far from being rowdy at all. The hotel resteraunt served up two very nice breakfasts (not that cheap but worth it) and the menu seemed nice for lunch / evenings but we didn't sample. Again the service was impecable. The hotel is also a pick up point for the bus going to Wrentham Village which is a must if you are visiting Boston for some shopping --- that large wardrobe DID come in handy! The bus costs about $35.00 each and Wrentham will take you a solid day to do (we caught 8.00pm bus back). There's a coule of grills etc there so no problem for eating. I'd recommend doing the Old Town Trolley Tour (tickets sold at Lenox) which takes about 2 hours and one of those hop on hop off jobs. This shows you what a nice city Boston is and gives you some good history information. We touched lucky with the weather -- it was COLD but lovely and sunny and most importantly dry. As a final bonus we got the use of the hotel car to get us and our overflowing bags back to the airport. this cost slightly more than a cab at $35.00 but door to door service in an A/C four wheeler with leather seats and complimentary drinks was worth it. We'll be going back to Boston once the credit cards recover and will DEFINETELY be looking to stay at Th Lenox again when we go.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: hdmcc
Reviews.Content: All I can really say is this place has the best service and most attentive staff compared to anywhere else I have ever stayed. I was there on business but managed to have a friend from the area meet me and we made the most of our stay. My business went from a projected one night visit to three and the staff bent over backwards to help with some last minute arrangements and special favours that continued throughout our stay. The food was wonderful, the drinks inventive and the front desk could not do enough to help From the valets to the parking attendants to the chambermaids we were made to feel very special. Everyone goes outside of their jurisdiction here and you will never hear "that is not my job". Bravo and I will be back, if simply just to enjoy myself.

Reviews.Title: “Like a spacious apartment”
Reviews.Author: Rob3349
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Lenox was enormous. It was a perfect oasis to return to each night, with a huge bathroom and a separate "closet" room. Staff were excellent and friendly and the location was perfect, being close to Newberry Street and Boylston Street shops and restaurants. The king size bed did slope into the middle a little, but we still found it comfortable. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, special mention for Christopher (guest services)”
Reviews.Author: rvkpr
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Lenox hotel for 4 nights and checked out today. Got a great room which worked out fine for my wife, 2kids and me. Christopher, at guest services, has been unusually thoughtful and attentive to our needs and deserves the first special mention. My children came down with a cold and fever and we were unable to go sightseeing on Monday. I mentioned it to Christopher and an hour later he came up to my room with a gift basket with cans of soup and childrens books about Boston. He then sent the soup up later (heated up and ready to eat!). This is a very warm and thoughtful gesture and a first time experience for me. Also, Jimmy made our arrival to the hotel a very warm and friendly one. He gave our children the two signature stuffed lions. I have stayed at many hotels and this stay will always remain in my memory as a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “The business!”
Reviews.Author: FELICIAFELICE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for four nights over Halloween. It's a great Boston option. We had a superior room with two double beds which was really comfortable. It was impeccably clean and a pleasure to stay in. The service you receive from reception, concierge and housekeeping is great; really friendly and helpful staff. I think the people at the Lenox go a long way to bump the hotel up from Above Average to Excellent! Location wise it's really convenient to shopping with options all around from Newbury Street to Marshalls/Filenes Basement and various malls with Saks, Barneys etc. We walked the short distance through the park to all the sights on the Freedom Trail etc. Some people have a gym high on their list of priorities so I'll mention that the gym is really small, stuffy and unappealling. Also no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, but tea/coffee available in the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: JWBruce
Reviews.Content: A high quality hotel dedicated to the business of looking after the guests. The location is good and there are any number of restaurants in the vicinity as well as some historic buildings. The best shopping in Boston is also on the hotel's doorstep. The City Bar stocks the best collection of malt whiskies I've seen and the bar staff really know how to mix a cocktail. The restaurant is highly rated although we did not eat there. The room was spacious and quite fashionable in a traditional way. However the most notable aspect of The Lenox is the staff who are alert, friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Saintsone
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the Lenox with our two children aged 10 & 11 and were so pleased we chose the Lenox, it had a lovely atmosphere. The staff were very friendly and helpful but not intrusive. Our room had two very comfortable double beds and a sofa with plenty of room and a walk in wardrobe and decent sized bathroom. We also had a full size TV, fridge, iron and board and dressing table etc. We ate in Solas the Irish bar and this was pretty good and cocktails in the city bar were great also. We didn't try the Azure restaurant as we loved the Atlantic Fish House just opposite. There was free coffee in reception but being from the UK would have loved tea and coffee facilities in the room. Boston is a great city and very safe city do the Duck Tours but don't bother with the science museum. We found doing the coach trip to Wrentham shopping outlet village was well worth a visit as the shops at the Prudential and Copley Centre's were gorgeous but pricey. All in all a great time and would definately go back to the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the country....”
Reviews.Author: jac2028
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this goooooooorgeous hotel for three nights in March and were very impressed. The hotel is on the list of America's historic hotels and it has been maintained and kept in prestine condition. The hotel is beautiful and classic, yet the rooms are modern and comfortable (and large unlike the Fairmont chain). The staff was personable and the whole experience made us feel like royalty. Now the only downside is that normally this hotel is quite expensive, however if you can get it at a deal (as we did) you should not hesitate to book as it was worth every penny. It's also in a perfect location. We had friends staying at the Fairmont and there room was much more expensive and was small, outdated and was not as chic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Best Servie”
Reviews.Author: KRUNKLE
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Lenox for two nights before driving west to the Berkshires. As always, I relied heavily on this site, but made my ultmate decision to stay here because of the ability to upgrade to a larger sized guest room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The service was perhaps the best reason to stay here. The front desk and especially the concierge service (Jason Lloyd) was very helpful and pleasant. The food at their resturant was very good, and well priced. Upon our return to Boston from Leaf Peeping, we had already chosen to stay at a different hotel. All the while we wished that we had returned to the Lenox. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, fantastic service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DevonUsatraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd stay at the Lennox and it did not disapoint! The room was clean & spacious, beds were very comfortable rooms now have added bonus of a fridge and in room safe Staff couldn't do enough for you very polite and helpful, the Lennox is situated in a great central location in Boston easy to get around on foot or by using the T (stations are very close by)good restaurants and shopping easily accessible, After a very busy sightseeing day too tired to go out so used the hotels in room dining, meal was delivered quickly it was hot and reasonably priced . Town car was available for us for our journey back to the Airport such a nice ending to our holiday would defintetly reccommend this to anyone wishing to visit Boston we are already planning our return!!!! Trip Advisor Member, Devon, UK

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm with all the Modern Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: curtis_keith
Reviews.Content: Its hard to judge a hotel on just a one night stay, thats why having stayed at the Lenox three times now, I am confident in my review of this hotel. The Lenox is a beautiful combination of unique and well appointed rooms with classic decour that transport you back to how Boston was years ago and all the modern ammenities you look for in a hotel today. My wife and I stayed in three different rooms on three different occasions and are looking forward to staying in another room as soon as we can get back to Boston. The heart of hotel is the staff and the Lenox staff is the perfect balance between attention to detail and allowing for your personal space. When you need something they provide it promptly without hastle and are respectful of your privacy. The soul of a hotel room is the bed and all three of our rooms had large incredibly comfortable beds, with amazingly soft sheets, mountains of pillows and the coziest down comforters. The duvet fit the style of the room with obvious attention to the overall asthetic. Stylish and smart it is nothing like the cookie cutter hotel rooms of a major chain. The bathrooms were no less impressive, marble counter tops and wonderful showers with both overhead and detachable showerheads. My wife and I truly felt refreshed after a stay at this hotel. Again their attention to detail was refreshing with Aveeda bath products and luxurious terry cloth robes. had breakfast in the Azure restaurant and were blown away by the deliciousness and freshness of our meals. We had fresh squeezed orange juice, toast, coffee and the best vegetarian omelette I ever had, my wife equally enjoyed her eggs benedict and bacon. We had the same waiter all three times we stayed and he was a delight first thing in the morning, again attentive but keeping a respectful distance a combination hard to come by in hotel employees and wait staff. Our car was handled with equal care and respect by the valet staff who parked our car in the attached garage. In addition to all this you get wireless internet, flat screen tv, some rooms have fireplaces and the swankierrooms have personal home theatre and remote control blinds. When I go to Boston to see the sights and spend the night I want to feel like I have privacy, like I have everything I need in the room and that I am well attended to by the staff. I get all this and more at Lenox and do not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for more from a stay in Boston than four walls and a TV. Lastly I will mention that the manager at the Lenox Ms. White went above and beyond durring a stay for my and my wife's anniversary when she offered us a free upgrade to a beautiful suite that was available in honor of our anniversary. I have stayed at the Lenox since and felt equally welcome and immensly enjoyed our stay there. Do yourself a favor and stay at a hotel with character and charm that is right in the heart of Boston close to all the shopping and events you won't regret it. Keith

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: soxgirlnh
Reviews.Content: Just had a "girls weekend" in Boston and we stayed at the Lenox Hotel on Boylston St. It was just what we needed! Beautiful rooms, window overlooked Boylston St. and we even had a fireplace! The staff was very polite and even brought us up a mini-fridge! It was perfect location to walk to dinner and we found a great bar in the hotel called City Bar. We will definetly be returning in a couple months!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: rednotdead
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but not the best. Room was ok and clean. Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the meals. Good location though, very close to Copley Sq, the Pru and the public Library. Loads of eating/drinking places around with a good value food court in the bottom of the Pru centre. Hotel seems to be trading on its past glories a little but I would stay here again - providing I can get a good internet rate!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Givvie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for 2 nights at the beginning of October and we really enjoyed it. The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Boston, close to shops, restaurants and the major attractions. We were given a large room on the 11th floor with excellent views out over the city. The room was very clean and beautifully furnished in the characteristic style of the hotel. It had a large walk- in wardrobe, perfect for storage, a safe, mini fridge, large TV, radio and CD player, large bathroom with a range of toiletries, bathrobes, a very comfortable bed, high speed wi-fi connection and delicious cookies left in the room every evening! The staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The only improvement from our point of view would be to have coffee/tea making facilities in the room itself as this was supplied in the mornings but it meant going downstairs to the lobby to collect it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: scaredintibet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing time staying at the Lenox. The room was impeccable and comfortable. And the staff was extremely helpful and nice, especially Meredith White. We really appreciated all her help and so enjoyed staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gunslinger99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lenox hotel for four nights early September. The location of the hotel is very good. Nice shopping streets (Newbury Avenue) is just a 2 minute walk away. Our room was quite big . The people in the hotel were exceptionally friendly. The service was excellent. e.g.: our stroller has been broken by Continental during our flight from Europe. Thomas Bliss, fantastic concierge, organized a new one. Thanks, Thomas! We can recommend this hotel to everyone, who needs a very good located hotel, friendly atmosphere and excellent service...

Reviews.Title: “fantstic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazandkazm
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of our 25th wedding anniversary holiday. what a fantastic hotel all the staff were so helpfull and friendly. we were given a up graded room with a city view which was a fab surprise, the room was spotless and huge. The bed was so comfy with beautiful soft sheets. The hotel was very central for sightseeing you could walk to most places from here or use the t station near by. this hotel is a must if in boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox is best!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseybostonguy
Reviews.Content: Lenox has it all: Great location, Great service, Great restaurants, charming rooms, fantastic concierge. All walking distance from Boston's best tourist attractions and business destinations. Highly recommend Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “A must if staying in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DollyGill
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay at the Lenox for my husbands 30th birthday. You can't get a better location, close to T-stop, close to shops, bars & restaurants. Cheesecake Factory & P.F Changs is a must!! The staff at this hotel are the best I have ever encountered in all the times we have stayed in the States. The service is second to none and staff cannot do enough for you. Rooms are spacious and clean, as is the rest of the hotel. Glad we picked the Lenox and when we return to Boston, won't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian9
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a family run hotel and it really shows. Everything is exactly the way a hotel should be. We stayed in room 918 ('Classic Room') from 1 to 4 Sept for the last three nights of our honeymoon and were impressed with everything from the bamboo in the bathroom to the presentation and cleanliness of the room. The service is equally excellent, from the cleaners to the concierge to reception staff to the bar staff. On a practical note the hotel is perfectly located for the subway next door, it is one block from the shops and cafes of Newbury Street and is about a 30 minute walk from downtown Boston. After spending three nights at the Boston Park Plaza on Arlington Street a week earlier we both felt the Lenox is on another level, most of the guests seemed to have stayed there before and I see why. My wife and I will be going back to Boston and we will be staying at the Lenox. (try the bar, I counted about ten different single malts, heaven!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaraOakland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox for several days for a family vacation prior to moving our daughter into college nearby Boston. It has an excellent location - one block from the T, many wonderful restaurants and shops within a few blocks, just a few T stops or a long walk to Boston common, 10 minutes T ride from the Freedom trail and museums, and a large grocery store one block away. Rooms were large and beautifully maintained, excellent service, concierge very helpful, bellmen also really great helping with lots of luggage and boxes. We got a good rate through hotel.com, and absolutely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: butterjl
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Back Bay area of Boston. Very close to Newbury Street with lots of shopping and restaurants. One block from the Prudential Center (v. large indoor mall with upscale shops). We had an enormous room (517) with a large walk-in closet and large bathroom. Impeccable cleanliness. However, the best attribute of the hotel was the service. The valet attendants at the front were attentive. The front desk personnel couldn't be more helpful, and "Jimmy" the older australian bellman was delightful (had to be 80 and managed to get all 5 of our bags to the room in record time and was charming us the entire way). I really felt that the price for the room was completely justified.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gkraus1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Lenox, very nice and clean hotel with good service. We had a quick breakfast at their restaurant Azure every morning and it was OK. The place did not "invite" us to come back for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but there are better”
Reviews.Author: Elstonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of a week in New England, during which I had stayed in some wonderful hotels and B&B's. When we arrived, our room was supposed to be ready, but there was dirty laundry lying in the bathroom. The room itself was small and pokey, with no view. I explained this to the desk, and asked if we could change rooms. They gave us a new room which was much more roomy, and which had a view (and no dirty laundry). The hotel is central, and convenient for the new shopping mall. The staff gave us an early morning call, and arranged transport to the airport in plenty of time for our flight. Some of the areas around the lifts could do with refreshing, as they are looking a little tired. Otherwise the room we had was fine. For the price, I would prefer the Hilton in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonDalezios
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed. We were there for 5 nights and we had a great time. Unbelievably polite and pleasant staff, beautiful room, fantastic location. I would definitely stay there again. The only issue that had not to do with the hotel but with expedia was that my credit card was hacked through the site (expedia.com), so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable but ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnandCarolineUK
Reviews.Content: Yes it is an excellent hotel and no doubt one of the best in Boston but it does not leave one wanting to go back. No complaints as such but not exceptional. For example we came in from the rain one afternoon and asked the conciege where we might get coffee. He acted as if we were asking for the moon. He suggested the bar and a Costa round the corner, eventually he offered us room service in reception which was fine but in a top class hotel I would not expect coffee and biscuits to be a problem. Room service emant we had to pay a service charge and they still expected a tip! The business centre has free internet access which is great but only two pc's so I regularly had to wait in line, again in this class of hotel I would expect more. J,C and H

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maximizinglife
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed only one night at the Lenox during our northeast college tour but that one night left us wanting more! The staff is phenomenal! Everyone from valet, front desk, concierge, bellmen, housekeeping was waiting to serve us with the most pleasant attitude, something that I find lacking at most places. The room was very clean and classy. The bathroom was a bit small but hey, this is an old city! I spoke at length with three different concierge about sites, restaurants and transportation. All three were very generous with their time and suggestions. The stuffed Lenox Lions given to children at checkin are a really sweet touch! As I mentioned, we were sadly only in Boston for one night but were able to spend two days. The bellstaff stored our luggage after we checked out until we came back at 6:00pm to pick it up, saving the hassle of taking the car out of valet to load it up and put it back (and tip for the in and out!). Hotel location is excellent, in a very tony area with excellent restaurants and shopping just one street away (Newbury St.). Local sites such as Boston Public Garden, Boston Common, and Boston Public Library are all within walking distance. This hotel definately exceeded my expectations and I am very anxious to return to Boston and show my husband around! I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else! I would also like to recommend two other companies we used and loved in Boston: Atlantic Fish House restaurant just across the street from the Lenox and Urban Adventours bike tour company. All in all, the people of Boston are great - very friendly and they have an awesome city to live in!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KgageStLouis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Lennox. Room was beautiful and large. Hotel staff were extremely accomodating. Room service breakfast was delicious. Great location close to Pru tower, Trinity church, Boston public library and public transportation. We did not need a car in Boston. The subway stop was one block away. We also did the hop on hop off trolley which we purchased through the hotel. Great restaurant...Atlantic Fish Co just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: nistock
Reviews.Content: Boston was the start of my July 2008 trip. After a much delayed flight, due to a computer crash at Dublin airport, the Hotel Lenox was a great first choice of hotel. We were upgraded to a large comfortable corner room. I really have no complaints about the hotel at all. Where it scores highest is its great location in the Back Bay area with its great places to eat and drink, as well as the shops. The start of the essential Duck tour is just round the corner. The Lenox is a 4-star hotel, and a very good one. It is friendly, efficient, with good service, and a good breakfast. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: egoldsby
Reviews.Content: We were there for a convention in February. Sometimes when you get the convention group rates, or it's planned through the convention website you're getting discounts and feel the difference in the discounted service upon arrival, but not the case here. My husband had a king bedroom and my mom & son shared another. Both rooms were exquisite, the service was fantastic and everyone from the concierge the personal touch of the manager was excellent. The location couldn't be better, easy walking or cab distance to literally everything. Highly recommend this boutique hotel. If I had to find a complaint, the servers at the irish pub downstairs were a little daft, but the food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “What lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: RQP
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Lenox when my dear husband arranged a birthday in Boston for me (including Red Sox tickets and a meal at the magnificent Capital Grille)... Although the Lenox is fantastically situated right in the heart of Back Bay and it is a fine old hotel building - it was the wonderful staff who really made it special for us. From the cleaning staff to the concierge - they were helpful, cheery (not always the case in Boston!), engaging and kind. The little touches = balloons in the room, and nice birthday card - this made all the difference. On a teeny off note... the room we stayed in had burns in the rug and bedside stand door (obviously a candle gone bad by a previous guest)... no biggie - but it was noticed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ShrimpScampi
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay on July 1 at The Lenox. The hotel was in a fantastic location, with Newbury Street and the Prudential Center within easy walking distance. We still dream of the extra comfy bed. The concierge made an error in booking us on a "Duck Tour" but immediately rectified the situation. In fact, they provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine as an apology. Certainly it wasn't necessary, but we appreciated the gesture - and the wine! We would definitely make The Lenox "home" during our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, careful which room you get...”
Reviews.Author: Barnie256
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the Lenox from Jul 2nd to 6th 2008. Overall the hotel is good, reasonably priced in a great location with good onsite hospitality amenities...the breakfast (always a good indication of the food!) was very good and reasonably priced. The room was a nice size, clean, with a good sized television and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was clean and ok in size but the bath is small. Overall the bathroom could use a little updating. Our room however did have a couple of niggles...at night, the gap under the door (about an inch and a half at the locking side) let in a lot of light and noise...also, the air conditioning, even when switched off, was quite noisy, it made a sound like excessive 'white noise' all the time...finally, there seemed to be some sort of electrical engine running somewhere below the room (a corner room a few floors over the Lindt chocolate shop) because all night long there was the hum of an engine - very wearing, only solved by using the cotton wool provided in the vanity kit as make shift earplugs! So overall good, but get as far away from the chocolate shop as you can!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arsenalmom
Reviews.Content: First time with family in Boston, and the Lenox and its staff could not receive a stronger recommendation. Perfectly situated one block from 30-40 great places to eat on Newberry Street. Staff actually go out of their way to be polite and helpful, not just at checkin, but throughout the stay. It was amazing. Nice work out facilities, great beds, Irish Bar on site. I can not imagine ever staying anywhere else in Boston. Everything was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Sunster-Chicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Boston for the first time and stayed at the beautiful Lenox Hotel in the Back Bay area of Boston. Our room was beautifully decorated, a very comfortable king-size bed, a good-sized bathroom and a separate closet for our coats, etc. The service was outstanding! Everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly and knowledgeable. The concierges gave us all the information, plus maps and suggestions for the places we needed to go. We walked to Fenway Park for a game (Red Sox won!), we walked to almost every site we wanted to see. The beautiful Boston Gardens were within walking distance of the Lenox and the hotel is across the street from the stately Boston Public Library and lots of shopping, restaurants and pubs. When we come again to Boston, (and we will) we will definitely stay at the Lenox . It was like our home away from home. The candies left on our turned-down bed every night were sweet! The hotel price was more reasonable than a lot of the larger hotels around. The Lenox is only 11 stories high, and it felt a lot cozier than the other hotels. We recommended it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously positioned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StefanieCapeTown
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel the Lenox is. After a very long flight from Cape Town in South Africa via London, we were delighted to find such a stylish well kept hotel. It truly lived up to all the rave reviews on Trip advisor and the room looked just like the photo on the web, which was a huge relief! It is probably the best positioned hotel for touring central Boston. I booked on line and got a special rate which was great. It is expensive, especially in South African terms, but well worth it. We loved the turn down service and the Lindt chocolate that was put on our pillow every night. Even better.....there is a Lindt store right underneath the hotel so every night when you trudge wearily back to your hotel, you could pop in for a sweet â€œpep me up". Another very useful thing is that there is a Dunkin Doughnut right across the road from the hotel so my husband popped over every morning for our coffee which was a fraction of the hotel prices. The hotel is so wonderfully positioned that we never had to use taxis. The "5th Avenue" of Boston, Newbury Street is only 2 blocks away. Truly a 3 min walk. There you can stroll along the wonderfully wide sidewalks and experience Boston life, its people and shops. The Bostonians are so smart and they all seem to have beautifully groomed dogs. A 20 min walk will take you to the public gardens and on the other side of the park is the famous Cheers Pub. A must see with good food as well. Another half hour from the park will find you in Beacon Hill, the oldest part of Boston which is an absolute treat, with the most exquisite homes and little squares. Boston and the Lenox is definitely deserving of a second visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nikitasmom
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lenox Hotel was great. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. My son was given a stuffed lion upon check in which he loved. The room was beautiful and surprisingly spacious for an older hotel. We ate breakfast at Azure. The meal was very good but the only downside is my son's breakfast didn't arrive until 20 minutes after ours. As a way to make amends the waitress didn't charge us for my son's. I would definetly recommend the Lenox. It's a wonderful hotel in a great location and you can easily walk to many attractions and it's close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at the The Lenox”
Reviews.Author: sophiadecouto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent this past weekend at The Lenox and had a fabulous time! The wonderful hospitality began from the moment we arrived at this â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel. Our room was really lovely (and big), turndown service was wonderfulâ€¦especially the delicious cookies they provided! If you want to have a few drinks, the infamous City Bar is in the lobbyâ€¦..have a few martinis (my favorite is the ginger-peach martini) and stumble up to your room. The Lenox is located smack in the middle of an array of shopping and dining. You can not go wrong at The Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Angelina049
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lenox hotel was superb, the staff was friendly and accomodating, the ammeneties were top notch, best location in Boston, I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterDundalk
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in room 918, a standard room. It was a good size room with a decent size bathroom and a little walk-in dressing room. There is a mini fridge with complimentary water, but no mini bar service or tea/coffee facilities. The bed is very confortable, and the maid sets it up for you in the evening and leaves some peanut butter cookies... The hotel is very well located, across the street from the Public Library and very close from the subway line. We liked the Irish Pub, Solas. The food was very nice, but the service was a bit slow and not overly friendly. We had a drink at the City Bar, where again the service was not as good as we expected ( I wouldn't call it "service with a smile").

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: kabir0210
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location than where the Lenox is located. We could walk/take the train anywhere. Conveniently located in Copley Square, you are one block from Newbury Street, a 10 min. walk to the public gardens, and endless restaurants and bars. The hotel itself was very nice, but pricey. I was expecting nicer rooms (especially the bathroom), but the location and excellent staff made up for it. I would definitely stay here again (if I can get a better rate)!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: mike_at_los_altos_CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Lenox Hotel between Thursday May 15 and Sat May 17. We had a great experience. We would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Boston. Room We had a double room on the 10th floor with two windows. The room is reasonable size in the Boston metro area. Not huge but big enough. It is nicely furnished. Room was super clean. The maid came to clean the room multiple times each day. They restock the bottle water, clean the bathroom and towels, and refresh the bed and bath robes. Free Wifi was available throughout the hotel. I believe that exercise facility was available also, but we did not use that. Service ALL the hotel works were very professional -- from bell boys to check-in counter to maid service. Always helpful and always smiling. The front desk was very efficient. We did not waited for long for anything. I am very happy that we were able to check in 7:30AM in the morning. That enable us to take a shower and have a full day to activities. Location The hotel is near the Back Bay Area in Boston. Near the Boston Public Library and the Green Line on the T (subway). The hotel is next to the Newbury Street shopping area, the Prudential Center shopping, Copley Place and the Duck Tour starting point. Boston Common, Faneuil Hall, Freedom Trail, Boston Harbor and Convention Center, and MIT can easily be reached via the T. Transportation We took the Silver Line, to the Red Line, to the Green Line on the T to the hotel. Easy, cheap and fast. No problem at all. We took the T everywhere and did not try taxi or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: BrightonSpike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lennox between the 5th and 10th April 08, On Arrival at the hotel we were met by very helpful reception staff. Boston is a great city, we have been to NYC previously and we would return to Boston over New York. The locals, The scenary and the shopping are all superb. The visit to the top of the Prudential Tower is well worth a visit for spectacular views across the city. As for the hotel, ideal situation, right next to the Copley subway which provides easy access to all of the city. The hotel in the main is fine, the room was very comfortable, the hotel is old and is showing some signs of this, most days we had an issue in the room and whilst not major every day when you have to ask reception to resolve problems it does get annoying, for example the air condition and heating failed to work each day, the shower had no hot water, the door key didnt work on a regular basis, The hotel staff were very apologetic and resolved the problem very quicky only for the problems to return the following day. Whilst annoying this would not stop us from visiting the hotel again, We hope to return to Boston later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: tb_review
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I write a review for an Hotel, but I want to share with other travellers my nice experience at "The Lenox" Hotel. I have spent only two nights at Boston in this hotel with my wife during our trip in the U.S.A at the end of April 2008. I live in Italy, and even if in last months you have probably read bad news about Italian garbage near Naples (grrr!!!), you know that Italians love living in clean houses. â€œThe Lenoxâ€� is not only a really clean hotelâ€¦if you enter the lobby youâ€™ll enjoy a really pleasant smell that is there in the air. But this has only been the beginning of our enjoyable experience. After booking the two nights I had sent an e-mail at Lenox internet site informing them that weâ€™d spend â€œa sort of second honeymoonâ€� in the U.S.A. At the reception when we arrived at the Hotel (in the early morning!) they gave us an upgraded room at the same price. What a lovely and big room, with a fireplace! After the surprise of the nice room we experienced a fantastic extra. After a few minutes we entered the room a waiter knocked the door with a delicious cheeseboard, some delicious biscuits and a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon on the tray. We loved it and, before tasting everything, we read the wonderful hand-written message that the assistant of the front office manager have sent us. We have carried this beautiful envelope back in Italy to have a good memory of that nice hotel. We used the wireless internet connection that is a complementary service (that is free of charge) to contact, with my laptop and webcam, our relatives in Italy using internet. The Hotel offers also many other free services that you could see directly at its internet site. The Hotel is placed in a perfect place. You can reach Copley place in 2 minutes, or see the magnificent London-like buildings (with lovely shops at their ground floor) in all streets near the Lenox. The metro is at 50 m. from the Hotel. I definitely recommend â€œThe Lenoxâ€� hotel in Boston. Itâ€™s really a valuable Historic American Hotel. P.S.: In Boston we have also tasted two delicious dinners at s"Legal Sea Food" Restaurant. If you like sea-food, shell-sea-food and good white wines then this is the right place for you. I recommend it. Its unique limit is that you can't find it in many USA cities!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: ivoryb
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a four night stay in the lenox a great experience. Firstly location is perfect close to Boston Common and handy for trains ( harvard trip a must) and short taxi rides to anywhere else you want to visit. The rooms were well appointed and roomy enough bathrooms were fine. There are two bars an Irish bar a little more casual and the city bar very busy and a little more highbrow.The gym is small but does a job.Staff very pleasant over all and doorstaff were very helpful. Overall if you stay at the lenox you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bradytomoss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights at the beginning of May. We arrived early (around 10 am) and were told our room was not ready yet. We were also informed at that time that we had been upgraded to an Executive Suite (room 1008) and that we would be contacted when our room was ready. By 1:30 pm we hadn't been contacted so I called the hotel and was informed that the room was still not ready but to call back in 25 minutes. We decided to walk back to the hotel and by the time we arrived the staff member told us our room was ready. She then handed us keys to room 417 at which time I asked her if this was the same type of room as 1008. She informed me that room number 1008 was still not ready and that other than being six floors lower they were bascially the same room. She allowed us to check the room to see if it was to our liking. The room was very nice but had no view other than that of a huge air vent. I then spoke with a room attendent who informed me that there was a significant difference between the two rooms. I returned to the front desk and questioned the employee further to which she replied, "you win. you can have the room." This comment upset me in the fact that I wasn't trying to win anything, I just wanted the truth. Oh....and magically, room 1008 was ready all along. Two lies from one employee....and that's not the last one. The room was beautiful (fireplace, flat screen, etc) The rest of the staff were excellent. Probably the best I have ever experienced from a hotel. Our first night there 84 year old employee, Jimmy Fisher, came to our room to light our fire. He alone made our trip. However, on our last night I returned to the front desk to obtain additional firewood to start another fire. The original woman was working and informed us that after May they no longer light fires in the rooms. I informed her that we had fires the last two nights to which she replied, "oh, ok, I'll send someone up." She drove me crazy! I almost informed her superiors about my experiences with her but didn't because the rest of the staff made me forget about her. The location is perfect. A good healthy walk to and from Faniel Hall but only a few minute subway ride if you're not into walking. Lots of restaurants around and plenty of shopping. Also a quick ten minute walk to Fenway. The only thing bad about this hotel (other than that one employee) is the fact that our room was so nice we never wanted to leave. I recommend this hotel to everyone and would definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is charming”
Reviews.Author: mrsje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox as my husband was running in the Boston Marathon. We originally booked the Marriott and, when we went to see what we missed, we were so glad we had changed our booking to the Lenox. There is a nice friendly atmosphere at the Lenox, the staff are all helpful and efficient and nothing is too much trouble for them. The hotel is well situated and within walking distance of excellent restaurants (inc the wonderful Atlantic Fish Company), shopping mall, Common, subway etc. Our room was clean and tidy with a comfortable bed, and we liked the homely touches to the bathroom and the nightly bed turn down service. We thought the marathon "goody bag" was a generous, thoughtful gesture by the hotel and was indicative of the great efforts to please. Our room service meal was excellent but my only crticism of the hotel concerns the bar and restaurant. For me the bar was not a good place - personally I don't like sitting in the pitch black, and I would have liked to be able to get a good cup of coffee when returning to the hotel after a busy day.The meal we ate in the restaurant was not at all good, but the hotel was completely full at that time, the staff were great and I feel very guilty making any sort of criticism at all. Our thanks to you all for a very enjoyable stay, I have no hesitation in recommending the Lenox and hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Katymc226
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing too much trouble for the staff, friendly, helpful and taking great pride in their work. The room was beautiful and the bathroom to die for! My husband wanted to fit the large LCD TV into our suitcase. Each evening the beds were turned down and little pastries left on the pillow. Sumptuous bathrobes per person, iron board, safe in the closet, which was easy to set with your own pin number, and an umbrella. Everything felt luxurious and the thought that went into the furnishings was incredible. The Azure restaurant served an elegant breakfast at a reasonable price; the Solas Irish pub did a very hearty plate of simple but good food (bring your appetite). The City Bar was lively but elegant, the staff were very thorough on checking ID to ensure no under age drinking. The hotel was central for walking into Boston, or if you did not want to walk, the dooman would wave a cab for you, however the â€˜Tâ€™ was only one block away with $2 per trip. To use a Bostonian quote, â€˜A place were everybody knows your nameâ€™, unlike larger chain hotels were you are just a number. We did not want to come home & we canâ€™t wait to go again. A word of warning which was not any fault of the Lenox was a rogue taxi driver when we were on a trip, claimed to be our transport back and then tried to claim extra money and was very demanding.. We called the police and the Concierge dealt with all of it for us, ensuring that we got inside in the warmth and even arranging coffee for ourselves and three people who were not even guests. Ask to check ID and always make sure you know who is supposed to pick you up

Reviews.Title: “Musty, gloomy dowager”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: At $345/night I was hoping for something a little classier. I don't think my room had been properly aired in years. The paint is chipping; the decor is tired and the lighting is terrible. The tiny room was dominated by a giant flat screen tv but there was no comfortable place to sit. Excuse me, the bed does not count as a chair, thank you very much. And what is it with the loose headboards that crash into the wall every time someone in the neighboring room rolls over?

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: Afa-Annie
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice on entering the hotel is the ambience and plushness. Our room was oppulent,not one of the large rooms there,but grand all the same....with a lovely comfy bed and widescreen LCD TV...just the tonic after a day walking the city....... The maid came every night to do the turn down...what a sweet gesture.......and with a sweet dreams pilllow put on top of the bed along with confectionery to nibble.......... The staff were all lovely and nothing was any trouble to them........ One particularly special touch happened just about half an hour after we arrived......Our bags took a while to get to us and a waiter suddenly appeared at the door with a trolley tray complete with champagne,glasses and a letter of apology because we didn,t recieve our bags to the room in their alloted time scale....... Wow.!!!! What service........... Would I recommend this hotel.......... YES..........you bet i would......... And if you are going i can assure you that your every need will be taken care of by their fabulous staff..........ENJOY........ Thankyou Lenox for lovely memories..........

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel - We Will Definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: SGtravels
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Lenox for a long weekend. We were amazed by this place. We used to travel all over with my dad's company, staying in some very high-end hotels. The Lenox, with its incredibly personalized and attentive service, stands out as one of the most memorable hotels we have ever experienced. The staff went above and beyond to make sure my mom and I had a wonderful stay. Everyone was exceedingly professional and friendly. My mom and I love to try non-touristy local restaurants. We called the concierge a few weeks before our trip and she made excellent recommendations for all of our meals. She even made all of the reservations and we found ourselves at the best tables. The hotel itself is a historic property that has been impressively updated. It feels both classic and sleek. Our room, with two comfortable queen beds, was spacious and very clean. The bathroom contained products by Aveda. The hotel is quiet. We never heard any noise from neighboring rooms, the hallway or from the street. The hotel's location is perfect, with easy access to the Copley Square train station. If you like to shop, Newbury Street is just a block away. It is also very close to the Convention Center and the Prudential building. Boston is really not that big; we walked from the Italian North End through Boston Common to the hotel in just about a half an hour. We highly recommed this hotel and definitely plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: AlexAlecSmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox with a friend. We had booked twin beds, we were give one queen size for two not small people. When shown the room we immediately asked to be changed and were told that this was not possible. This continued to be not possible for the whole 6 nights so I spent 4 of them sleeping on the floor. Our requests were met by blank smiling faces that refused to recognise a problem or do anything about it. Alex Alec-Smith

Reviews.Title: “Suberb service!”
Reviews.Author: comedor
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Marathon weeked; a very busy time for the hotel. Nonetheless, the service was superior. Not only were we treated great, we saw many instances where staff helped other visitors. (e.g., for people checking in whose rooms weren't ready yet, staff immediately "jumped" them in the lobby offering to take all manner of bags to storage to leave the guests free to cruise the nearby streets and marathon expo.) I know we would never have gotten the same level of service at one of the large chain hotels nearby. They accomodated a room change request; they gave great, accurate directions- an especially helpful act because of street closures on both Sunday and Monday. The conceirge staff was very knowledgable and gave us a restaurant recommendation that perfectly fit our description of what we desired. Our room was clean and presentable; never waited too long for an elevator (good luck with that in a fully-booked Marriott!); enjoyed the walk-in closet and large in-room fridge; nice to have a bathtub available instead of shower only. I'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: philwrigley
Reviews.Content: The Lenox made our trip to Boston fantastic. From check in to check out - the staff could not have been more helpful aiming to please our every need! Check in was smooth and they provided us with some useful information on the city. It was only a short walk from the Copley Place subway station - making the journey from the airport a breeze. We were a little dissapointed with the size of the room we were allocated. After the first day, we contacted the front desk who were happy to upgrade our room to make our stay more comfortable. Both rooms we stayed in were lovely, but we felt we were in heaven with our second room. A lovely 4 poster huge bed, a seating area, a HUGE plasma television, radio/CD player, a seperate closet (walk-in), a fridge with ice compartment, room safe, plenty of lighting / table lamps, books to read and information supplied about Boston. Every request we made - the hotel went out their way to ensure it was done with speed. Our visit to Boston was made a real pleasure and delight with the hotel - we would love to return here in the future. As part of the hotel is an Irish Bar which was always busy - a great atmosphere. There was also a seperate restaurant and more upmarket bar to satisfy everyones needs! The hotel is a short walk to all the attractions in the city - we only ever had to use public transport to visit Harvard University. It is in close proximity to the Prudential Center (loads of shops and cheap eating places) and also one block away from Newbury Street. If you are considering Boston - make sure you investigate staying at the Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: peterharwich
Reviews.Content: Had been looking forward to staying here having looked at the reviews, reality was a little different. I think I have seen a smaller hotel room but after thinking for a week I cannot recall where. We had hoped for a twin rather than a double a request for this was dismissed out of hand with a retort that we should keep checking back to see if one became free. Staff came and removed the keyboard that was with the tv, no note was left to explain this so we thought intruders may have got in, but it was to do with wireless access points. We were out a lot during our six night stay but when we were in the room staff kept knocking on the door to ask if you were OK, when you said no they just stared at you, very strange !. Will not go again.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for 4 nights while on a business trip. The rooms were nice, big, clean. Large plasma in the room. Don't know if that was their standard room or a check-in upgrade. The gym is small but functional and the hotel has limited amenities... but for someone who just needed bed to sleep in the hotel is perfect. Location is a ++++++ as it is lively just stepping outside the doors - even at night. Met all my requirements and expectations...

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox for 4 nights with our 2 children. After reading many reviews on here I emailed the hotel a week before our stay and asked if we could have a corner room and how did we get the teddy bears for our children. Keith emailed back and said he would sort everything out for me! When we arrived after a long flight we were welcomed so warmly and our children were given lovely soft teddy bears - what a wonderful gesture. When we walked into our room we were delighted - it was so so spacious and beautifully furnished and decorated with 2 double beds, a large flatscreen tv, writing desk, good sized table and chairs, full length mirror, 2 windows, fireplace, CD player, drinking water and proper glasses, a massive drawer unit and built in wardrobe which contained the safe, bathrobes, umbrella, iron and ironing board. The bathroom had aveda toiletries and plenty of fluffy towels folded creatively. ( But our toilet also had vecro to hold up the seat!!) The public restrooms were lovely and my husband and son were amazed to see a tv above each urinal - my daughter had to go in to see this but I did not dare. All the staff were so friendly, Keith and Cindy helped us out regularly with advice and maps and ideas on child friendly eating places. We also loved the lindt chocolates every night as part of the turndown service. We would definately stay here again, the location is great, as others have described and I can honestly say it is the friendliest place we have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, but”
Reviews.Author: fielding
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lenox over St. Patrick's Day weekend (yes, it's a weekend in Boston). The Irish pub in the hotel was jammed and rowdy. So was the other bar -- City Bar -- even if a gentler kind of spot. There was lots of comings and goings through the lobby -- many people not guests but going to the bars. That's not why we were in town and, despite the hubhub, enjoyed our stay. Still...the old-fashioned presence of the Lenox -- very lovely, really -- belies the notion of it as one of Boston's favorite watering holes. Our room was one of the larger doubles featuring two windows and well over 400 sq ft. Not especially well appointed -- certainly could use some updating, and the bathroom was small. Strangely, the toilet seat could only stay up by being velcro-ed to the wall behind it (velcro provided). Good beds and very dark curtains. Didn't pick up much street noise and we slept so well one night we overslept a meeting the next morning. We booked our room on hotel.com and got a very favorable rate, much less than the advertised rate. For what we paid, and for Boston (notoriously expensive), the Lenox was great. Not so sure I'd say that, though, if I'd paid more. One of the Lenox's finest features is the location in the heart of Back Bay -- it's one reason why we picked it . The other reason is because we had stayed there for a night on our honeymoon more than 30 years ago. No real memory of it, but I'm quite sure it didn't have the lively night life then that it does now. The Lenox has a nice authentic old-fashioned ambiance in a superb location -- if only the rooms had some of the same updating that has been put into the public conveniences!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwiwinelover
