Reviews.Content: Without exception, the five nights we spent at the Lenox was the best hotel experience we have ever had. The reception area was elegant and welcoming. Our room was huge with a massive television, huge bed, excellent shower pressure and the maid service was very good. The location was perfect for us, very close to great shopping and restaurants. Without a doubt I would stay here again. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen-Mark
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at The Lenox and had a fabulous time. This is a great hotel in every way - staff, location, cleanliness and facilities. It is a two minute walk to the Copley T-station and walking distance to everything from Boston Common to the shopping at the Prudential Centre next door. The Irish Bar in the hotel, Solas, has a good atmosphere and serves great food. The City Bar also in the hotel is a more salubrious cocktail bar which makes super cocktails and is really relaxing. It is very busy at weekends. We ate at Azure Restaurant in the hotel once and had a good enough meal - not good enough to return though! All of the staff at the hotel were excellent - friendly and helpful yet so professional at all times. The Lindt chocolates on the pillows each night was a nice touch as was the complimentary water in the rooms each day. Two small things that slightly irked me was the fact that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and also that whilst we were there they were laying new carpet on the corridors and stairs and the hammering started quite early. Not great when you are having a lie in on holiday! We thought it a little strange that we had been given notification that the windows would be cleaned (didnt see or hear that) but not about the noise from the carpet layers. As I have said these are very small things in an otherwise excellent hotel and if in Boston again I will definitely be staying at The Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot OK room”
Reviews.Author: wife-o-chris
Reviews.Content: The location of the Lenox right in the Back Bay is the number one reason to stay there, The Hotel has impressive history, and the staff is nice and helpful. The rooms are just OK. The rates at the Lenox are usually pretty high, and it's a bummer when you get a tiny room with an old TV on a stand from the 80's. The beds and pillows are nice and comfy and the Aveda products are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: uktraveller1982
Reviews.Content: Am pleased to say I can agree with the vast majority of other reviews on here that put that hotel at 4th best in Boston. Easy checkin meant we were in the room very quickly, with a follow up courtesy call to check all was well. We had a corner room with 2 doublebeds, lots of room. No real views to speak off but then we weren't there for the views. Large TV, reasonable sized bathroom with Aveda toiltries. Fairly small closet really, but enough space for us really with the draws as well. Nice to have a large full length too as often hotel rooms do not have one. Maid service efficient and friendly, evening turntown available. We found the concierge and front desk helpful, even the bellboy was quick to ask if we needed a hand with anything whilst waiting for the concierge and advised us of what we needed. We didn't eat/drink any any of the restaurants but all looked nice and seemed to be enjoyed by the locals, which is usally a good sign. Key for me is the location, right by the Copley T station and pretty close to Back Bay too on the Orange line, which is pretty handy. Good shopping nearby with Newbury St and the Prudential Centre. We had a really good rate so for the money we paid, definitely worth it and even paying more I think that I would have been happy.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed in. Insincere And Unqualified Staff”
Reviews.Author: ronanosullivan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel. I was fined US 175 for smoking in a room. There was no advice that you cannot smoke in this room, there was no no smoking sign in the hallway, room door or in the room. Further there was ash trays provided in this room. The staff were not helpful and just quoted that there is a no smoking policy? I asked what efforts they had used to inform patrons of this policy and they said it was quoted on website and in a form you sign upon booking. Unfortunately a travel agency booked hotel! Wreckless staff and obviously high uneducated as they werent able to evaluate the situation themselves. Upon complaining to the hotel manager he hung up the phone. Terrible stay well clear of this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but a couple of blips”
Reviews.Author: Boowilo
Reviews.Content: We booked the Lenox as part of a weekend package and, although it hadn't been our first choice, we were pleasantly surprised. We were given a corner room which was huge but the best thing was the thickness of the walls and therefore the soundproofing - no creaking floorboards or rattling plumbing from next door. With Boston so achingly cold outside, our room was a haven of warmth and cosiness. It's a lovely hotel and the reception and concierge staff are very friendly and helpful but a couple of details let it down. After a hard day shopping we ordered tea from room service. When nothing arrived after 20 minutes we chased and were told it would be another 25. How long does it take to fill a pot with boiling water? When it did turn up the tea was lukewarm. And the bathrooms (or ours, at least) are dated with clanky taps and disappointing showers. Still, on the up side, the location is great and they do a wicked watermelon mojito in the stylish bar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a very convenient area.”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while on a business trip in Boston. I managed to get a great rate for the standard room and was a little concerned that I would end up in a miserable corner somewhere in the depths of the hotel. Thankfully I ended up in a nicely appointed room next to the elevator. And - no elevator noise. The view was less than stellar - a rooftop and looking up to the Prudential Center but I wasn't there for the view. The closet was a true walk-in closet with plenty of quality hangars, luggage stand, a safe, ironing board and iron. Also provided were terry cloth robes for in room use. I could even fit my luggage in the closet and still get to my clothes with no problem. The only down side was the safe was too small to fit a standard laptop computer. Not very useful from that standpoint. The queen bed was comfortable and turn down service was provided every evening. The room was quiet and I didn't even need to use my earplugs. The free wireless internet worked fine and the flat screen TV worked fine. Lighting in the room was excellent. The bathroom was smallish but efficiently designed. Shower water pressure was strong (very strong) and hot water was consistent. The standard amenities were available and replenished when used. The service at the hotel is excellent. The front desk was more than polite and informative. The bell staff was helpful and polite. The valet and doorman went out of there way to get a cab from around the corner during a heavy rain. The only restaurant I used on the premises was Solas the Irish Pub and I had the Mussels in white wine broth for an appetizer (excellent with great bread for dipping) and the Apple Crisp with Ice Cream (a little burnt on top but still tasty). I was stuffed. Service was polite but a little frazzled. The location of the hotel is excellent. I went to a restaurant on Newbury Street, Tapeo, for Spanish tapas. It was within easy walking distance of the hotel. I had been there before and recommended it to a small business group. It turned out to be a winner again. Excellent service and great food. You can walk to one of two T stops to get around town and there are plenty of other good restaurants and shopping in the area. Checkout was easy and no surprises. All in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 out of 5, Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PeapodNY
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, we have very little to complain about The Lenox Hotel. We just spent the weekend in Boston and booked a great rate for a king room on hotels.com. Immediately upon check in, the hotel was accommodating with an issue we had. They called about 20 minutes later to make sure everything was ok with the room. The concierge, Tom Bliss did a great job with recommendations as well as getting us a last-minute reservation at Aujourd'hui for dinner. All of the staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The decor is elegant and charming and while might be stuffy for someone looking for a modern decor, I found it very welcoming. Downstairs has black wood and the hallways are navy and gold, just beautiful and classic. The rooms are a similar style, with nice molding and decor. The room was not huge but a good size with a comfortable king-sized bed and a flat screen TV. The marble bathroom was also not huge but very nicely lit and laid out with nice fixtures and there was a large walk-in closet. A good number of outlets and complimentary wireless made a little work very easy. We asked for and were given a room on a higher floor, so we had a nice view looking down Boylston Street but with very little street noise or sound from the hallway of the hotel. Wonderful night's sleep both nights. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, once room service and once at Azure. The breakfast is decent, though you might be able to find something better for the price fairly close by. There was a line at both City Bar and Solas on Friday night, but City Bar gave us priority as guests of the hotel and we did not wait long to get in. Overall, I would highly recommend The Lenox as a relaxing, warm, charming, elegant place to stay in Boston. It was very convenient off I-90 and parking, though not cheap (Copley Place was $34 for 24 hours), is easily accessible within 2 blocks walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer Gets Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: tonicurt27
Reviews.Content: When I called the Lenox Hotel for a return visit, I was treated like a VIP by an engaging woman on the reservation desk named Debbie Curran. What a pleasure to be made to feel that my business was important to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: cjlewis
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Lenox Hotel Back Bay Boston. I was in a party of fourty nine of us that had travelled over from wales for a break from work. And we found the perfect city and the perfect hosts. All the staff were freindly and couldn`t do enough for any of the group. The hotel was clean efficent and situated in a perfect location near the many shops. Staff were always their to help any of the group to plan their day and help organise some day trips with local firms which saved us spending money on organised tours. the rooms are adequate for the amount of time your in them and are well proportioned. It also has a nice irish pub which serves good food and drink and also a snazy citi bar and restaurant. All of my companions enjoyed themselves and appreciated the hotel hospitallity. I will be returning with the in laws for a pre christmas trip and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: VATman
Reviews.Content: In Boston for two nights prior to a 5 night stay in Killington as part of a half term family skiing trip with our 14 years old son. Chose this hotel based on other reviews and location and got a great deal via otel.com (one of the links via check rates). Everyone at the Lenox was so friendly and helpful. The place is small enough and old enough to have the character that you just don't get from the big corporate chains. The rooms are traditionally furnished and OK space wise although our bathroom was a bit small. I believe the lobby, restaurants and other public areas have all been refurbished in the last year or two. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which was good and the location is perfect just a block away from Copley Sq. Would recommend the Lenox to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of Copley Sq”
Reviews.Author: Bgiants
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for two nights and my stay exceeded expectations. I was in Boston for a professional conference at another "major" hotel chain, but decided to stay in a more personalized location - and very glad I did. From the greeting of the doorman upon arrival to his goodbye two days later, I felt welcomed and at home at the Lenox. The King room was very roomy, wireless internet, large walk in closet with refrigerator, large bathroom with elegant fixtures, and large HDTV. Room was clean and the staff was very accomodating. I was called 5 minutes after check in just to see if I needed anything and if the room met my expectations - great service. The conference at the other hotel was overbooked and one of my colleagues needed to find another hotel. I asked the Lenox if I could move to a room with two beds and they were very accomodating - even offering to move my luggage. They never hesitated in their efforts to make my stay enjoyable. The double room was just as nice as the King room - it even had a fireplace. So when in Boston, look up the Lenox, and if in the Copley Sq. area - definitely stay here instead of the Marriot's, Sheraton's, or Hilton's - I have stayed at each of these and the Lenox is cheaper and much better.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: alfa114
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in october 2007- the hotel is in an ideal location to see Boston. some very good bars and resturants close by. the hotel offers a warm welcome at check in. the rooms were very well set out clean and a resonable size.the staff we found were helpful. we very much enjoyed our 3 night stay. although the parking charges were a little expensive. try the duck tour its good value for money.if we return to Boston which is possible as its a great city to visit we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendes1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the The Lenox for three nights with my husband en route to Vermont. On our arrival we were met at the door and had help with our luggage which there was a lot of as we had cases, skis, ski boots etc. We went to the front desk where check in was quick and painless. Our room was on the 7th floor and was really nice. Fairly spacious but not much view to speak of. Not that that was a problem as we didnt spend that much time in the room. There was a huge tv for my hubby and wireless internet access for me. We ordered room service the first night which arrived quickly and was very hot and tasted great with the price being reasonable too. Although it was freezing cold and snowy we didnt use public transport at all as the hotel was ideally located for walking. There is a nice restaurant in the hotel called Azure which was great and also a cocktail bar which we used although it did get very busy. There is an Irish bar which was also very good. All the staff in the hotel were really polite and friendly. I would certainly go back to The Lenox as it was really good. We had a great stay and cant fault anything

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox made me not Hate Boston”
Reviews.Author: shroomaker
Reviews.Content: Dearest Travelers, Nearly 3 months ago a friend decided we should take a friendly trip up to Boston from New York. Prior to this trip, Boston did not rank high on my list of places to travel and visit. The Lenox and its staff provided a tip top service and Boston experience. In times when those who do travel for business or leisure we decide by price or status. There is an outstanding brunch. The hotel looks classic and clean. Often hotels that are so into themselves forget to be into the guest. The Lenox never forgot that our group was elite and special. From proper parking accomodations to detailing our room with a fridge, I would recomend this hotel to all who know what the best is. Best regards, Chris

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: bcollin76
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel in the Back Bay, within walking distance of many attractions, and very close to the "T" and commuter rail which will take you any where else you would like to go. Rooms are very large, clean, and beautifully decorated. My only complaint would be the beds were too small and not very comfortable. Otherwise a great room with wonderful perks like free bottled spring water and chocolates. The room we stayed in had a decorative fireplace, but on our next stay we will reserve a room with a working fireplace. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Couldn't ask for better service. We travel to Boston often, and have found our new home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: w_barb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Lenox for 3 nights between Christmas and New Year. When we arrived we were told that the room booked for us was unavailble and that we were being upgraded. We were given a corner room on the 11th floor. It was very large and decorated beautifully throughout. The views from the room were good. The bed extremely large and comfortable. We ordered breakfast on the first morning and could find nothing to complain about, the food was plentiful and delicious. Every evening our bed was turned down, the light and radio left on to welcome us back to the room and a bar of Lindt chocolate left on the pillow, it is little touches like this that make the place extra special. Every member of staff that we spoke to was polite and extremely helpful. The business centre is free of charge (unusual these days). In all we could find nothing to complain about during our stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is centrally located and we found it very easy to get around from here.

Reviews.Title: “Lenox Hotel - Almost Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: LittlePumpkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox for 5 nights in December. Had a beautifully appointed room on the 9th floor with wonderful views over the city. Had to be one of the largest hotel bedrooms I have ever stayed in. Aveda toiletries in the bathroom were great - in fact the housekeeper had forgotten to leave shower-gel one of the days and I left her a little note the following morning. She left additional supplies each day thereafter which was very thoughtful. The bed (and more especially the pillows) were soooo comfy and it was great to snuggle down and look at the snow falling outside! Everything was spotless and clean. The concierge, reception and portering staff - not to mention the waiting staff at breakfast were all very friendly, courteous and helpful. We didn't try out the fitness room (we were on holidays after all...!). However we did use the business centre to check emails etc during the course of our stay. The City Bar is a great place to wind-down after a hectic day and seemed to attract a hip happening local crowd - which added to the ambience. I loved it (and especially the cocktail menu..!). We had lunch in Solas, the Irish bar twice during our stay - which was great. The only fault I would have is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. I find it hard to adjust initially when I go to the States and have an irratic sleep pattern. I certainly would have welcomed the option of making a coffee at 3.30am some of the nights. Saying that, it would not deter me from staying at the Lenox again and am already looking forward to my next trip! For first-timers to Boston, the Lenox is in a great location in the city and you would be hard pressed to find a better gem than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class Service at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: swankyforless
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox on November 23, 2007 in preparation for a friend's wedding that was held there. Our suite was on the top floor, corner room, with a fantastic view of Boston and a working fire place. Mirrored french doors divided the sleeping area and living area. The living area had a small couch, chairs, and a large dining table with about 6 chairs. This was a fantastic and beautiful room for the bride to get ready in. The service of every associate was impeccable. I was able to get into the room before the bride arrived. All bags were brought up in a timely fashion. We were brought extra shower caps and towels, hot water for tea, etc. After requesting these items the front desk called up to ensure their delivery. After all the girls were ready, the room was cleaned and flipped for the honeymoon suite. They did a beautiful job with rose petals, etc. I LOVED my stay at the Lenox and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike13England
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2nd December for 3 nights. Our two queen bedded rooms were spacious. We were on the 4th floor with a good view of the city. The staff were friendly and the rooms were very clean. Hotel is well located for shopping and sightseeing who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Charming, immaculate and perfectly located.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on various occasion 6-7 years ago and I have to say the Hotel had not lost its genuine old world charm during this stay. Immaculate throughout from the small lobby, to the upmarket City bar and the ever so smart tall ceilined but expensive Azure restaurant where on this visit was a dissappointment which must have shown on my face as the appetizer was removed from the bill without me saying a word so maybe this was a one off. My corner room complete with fireplace was as always quite luxurious and spacious, generously furnished including sofa, upmarket radio with ipod connection, magnificent curtains. Other nice touches are free internet connection, extensive choice of TV channels, free daily water ration and high quality bathroom toiletries. The dim night light in the bathroom is something that others should adopt. No minibar which is fine by me, no coffee maker but the best Starbucks in town is literally across the road. Corner rooms all seem to be larger than non corners but not to worry as the hotel is E shaped. The hotel is also home to the pleasant small and lively Irish bar Solas. Great location just a 2 minute walk from Copley Square green line subway station, Newbury Street and dozens of restaurants. Car parking available next door in the underground Prudential complex although most folk seem to use the hotel valet service. Taxi to Logan is about $30-35 and 15-25 mins, subway is $2 and about 45 mins via green and blue lines. Downside is some of the rooms can suffer street noise and the daily emptying of the bins. Just squeezed a 5* rating. Shame no loyalty points.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Bleachyspice
Reviews.Content: The first part of our American visit in November 07 was a return trip to our beloved Boston. We decided to stay in a different location and opted for The Lenox which is stiuated on Boylston Street. We chose a cracker! The room was beautifully furnished, although not extremely spacious, it was clean and comfortable. The rest of the hotel was decorated to an extremely high standard and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There was free wi-fi through-out the hotel and they had a business centre which was also free. This was an amazing service for a 4 star hotel to provide. The Lenox apparently had a full re-furbishment a few years ago and it does not disappoint. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We felt regal”
Reviews.Author: leftwing
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a fabulous small and cozy hotel. My teenage son and I stayed there a few weeks ago and had a wonderful night. The room was huge and had a fireplace. Our beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. We felt regal! The exercise room was nice, too. We had trouble with the lock on the door when we first arrived. Someone came up to let us in and it wasn't a problem afterwards. If you're coming to Boston, want to stay in a great location and be treated well, then the Lenox is for you.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: PGLRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the beautiful room and restaurants in this historic hotel. The hotel staff made the experience even better with their friendly and helpful service. I will make sure I stay at the Lenox Hotel again the next time I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Lenox Hotel was such a treat! BEAUTIFUL & Lavish!”
Reviews.Author: stephfab
Reviews.Content: Staying @ the Lenox Hotel in Boston was such a treat! We were greeted by quick/efficient valets & concierge. The property and decor is gorgeous, like a super-charged Providence Biltmore. Upon entering our rooms there was a gift basket with all sorts of mouth-watering delights and a hand written note welcoming us. Our room was spacious, extremely well-maintained and cozy. I highly recommend the Lenox Hotel in Boston as an alternative to the regular/normal hotels you can get anywhere in the US. This is truly an exclusive Boston experience!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, classy, lovely, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Bkyroz
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at the Lenox back in April, and returned again recently for cocktails at City Bar. It is such a charming, historic hotel, and the recent renovations to the Lobby look AMAZING! So classy and clean, and the staff is very friendly and accomodating! My room was clean, spatious, and inviting, and the service was top notch..and GREEN- which I totally appreciate. One day the weather was terrible, so we stayed in the hotel the entire day- and didn't get stir-crazy! Between the good TV channel options, the great room service menu, the City Bar (amazing bourbon, BTW!) and Azure downstairs, we had a blast! Overall, the Lenox was a great place to call home during my weekend in Boston- plus, it's in the middle of everything, so I was a short walk to shopping, theatre, great restaurants, and the T!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend the Lenox!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslander93
Reviews.Content: Everything about my overnight stay at the Lenox was fabulous! The hotel is in a perfect location - close to amazing restaurants, shopping and entertainment. The staff was friendly, efficient and helpful and the rooms were beautiful - spacious and classy with all the comforts one could need. I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend the Lenox to anyone looking for a great time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Homely and Friendly - the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterRobert
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a lovely clean, homely and friendly hotel. Staff are great and make you feel really welcome, and almost "part of the family". Compare this to the clean and clinical almost "processed" feeling that you get with lots of other hotels. We upgraded our room to a corner suite looking up Boylston Street towards Trinity Church. Looking out over Boylston Street from one window, and over Exeter Street from the other. This room was fantastic. Upon return approx 10 days later (and the end of our US tour), we stayed again at the Lenox. They had automatically upgraded our room free of charge to a room adjacent a corner suite room. This room was lovely again. The Irish bar is great and the food really good value. Try the Clam Chowder! The restaurant in the hotel is really good. You must try the steak and eggs for breakfast. We will be staying at the Lenox again on our next Boston trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jackrus
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this very good hotel - it was centrally located for anywhere in Boston. The room was clean on arrival and kept spotless throughout our stay. We found nothing to criticise about this hotel - free use of the internet was also a plus. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent value but didn't eat there of an evening. Staff were very helpful and I am sure nothing would to too much trouble for them. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was VIP!”
Reviews.Author: WalkinMan
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Lenox was nothing short of wonderful. The staff was very accomodating and my room was spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, employees, food and location!”
Reviews.Author: rosinafrat
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about my stay. The personnel at the front desk were very helpful and extremely polite. We were always greeted with a warm smile and cheeful comment by all employees. We ate at Azure and it was wonderful as well. The location of the hotel is perfect for many things, but especially convenient for shopping. I especially enjoyed that there was mall and boutique shopping within a few blocks of the hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The little extras such as the robes and chocolates were a welcomed surprise to my stay. I would (and will) stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston & Surrounding areas”
Reviews.Author: koi7
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Lennox Hotel in Back Bay, Boston September 2007. This is a wonderful small but very friendly hotel with first class facilities. The city is a must for both young and old as there are all types of attractions in Boston and the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: wilderspin
Reviews.Content: Having looked at various reviews we picked the Lenox for our 5 night stay - and weren't disappointed. We had two rooms - one for me and my 12 year old daughter and the other for my Mum and a family friend. The aim was to shop, eat, shop and shop some more and we certainly did. The Lenox was in the perfect location for us as it was easy to get around most of the local shopping areas, and if we did want a taxi there were always plenty outside Lord & Taylor next door to the hotel. One room (504)was really spacious, a view across to the huge Boston Library, two double beds, plenty of storage, a sofa and room to walk around despite all the shopping bags! Our room (523) was a huge corner room with the same contents, plus even more space, a (non functioning but ) beautiful fire place and 2 large windows on two sides. The beds were comfy, the robes provided were great - as was the wonderful aveda bathroom stuff. My daughter was treated like a princess throughout our stay, which certainly made her feel very grown up. Before arriving I'd asked for help (via e-mail) to book a surprise on arrival and Keith was brilliant. We walked out of arrivals to find someone waiting with a sign saying my daughter's name. We followed and headed off, to our waiting stretch limo! I'd also asked if they could help arrange a bear for my daughter to find on arrival, only to be told all their younger guests received one. Sure enough on check in my daughter received the softest, cutest bear - complete with hotel ribbon and welcome card. We ate in the Azure restaurant for breakfast every day and found the food great and the service very good. We wanted to visit the outlets, book a Duck Tour and a car ( no limo but big enough for 4 people and 10 bags!!) to return to the airport and once again the concierege (Cindy this time) were really helpful. During our stay we had a few small problems - one day the telephone packed up and the next the remote to the TV. Both times they fixed them really quickly, and the maintenance guy was really friendly too. My daughter kept all the delicious Lindt chocolates placed on the beds when turned down at night, to bring home for her Dad. Will definately stay there again:-)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jules124
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights abd wish it could have been longer. Room was spacious and had lovely decor. Bathroom well stocked with Aveda products and nice fluffy robes and towels. Each evening bed is turned down and truffles are on your pillow, nice touches. Breakfast in the restaurant is good value and feels like a treat. The hotel also has 2 excellent bars, one being an irish pub with bar meals and a friendly atmosphere. The other a stylish cocktail lounge. The restaurant serves good food too at lunch and dinner. This hotel is luxurious without being snooty, the staff are friendly and helpful. I would return tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Aguilas
Reviews.Content: Located off Copley Square, in the Back Bay area of Boston this lovely hotel is one block from Newbury Street, the Prudential Shopping Centre and Copley Place Shopping Mall and close to pickup points for the Trolley bus tours of the city. The rooms are luxurious, the beds turned down every night and Lindt chocolates left on your pillow. The bathroom has good toiletries, hair dryer and super soft terry bathrobes. You will also find a complimentary copy of USA Today waiting for you each morning. From the moment you arrive at the door you can feel the difference. The staff were fantastic they booked our trips, leaving tickets in our room while we were out sightseeing, they advised the best shopping areas and restaurants. But a special mention has to go to Jimmy the oldest bellboy (84 years old) in Boston who is a mine of information, could have spent hours just chatting to him. The whole experience was fantastic, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Lenox Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vatican
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located in the Back Bay area of Boston next to the Prudential shopping centre which has hundreds of shops. It is also next to Beacon street a very rich neighbourhood. It is 2 minutes walk from Copely Square were the Trinity church is and a markets is held there once a week. Also it is next to the public library and I advise that everyone goes in the library for their breakfast, it is the most wonderful setting I have ever been in, its like a roman paradise abd you would never know it exisied from the outside, please go in and have your bagels in the tranquil setting of the fountain and roman pillars on the bisto tables its truly fantastic. Also go up the Skywalk in the Prudential Tower again fabulous and not many people know about it take some ID with you though. We used the Grey Line tours daily to different states, like Maine, New Hampshire and these trips are worth every penny if you do not want to drive, well organised and plenty to see and do. We went to \maine and went in a white horse and cart around the streets that no tour bus could get around what a fabulous tour really recommended. Again the coach will pick you up from you hotel and drop you off so there are no worries!!! Then hop on the tube " T" to Harvard University and watch all the students reading in the square, and look around the dorms what a fasinating place have lunch on one of the pavement cafes and listen to the students playing whatever instruments at the time are being played. From the Hotel you can walk a few hundred metrers to Boston Common and the Public Gardens beautiful on a lovely warm wintery day. We walked to downtown along Tremont Street tpicked up the Freedom Trail which is indicated by a red brick line and followed it all the way down to Quincy Market and the harbour side boats. It only takes about twenty minutes and it is a very safe walk. Have your lunch on the cafe at the bayside they give you a bleeper if busy so you can walk around until your table is ready very good food indeed. Quincy Market has all the street entertainers, lots of shops but I bought some gifts from the small carts which I later found half the price in the downtown shops so beware of that. I think the Back Bay area is the best place to stay as you are near the back bay river and you can still walk to the harbour downtown area to take the harbour cruises. You also have the boston common for walks etc. Finally I would like to add I was unsure as to if Boston was a safe city as you hear so many stories, it was absolutely 100% safe infact the safest place in America I was ever in and would definately be returning again for the next fall and i will be staying in the Lenox hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent - can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: foxbeliskey
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Lenox after researching on TripAdvisor. All staff welcoming and helpful - rooms spacious (we were offered a small dark room at first, but they changed it without any fuss). Central, perfect location in Back Bay Overall would highly recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “save money at the Lenox Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has travelled to Boston knows that finding a hotel room is tough.Finding a good hotel room is tougher. And finding a good hotel room at a decent rate is nearly an impossible task! Here's my tip based on recent experience - when u enter Massachusetts stop at the first Cisitors center u find - we entered on the I-90 from NY state - and stopped at Lee Visitors Center.They have friendly personnel there who are glad to help u phone ahead for available accomodations.In addition there are flyers there for great hotels at amazing prices - we tried about 6-8 different hotels but all were fully booked.Finally we tried the Lenox which the visitor center flyer promised for a room rate of $205 +tax per night.When we called the hotel reservations said yes,they did have a room available and quoted us c $410 +tax for a room for three for one night.When I mentioned that I had a flyer with a $205 rate quoted the reservations clerk hesitated,put me on hold for a minute and then came back and agreed to book us a room at that rate provided we gave her a credit card on the spot,reservation was not canceable and we had to show the flyer upon check in. We did all that and we did get a spacious room with 2 double beds at the 100 year old Lenox. Only downside was that they would not let us stay on a second night when we requested. The hotel itself is grand,service is impeccable and location is very god - near the prudential center,newbury street etc. Parking for our rented car was a high $42 per day. But all in all a god experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: kejibeard
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years my husband and I have taken about 20 trips to Boston staying at many different hotels. I only wish we had found The Lenox years ago. As other reviewers have said, it is in a great location- close to the T, close to restaurants, close to shopping. For me though it's the rooms that make it my favorite hotel in Boston. I usually have trouble sleeping in hotels. Not at the Lenox. The rooms are quite, the bed is comfortable and the black-out drapes truly keep the room dark. I highly recommend the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: janeb65
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for location. It's centrally located so you can walk in any direction and find something on your list of things to do. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was clean with a very comfortable bed. After walking 8 hours, a good bed is even better!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Delius17
Reviews.Content: Great place with atmosphere and charm. Friendly staff. Ideally located for all the sights with lots of restaurants nearby. (We love The Cheesecake Factory a step away in the Prudential center!) Would wholeheartedly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: yogababe1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrive late at the Lenox Hotel. After checking in with a very polite and friendly staff we went to our room on the 7th floor. It was gorgeous and very large in the colonial style. It had a (non-working) original fire place, love seat, lots and lots of windows and a divine bed. Being runners we were even more pleased to have one set of windows look down on the Boston Marathon finish line on Boylston street. This entire trip was booked on HOTWIRE. We highly recommend the LENOX. Also not that expensive for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mindintomatter
Reviews.Content: We love historical properties and The Lenox Hotel did not let us down. The Lenox is an architectural gem with a grand past. Customer service was exemplary. Prior to our stay, I requested an upper floor room with a view. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a coveted corner suite with a fireplace and a lovely view of Trinity Church. Our room was well appointed and had a most comfortable king bed with plenty of surrounding seating areas. The Aveda bath products are always a plus on my list. Perhaps, one of the best things about the hotel is its prime location. Ever fashionable Newberry and Boylston Streets are just a stone's throw away. Eateries and classic Boston bars abound. A stroll through Boston Commons beckons only a few blocks away. Upon returning to the hotel in the evening, we discovered The City Bar inside The Lenox is the hip place to be on a Saturday night. Though a line had formed for those waiting patiently to be admitted, we were let through immediately as one of the benefits of being a guest. As one of the best values in Boston, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but good location”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCW
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, we were looking forward to staying in this highly rated hotel. It had been reviewed on a "Green List" for it's eco-friendly practices and we were lucky enough to score a great daily rate online [not on the hotel's own website]. Upon arrival, we were impressed with the grandness of the lobby, photos of celebrities who have stayed at the hotel, and the fabulous location within walking distance to many sites, restaurants and the Galleria Mall; it is also a 10 minute walk from the Metro. Unfortunately, the room was less than expected: the furnishings were old, and the room had a bit of a musty smell. The air conditioner was extremely loud and the week we were there, it was 90F outside, so we had it running most of the time. Due to the air quality inside the room, the loud air conditioners and thin doors, we did not sleep soundly during our 2 night stay. I'd recommend staying here only 1 night to explore the city, or if you have it within your budget to get a suite, I am sure that you wouldn't run into the problems we had. Boston's transit system is reliable and well laid-out so it is not a big deal to find a hotel further from the city. PS: Be prepared to pay $38 per night for parking

Reviews.Title: “Lenox is a charming and comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eslteach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Lenox in Boston in a Queen room with a lovely view. Our son, who lives in NYC, stayed in a standard double room which was also very spacious and had a nice view. Both rooms had a fireplace (which we didn't use of course in July.) The service was great and the location was perfect for us. We enjoyed everything about Boston and the neighboring Cambridge where we visited Harvard. Little Italy is charming and most of the restaurants we tried were great. The rates for the Lenox were very reasonable for the quality of hotel, location, and service. Loved Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the View”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller6
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights in Boston through Virgin Holidays as part of a week's stay in USA. Got room 315 at the Lenox. It is small by American standards and the bathroom was tiny. There was mould all around the bath and everytime we used the shower, there was water on the floor afterwards, so we had to put towels on the floor. The view was of some sort of heating ventilation on a flat roof. we couldn't even tell what the weather was like so just kept the curtains closed all the time. When we asked if we could move to a room with a better view, we were told that we would have to pay a charge of $60. The guy on the desk was totally disinterested, although the person who took our bags to and from the room was very helpful. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room so you have to order room service if you want anything. The lobby was recently renovated, but how often do you use that apart from when you are waiting to leave? The only good thing for us was the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Portastorm
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Lenox Hotel. I can't say enough about how helpful and friendly the hotel staff was to us from the desk folks to the bellhops to the concierge. There was a slight mix-up in our reservations so they put us in a huge corner room that was magnificent! If any of you watch a Disney show called "the Suite Life of Zack and Cody", my kids felt like we were staying at the Tipton Hotel! The aging hotel was been re-done admirably and in a classy manner. We ordered room service one night for dessert and the cheesecake and apple cobbler were just great! Also ate breakfast several times at the hotel's Azure Restaurant and, again, a high quality experience. Rooms were kept very clean and twice daily service for our rooms including a turndown at night with luxurious robes on our beds. The location was great, near a T stop, and also near the very cool Newbury Street neighborhood. All in all, our experience was just great and well worth a return.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: ninameyers24
Reviews.Content: Recently travelled to this wonderful city and stayed at this lovely hotel with my friend in April of this year.We are both very well travelled and have experienced many hotels all over America.We were pleasantly surprised with The Lenox and absolutely loved it!!We were lucky enough to to get upgraded to a corner room which was huge,with 2 double beds and a fireplace,also had a decent sized bathroom.In the bathrooms they supplied Aveda products and on a nightime had a turndown service in the bedroom and placed Lindt chocolates on your pillows(these little touches do make a difference)!The staff were really friendly and very helpful and efficient.The location of this hotel is brilliant and very convenient being just a block from Newberry street where the shops are fabulously chic!!We were very fortunate that when we were there we had fabulous weather which was often in the high 80's so we were able to explore Boston fully and also took day trips upto Salem and Rockport. All in all loved Boston and loved The lenox hotel.Would definately recommend and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowAlbert
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Room was small but very clean. Ideally located for sightseeing. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovate Please!”
Reviews.Author: workandplay8
Reviews.Content: This hotel sorely needs a renovation. French baroque looks neat, but 50 year old surfaces are just decrepit. Could be charming, but really disappointed. Two distinct bed bug bites didn't help. Staff was very friendly. One of two elevators were broken for 2 days, other elevator was very slow and tiny. Room was crampily small. Really don't see the point when better hotels are available.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not all that”
Reviews.Author: M0glie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the last part of our trip. We started with the Queen Mary 2 (S'ton to New York) and ended with the Lenox, so were looking for something special. As others have stated, The Lenox is looking a bit tired and worn. We had a great view (11th floor) but the room could certainly have done with a refurbishment, as could the 11th floor corridor. The bed was AWFUL, it was so hard, I found it difficult to stay confortable for very long. The bathroom was ok, again a bit old and tired. Worst of all, the noise at night. The people next door to our room, returned from obviously a fun night and crashed around and laughed for at least 30 minutes, this was at 01:00 am! I nearly rang the reception at one point. There is no sound proofing at all and you can hear every conversation in the corridor and every bedroom door being opened and "slammed"... all in all, rather dissapointing. Boston however was wonderful, clean, interesting and expensive:o)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: neeniedawg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox with my husband and two young sons. Our stay was fantastic. The Lenox staff were brilliant. Friendly, helpful, very kind to our boys. Very accommodating to children overall. Our room was large with a great view of the Back Bay. Loved amenities like free wireless Internet service after staying at a Marriott where they charged $10 a day. We loved the turn down service at night. We felt like we were treated like special guests. Anything we asked of the staff they provided quickly and with a smile. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. This is a great location in Boston and within walking distance of the Common, Beacon Hill, Newbury Street, and just two T stops from Fenway. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: glaciertravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lenox late Novemer 2006. We are a family of 4 and this hotel was really good. The staff is excellent and the rooms very good. Room-service was great. I loved the complementary newspapers in the bag. Only thing I might want to complain about is the breakfast and the restaurant. Neither the interior (somehow "cheaper" than the rest of the hotel) or the breakfast it self was to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox continues to excel in competitive Boston”
Reviews.Author: vcon2545
Reviews.Content: I got the chance to spend last weekend at the Lenox in the Back Bay of downtown Boston. While the Lenox certainly doesn't dwell on this fact, the location of this hotel puts you in the heart of Boston. For a city that wasn't built on a grid system as later U.S. cities used, being able to access all of the 'T' subway lines within one to two stops should be taken into consideration. Instead of reiterating all of the information that is printed in every tourist packet in Boston, I would also like to stress that Boston is a walking city and having the Lenox's location is invaluable. Being a professional chef I don't get many days off and I can't stand it when a restaurant or hotel charges too much for the view or location and doesn't deliver with the quality. I don't understand this at all. It is a given that people are going to come for the view, therefore reinvest some of that money into making all aspects of experience memorable. For example, having a great view of the Connecticut River and a flavorless overcooked $25 steak tends to negate the former tranquility of the CT River. The Lenox thankfully, DOES NOT fall into this category I just described. Being a pessimist I was continually won over by the little things, which in my business is what keeps people coming back. From the maid helping me with the door to the 'Navy shoe shine' I received from a very knowledgeable Bell Man. I bought my girlfriend some flowers and had placed them in a champagne bucket next to the desk in the room. When we returned from touring Boston, not only were the flowers kept in the champagne bucket (you could imagine a better use for a silver champagne bucket) but the flowers were placed above the television making them the first thing you see when you walked into the room. It is the little things once again that made the difference for me. Thanks again to all the staff at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Worn”
Reviews.Author: TravelsJ
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this place...the rooms are in dire need of some updating. Pretty depressing and definitely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “10 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC-Canuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at the Lenox in Boston. The staff were great and I loved it there. The room was very large, nice furnishings and even had a working fireplace! If you call them prior to 11pm they will bring up the wood for you and light a fire. Room - see pictures. very spacious, large closet, good size bathroom for US. Bed was king size. Bedding was very nice. Security - doormen always on duty. no problems. Room Service - had a breakfast of fruit plate and toast and very ample portions. Very prompt. None of their entrees are vegetarian - even the pasta is made with chicken stock. Bath - see pics. Aveda tolietries - good selection. 2 bathrobes in closet. Internet: Free wireless internet available in the room. Environment - very green hotel. recycle paper, plastic bottles, cans. change the sheets every 3rd day of your visit unless you put a card on the bed, requesting otherwise. As a vegan this was very nice to see. Shopping - right next door to Lord & Taylors. Also next to a couple of large shopping malls. Just a short walk / taxi to Boston Commons. Taxi - a bit hard hailing a cab at 9am but the doormen were great chasing one down for us. Would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect ending to my trip in the US!”
Reviews.Author: lady_britts
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived at the Lenox, I was treated exceptionally well. The staff were happy and helpful. The hotel itself was beautiful and my room which was an executive double, was lush and extremely spacious. I stayed there for 2 nights and ate in both of the restaurants. On checking out, they let me use the main desk computer so I could check in for my flight online. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and pricing!”
Reviews.Author: flight302
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night, and enjoyed hotel and the location. Walking distance to all the key places to visit in the city and the subway is a block away for the others.

Reviews.Title: “Good value (last time I stayed)”
Reviews.Author: JimmyDub
Reviews.Content: Bostn hotels are implasuably expensive. The Lenox has a certain charm, the rooms are small but nicely done. Really central location. A better bet forthe money that the Marriot or Sheraton. If I go back on business I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little faded but recommended overall”
Reviews.Author: Northfields
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lenox for 4 nights at the end of October. Hotel accommodation in Boston is relatively scarce and therefore not great value compared to other cities which we would say is the case for The Lenox too. The hotel was clearly very beautiful once, but has been allowed to fade a little as the decor is now dated and a little tired. There are no coffee-making facilities in the room, nor a mini-bar/fridge. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was clean, the room was a good size with two double beds, the bathroom was nice with fresh flowers. The location is fantastic - Back Bay is definitely the place to stay in Boston. Breakfast seemed expensive so we ate out in Boston - which is recommended - plenty of choice at a range of prices. Regarding restaurants/bars in the hotel: we didn't try Azure; City Bar is okay but there are better places in Boston; we ate in Solas (Irish Bar) on our first night as it was convenient after our flight was delayed and we arrived quite late - it was fine and the food was good. We never used the concierge service as we couldn't get to speak to them as others have mentioned below. We found the front desk helpful though - when we arrived we were allocated a room on the 3rd floor, when there was a wedding reception on the 2nd floor. It was extremely noisy but we requested to change and they sent someone up straight away to give us a new room. Overall, a good hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: KatL
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Lennox for two nights during a trip to Boston and Cape Cod. Our trip started in Washington DC and we had just stayed at the Palomar Hotel (a Kimpton Boutique) and been very spoiled. We checked into the Lennox at $100 per night more than the Palomar and expected old fashioned luxury. Instead, we found a small, pokey room, unfriendly staff and a disappointing stay. There was only enough room at the end of the bed for one of us to walk by, the bed wasn't very comfortable and on a couple of occasions, the desk staff weren't very helpful. They even asked the car hire company to move the car they were delivering to us and we were in the lobby waiting to step outside! At $260 per night I expect a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chevette
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Lenox for 5 nights. The room was lovely with two double beds and plenty of space. Nice touches with fresh flowers in the bathroom, quality toiletries and bath robes. Friendly staff especially Jimmy who at 83 has worked at the Lenox for 50 years. Would have liked tea/coffee facilities in the room however Starbucks across the road. Rooms were quiet and hotel is well placed. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel for Buisness”
Reviews.Author: Cairney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days in The Lenox hotel overall, would give this the thumbs up. A few things that were not exactly "spot-on" were...... There was very little room in the bathroom, or on the counter. Nice free toiletries - they think of everything - but took up too much space and were very small bottles. Would it hurt to give guests a reasonable sized shower gel, especially as two people were in the room?? The hairdrier had about as much power as a dying duracell, again, would expect better from a quality hotel. We ate in the restaurant Azure once, good food, but the waiter was very brusque, NOT the usual service we received from other restaurants. Try Abe and Louis's across the street, the greeters are a bit dour but fantastic service from the waiters, we had Jimmy, he was the best we encountered in our week in NY and Boston. The concerierge wasn't very helpful to us, and looked like she minded being disturbed. Again, like a previous comment, always had someone with her. The hotel is a very good location for shopping from as it's the street down from the equivalent of 5th Avenue. Lots of tourist info in the room to help out and we liked the ice machine and drinks machines on every alternative floor. Great blackout curtains, good view of the main street (Boylston) but this will be blocked when the 14 storey hotel next door is finished being built. No noise from the site, which was good. Would recommend for Buisness travellers, could probably find somewhere a bit more personable for families or couples if you looked.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home.”
Reviews.Author: Ballgirl
Reviews.Content: I don't know about anyone else but the one thing i miss most when I go on holiday is my bed! However, this was not the case on visiting the Lenox Hotel as the beds are huge and very comfy. Being from the UK we are not used to such big beds and I can honestly say I slept like a baby!. The rooms are also very spacious, decorated in that lovely old-fashioned charm style and spotlessly clean. The remainder of the hotel is also very nice with extremely friendly staff. The location of the hotel was also great as it was within walking distance of most attractions and if you were too tired to walk then the subway was good and only a short walk from the hotel. If we ever return to Boston I would definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: august16
Reviews.Content: Considering the amount of money charged per night, my boyfriend and I were very dissapointed with our three night stay at the Lenox in May. Negatives: It seems that all a hotel needs to be rated 4 stars, is some Aveda hair care products. When we arrived, the hotel had overbooked the king sized bed that we reserved and gave us a room with 2 double beds ( We were able to switch to a room with a king bed the second night). The room itself was dark and faded. The mattresses in the first room we stayed in, were horrible and sunk in the middle. Pillows were uncomfortable, unless you like those pillows you buy at the price club that have absolutely no support for your head. Requests for extra pillows to be brought to our room were not met. No one answered the phone at the reception desk 2/3 mornings when we attempted to pick up our car, so we had to go downstairs and wait for our car. There was also no coffe maker in the room. Positives: Location was great. Hotel room was clean. Lobby was nice, Hotel bar was popular. Aveda hair products. All in all not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance in good location”
Reviews.Author: MJCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in May. One pays mainly for its proximity to the most popular tourist area, its reputation and a comfortable bed, which may be enough for some. However, one's expectations are let down by below average service (a missing bedside lamp was promised and not delivered), dated room decor and below average bathroom. The hotel breakfast was good, but quite expensive. The hotel has paid valet parking. If we should return to Boston, we would probably try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference and stayed 6 days. Staff was lovely and very friendly. Knew all the great dining spots in the North End. HIGHLY recommend Mike's Pastry - get the chocolate filled cannolis. Visit the original Pizzie Regina's in the North End as well - particularly on a Red Socks game night. Too fun! Lenox sits next to French chocolaterie and Lord & Taylor. Great little Whole Foods type market in the neighborhood as well. Wasn't able to get a corner room but the front desk manager offered a wonderful room on the 11th floor with a fabulous view (finish line for the marathon was just below). Room was large with 2 double beds. Burned out light over the vaniety was fixed almost immediately upon request. Concierge kept up with the Spurs game for us! Was always greeted when I entered the lobby and asked if I needed assistance. Kate was wonderful and was lucky enough to catch her on last day at the hotel. Too bad for the Lenox to loose her! Even the house keeping attendants and room service staff greeted us in the hallways and wished us a nice day. Easy access to ATMs, the metro, and cabs - though the cab drivers were rude if you weren't spending $10 a fare with them. They hate driving you to the convention center. Didn't eat at the hotel restaurants or visit the bar - though Lenox is apparently THE PLACE to go for prom night dance. If you are into charm, location, and feeling like you aren't just another conventioneer, then the Lenox is your perfect escape in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: donethat
Reviews.Content: The Lenox is a real charmer, if you snag one of the higher floor corner rooms that are very large sized and nicely restored. Ours had an "ornamental" (non-working) fireplace, chandelier, and terrific views onto Boylston St. below. Bedding was good and the room and bathroom were spotless. Service was pleasant and efficient, with the exception of a very late night room service meal we ordered that arrived cold and short one entree, which took another half hour to be delivered. The Lenox has a fabulous location at Exeter and Boylston Sts., the Public Library and T (subway station)in the immediate next block, and all the shopping galleria next door at the Pru Center. Numerous excellent restaurants and bars, including Legal Seafood in the Pru Center, are all within walking distance on Boylston St. or another block down on Newbury St.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customers at the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my sweetie and I need a little romantic recharge, the Lenox is our favorite spot. Amazing views, fluffy pillows, perfect mattresses and a super friendly staff from the Bellman to the General Manager melt any of the world's stresses away. We would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else in Boston. It's a close walk to multiple major public transportation routes and/or the best walking neighborhoods of the city. Fine shopping, restaurants and culture are a stone's throw from the front door. The building with all its colorful charm and architectural detail lets me feel like I'm stepping back in time. It's just beautiful. We've stayed many times in the past and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox-The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed at the Lenox Hotel many years ago (26)and decided to stay there again recently to see if it was as nice as we remembered. It certainly is! This is a beautifully maintained hotel in a great location. It is within a few steps of the famous "T" subway system and really is within walking distance to almost all of the wonderful sights of Boston including Fenway Park, Newbury Street and the Boston Common. Our room actually had a working fireplace. What a treat especially with a light snow falling on a January night. If you are looking for a lovely hotel with a great location at a reasonalble price you must try the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend. Fabulous hotel, great service, and loved the little Irish Pub on the ground floor. Clean, distunguished, large rooms...get one with a fireplace, it is worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great first time visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: joolsWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very good location, lovely room, room service was excellent. The Solas Irish Pub attached to the hotel is friendly and the food is good - Samual Adams Winter beer highly recommended! Staff are helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Joolssiam
Reviews.Content: We paid a little more to stay in a "better" hotel and pamper ourselves for 4 nights. The lobby is impressive and initial service was friendly. However, when I got into the room, it was clear it was a smoking room and, to a non-smoker, was pretty unpleasant. I phoned down to advise of the mistake, only to be told there were no more rooms and they would move us the next day - no apology. I asked them to bring up some air freshener as the room stank - response was "you could open a window" That room, and the room we got moved to, still without any apology, had a strange layout - the door to the bathroom was right opposite the bed, meaning you couldn't fail to wake up your partner when trying to put on the bathroom light, as the switch was outside the room. there was supposed to be some sort of night light, but it didn't work in either room. The rest of the room was quite ordinary and unimpressive - not what I expected of such a hotel. The place felt faceless, soulless and miserable. One bar was so up-market, it felt freaky, the other was a plastic Irish bar with the character of a paper bag. The restaurant did a decent, but incredibly over-priced breakfast. After checking in, nobody seemed genuinely friendly or helpful. The whole experience left a sour taste in the mouth - felt like a waste of money and we'd have been better off for friendliness and value in a smaller three star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in The Lenox from 14th-17th November 2005 and had a wonderful, relaxing time. We upgraded to a corner suite, at an extra cost of Â£30 a night (bargain!) and couldn't have been more pleased. I have never stayed in such a beautifully appointed, comfortable, quiet room. It felt as though we were the only people staying in the hotel it was so quiet! We ate breakfast in The Azure restaurant every morning which was delicious and really set us up for the day. The waiting staff were friendly and courteous. The one waiter even remembered that we drank tea, not coffee, on our second morning there! The location of the hotel is excellent, within easy walking distance of most things, including the Boston Common, and the T stop was just up the street. We found out that we are expecting our first baby shortly before leaving on this trip, so this was something of a celebratory trip for us, and I can honestly say that it could not have been better. All in all, an excellent stay was had in this hotel and we will definitely return again in the future. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you get a deal on a suite.”
Reviews.Author: canuckpump
Reviews.Content: First time in years I have stayed at the Lenox. It is beautiful and in a great location. Staff could have been friendlier, especially the older gal at the little info. desk, could not get a smile out of her no matter how I tried. Room was lovely, wallpaper in bath peeled a little but no biggie. Make sure you ask for a suite when you book, a corner room if possible. The junior suites are tiny and you will not be happy as other people have stated. Overall a pleasant stay in a grand hotel but I would never pay the rack rate. T stop, coffee, drugstore and groceries 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Lenox for 4 nights 23rd-26th October. The Hotel is clean and well maintained, if a little dated in decor. Reception staff are helpfull, and we had no trouble checking in or out. Good, concierge desk where trips and tickets can be booked. Did not use the Hotel restaurants, but the food in the attached Irish bar is tasty and reasonably proced. The Guiness is cold and bitter - just the way it should be. The Lenox is in easy walking distance from the main tourist areas of Boston(15-20mins). The 'T' stop is 2 mins down the road. I would recommend this Hotel with one reservation:- Check the room when you book - they vary in size.

Reviews.Title: “Better to avoid”
Reviews.Author: jafb
Reviews.Content: Its convenient location in Back Bay doesn't make up for TIRED FURNITURE and SERVICE PROBLEMS. Lobby is chaos, desk people overwhelmed during my 4 night stay. Jr. suite was missing furniture[ which was brought to us]. No turn-down service except by request, then did not happen. Desk promises to get us newspaper, did not happen. No bellman for luggage.They ran out of access cards to use computer. Gym stiflingly hot. With so many other fine hotels in area, I cannot recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: silvergirlracer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September. We arrived on an early flight from chicago but the front desk were very helpful in letting us have a room well ahead of normal check in time. The room was very spacious with a huge, comfortable bed. We had a nice corner room on the 5th floor with a good view of Boylston street. The Bathroom was spotless with nice Aveda toiletries. I particularly liked the crystal glasses and ice bucket - a nice change from the usual plastic stuff you get in hotels. The air conditioning was VERY noisy but to be honest you get used to it and sleep right through. We just put it down to one of the quirks of an older hotel. The Hotel is in an excellent location - The T stop is a close by as is Newbury Street and Copley Square. We walked to Boston Common, downtown and Fanueils Market and it only took around 20 minutes or so. It could probably be done quicker but we were browsing along the way. We were out a few nights until around 1:00 in the morning and when we came back the hotel was still bustling with party goers in the attaching Irish Pub. It seems to be a popular place with local Boston people but we could not hear any noise at all when we were back in our room. We walked around the hotel areas very late at night and felt safe One word of caution though - even though I had pre-paid for the room and had no extra charges an amount was billed to my credit card on check in. Hopefully, this will be sorted and refunded shortly but I would advise you to just double check with the front desk when you hand over your card. We would definately stay again and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the lenox in boston for our 6th wedding anniversary. Although not a terrible stay, i have had better. The room was the smallest i have ever stayed in. Only room for one person standing in the bathroom. No counter space at all. The hotel is very old and smelled a little. All of this was fine however. We came to see the city, not stay in the room. Very close to the T and Newbury street which is actually why we chose this hotel. My biggest complaint came on the last day. My husband had a beautiful bouquet of pink roses delivered to our room on the day of our arrival. When we left of course I wanted to take them with me since I had only enjoyed them for 3 days. The hotel was very unhelpful with providing a box for me to transport them home in. They said that if we wanted a box we shouldn't have had them delivered in a vase. So my husband and i walked down the street ourselves to Winston Flowers Florist and they helped us to package them so i could take them home. I was not impressed with the level of service at this hotel. Judging from previous reviews it seems to be hit or miss. Unfortunately this past weekend was a miss. I expect much more from a 4 star hotel. Next time we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Curious experience at Lenox”
Reviews.Author: Wtravel66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in "Superior Double" room t $269 per night plus tax nd $36 per day for parking. Room was tiny, no minibar, no coffemaker. Instead they want you to order in-room brekfast, which we did once - $50 for 2 people for bacon and eggs. One small window was facing service roof with a wire cage over a ballroom dome. Room above us had a leaking window air-conditioner that poured water into our window. Hotel supposedly won all kinds of eco awards for water conservation, etc. But shower in our tiny bath was as close to a fire hose as you can get - enough water coming out for 4 showers. They ask you to re-use your towels, or put the ones you want replaced on the bathroom floor. We left one on the floor - it actually never got replaced. Very curious experience, will never stay there again. Furniture and curtains were nice, but then the only blanket option was a down comforter in July!?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lenox”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox from July1-5, to see Boston, but mostly to be there for the 4th of July fireworks. The Lenox's staff is very friendly (Kate) and very helpful - they even provided us with a blanket for the July 4th festivities on the Esplanade. Our room had a great view of the skyline of Boston and Cambridge, and was taken care of promptly when we left every morning. The location of the Lenox can't be beat - one block from the T station, one block from Newbury, and within walking distance to the Boston Garden and Common. Would definitely stay there again.
